access: Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.
description:
Located at the epicenter of Chicago's cultural, historical, and business attractions, this luxurious studio offers guests all the comforts of home, whether on the road for work or relax. 
You will be a walking distance of world famous attractions including: Millennium Park, the Bean, Navy Pier and Riverwalk. 
Enjoy our amazing amenities to provide you the best stay possible, including complete kitchen, equipped bathroom, king sized bed, TV with Netflix and Wi-Fi in all area.

The apartment is located in a unique neighborhood and has everything you need for an amazing time visiting Chicago. 
The studio is solely for our guests. It is a beautiful open space including a comfy sitting area, where you can rest on the sofa and watch a big TV with streaming platform installed as Netflix. Also, has a cozy sleeping area including a king size bed, comfort pillows and blankets, a a private and complete bathroom, equipped with a bathtub shower: you'll find body soap, shampoo & conditioner, a hair dryer and towels available for your use.
All area has high-speed Wi-Fi if you're travelling on business. Don't worry to miss anything.

Our AC/ Heating unit allows controlled temperature of the space. With a remote control you'll be able to set your desired temperature.

Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal.

Due to our central location, whether it is nightlife or family activities, is just a quick journey. A variety of michelin restaurants, bars and grocery stores are just a few steps from the building.

access: We have two decks for outside relaxation.  Feel free to use our kitchen & laundry.
description:
Bright clean spacious home in the heart of Oak Park 2 minute walk to the Blue line and Oak Park Ave bus line.

Great location, close to shops, and transportation.  We live in a quiet street and summer is an ideal time to enjoy our home & Oak Park!

We have two decks for outside relaxation.  Feel free to use our kitchen & laundry.

We welcome the chance to interact with guests but aren't home all that much.  Comfortable too if guests want to keep to themselves, we are pretty easy going!

Diverse neighborhood, with great shopping, cafes, restaurants, parks and architecture!
Close enough to the city for easy access but far enough away to relax!

We have bikes here, train and busses around the corner & UBER easily available.  We have parking but it's a quick walk to many great local spots!

Spend the summer in our lovely home, walk to the nearby public pool, take in one of the many festivals or jump on a train to the city!! It's the best of both worlds!

access: Guests will have access to the 2nd floor apartment, the basement for laundry, the backyard and 1/2 of the garage.
description: Indulge the senses in the historic charm of this 1913 Arts and Crafts apartment. Discover a carefully designed space featuring a mid-century modern aesthetic, contemporary finishes, a bright living space, and a backyard BBQ area.
house_rules:
- Quiet hours  9 P.M. to 8 A.M.   
- Pet friendly.  But dogs must be walked on a leash and their waste picked up, according to city ordinance.
- Contact host with type and number of pets.
interaction: Text us.  We are right down the street.
neighborhood_overview: Andersonville is an old Swedish area of the city where early 20th century architecture abounds. A replica of the original water tower, painted with the Swedish flag, sits atop the Swedish Museum. Small one-of-a-kind shops line Clark Street nearby. The Aragon Ballroom and the Riviera Theatre are just over a mile away.
notes:
Many neighborhoods in Chicago have at least one street festival in the summertime. Andersonville's is June 8th, 9th, and 10th, and it runs along Clark Street from Foster to Catalpa.  There are several different stages for music.  It's a ton of fun!

We are a licensed vacation rental with the City of Chicago #2411496
space: Our place is a large vintage 2 bedroom/1bath.  It was built in the early 1900's, in the Arts and Crafts style.  It retains much of the original charm with stained glass and wood details.  One of the bedrooms has a king bed.  The other has a queen.  There is a full kitchen for cooking and a beautiful backyard for grilling.  If you prefer to go out, we are just steps from Calo, Big Jones, Hamburger Mary's Ranalli's Pizza and Marty's Martini Bar.
summary: Indulge the senses in the historic charm of this 1913 Arts and Crafts apartment. Discover a carefully designed space featuring a mid-century modern aesthetic, contemporary finishes, a bright living space, and a backyard BBQ area.
transit: We are just a few blocks from the Red Line and within steps of major bus lines.   There are also Divvy Bikes available for rent at several kiosks in the neighborhood. These are bikes you take from one docking station and may be returned to a different docking station.

access:
Private second floor with bedroom, living room and bathroom. You are also welcome to relax on our front porch or use the back yard if you'd like. There is
 no use of lower level or locked rooms that are not in description
description:
Private 2nd floor of single family home in safe, quiet, and residential neighborhood. Located between O'hare and downtown. About a 15 minute drive from O'Hare, 30 minute drive to downtown. Use of bedroom, private living room with kitchenette and private bathroom. Second floor has a shared entrance with first floor. Central heat and AC, easy street parking,  close to public transit, and a quick bus ride to Jefferson Park Transit Station where you can catch the blue line straight to downtown.

Thank you for your interest in our Airbnb! We look forward to meeting you!  Please read the entire listing before booking. You will be staying on the second floor of our home that has a shared entrance with the first floor. Each floor has a door with a lock, so they are completely separated. There are other rooms upstairs that are used by us when we do NOT have guests, but when we do, our guests have COMPLETE privacy of the second floor.

There is a kitchenette that includes a microwave, mini fridge and freezer, coffee maker, and water machine with hot and cold water. We provide, coffee, tea, sugar, and powdered creamer. This is NOT a full kitchen to cook in, but an area where you can prepare simple meals/snacks and keep foods cold and heat up in the microwave. Please refer to pictures. 

In addition to the bed in the bedroom, the couch in the living room of the unit can be used as extra sleeping space, as it converts to a bed. The living room also has a smart Roku tv with cable, Netflix, and Hulu for your entertainment. 

We have a pack-n-play with attachable changing table for babies and toddlers, and an umbrella stroller that you are welcome to use. Just let us know in advance if you'll be needing these!

The bathroom has a clawfoot tub with a shower. We will provide shampoo, conditioner, soap, and towels. A blow dryer is also available for use.

Our home is over 100 years old,  so if brand new is what you're looking for,  this isn't it. But it's a clean, private, and cozy space with character.

We live directly across from a great park that has a playground, tennis courts, and a running track. We have some tennis rackets that you're welcome to use if you choose to play. Please let us know if you'd like to borrow them!

Private second floor with bedroom, living room and bathroom. You are also welcome to relax on our front porch or use the back yard if you'd like. There is
 no use of lower level or locked rooms that are not in description

Someone will usually be around downstairs. We are more than happy to assist you with anything you may need, but we will give you your privacy. You can also text or call if you need anything and we'll respond promptly!

Jefferson Park is a quiet, safe, and RESIDENTIAL neighborhood on the northwest side of Chicago with easy access to the airport and downtown.  We are about 15 from O' hare airport and near public transportation(buses about two blocks away,  train station to downtown about 1 mile away) We live directly across the street from a park that has tennis courts and a running track. There are restaurants and a grocery store within walking distance.

We are about a 15 minute(sometimes less!) drive from O'hare airport. You can catch a bus two blocks away from our home to get to the Jefferson Park Transit Station that is a just over a mile away. The blue line will take you to O'hare and downtown. Easy street parking is also available across the street, if you are driving.

We are a quiet family of four with two dogs. Our dogs are friendly, but you will most likely not have much or any contact with them as they are kept separate from the second floor. Please let us know in advance if you will be using the futon to sleep or if you need the pack n play,  so that we may leave out clean linens or have pack n play set up for you.
house_rules:
No smoking inside and no parties or events. This is a quiet residential neighborhood. Please be courteous of our neighbors. 

You will not have access to the lower level where the main kitchen is, but a kitchenette with a microwave, mini fridge and freezer, coffee maker, and water machine is available in the unit.
interaction: Someone will usually be around downstairs. We are more than happy to assist you with anything you may need, but we will give you your privacy. You can also text or call if you need anything and we'll respond promptly!

space:
Thank you for your interest in our Airbnb! We look forward to meeting you!  Please read the entire listing before booking. You will be staying on the second floor of our home that has a shared entrance with the first floor. Each floor has a door with a lock, so they are completely separated. There are other rooms upstairs that are used by us when we do NOT have guests, but when we do, our guests have COMPLETE privacy of the second floor.

There is a kitchenette that includes a microwave, mini fridge and freezer, coffee maker, and water machine with hot and cold water. We provide, coffee, tea, sugar, and powdered creamer. This is NOT a full kitchen to cook in, but an area where you can prepare simple meals/snacks and keep foods cold and heat up in the microwave. Please refer to pictures. 

In addition to the bed in the bedroom, the couch in the living room of the unit can be used as extra sleeping space, as it converts to a bed. The living room also has a smart Roku tv with cable, Netflix, and Hulu for your entertainment. 

We have a pack-n-play with attachable changing table for babies and toddlers, and an umbrella stroller that you are welcome to use. Just let us know in advance if you'll be needing these!

The bathroom has a clawfoot tub with a shower. We will provide shampoo, conditioner, soap, and towels. A blow dryer is also available for use.

Our home is over 100 years old,  so if brand new is what you're looking for,  this isn't it. But it's a clean, private, and cozy space with character.

We live directly across from a great park that has a playground, tennis courts, and a running track. We have some tennis rackets that you're welcome to use if you choose to play. Please let us know if you'd like to borrow them!
summary: Private 2nd floor of single family home in safe, quiet, and residential neighborhood. Located between O'hare and downtown. About a 15 minute drive from O'Hare, 30 minute drive to downtown. Use of bedroom, private living room with kitchenette and private bathroom. Second floor has a shared entrance with first floor. Central heat and AC, easy street parking,  close to public transit, and a quick bus ride to Jefferson Park Transit Station where you can catch the blue line straight to downtown.
transit: We are about a 15 minute(sometimes less!) drive from O'hare airport. You can catch a bus two blocks away from our home to get to the Jefferson Park Transit Station that is a just over a mile away. The blue line will take you to O'hare and downtown. Easy street parking is also available across the street, if you are driving.

description:
Location, location, location! This beautiful modern apartment is located in the heart of Chicago, walking distance from many amazing city attractions, varieties of cafes and restaurants. You are right down the street from Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Grant and Millennium Parks, Soldier Field and Lake Michigan. Enjoy being minutes away from McCormick Place If you're in town to attend a conference.The unit is very sunny and it's cozy setting will make you feel like home.

The unit is equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay, including a hairdryer, steamer, coffee machine, complementary WIFI and so much more! Coffee/tea, cooking supplies, fresh linens and towels. 
You will have access to the entire unit! The space features a spacious studio accommodation. The full kitchen has everything you may need to make your favorite meal! The living room area is conveniently set up with a QUEEN memory foam bed and a FULL size convertible sofa bed.  Washer and dryer is located in the building. The unit features hight ceiling, lots of windows and lots of lights well as central AC/Heat that guests can adjust to their preference. Flat screen TV with Apple TV lets you stream your favorite TV show or a movie.

I can be reached by AirBnB message, text or phone call if you need anything or have any questions.

South loop is one of the best locations to stay in Chicago! Close to all the main attractions, right off Michigan Avenue. Walking distance to Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Planetarium, Grant and Millennium Park‘s, Art Institute of Chicago, State Street shopping, Soldier Field and so much more! 
Chicago Convention Center, McCormick Place is just a short cab ride or a joyful 15 minutes walk.

Limited free street parking, paid meter street parking and numerous paid parking huaraches are available in the area. Subway and bus stops are right by the building. Easy access from both airports – O’Hare and Midway. Five minutes cab ride or a short walk to McCormick Place, River North bars and clubs, short walk to Soldier Field and the lake!

Due to the apartment’s prime location, you may encounter some city noise, nearby train.
This is a corner building that has 2 legal addresses and entrances, you will be provided with the second address and it’s main entrance with your check in instructions.

description:
Spacious, elegantly appointed and furnished Lakeview vacation/executive 2 BR 1 Bath
First floor on a quiet, tree lined street, The entire apartment either features oak floors or ceramic tiles,
all solid oak doors and windows, oriental rugs, even a piano. Hotel grade mattresses on queen sized beds with Egyptian Cotton linens.
a 40 in flat panel television, original art work
fully equipped big kitchen with dinette set, additional breakfast room overlooking the garden, coffee maker, espresso maker, microwave
3 mins to Brown Line, no permit required for parking.

We hope you find everything to your liking. Here are some suggestions and requests that should make your stay as comfortable as possible: You will notice that the location is the best between being close to the city and being in a quiet residential neighborhood. The CTA Brownline Paulina Station is just minutes away, the No. 11 Bus even closer. Whole Foods Market is the preferred upscale source for nourishments and the best fruits and vegetables for the discriminating taste. Jewel Foods is about 4 blocks south between Paulina and Ashland. There are several bars and restaurants in walking distance, feel free to inquire about recommendations.
You will find our beds comfortable, with hotel grade mattresses and 100% cotton linens, there are additional blankets and covers available for the asking.

Also, our company manufactures 3in1Dead Sea skin care products, you will find some free samples for your use or take them with you. If you are interested in purchasing some, let us know.

access: Entire space
description:
Walk to Hollywood Beach, dance the night away at tight-knit Andersonville, or stroll along Lake Michigan. This ideally located Scandi-style apartment (inspired by Södermalm, is an island in central Stockholm, Sweden) features a bar, board games and lots of space to spread out and relax.

Towels and toiletries will be included according to number of guests BOOKED. Fees will apply to extra guests. We charge $49 per extra guest per night

This is a private air-conditioned apartment with Scandinavian style, monochrome palette, tucked in between Thorndale Beach and the Redline ‘L’ Station. A walkable wonder and just 14-minutes drive to Grant Park and Magnificent Mile

Entire space

We like in-person check-in but self-check-in and full privacy are offered

A century ago, Chicago had a robust Swedish population whose epicenter was Andersonville. the Swedish influence remains, dotting the stroll-friendly commercial areas with Swedish businesses and restaurants. Lakefront community Edgewater is a liberal, pretty paradise and features Chicago's gay beach at Hollywood.

Chicago's largest park, Lincoln Park, stretches south from Edgewater for seven miles along the waterfront, almost to downtown.

Street parking is free all around but we do offer a garage spot for extra fee (enquire). Redline ‘L’ is a block away

Guests will receive a link with instructions within 24 hours of check-in

FULL DISCLOSURE: If you haven’t used or don’t know how to use a lockbox, self-check-in is not for you. Your check-in should be in-person and between 3PM and 9:30PM. Absolutely no exceptions
interaction: We like in-person check-in but self-check-in and full privacy are offered
neighborhood_overview:
A century ago, Chicago had a robust Swedish population whose epicenter was Andersonville. the Swedish influence remains, dotting the stroll-friendly commercial areas with Swedish businesses and restaurants. Lakefront community Edgewater is a liberal, pretty paradise and features Chicago's gay beach at Hollywood.

Chicago's largest park, Lincoln Park, stretches south from Edgewater for seven miles along the waterfront, almost to downtown.

space: This is a private air-conditioned apartment with Scandinavian style, monochrome palette, tucked in between Thorndale Beach and the Redline ‘L’ Station. A walkable wonder and just 14-minutes drive to Grant Park and Magnificent Mile
summary:
Walk to Hollywood Beach, dance the night away at tight-knit Andersonville, or stroll along Lake Michigan. This ideally located Scandi-style apartment (inspired by Södermalm, is an island in central Stockholm, Sweden) features a bar, board games and lots of space to spread out and relax.

Towels and toiletries will be included according to number of guests BOOKED. Fees will apply to extra guests. We charge $49 per extra guest per night

description:
You will have a private room and the whole floor to yourself. You will have your own bathroom and you will rarely see me unless I have to do laundry or if you have any needs.
There is also a private entrance for guest to use. Feel free to ask if there are any questions:).

The area is spacious, giving guest plenty of room to lay back and relax. It includes a private bathroom, laundry room, mini fridge, and microwave.

The whole floor will be for the guests use.

Close to public transportation. Takes about 20 minutes to go downtown by car. There’s also a public park that is about five minutes by walking.

Car or bus both are great there’s parking all around the house and the bus stop is right outside the house.

I would like guests to know that I do work and so there maybe times where I am not available to check guests in personally, but I do try to at least meet with guests once after they check in so that I can answer any questions.

description:
Close to downtown Chicago, IIT, McCorMick Place Convention Center. Private  bedroom. Private bathroom. Renovated historic Victorian rowhouse with charming original architectural structures.  High ceiling. Exposed brick walll. Hardwood floor.

Full bed, desk, closet, linen organizer. TV.


FREE use of washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI. 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 2 stops to reach downtown). Also many buses to downtown. Central air conditioning at nights and weekends in the Summer. 24 hrs (thermostat) central heat in the Winter.

Duplex home with kitchen and living room on the 1st floor. Back yard with wood deck equipped with bbq. You will have a private bedroom. Shared bathroom with just one another person.

* 3 blocks to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier.

* 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should cost less than $10. Or take bus #3. Or nice long walk in Summer.

* 3-block walk to Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), 35th street campus.

* 6 blocks to Vandercook college of music

* 7 blocks to IL college of Optometry 

* 13 blocks (biking distance) from Mercy Hospital 

Plenty of free street parking at the front of the house. Very friendly homeowner. We provide a safe and secure homestay -- once confirm your booking, you will need to confirm your identity by emailing me a copy of passport, or student ID, or intern letter or evidence of employment. 

Full access to kitchen, living room, and back deck. However, light cooking only, please - no splashy oily or smoky cooking.

PLEASE NOTE: Up-and-coming neighborhood. Police head-quarters is just a block away. We, all at the house, use public transportation -- "VERY" convenient.

description:
Check out Great location for this apartment home. Come home to premium catering style kitchens featuring state of the art stainless steel appliances. Unwind after a long day in your very own relaxing soaking tubs, and take in beautiful and breathtaking city views. A three minute walk from Lake Michigan and two blocks from Michigan Avenue. Enjoy premium shopping, dining, and nightlife at your doorstep. You can enjoy all that the greater Chicago area has to offer. Laundry room in the building.

Managed by Corporate Housing Company Prestige Suites.

Ideally located in the heart of the Gold Coast, The Seneca is the pinnacle of apartment living. A three minute walk from Lake Michigan and two blocks from Michigan Avenue, you will love the perfect blend of comfort and convenience that Seneca provides its residents. Enjoy premium shopping, dining, and nightlife at your doorstep. Our walkable community gives you exclusive access to a plethora of shops and restaurants you won't find anywhere else. Just minutes from Downtown Chicago, River North, and the Loop, you can enjoy all that the greater Chicago area has to offer. Experience great culture at the Museum of Contemporary Art only two blocks away or the Broadway Playhouse, right across the street. Enjoy on campus events and other higher educational benefits from Northwestern University, only a five minute walk from Seneca. Enjoy all of these great attractions and more all conveniently close to home. Apply online now!

Enjoy on campus events and other higher educational benefits from Northwestern University, only a five minute walk from Seneca. Enjoy all of these great attractions and more all conveniently close to home. Apply online now!
summary: Check out Great location for this apartment home. Come home to premium catering style kitchens featuring state of the art stainless steel appliances. Unwind after a long day in your very own relaxing soaking tubs, and take in beautiful and breathtaking city views. A three minute walk from Lake Michigan and two blocks from Michigan Avenue. Enjoy premium shopping, dining, and nightlife at your doorstep. You can enjoy all that the greater Chicago area has to offer. Laundry room in the building.

description:
Peaceful and cozy apt. located on the NW side of the city in a quiet neighborhood. Short distance from the I90/94 highway. About 5 miles from Wrigleyville/boystown.

Perfect for 2 small families, or group of people but still have space an privacy

I live a 5min drive from this location and available when needed.

1 block away from Chopin Park and located in from of a Church, a few blocks walk from bus station that will also take u directly to the blue line train station.

If your are driving during your stay, you are located close to the highway that take u anywhere in the city. About 15-20mins from O’Hare airport.

description:
This unit is located in a vibrant neighborhood filled with diversity. This jewel is located near public transit where you can hop right on the train and be downtown Chicago in less than 15mins. This modest apartment is situated in a 8 unit building. It will host a weekend getaway with your significant other and is spacious enough to have the family coming in town to vist for the holidays.

This space is trendy with an Urban flair. It is located near the pulse of everything. You are about 30mins from either Ohare or Midway. You are less the 7 miles from downtown. There is public transportation within walking distance. You are a $10 Uber or Lift ride from "The Chicago Bean and Grant Park"

Apart from the obvious attraction of the acres of green recreational space offered by the parks, West Humboldt Park is also bordered by Garfield Conservatory and the coming Bloomingdale Trail – a proposed two mile elevated, multi-use, linear park and trail. New educational institutions include Rowe Clark Math and Science Academy, the newly renovated state of the art Westinghouse High School and the Richard M. Daley Library. Hargrove Hospital recently completed a $25 million renovation of Garfield Hospital, providing both jobs for community residents and mental health services for troubled youth. Iconic local businesses include: Roeser’s Bakery, Jimmy’s Red Hots, Rosa’s Lounge blues club on Armitage, and Headlines Barbershop, along with newcomers on Chicago Avenue – Brother-In-Law Ribs and Turkey Chop Gourmet Grill – and Inspiration Kitchen on Lake Street. Residents also enjoy local festivals such as the yearly African Cultural Fest in Kells Park, now in its sixth year, and the Saturday West Humboldt Park Farmers Markets in the NHS parking lot at the corner of Chicago and Central Park, now in its fourth year.

You are walking distance to public transportation. A $10 Uber or Lyft right downtown about a $30 dollar Uber/Lyft from Ohare and abour 25 from Midway.

additional_house_rules:
Quiet hours from 10pm-8am
• I like to keep a shoe-free home.
• I enjoy offering flexible check-in and check-out times, however if you wish to check-in before 2pm please note I cannot always guarantee a clean bed will be immediately available due to the time it takes to clean and put on fresh linens. You are welcome to use the other rooms in the house or drop off your belongings until your bed is ready. Likewise if you wish to check out after noon you will need to move your belongings out of the bedroom at that time so we can clean and change the sheets.
*There is an additional charge of $25 per night if any guests will be sleeping outside the guest bedroom.
ANY TYPE OF WEAPON IS EXPRESSLY FORBIDDEN

access: Access to the entire apartment.
description:
My place is close to tons of great restaurants, parks and pools. Very close to Downtown 'Magnificent Mile' and the West Loop. Easy transportation to Wicker Park, South Loop and the Sears Tower (Chicagoans refuse to call it Willis Tower). Good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers. Very close to #65 Grand bus. Near #66 Chicago bus, Blue and Green line 'L'.

Free laundry in the basement.

Access to the entire apartment.

I work full time as a veterinary nurse but am home some evenings. 
My partner, Benjamin, will sometimes spend the night.

Getting to any corner of the city is convenient

There is one cat that lives in the home, the litter boxes are not inside the apartment. I live next to a commercial food facility and the 'beep' of the trucks can be heard as they back up early in the morning for deliveries. This is only an issue on some weekday mornings. I like to let anyone staying on a weekday know.

access: The entire space is yours, and you are able to use laundry and gym at the building. Please make yourself at home! :)
description:
Beautiful and charming studio in one of Chicago's best neighborhoods. Perfect spot: a less than 1 mile to downtown, with  coffee shops, bars, restaurants, shoppings, pharmacies and grocery stores at your doorstep. A quick ride to everything else amazing to explore in the city. Lots of natural light, laptop-friendly work spaces, and a dazzling view at night. We hope you will fall in love with Chicago as we have from this perfect nest in the heart of the city.

This studio is airy, brilliant, and abundant with natural light.
It is an open concept studio with a super comfy king size bed, a full kitchen, and an enclosed bath with a tub and shower. It’s the perfect spot for lounging in between adventures around the city. The kitchen is stocked with all the basics (coffee maker, toaster, electric kettle, refrigerator, stove, oven and microwave) and we also offer cups, wine glasses, dishes, pots, pans and cutlery.
If you are more than two, we have a sofa bed to accommodate the third person. Don't worry about blankets, pillows, bed lines and fluffy towels - they are all include in the unit, besides bathroom amenities: body soap, shampoo, conditioner and hair dryer. 
For your total comfort, your stay will equipped with Wi-Fi high-speed, Smart TV with Netflix, air condition and heating.

The entire space is yours, and you are able to use laundry and gym at the building. Please make yourself at home! :)

We are only a message or phone call away! We are happy to assist with any issues or questions to ensure you have an awesome stay!

Please remember this is a residential building and to respect quiet hours from 10pm-8am.

Queen bed
Private bath [Bath is located across the hall from guest room]
Flat screen television w/ free cable
Wireless internet
Ceiling Fan
Alarm clock
Bath robes

Comments:  This room offers quiet comfort and value.  We have discounted the price only because the bath, although private, is located across the hall from the guest room.  The room is located at the center of the house and is very quiet.

We are a licensed State of Illinois/ City of Chicago Bed and Breakfast.. License Number #: 2207267

Please contact House 5863 for Access Information

Owner lives on property and available by email, phone, text, etc.

Our bed & breakfast is located in the Edgewater/Andersonville neighborhood of Chicago. Our neighborhood is diverse, urban, unique and simply a great place to be when in Chicago. We convenient to transportation, major attractions, Chicago's lakefront, shopping, dining and a vibrant community.

access: Guests will have access to the entire 1st floor apartment and 1st floor back porch area. We only ask that you stay out of the utility closet.
description:
My place is setup for you to enjoy your stay in Chicago. Located 5 km from United Center and 8 km from Willis Tower,  The Chicago Board of Trade Building is within 8 km of the apartment, DePaul University is 8 km from the apartment. The nearest airport is Midway International Airport, 10 km from the property.

My place is super clean and close to downtown. I have free on street parking. Douglas park is walking distance  if you want to exercise and the people are nice and friendly.

Guests will have access to the entire 1st floor apartment and 1st floor back porch area. We only ask that you stay out of the utility closet.

Our work schedules keep us busy but if we are free, you are welcome to text us and ask us for information. We stay in one of the upper floors so we will be nearby but definitely will respect your privacy.

Hello and thank you for viewing my listing. If you decide to book you will be renting my entire apartment. It is not shared space! I stay in a diverse neighborhood. If you have a problem with African Americans and Hispanics this is not the Airbnb for you. Additionally I love my neighborhood because the pink line train is 3 minutes away.  Downtown is 15-20 minutes by train. Uber to downtown is between 5 and 10 dollars. The people are kind and friendly plus Douglas park is 5 mins away walking distance .  My place is up to date with everything to have a short or long stay. Currently I’m getting estimates to update the kitchen but all the appliances are brand new. So you can make yourself a hot meal if you choose to. Last but not lease did I mention Douglas Park host the riot fest  and a ton of other events. So thanks for taking the time to view my page. See you soon!!!

I would suggest the train it is cheap and convenient. ride sharing is cool . I have free on street parking in front of my apartment.

Chicago is a major urban city and you should always take precautions when walking around the city. If you are walking at night, pay attention to your surroundings and be safe. If heading downtown at night or coming home late, take a Lyft and pay just a few dollars to quickly and safely get to and from the train station in a matter of minutes. These tips apply in every Chicago neighborhood, even downtown on Michigan Avenue.

description:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space" *
Lovely single family house with large fenced yard. One large bedrm with a good-size closet. Common areas include living, dining, kitchen & laundry rooms. Great for business travelers with office amenities (printer, copier), iron & washer&dryer. 

Quiet & upscale suburbs.  Known for its Frank L Wright hses. Cls to public trans & I-290. 15 min to dwntwn Chicago via train & 20 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr & Hines VA & Rush Hsptl

NOTES: 
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in". 
(3) Let the host know if you plan to drive so the parking matter can be addressed if needed.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house has an exceptional great location.  It is about 10 minutes to a Green Line Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car.
(c) Free parking is provided.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. If you rent a room in or near downtown Chicago, you implicitly or explicitly spend a lot of money just on parking.
(d) The "Occupancy Tax" is about 11% here which is much less than 23% or higher (doubled) in Chicago. The occupancy tax is paid by the guests based on the sum of room rate and cleaning fee.  With this tax and parking cost in mind, it is much more economical (and without losing convenient access to downtown Chicago) to stay in a convenient suburbs rather than in Chicago or downtown Chicago. Since the "Occupancy Tax" is waived if you stay 31 days or longer, you can avoid this tax and save quite a bit of money if you plan your trip ahead and check with the host for room availability.

====== Other Information  ========
Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. A full service restaurant (Blue Max Cafe) is only a block north of the house (serves breakfast and lunch only). Various fast food and slow food restaurants are also very close.  A great oriental message service is just couple blocks south of the house (not too expensive, please get coupon from the host for one-time discount).

The house is the middle of Oak Park and Forest Park downtown (almost equal distance).  You have access to 24 hours super markets, and all sorts of other stores and entertainment in both downtown, plus big Chicago downtown of course. Come to stay in the house, and enjoy both the big Chicago, and friendly cute downtown in both Oak Park and Forest Park.

description:
This is a studio apartment in the heart of the River North neighborhood. Is the one of the best areas in Chicago with many restaurants, bars, grocery stores, shopping, and residential buildings. Around the block you will find a CVS, Walgreens, many local popular bars, restaurants, shoppings and more. Oak Street Beach, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, Lincoln Park Zoo and 360 Chicago are all a short walk distance.

You will have access to the following:

> Free WiFi high speed, central air conditioning & heating.

> Private room includes: queen-sized bed, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, pillows and blankets. 

> Kitchen includes: refrigerator, microwave, stove, oven, coffee machine, electric kettle, fridge, dishes, pots, glasses, cutlery, salt and pepper.

> Comfortable sofa, to watch the big TV with Netflix. Don't worry to waste your best series and movies.

> Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper & hair dryer.

> Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out.

Fitness center, pool and laundry: all available at the building.

As much or as little interaction as you desire. Your comfortable and pleasurable stay is our goal. Feel free to contact us anytime you need.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other service that interest you.

Please enjoy the deck, but respect the neighbors and limit the noise after 11 pm.

access: Guest will have a key so access anytime. We are flexible with check in and check out for leaving luggage. Typically the room is ready by 3:00pm and we expect to clean around 11:00am or after.
description:
Our family-friendly apartment will welcome you with all the amenities needed for your Chicago visit. Located in the heart of Little Italy, a short walk to restaurants, bars, Starbucks, parks & playgrounds, UIC Pavilion & Medical District. Only a few blocks to the EL (Pink line train) which takes you directly downtown to all major attractions including The Art Institute, Millennium Park, Michigan Ave, theatre district, lakefront and so much more. Only 2.5 miles walk to the lakefront.

Located on the 2nd floor of our building, this sunny & bright apartment offers plenty of space for you to make the most of your visit to the Windy City. Our kitchen is basic but ready for your cooking needs, should you choose to make your own meals. The open floor living space features a dining area and a living room area.. There is also a flat screen TV with Netflix & all access cable. The space also features a desk for your laptop or writing needs and a USB charging station for your convenience.

For families, we have games to help entertain any kiddos, as well as books throughout the apt for adults and kids alike.

The main bedroom offers a brand new and comfortable queen bed and plenty of closet space. The 2nd bedroom features a new comfortable full sized bed.  The 3rd bedroom features a new comfortable bunk bed with one full sized bed and one twin sized bed. The  bathroom is equipped with all toiletries you may need. You will also find a lovely front yard deck with seating.

Guest will have a key so access anytime. We are flexible with check in and check out for leaving luggage. Typically the room is ready by 3:00pm and we expect to clean around 11:00am or after.

This listing is for the entire 2nd floor apartment of our building. You will have the whole apartment to yourself.

Street parking. We can also arrange housekeeping service for an additional fee for stays longer than a week.

5 Bedroom Home with 6 beds, 4 queen size,  2 full size and 3 additional floor mattresses, Large living room, formal dining room, 2nd living and dining area, 2 full Bathrooms, 2 Kitchens, main kitchen with granite countertop, stainless steel appliances, laundry room, fireplace, patio,  deck. Walk to bus, restaurants, coffee shop, bars, grocery store, Lake Michigan, Loyola University, RedLine Train. Nice neighborhood of East Rogers Park. Family or friends vacation, work travel, wedding stays!

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this pretty one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped South Loop home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI92)

Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

additional_house_rules:
(1) Please respect our neighbors, as well as Building and House Rules, and avoid any loud noises and parties.   ANY noise complaint from other building residents or neighbors, will result in IMMEDIATE TERMINATION of reservation and a BUILDING FINE OF $500.  
(2) Must provide complete list of guests to be registered with the building within 72 hours of booking else risk cancellation
(3) Must follow ALL checkout instructions posted on kitchen counter (and Airbnb's House Manual) else be charged $40
(4) Smoking allowed ONLY on outdoor patio -- please collect and dispose all ashes.  Young children live below -- NO flicking of ashes from the ledge of the patio.
(5) No overnight guests NOT on reservation - host reserves right to immediately cancel reservation if this is violated
(6) Same day instant booking reservations completed after 4pm, may have to wait up to 2 hours to be able to check-in (if unsure please send Host an inquiry BEFORE booking)
(7) Any peak season weekend bookings between March-October of  less than 3 nights  carry a small surcharge of 20%.  All surcharges are charged separately.

access: You will be able to enjoy both floors of this gorgeous apartment... the outdoor porch, the private roof deck, every bedroom and bathroom, the foosball table and arcade in the game room, and of course the spacious open immaculately-designed entertainment area!
description:
**DISCOUNTED WINTER RATES**  NEWLY UPDATED MODERN LOOK! Live it up & say WOW in this TOP FLOOR immaculate 3 bedroom, 3 bath 2-story Loft home with PRIVATE Rooftop Patio. Great entertaining open layout w/dramatic high ceilings: all-white kitchen w/ huge island, game room, deck w/gas grill. Tucked away on a quiet street, you can walk 45 seconds to Wrigley, board the CTA Train 3 blocks away, and get to downtown in only 15 mins! Over 675+ 5-STAR reviews!!! 4 private parking spots available for rent.

You will love the huge dramatic opening as you enter the space.  Everything is set for you to have fun -- fully stocked kitchen w/ decanter, cookware, and even spices. Board games available.  Foosball table and arcade station for fun with friends.  Outdoor porch and deck allow you to bond with your friends & family.  Front entrance and back entrance allows for maximum convenience.

Sleeping Arrangements: 
Our apartment has 4 real queen beds in 3 bedrooms, plus a Japanese-style full size pullout in the game room to sleep 10 adults in real beds.  An additional 6 adults can sleep in the 2 queen size deluxe air mattresses, and 2 extra long (96") plush sofas to maximize your sleeping arrangements.  

The apartment has state of the art digital wifi locks for keyless entry (convenient for groups) and you are sent a special code just for your use.  Your safety and security are completely -- the entry codes are auto-generated for you during your stay and no previous guests can access the apartment after they check out.   In addition, the building has video surveillance in the building outdoor perimeters and lobby.  

The apartment also comes with a learning Nest thermostat, Echo speaker with Alexa, a state-of-the-art modern gas fireplace, and tons of board games, books, outdoor grill, and foosball table for your enjoyment.

You will be able to enjoy both floors of this gorgeous apartment... the outdoor porch, the private roof deck, every bedroom and bathroom, the foosball table and arcade in the game room, and of course the spacious open immaculately-designed entertainment area!

As guests you will enjoy total privacy and the entire apartment is for your use only.  We are available 24x7 by text / phone for any questions, recommendations, special needs, etc.

I love this city and have a whole host of recommendations in Wrigleyville, Boystown, Lakeview, Lincoln Park, River North, and Chicago landmarks.  Ping me for any recommendations!

Recommendations for the best venues nearby?  Restaurant reservations?  Best spots locals go to?  Special event and celebration requests?  Need your fridge stocked with groceries and/or beverages?  Simply ping me and I got you covered!

LITERALLY it will take you 2 minutes to walk to the center of Wrigleyville and 5 minutes to wander over to Boystown!  You cannot get any closer.  Yet the apartment is in a beautiful building tucked away on a curved street (Cornelia) and it is very quaint so you don't here any of the ruckus.  

From the roof deck you can see the entire Chicago skyline - from John Hancock, to the Trump building, and even Sears/ Willis Tower.

You can also see the top of Wrigley Field and the bleachers... and during game day or concert you will feel like you're IN THE ACTION!

Check out one of the pictures in the listing that has a map detailing how crazy close you will be to everything!

Park like you're literally almost at Wrigley Field -- up to 4 private parking spaces from the building (A1 Property Management) available for a nominal fee. Second car spot available for a discount as it is a tandem spot.

Super DUPER close to every transportation option - L train options:
Red Line Addison is a short 2 blocks East; 
Red Line Belmont is 4 blocks south; 
Brown Line Southport is 4 blocks West.  

Get to Downtown / Chicago River / Millennium Park within 15 minutes by train.

SUMMER BOOKINGS (MAY-SEPTEMBER) WILL OPEN IN FEBRUARY 2020.  PLEASE DO NOT SEND INQUIRIES REGARDING THOSE DATES UNTIL THE DATES ARE OPEN.  

Please check out over 675+ reviews averaging 5.0 stars on Airbnb across my other listings in Chicago for a better idea of the quality, essence, and hospitality of our Airbnb listings.... you will be in good hands!  

During winter season (December - March), we provide COMPLIMENTARY street parking permits for one car.

Surcharges: Kindly note, during the peak Summer/Cubs season (May-October), all weekend stays less than 3 nights carry a small surcharge of 20%.  During March & April, all weekend stays less than 3 nights, incur a small surcharge of 10%.  No surcharges during off-peak season (November through February).    All surcharges are assessed separately from the Airbnb booking, but are only assessed over room rate (cleaning fees, taxes, and Airbnb fees not applicable). 

Small third-party additional cleaning fee applies for groups larger than 10.

Please note a 2nd Queen size airbed is available if the guest size is greater than 10 guests, or by request only.  Please note that to accommodate parties of 15 or 16 guests, we provide linens for the extra-large plush sofas in the living room.
house_rules:
(1) Please respect our neighbors, as well as Building and House Rules, and avoid any loud noises and parties.   ANY noise complaint from other building residents or neighbors, will result in IMMEDIATE TERMINATION of reservation and a BUILDING FINE OF $500.  
(2) Must provide complete list of guests to be registered with the building within 72 hours of booking else risk cancellation
(3) Must follow ALL checkout instructions posted on kitchen counter (and Airbnb's House Manual) else be charged $40
(4) Smoking allowed ONLY on outdoor patio -- please collect and dispose all ashes.  Young children live below -- NO flicking of ashes from the ledge of the patio.
(5) No overnight guests NOT on reservation - host reserves right to immediately cancel reservation if this is violated
(6) Same day instant booking reservations completed after 4pm, may have to wait up to 2 hours to be able to check-in (if unsure please send Host an inquiry BEFORE booking)
(7) Any peak season weekend bookings between March-October of  less than 3 nights  carry a small surcharge of 20%.  All surcharges are charged separately.

description:
Is this your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay. www.airbnb.com/c/christiang5737 
Are you ready to become a host.?! Use this link to get started.! 
www.airbnb.com/r/christiang5737 
Private room in a brand new mobile home 10 minutes from O'Hare airport, clean and safe community. Allstate Arena, River Casino,Outlet mall, Donald Stephens Convention Center. 
✓ Free WiFi. 
✓ Continental Breakfast. 
✓ Uber/Lyft to airport around $15-$20, 10- 15min

Come stay in my (1000sq ft) mobile home (private room with shared full bath) right by O"hare airport. Right next to all the great tourist hot spots, Rosemont, Allstate Arena, outlet mall, restaurants, Rivers Casino etc.. easy access to the metra(2 miles), the place is ideal to stay near the airport. Within 20 miles drive to downtown and some of the most popular and photogenic spots in Chicago. Why pay $200+ a night at a hotel when you can stay in my house for much less? Allstate arena has concerts all the time, check their concerts program. River Casino offers great food, buffets and music. The house is sunny, spacious, and warm. You'll have your private space. The entire 3 bed/ 2 bath mobile home was build in 2015 Brand new kitchen counter tops, tiles, dark hardwood floors, custom cabinetry, new refrigerator, central heating, and with huge windows. 
 If there is anything you need to help make your stay easier just let me know. I can gladly pick up any food, prepaid phones, or prepaid transit tickets that you'll need beforehand. Any groceries you think you'll need also just let me know. If you forget we're always within a 5 minute drive to a gas stations and 5 min to a Target, Kmart, Our kitchen is pretty stocked with the basics and you are free to use any of the utensils/spaces as you please. Morning people are free enjoy any of the breakfast cereals that we have and any of our coffee as well.

5 miles from O'Hare International Airport
20 miles northwest from downtown Chicago
4 miles away from the Des Plaines Metra Train Station which takes you downtown Chicago
Walk to  # 223 Pace Bus Stop
Next to I-294 Interstate Highway
6 miles from Fashion Outlets Of Chicago
4 miles from Rivers Casino

Situated on the Des Plaines River, Des Plaines is an outdoor lover's paradise. The Des Plaines River Trail features hiking and bicycling paths, and in the winter months draws cross-country skiers and snowmobilers. Autumn is a particularly wonderful time on the river, as the leaves glow in fiery shades of red, orange and yellow.

5 miles from O'Hare International Airport
20 miles northwest from downtown Chicago
4 miles away from the Des Plaines Metra Train Station which takes you downtown Chicago
Walk to  # 223 Pace Bus Stop
Next to I-294 Interstate Highway
6 miles from Fashion Outlets Of Chicago
4 miles from Rivers Casino

No parking.
If you're being picked up by Uber or Lyft, please SHARE YOUR LOCATION with your driver to be found easily.
No shoes in the house. 
No smoking in the house.

additional_house_rules:
Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises. 



Please be aware that this particular location has two beautiful well behaved German Shepherds.   I have other locations that are very close by five blocks away, where we do not have any animals on site. This is my personal residence and if you are not a dog lover this would not be the best listing for you. Please review my other listings where animals are not on site

access: Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!
description:
Beautiful room located in a safe and upscale area . FREE LAUNDRY! New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Homestay is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.

Spacious and clean homestay located in the heart of Forest Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.

Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

I am available for anything you may need!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.

access: Guests have access to the living room, sunroom, kitchen and dining room, in addition to the guest room. There is a second bedroom with a trundle bed that is available at times for an added fee.
description:
We are close to the beach and bus/train lines to Loyola or Northwestern, Wrigley, and downtown. Take off to explore world cuisine, or stay in with full use of the kitchen. We are vegetarian, so we respectfully request no meat in the house. There's room to store food in the kitchen/fridge. You'll hear sounds of the city and active neighbors, but there are cozy spots to read, watch movies, or listen to music. Registration pending.

This is a spacious first-floor apartment on a tree-lined street in a two-flat building built around 1900. The sunroom in front overlooks the street and has a lovely spot to read, eat your morning meal, or rest on the couch. Games and toys for kids and grown-ups, and a nice TV to watch a movie.

Guests have access to the living room, sunroom, kitchen and dining room, in addition to the guest room. There is a second bedroom with a trundle bed that is available at times for an added fee.

We are glad to welcome you to our home, and will be delighted to offer suggestions about things to see and do in the area.  We live in the space and are around most days and glad to be of assistance as you plan your day's activities.  We'll always have tea and coffee, and will try to have some breakfast basics on hand for you to get yourself started in the morning.

Rogers Park is the farthest north neighborhood in Chicago, bordered by Lake Michigan. This is a diverse neighborhood with great coffee shops and restaurants nearby, including a Giordano's at the end of our street and many excellent ethnic restaurants within walking distance or an easy drive. There is a local grocery store around the corner. Additionally, there is easy access to a host of fantastic seasonal and year-round Chicago activities from Shakespeare in the Park to Wrigley Field, to the Field Museum, Millenium Park and other attractions downtown.

We are a 5 minute walk from the Morse Red Line Stop, 10 minutes from the Loyola stop. Ravenswood Metra stop is also about a 10 minute walk. The 147 express bus to downtown leaves regularly a few blocks from our house.  It's 13 miles to Ohare, 22 miles to Midway airport.

This is a vegetarian house and we respectfully request that you not bring meat into our home. Thanks!

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

access: You'll have the entire unit to yourselves!
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My place is a half block from Wrigley Field. You can be to the ballpark in 2 minutes (or Murphy's)!  Enjoy your pregame afternoon feeling the buzz of the neighborhood from the private deck. I have extensive information for you - let's chat!

This is a 2-floor condo with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, an office, 3 outdoor spaces including one large private rooftop deck, and a large living/dining/kitchen area. Completely gutted in the 2000s and modern now, it was originally built in the early 1900s, so it has lived/loved this neighborhood almost as long as Wrigley Field itself! Includes two parking spaces!

You'll have the entire unit to yourselves!

Wrigleyville is hopping with World Series Champions Fever!  You will be mere steps from Murphy's Bleachers and Wrigley Field.

The unit is 1.5 blocks from the Addison Red Line stop.

This unit sits adjacent to the el (Red Line).  The noise can bother some people, but on the other hand, thousands of us live next to it every day.
house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

space:
A basement bedroom with a private bathroom. In the basement unit, there are 3 private bedrooms in total. And a shared laundry is there as well.

If you need, you could use a shared kitchen upstairs.
summary:
My place is a basement bedroom with a private bathroom in the heart of Chinatown resident area. 

A small fridge is in the room. A paid laundry room is available in the apartment.

It is closed to Cermak-Chinatown Redline Station. Several bus stations are within in 5mins walk.

15 mins to Loop and McCormick Place.

You can enjoy every type of Chinese food in Chinatown.

access: Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.
description:
Our apartment offers everything you need including special amenities: Wi-fi and NETFLIX. Walk to everywhere, the neighborhood is full of attractions: Loop, Millennium Park, Ford Center, Riverwalk Magnificent Mile and others, all between 9 and 20 minutes walk distance. The city transportation is also very close - major trains and subway lines are just a one block distance. Great place for solo travelers, couples, small families or even business trip!

our stay will be more like your own home rather than a different place. A large studio fully furnished a walking distance from downtown.
You will find a comfortable king size bed, kitchen utensils, with 100% privacy. We will provide clean sheets, towels, toiletries and blankets. The apartment is spacious for 3 people maximum. In all area has air conditioning, heating and Wi-Fi high-speed internet. In the living room you will find a sofa where you can watch TV with Netflix platform. 
Complete bathroom with all amenities needed: shampoo, conditioner, body soap and hair dryer!
Feel free to wash your clothes with washer and dryer available in unit.

Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.

Should you need help with anything - instructions on how to use an appliance, transportation info or restaurant & sightseeing recommendations? Please let us know. You can always contact us via airbnb messaging. We're always happy to help!

heck-in: from 15:00 h Check-out: 10:00 
We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other service that interest you.

access: Access to the entire apartment and the laundry room, plus Free wifi!
description:
This fabulous historic apartment is within walking distance to a multitude of different restaurants from fine dining, local pizza, to coffee shops, bakery, farmers market, museums, Skokie theater, grocery store, public transportation to Wrigley Field & Chicago, public library, pool, and cigar lounge. You’ll love this clean, smoke free property, because of the cozy ambiance, safe neighborhood, and peaceful comfy beds. It's private, great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

It's an adorable apartment decorated with fine antiques, lots of care and details which give it a cozy home feeling!

Access to the entire apartment and the laundry room, plus Free wifi!

Available via phone or text, and we live upstairs so we are usually around.

Everything you want! Numerous fantastic restaurants, farmers market, Churches, coffee shops, a cigar lounge, library, public pool, parks, quite and peaceful. We are registered on the historic walking tour and on the historic bike tour !

Easy walk (less than 4 blocks) to public train transportation yellow line called the Skokie Swift, bus stop across the street, easy street parking, and easy public parking lot directly across the street too.

Adult oriented space!!!
100% smoke free property!!!

additional_house_rules:
I would ask that if the guest smokes, they would do it outside. No drinking.  I am allergic to cats.
I am severely sensitive to artificial perfumes and dyes, so I provide fragrance/dye free detergent for my short-term guests and ask long-term guests to buy fragrance/dye free laundry detergent.
No aftershave, spray deodorants, or perfume unless it is hypoallergenic.
Please do not put wet clothes or towels on wood surfaces, including the floor.

description:
Comfy private bedroom and bath in an artist's home with European feel.  Access to the kitchen and backyard. Near cafes, beach, and roads and trains that whisk you to the Windy City. Anastasia is a multi-lingual host and composer, author, artist.

Comfy private bedroom and bath in an artist's home with European feel.  Access to the kitchen and backyard. Near cafes, beach, and  and roads and trains that whisk you to the Windy City. Anastasia is a multi-lingual host and composer, author, artist.

My house is close to the lake and to the expressway that goes to the airport.  An amazing tree sanctuary is down the street. There are two small shopping malls within walking distance.



I am often teaching piano at a music school or performing, but I would love to share some tea or a very quick meal occasionally...I am very busy at home!

I love the park across the street and the neighbors.  We have a lot of trees and it is very quiet at night.  I also enjoy seeing films at the old-fashioned  movie house-- the Wilmette Theatre.  I am also a block away from the community center where they have a great fitness place.

I have a free space in my driveway for guest parking.  There is a bus stop  two steps away from my house that leads to a major transit hub where one can conveniently get to the airport by bus or train.

I want my guests to have a wonderful home away from home!
house_rules:
I would ask that if the guest smokes, they would do it outside. No drinking.  I am allergic to cats.
I am severely sensitive to artificial perfumes and dyes, so I provide fragrance/dye free detergent for my short-term guests and ask long-term guests to buy fragrance/dye free laundry detergent.
No aftershave, spray deodorants, or perfume unless it is hypoallergenic.
Please do not put wet clothes or towels on wood surfaces, including the floor.

description:
Nice 3 bed 1 bath in the humboldt park are .Full kitchen fully stocked. 2 queen beds, 1 twin bed, 1 couch and air mattress. Only 20 mins away from Ohare. Comfy private 2nd floor apartment 3 bed 1 bath all to yourself There is 950 sq feet of space. 3 bedrooms and 1 baths. Lots of restaurants and shopping a few minutes away. Free street parking. . Washer and dryer. TV firestick watch any live channel you want. 2nd floor unit

Stay in a private apartment, The apartment has a full kitchen with all the amenities, 3 bedrooms with 2 queen size beds, 1 twin bed, 1 couch, 2 air mattresses for more guests, 1 baths, living room, dining area and  a free parking on street. Washer and dryer.

Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s a lock box code with keys .   It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

great location near Ohare airport. highway and train easy access to downtown chicago. Close distance to restaurants and shops

Top things to do in Chicago area.

 Wrigley Field watch the chicago cubs play, ton of bars, restaurants, and nightlife

Sky Deck Willis tower downtown Chicago

the Bean at Millenium Park towner downtown Chicago

 Shedd Aquarium. Down town Chicago

 Rivers Casino Rosemont IL 

HorseShoe Casino Hammond IN
 Museum of Science and Industry Downtown Chicago 
Magnificent Mile down town chicago.
Maggie Daley Park. Downtown Chicago
Lincoln Park zoo Chicago IL
Lake Front trail for walking and biking. Beaches summer time. Down town Chicago 
 Field Museum for history. Down town Chicago
Chicago River Walk ton of shops and restaurants. Down town Chicago
 Chicago Cultural center. Down town Chicago
 Boat tours Down town Chicago
 Buckingham Fountain Down town Chicago
 Art Institute Down town Chicago
 360 Chicago Observatory Deck Down town Chicago
Richard H. Driehaus Museum Down town Chicago 
Symphony Center - Chicago Symphony Orchestra Down town Chicago 
United Center watch the Bulls, Blackhawks play
Comiskey Park watch the whitesox play

Taxis, Uber, and Lyft are available anytime and cost about $20 to get to anywhere else in town. I prefer Uber.   Also, the public bus stops are a few blocks away come every 15 minutes.

access:
Guests have access to the entire apartment when booking. One room is locked closed and the basement is off use, otherwise the entire place is yours to make yourself comfortable.

Tenants who help out live upstairs of the Airbnb and are available as needed. This is a "family friendly" neighborhood - late night parties are not allowed. Additional people are welcome to visit guests, but anyone not registered as a guest must first be cleared with owners. No additional overnight guests are permitted - other than those included in on the original booking.

Upon arrival guests will find the fridge will be stocked with basic food so you can come in and find something to snack on and make a simple first morning's breakfast - we provide coffee and a coffee maker, a variety of tea and other small appliances.
description:
This light, and comfortable space embodies the Chicago spirit in a historical Chicago 2-flat on one of the best blocks in the city.  Plenty of space in the apartment and all amenities provided for your stay. Lounge on the large outdoor deck and yard.  The wonderful neighborhood offers a nature walk at the end of the block along the Chicago river with restaurants, bars and transportation close by.  Great space for couples, families and work travel. Plenty of free street parking.

The unit is the first floor unit in a two flat, there are tenants that live upstairs and are available to help with any questions you have or things you need.  A sliding glass door opens to a deck in the yard you can use.  The deck will be set with patio furniture and grill in the the warm months.

Guests have access to the entire apartment when booking. One room is locked closed and the basement is off use, otherwise the entire place is yours to make yourself comfortable.

Tenants who help out live upstairs of the Airbnb and are available as needed. This is a "family friendly" neighborhood - late night parties are not allowed. Additional people are welcome to visit guests, but anyone not registered as a guest must first be cleared with owners. No additional overnight guests are permitted - other than those included in on the original booking.

Upon arrival guests will find the fridge will be stocked with basic food so you can come in and find something to snack on and make a simple first morning's breakfast - we provide coffee and a coffee maker, a variety of tea and other small appliances.

I will most likely be near by or traveling and may not be available to meet you.  The tenants upstairs can be available.  I may be able to meet you as you check in or out during your stay.

This block is the sweetest block in the city of Chicago.  The neighbors are warm and welcoming with a community spirit.  The Chicago River is located at the end of the street with a beautiful nature walk.  Take a stroll and watch the ducks, birds, turtles etc. The area is extremely safe and plenty of parking and families out walking dogs and kids playing. Just down a couple of blocks are bars, and amazing restaurants.  There are also two large parks walking distance from the house.

The brown line train is .5 miles walk from the house and will take you straight downtown.  The Western Ave. bus is a block and half from the house and will take you to explore the neighborhoods of the city. Ubers & Lyfts are all over Chicago as well.  The city of Chicago has a bike rental program (Blue Divvy Bikes) and one of the bike rental stations is at the end of the cross street.

Tenants do live upstairs so you may hear them come and go with low noise.

This is a non-smoking environment - NO SMOKING is allowed in the house - we are firm about this and will appreciate it if guests honor this rule.
interaction: I will most likely be near by or traveling and may not be available to meet you.  The tenants upstairs can be available.  I may be able to meet you as you check in or out during your stay.

additional_house_rules:
Quite hours 9pm-9am. Please Please be mindful of neighbhors when playing games. Our neighbors live above and to the side of us. We are all sharing walls and all deserve respect. 
No parties. Only guests on the reservation are permitted in the home. This is a residential neighborhood. If you live in Chicago please message me before instant booking. We also ask that Guests be 21 years old to book and have a current picture on your profile. NO SMOKING ALLOWED INSIDE OR OUTSIDE OF ANYTHING. IF YOU SMOKE PLEASE DO NOT BOOK.
