access: Bedrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry, ensuite baths, bedrooms, front porch, decks and backyard.
description:
Walk to Wheaton College!  Private rooms in a shared home. Beautifully maintained, light-filled home close to campus and train.  Standard booking includes two BRs - 1 queen, 1 dbl, each with en-suite bath.  Optional 3rd BR with queen (both en suite baths) and 4th BR with 3 singles available for additional $60/room/night. Hosts stay in lower level, shared main level. 4 private BRs and 3 BAs are on the upper level. Kitchen, laundary, grill, outdoor spaces all available.

Tall ceilings, large windows, plank pine floors and contemporary colors and decor. Plentiful natural light and a quiet setting.

Bedrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry, ensuite baths, bedrooms, front porch, decks and backyard.

As often as possible, hosts are available to answer questions as well as the occasional local ride to the train station or downtown as needed.

Tree-lined streets, unique architecture and plenty of peace and quiet make this neighborhood special.

Walkable to downtown, quiet and quaint. Close to downtown Wheaton and Glen Ellyn and walking distance to the Metra train.

Grassy backyard for a picnic.  Note that this listing is for a private room within the homeowners' primary house.  Homeowner and their family currently reside in the home, but guests have access to private guest rooms and en-suite bathrooms.
house_rules:
-Please remove shoes in the house.
-Please respect quiet hours from 10pm to 8am with no loud music or socializing in public spaces.
-Hosts are allergic to smoke and strong smells. Please no smoking on the property and avoid use of strong scents and perfumes. Thank you.

description:
This is a spacious "in-law" suite with your own private entrance and check-in in our Wicker Park home. The living room has a cozy fireplace and super comfy furniture, the kitchenette is nicely equipped, and you'll enjoy a good sized bedroom, bathroom and a laundry room. We are on a quiet residential street, just a 5 minutes walk to our favorite coffee shop (Purple Llama) and 15 to the park and the famous Big Star Tacos.

I have lived in Chicago for 25 years and would love to share my favorites places with you. I live upstairs and will be here if you need me, but if you prefer to be left alone that's fine too!

Wicker Park is Chicago's best neighborhood, with great architecture, tons of character and independent shops, bars, cafes and fine dining.

45 minutes from airport. Take the blue line from O'Hare to the Damen or Western stop. We are within walking distance of cafes, bars, restaurants and shops.

We live upstairs and although we try to tread lightly, you may hear us walking around as the floors are a bit squeaky.

-No smoking in our home or on the property.

access: Entire 3bd 2 bath apartment. Rear shared terrace.
description:
Amazing location for Gallager way events, cubs games and concerts at Wrigley Field. This stunning apartment in the heart of Wrigleyville, brand new, fully renovated 3 bedroom 2 bath apartment. Only 2 short blocks away from Wrigley Field!  Close to Addison Red Line & Southport Brown line for easy access to all of Chicago! Explore the nostalgic Wrigley neighborhood with tons of shops, restaurants & taverns within walking distance. Everything you need is just steps away.

Fully remodeled!! Be one of the first to say in this amazing Wrigleyville apartments. Unit has large living room, cool exposed brick dining bedrooms, and great deck off back kitchen to enjoy a morning coffee or tea. This is its own separate second floor unit with three bedrooms and two bathrooms private entrance. Kid and family friendly including furry family! Washer and dryer in unit. We can be available as little or as much as you like

Entire 3bd 2 bath apartment. Rear shared terrace.

Available anytime for your convenience.

This condo is located in Wrigleyville one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. The streets are alive with things to do - Restaurants, Sports Bars, Live Music, Comedy Clubs, Shopping, Wrigley Field, Blue Man Group at Briar Street Theatre, and Lake Michigan are all within very short walking distances.

CTA located steps away from the front door. Near Chicago Brown and Red Lines. Divvy bike stand just across the street and Clark st. bus number 22 in front of main entrance to unit.  Plenty of taxis, Uber’s and Lyfts if your traveling in style. Bird and lime coming soon (we hope)

Rollaways provided upon request.

access:
All guests are welcome to enjoy our home.  
We provide organic coffee/tea, toast, butter, jam in the morning,  bottled water, bath towels, bed linens and WiFi.  
Two flat screen TVs (with cable) are available to watch in kitchen area and Living Room.  
Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Full kitchen use not allowed.
A lovely, large outdoor deck is available in summer, fall to enjoy.
description:
Large Bedroom with very comfortable King size bed on second floor next to a squeaky-clean, modern bathroom.   Perfect for visitors for Loyola or Northwestern University in Evanston.  You will feel at home here.  Sleeps one or two people.

This large room has a wonderful king size bed, spacious closets, and natural sunlight.  I provide high quality, fresh linens and plenty of bath towels.   This room can accommodate 1 or 2 guests.   
I have two other listings that you can look at to see what the best choice is for you.  
Listing #2 is https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1900901  Bedroom in vintage home, Rogers Park (Double Bed)- for one person.
Listing #3 is https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3634631  Perfect for One in Charming home  (Twin Bed)

All rental rooms share the modern shower on second floor.  Perfect for people visiting Loyola or Northwestern (Evanston) for a quick trip or for month long stays.   Easy going hostess provides a safe environment to re-charge for the next day's adventures.  
I have two kittens that behave reasonable well - they are adorable!  

Evanston is 3 miles north and the neighborhood Andersonville is less than 2 miles south.  Both areas have great dining and shopping.  
Downtown Chicago (The Loop) is approximately 8 miles south and public transportation can get you there with ease.  So many Things To Do in Chicago!

House is on a cute, quiet residential block.  You will be happy you chose my house because you will feel comfortable and safe.  This is your home away from home.

All guests are welcome to enjoy our home.  
We provide organic coffee/tea, toast, butter, jam in the morning,  bottled water, bath towels, bed linens and WiFi.  
Two flat screen TVs (with cable) are available to watch in kitchen area and Living Room.  
Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Full kitchen use not allowed.
A lovely, large outdoor deck is available in summer, fall to enjoy.

I live in the home with my partner.  We are quiet and will respect your privacy.  We both work daytime hours and are home in the evenings.   I will be there to greet you and assist with questions.  I will respect your privacy or love to visit - which ever you prefer.

My home is located on a cute,  residential street of all single family homes. Some small to medium size multi unit buildings within a block or so. Quiet neighborhood.

The Metra line is 3 blocks away.  Clark street bus #22 is a block away.    CTA Red Line is about a 15 minute walk, (Morse or Loyola closest stops).  Taxis are readily available.   Chicago also has Uber and Lyft car services.Perfect for people visiting Loyola or Northwestern Universities.

In summer, there  are ceiling fans and window Air Conditioning units in bedrooms, no central air.
house_rules:
I accept respectful guests who will treat my home with care.
Please No smoking, burning candles or incense in any room of the house.   
Please NO eating in bedrooms.  Please Eat in the dining room and clean your own dishes.
Please be clean in the bathroom, use the squeegee on shower glass after use.  
No unauthorized guests to be brought back to home.
Please try to be quiet when returning to the house if it's late in the evening.  
Please remove shoes when entering the house.  Thank you.

additional_house_rules:
Welcome to our Nook , we would like to enhance your visit to CHICAGO with our lovely space . We ask that while you are there you treat it as if it were your own . Starting with taking your shoes off upon your arrival , not wearing heels on the floor as it will scratch the finish . Please do not rearrange or slide any of the furniture or art around . 
This is a large space and sleeps 6 to 8 people . We DO NOT CONDONE PARTIES , however we are above a commercial space and your welcome to enjoy your music .That being said we want you to have a great time , there is a full bar with items for PURCHASE. All the snacks and or drinks in the fridge are free and there for you . 
We want you to enjoy / and or smoke on our deck , it is very important that you DO NOT GO OVER THE FENCE ONTO THE ROOF! It is not stable for walking and we do not want anyone to get hurt . PLEASE DO NOT WATER PLANTS AND OR USE THEM FOR ASH TRAYS .
Please , if you do laundry clean out the the lint when done . 
Please , turn off lights when your not around . 
Recycling is important to us , we provide a recycling bin . For those of you on long stays we ask that you please carry the garbage down and not leave it on the back porch . This is a good space to hang out with friends , please clean up if you have a group of people.
Thank you so much for staying with us !

description:
This spacious   apartment has a classic Chicago vibe . Conveniently location in  wicker park about a mile from the expressway and a half of mile from both the Damen and the Western Blue line stop. With exposed brick throughout the space , and different nooks to hang out in it's a great space for groups of six . There are two sitting  areas , a large kitchen if you came to hang out and cook , great space to entertain .If you came to explore your sure to find whatever your interests are.

Our space has 3 beds and sleeps 6 comfortably , there are also 2 couches . We are above a commercial space so your welcome to listen to enjoy  your music at your listening pleasure. There is an outside area if you choose to smoke , there is no smoking inside . PLEASE DO NOT USE PLANTS AS ASH TRAYS .

I'm always an email or a text away ! I travel quite a bit but if there is a need someone can accommodate you .

This area features some great restaurants & bars . People love the patio at Big star , Etta for a hearty meal , Violet Hour for some fancy cocktails  , Goddess & Grocer for healthy snacks, The Chop shop for live music, Rosa's for some dancing & jazz,Schwa for a tasting menu, Small Cheval for a burger , Piece pizza , Parlor pizza, Lou Malnati's pizza . Lots of great coffee as well to list a few , 2 blocks away is Harrison's coffee& cafe , Dark matter,  Collective .  AND lots of shopping from designer treads to vintage clothing and everything in between . Theres really cool art stores and record shops scattered about . We have the 606 which is a lovely bike path going through the neighbor hood , Wicker park where there is a seasonal farmers market . No matter what your thing is , there will be something for you within a couple blocks !! Have fun !

We are  located 13 miles from Ohare airport , off the Western and fullerton exit on the Kennedy Expy (90) . We are 8.8 miles from Midway airport . The nearest main intersection is Western & North ave . There is the Western Blue stop going north and the Damen blue line stop going east which takes you downtown where you can easily transfer to another line . There  is a metro train by Western and Grand ave . Taxis and uber's are readily accessible . North ave is great for walking , you'll find everything you could need . There is plenty of free over night street parking .

There is keyless entry which you will be messaged instructions upon and not before check in time .

additional_house_rules:
Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises. 



Please be aware that this particular location has two beautiful well behaved German Shepherds.   I have other locations that are very close by five blocks away, where we do not have any animals on site. This is my personal residence and if you are not a dog lover this would not be the best listing for you. Please review my other listings where animals are not on site

access: Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!
description:
Beautiful room located in a safe and upscale area. New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Homestay is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.

Spacious and clean homestay located in the heart of Forest Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.

Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

I am available for anything you may need!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.
house_rules:
Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises. 



Please be aware that this particular location has two beautiful well behaved German Shepherds.   I have other locations that are very close by five blocks away, where we do not have any animals on site. This is my personal residence and if you are not a dog lover this would not be the best listing for you. Please review my other listings where animals are not on site
interaction: I am available for anything you may need!
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.
space: Spacious and clean homestay located in the heart of Forest Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.
summary: Beautiful room located in a safe and upscale area. New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Homestay is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.
transit: Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.

description:
My building is ideally located near the intersection of Oak and Rush. It is steps from the best restaurants, shops, and nightlife on Oak Street, Rush or Michigan Avenue! My unit is beautifully furnished, and is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers or the like. You will be wowed.

You will have everything you could need. My place is fully furnished, has luxury bedding, a 24-hour (airbnb-friendly) front desk, high speed wireless internet, Comcast cable with HBO, and I even have hotel toiletries for you.

Also, Chicago has a number of transportation options. You can easily Uber, cab, bus, or train your way around the city. There's also a divvy station around the corner.

additional_house_rules: Cloud9 House Rules  1. IDs:: All adult Guests (18 and older) must provide ID verification: license, state ID, or passport before Check-in.   2. Security Deposit:: All bookings require a security/damage deposit of $750 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance. *For last-minute bookings or local stays, damage/security deposit may be held in advance by Cloud9*  3. Cancellations:: Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if Check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before Check-in. *No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of Check-in*  4. Check-in:: any time after 4 PM.  Check-out:: any time before 11 AM.  *If an earlier Check-in or later Check-out time is desired, please send a request. We can only confirm 24 hours in advance. No guarantee*  *If an unauthorized late Check-out delays cleaning of the unit, Guests will be charged $100. Any Guest still in the unit after 1 PM will be charged another night (Note: this does not apply if late Check-out was pre-approved)*  5. Violations:: -No smoking or vaping of any kind: $500 fine  -No pets (please notify us if you have a service animal) -Lost/missing keys/fobs: $100 each to replace -Renter is liable for any damage and/or lost/stolen items during occupancy -If extraordinary cleaning is required: $100 every hour of extra cleaning -No parties, gatherings, or events -If the property is used by more than the number of individuals listed in your reservation, we may charge the full security deposit  6. Liability:: Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises and/or using its facilities. It is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. -Guests should report immediately to us anything that presents a danger/could result in damage to the location or individuals  When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.  Shoes off, please :-)

description:
A fabulous high-rise suite in Chicago's bustling West-Loop, by Cloud9. This 2-bed 2-bath features an incredible skyline view that you can admire on your own private balcony. This unit features Mid-Century Modern style with premium accessories like Sonos sound, Le Creuset, and in-suite washer/dryer. Delight in a leisurely swim in the building's expansive outdoor pool. Inside, take advantage of all the other wonderful amenities this building has to offer: like a yoga studio, and a theater!  Enjoy!

Unit Amenities:
- Private balcony
- In-suite washer/dryer
- Full kitchen, featuring Le Creuset 
- Flat-screen TV
- Sonos wireless sound system (integrates seamlessly with included WiFi)
- Freshly laundered linens
- Premium mattresses
- Chicago-based Metric coffee
- Spacious closets
- Toiletries
- Extra pillows and towels
- Stainless steel appliances
- Plank floors
- Stone countertops

Building Amenities:
- Outdoor pool
- State-of-the-art exercise facility and steam room
- Yoga studio
- Business center
- HD movie theater
- Terrace lounge w/community firepit
- Private footbridge linked to Jewel-Osco
- Lounge area with billiards table
- Basketball court
- Bicycle storage and services
- GE car charging stations

Guests have full access to entire unit. Guests have access to building amenities with included key fob.

The Check-in and Check-out process is entirely automated, but we are available to answer questions through the app or email, or give us a call.

The West Loop is a study of contrasts, mixing the bright and chic with the industrial and gritty. With a plethora of new restaurants on Randolph Street and Fulton Market, this location offers a full spread of the real taste of Chicago.

Utilize the ParkChicago app for metered street parking. The SpotHero app is also useful for parking.

There is public transportation nearby as well:
65 Grand Avenue Bus

517 N HALSTED ST
Chicago, IL 60615
 
Union Station
goo.gl/maps/hudvCowc8nT2
210 SOUTH CANAL STREET 
Chicago, IL 60615

Please let us know in advance if you want to reserve the parking space

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our 3 bedroom Bucktown condo is a cheerful and convenient place to call home during your Chicago stay - we're just up the street from the renowned Bloomingdale Trail, and a few blocks off the neighborhood's shopping district on Damen. We're also right around the corner from Lottie's Pub, made famous by Chicago Fire, and you'll love Bucktown's charm and how easy it is to get to the Loop from here - book today!

Our garden-level condo has three bedrooms and two bathrooms - one of which is an ensuite in the master bedroom, with a luxurious standup shower - and a recently renovated kitchen with new appliances. There's a dining room with seating for 6, and our living room has a cushy L-shaped couch and wall-mounted TV.

I travel often so I use and trust an off-site management team to help guests get the information and service they need to make their stay enjoyable! They will be your contact for all communication leading up to and during your stay.

One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

We're a 10 minute walk to the Damen blue line station, and just steps to the Damen and Armitage buses - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

access:
Kitchen, dining room and living room
Restful, private backyard with fire pit and charcoal bbq
Washer and dryer located in basement
description:
Welcome to my 3-story historic landmark Evanston home w/3 rooms to choose from 2.5 blocks from CTA and 5 blocks from Metra.  Ideal for Northwestern Univ-related business or family affairs w/multi-room needs.  Bath in hall is shared by guests. Self-serve breakfast included.  Use dining room, living room, backyard, board games.  Wifi is strong anywhere in the house. Close to Downtown Evanston, 80+ restaurants, Union Pizzeria & Space for musical acts and good eats. 15-minute walk to Lake Michigan.

The house is one unit of a landmarked Holabird and Roche, 5-unit row-house built in 1892. A 3-story home located in a quiet, tree-filled neighborhood full of beautiful historic churches and homes. 
Guest rooms are on the second floor and share a bath. Out of respect for our neighbors and other guests, we lock the door at 11:30p unless special arrangements have been made in advance.

Kitchen, dining room and living room
Restful, private backyard with fire pit and charcoal bbq
Washer and dryer located in basement

I am happy to provide as much or as little interaction as you desire. I work at home, so am available more often than not and am more than willing to provide restaurant or other suggestions to enhance your stay.

Location is on a quiet, tree-lined street with a park just a block away. Many other historic homes and churches within walking distance.  Lake Michigan is just 3/4 mile away with beaches, parks, and biking and walking paths. There are Trader Joes, Whole Foods and Jewel/Osco stores approximately 1/4 mile from the house. Many fine restaurants are within walking distance . Approximately 1.25 miles from Northwestern University.

You can get to anywhere around Evanston and the city of Chicago from the Dempster Street purple line (2.5 blocks)and Davis Metra (5 blocks) stops which are within easy walking distance. Evanston has over 80 restaurants covering almost any ethnic food you could desire.

The bus route 250 which travels to and from O’Hare airport has a stop at the Davis St. (5 blocks). Ample free street parking is available on the blocks surrounding the house.

There is no smoking allowed in our home. 
You are welcome to use the kitchen as long as you clean up following its use. 
Please, no wet or dirty footwear (slippers provided). 
Please treat our home with the same care and consideration you would your own.
Wi-fi available throughout the house.
Though as a rule, parties are not allowed, if you have need of a place to host family or colleagues during your stay, let me know and we can see what accommodations can be made.
If you are staying with us and have booked more than one room due to an event such as a wedding where multiple guests need to get ready all at the same time, an additional bathroom can be made available.

access: The entire property is available to guests
description:
The apartment is located in the heart of Lincoln Park one of the most prestigious areas! You are steps away from Lincoln Park Zoo, the Lincoln Park Conservatory and Lake Michigan Lakefront. This beautiful 1700 SF 2 Bedroom 2 bathroom apartment is 10 minutes away from Downtown Chicago by car with plentiful public transit options. You can not beat this location!

The master bedroom features a king-size bed with flat screen TV. The guest bedroom has a queen bed and en-suite bathroom. The living area has a pullout sofa the size of a standard queen bed. The apartment features 11-foot ceilings, featured brick walls, hardwood floors, and a wood burning fireplace (not operational). The kitchen features stainless steel appliances, and the family room features a flat-screen TV.

The entire property is available to guests

Please contact me through Airbnb message and I will be happy to help.

Lincoln Park is also home to five architecturally significant churches: St. Vincent de Paul Parish, St. Clement Church, St. Josaphat's (one of the many so-called 'Polish Cathedrals' in Chicago), St. James Lutheran Church and St. Michael's Church in the Old Town Triangle area of Lincoln Park. Visible from throughout the neighborhood, these monumental edifices tower over the neighborhood, lending the area much of its charm. Five Lincoln Park churches are affiliated with the Catholic Church (St. Bonaventure Oratory, Saint Clement Church, St. Michael in Old Town, St. Teresa de Avila Catholic Parish, St. Vincent de Paul Parish). The neighborhood also houses Children's Memorial Hospital (recently moved to Streeterville and was renamed Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago) and the currently closed Lincoln Park Hospital (formerly known as Grant Hospital and before that German-American Hospital), which is slated for redevelopment to condominiums, apartments, medical offices, and retail to be renamed Webster Square.

Chicago has an and easy to use public transportation system. The Chicago Transit Authority from both airports (ORD and MDW) to the city and buses and trains to every neighborhood. You can pay-as-you-go for about $2.25 one-way or pick up a CTA 1,3,7 or 30-day Ventra Transit Account Card and ride the buses and trains any distance as much as you want. The CTA website / APP can help with every aspect of travel plans while you're here on your vacation.

Chicago also has one of the largest bike rental programs, just under 5000 bikes at almost 500 neighborhood stations -- Divvy Bike Share Program. You can rent at one docking station and ride as long as you want and when you're finished, just drop off at a station nearest destination.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this sophisticated River North furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and lovely living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI133)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this two-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking

- Bike Storage
- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

description:
This sunny & spacious 2bd / 2ba is the perfect getaway in the epicenter of the bustling Fulton Market neighborhood. Find Chicago’s most eclectic restaurant scene steps from your apartment. Explore the many coffee houses, shops, and galleries the West Loop has to offer. Downtown and Millennium Park are a short "El" ride away. 

Pressed crisp linens, complimentary assorted coffee and fluffy towels await!

This unique Fulton Market rehab has exposed brick, three skylights, and an open floor plan. There are two bedrooms and two bathrooms, and there is a trundle bed that opens to a king in the living room. The apartment has a washer/dryer, and the large kitchen has everything you need. There is a large deck off the living room.

The apartment takes up the entire second floor of a two story historical Fulton Market building. You have your own private entrance on Lake Street with a private stairwell that leads to your 1000 square foot apartment.

Guests will be given a key code to use for entry. I will be available before and during your stay to help in any way and to give recommendations of things to do in the neighborhood!

The Fulton Market District/West Loop is Chicago’s former meat and produce warehouse district. Many existing brick and timber loft buildings have been converted to other uses, including condos, creative offices, art galleries, restaurants, hotels, and retail boutiques. 

This is a must-visit locale, and locals and tourists alike descend on the neighborhood to dine at the many critically acclaimed restaurants. Blackbird, Girl and the Goat, Momotaro, Au Cheval, Lena Brava, Publican, Avec, Green Street Smoked Meats, Federales, Smith & The Loyalist, Eden, Moto, and Elske are just a few. 

McDonalds new global headquarters, Google’s midwest headquarters, SRAM, MNML, and many other innovative companies are in the neighborhood. There is a We Work office a couple blocks from the apartment. 

Millennium Park and the theaters of the Chicago Central Business District are a short train ride away. The United Center for Bulls, Blackhawks, and concerts is a short cab ride or shuttle ride to the west.  Walk to City Winery for a concert! 

This is the hottest area in Chicago right now, and this apartment is in the epicenter just steps from Morgan Station.

Morgan Station with Pink and Green train lines is on your block. Access any part of the city through Chicago's "El" network. A DIVVY bike station is on the corner with bikes available to rent 24 hours a day. Many nearby restaurants offer shuttles to the United Center.

The Chicago "El" Morgan Station with Pink and Green train lines is conveniently located on the nearby corner. Google's headquarters is a block away. It would take weeks of dining out to hit all the great restaurants in walking distance from the apartment. This apartment is at the center of all the activity!

description:
Cozy. Clean. Comfortable. 

You'll have the entire condo to yourselves, as I only rent my place when I'm out of town - which is quite often! You'll have full access to my spare bedroom, the living room, kitchen, bathroom and balcony. Private entrance into condo through back steps/entrance.

Condo is on a cozy street in Ukranian Village, just a couple blocks away from dozens of great restaurants and bars on Division St. The Division and Chicago bus lines are just a few minutes to walk to, which will take you East downtown.

Available during your stay via text, phone, email - quick communication to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.

CTA bus lines within a few blocks: Division, Chicago, Western
CTA blue line 15 min walk
Ubers/Lyfts - $10 - $15 to downtown

description:
Cozy, clean garden apartment  located in the safe, trendy Logan Square neighborhood.  Short distance to boutique shops, restaurants, nightlife, & the blue line (.4miles) which takes you downtown in 30 minutes.

Easy access to & from airports, groceries, movies, and anything else you could want!

Easy, free street parking. Keyless entry.

This is a great area of Logan Square that is good for anyone who is looking for  a clean, affordable, comfortable stay in a great neighborhood!

You will find a great kitchen area, 2 bedrooms with comfortable beds, a couch and  hardwood floors throughout. Nice size bedrooms! The first bedroom has a queen size bed with a full closet.  The second bedroom has a queen size bed with a desk and hanging rack. 

The kitchen is stocked with basic   cooking essentials
Coffee, tea, and welcome snacks are provided.  

Shower essentials- towels, wash cloths, soap, shampoo are all provided. 

Laundry access available for longer staying guests.

I will always be available 24/7  via a quick call or text.

Logan Square is a vibrant neighborhood with bustling businesses, top rated restaurants, unique coffee shops, and a lively farmers market (Sundays).  
North Milwaukee Avenue is the main commercial strip and features cool restaurants, cocktail bars and craft beer taverns.  Logan is also home to several Michelin Restaurants for those who are foodies but if not, then there are also quirky coffee shops and delis, as well as art galleries and music venues. The Logan Theatre shows movies and has a vintage bar.
The neighborhood is only 6.5 miles away from downtown Chicago!
There's a welcome binder with recommendations on our favorite places in the neighborhood (most are walking distance!), must see places in the city, and a few guides collected from local publications.

There is ample free street parking in front of the apartment. There are no permits required to park. There are also no meters and there are no time limits for parking on the nearby streets.
If driving is not your thing, then the blue line is an 8 minute walk!

access: The guests will have access to the entire basement apartment which includes a private entrance, bathroom, one bedroom with a full size bed. The living area is fully furnished with a futon, tv, microwave, and refrigerator.
description:
The property is located along Lake Michigan about 4 miles from downtown Chicago in the historic Bronzeville Community. A beautiful park is across the street and McCormick Place, Marianos, and  Walmart are minutes away.

The guests will have access to the entire basement apartment which includes a private entrance, bathroom, one bedroom with a full size bed. The living area is fully furnished with a futon, tv, microwave, and refrigerator.

I'm always available for questions and ready to assist you.

Bronzeville is a magnet for young urban professionals and  entrepreneurs who are leading the revitalization of the area and the restoration of its historic landmarks. The history of the area has made it something of a tourist attraction, and the neighborhood has many new businesses, including cafes, coffeehouses, and quaint shops. The demographic trends young, but there are many families with children in this tight-knit community.

Bronzeville is convenient to the city’s business district with easy access to anywhere in town, with plenty of public transportation options. The Chicago Transit Authority operates the Red and Green rail lines which serve the Bronzeville neighborhood, as does the Metra Electric District Main Line. Several bus routes run through the area, and the major artery of the Dan Ryan Expressway is just a few minutes’ drive away. Anywhere in the city of Chicago can be reached quickly and easily by public transit or by car.

Please be mindful of the utilities. Turn off the lights when you aren't using them and don't leave the water running. This helps to keep the cost down. 

Make sure that all the gate and doors are properly locked  when coming and going for your safety and mine.

description:
This private room features 2 separate beds perfect for 3 travelers and an early check-in (1 pm)! The apartment is renovated and includes FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is QUIET & SAFE, even at night!

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> 2 separate beds (1 queen & 1 single sized perfect for 3 travelers staying together!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like. You can park 2 cars!

> The back deck has a beautiful view of the Willis Tower

> Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer

> GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattresses

> Early check-in! 1 pm!

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN WALK to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago) 

> 15 MIN walk to Rush University 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival. I am also providing a booklet full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

additional_house_rules:
Rental Agreement - Once booked you agree to all the terms.

House Rules - These rules are simple to follow but if you cannot follow them please do not book.

• Respect the neighbors/ neighborhood and keep the noise to a minimum.
•No parties or get-togethers of any kind are allowed
•Please keep the noise to a minimum after 10 PM
•Take your shoes off at the door
•Treat my place as though it was your own home.

Damage and Lost Property Information-
•If there are found to be more people staying at the property than the number of guests stated the reservation you will be docketed $25 per person per night.
•Failure to return the keys will result in a $250 lost key charge
•Guests are not permitted past 10pm. That does not mean you can throw a party until 10 pm, parties are never permitted. However I understand people have friends or family in town and they might stop by for a bit and that is ok as long as they also observe the rules.
ºThe reason these rules are in place is to ensure the property, the neighbors and neighborhood are respected. If all three of those things happen there shouldn't be any issue.

After booking and before you stay I require that you send me a picture of your government issued ID. (This is no different than a hotel looking at your ID and credit card upon arrival) Upon receipt of these documents I will send you the necessary access instructions for the unit. You will receive the instructions either 1 week before your stay or immediately if your stay is less than a week away.

access: You have access to the entire apartment. There is a patio to sit on outside located through the back door in the kitchen. There is also a backyard you can feel free to sit in and use at ground level in the back which is a shared space between you and the neighbors.
description:
This vintage penthouse apartment rests at the top of a charming three-story greystone building. Dressed with eclectic style and tree top views of wonderful multicultural Humboldt Park neighborhood. Your stay will be extra relaxing with super comfy beds, old rockers to chill in, and a movie-watching corner! I love being able to connect with people from all over the country and world, and look forward to learning what brings you to Chicago.

My place is located in beautiful East Humboldt Park. This is a hip and spacious 1500 sq foot apartment has 2 bedrooms a large kitchen, bathroom, and laundry. The comfy sofa opens up into a full size bed. Enjoy the exposed brick, tealight fireplace, 42" TV, Blu-ray DVD player, Amazon Fire Stick & Netflix App. There is an iMac set up to browse the internet or check emails. The kitchen features a dishwasher and a large gorgeous granite top kitchen island. The apartment sits on the third floor walk-up with beautiful tree lined street views.

You have access to the entire apartment. There is a patio to sit on outside located through the back door in the kitchen. There is also a backyard you can feel free to sit in and use at ground level in the back which is a shared space between you and the neighbors.

I do have self check-in instructions for you and will leave you enjoy your stay. Should you need me I do live below the unit and am accessible to answer any questions you might have.

This neighborhood is special for many reasons. It is two blocks from Humboldt Park which is one of the largest city parks West of downtown. There are many walkable restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores.

If you drive there is free street parking for your car and no permit needed. The city bus runs a block and a half from the house and I'm centered between three blue line train stops that can shuttle you anywhere in the city.

Sometimes you may need early check-in or late check-out. If it's possible I will absolutely accomodate. If have guests checking in and out on the same day it will be difficult however you may be able to drop luggage off early and pick up keys. That will need to be worked out in advance with me though. Thanks for understanding.

access: Easy entry with code to the front hallway  door and then a code for lockbox to the unit  This is the first floor apartment  which Is the door to the left when you enter the front hallway . Please only use the front doors for coming and going .
description:
Everyone’s favorite  ....The Classic Chicago Red Brick two flat with a charming first floor apartment. KING size bed

Just steps to historic and beautiful Logan Boulevard . Logan Square is quite a large neighborhood and some areas are far better then others particularly for unfamiliar tourists / travelers . This location actually is a PRIME location.  It has long been considered the best section of Logan Square as it’s so close to the Historic Boulevard

Easy entry with code to the front hallway  door and then a code for lockbox to the unit  This is the first floor apartment  which Is the door to the left when you enter the front hallway . Please only use the front doors for coming and going .

I’m happy to offer suggestions and answer any questions or concerns you may have . So if we don’t run into each other feel free to text me anytime .

Gorgeous 2 story Red brick building with a spacious first floor apartment  that is perfect for tourists / business trips / weekend getaway 

 Many will book longer stays because they come to Chicago in search of housing  in the area after a job transfer. Spending some time here before signing a long term lease helps you find the better deals and to get to know the neighborhood . 

Located  in the center of everything  Logan Square has to offer makes this  beautiful and safe neighborhood  the perfect spot to go check out Chicago 

. You will love the easy access to transportation . This will help you get to all the Chicago hot spots like the downtown area or lakefront quickly. After exploring  you just hop back on the train. It’s always a treat to check out the city from the train . Then come home to a true Chicago neighborhood that always has something going on. .

You will be in a great section of Logan Square so simply walking to shops restaurants and cafes will be safe easy and fun. It’s so helpful to be a quick 5 minute walk to the blue line train . This train gets you downtown in 15 minutes or Ohare Airport in 25. 

There are Divvy bikes and scooters for rent a block away as well . UBER and taxis have no trouble finding the home . If you are driving I’m just off the 90/94 expy Diversey / California exit .that gets you downtown or wherever you need to drive quickly . 

The # 76 Diversey bus is a block away and will take you to the famous Chicago lakefront. Just get off at the last stop which is the nature museum and from there you can also rent bikes to explore the 22 mile lakefront trail . For the skateboarders many enjoy the smooth streets and take it to the skate park under the Logan Boulevard viaduct . The city also recently has scooters for rent stationed all over the various neighborhoods.

The home is 120 years old and in great shape by making sure it’s taken care of  . The floors are original and beautiful so please just use your common sense in avoiding scratching or water/ snow damage from shoes by removing them. . Avoid moving heavy items that can mar the hardwood or tile. They’re durable but I just remind everyone to treat the home as your own . Thanks
house_rules:
This is not a mailing address and this address is not to be given out to receive mail or packages . If there’s a reason for such a thing you must notify me first for permission. Of course ordering a pizza or food for delivery is fine . This is just stating that this is not a mailing address . 

Only scheduled guests stay on the premises . 

Codes or keys are not given to non guests for any reason . Only the scheduled guests who are occupying the home . 

Absolutely no smoking in house 

Please be respectful of people living on the property and the neighbors with quiet hours  of 11 pm - 8 am 

No parties or events

No candles or insense

No glitter
interaction: I’m happy to offer suggestions and answer any questions or concerns you may have . So if we don’t run into each other feel free to text me anytime .
neighborhood_overview:
Gorgeous 2 story Red brick building with a spacious first floor apartment  that is perfect for tourists / business trips / weekend getaway 

 Many will book longer stays because they come to Chicago in search of housing  in the area after a job transfer. Spending some time here before signing a long term lease helps you find the better deals and to get to know the neighborhood . 

Located  in the center of everything  Logan Square has to offer makes this  beautiful and safe neighborhood  the perfect spot to go check out Chicago 

. You will love the easy access to transportation . This will help you get to all the Chicago hot spots like the downtown area or lakefront quickly. After exploring  you just hop back on the train. It’s always a treat to check out the city from the train . Then come home to a true Chicago neighborhood that always has something going on. .
notes: The home is 120 years old and in great shape by making sure it’s taken care of  . The floors are original and beautiful so please just use your common sense in avoiding scratching or water/ snow damage from shoes by removing them. . Avoid moving heavy items that can mar the hardwood or tile. They’re durable but I just remind everyone to treat the home as your own . Thanks
space: Just steps to historic and beautiful Logan Boulevard . Logan Square is quite a large neighborhood and some areas are far better then others particularly for unfamiliar tourists / travelers . This location actually is a PRIME location.  It has long been considered the best section of Logan Square as it’s so close to the Historic Boulevard
summary: Everyone’s favorite  ....The Classic Chicago Red Brick two flat with a charming first floor apartment. KING size bed

access: You will have the entire second floor apartment.
description:
Awesome 4 bedroom/2 bathroom in one of Chicago's top neighborhoods. Trendy boutiques, outdoor cafes, and great restaurants and bars. Very family friendly neighborhood with plenty to do with family and friends!

This is a 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom fully furnished apartment in the heart of Roscoe Village. Whether you’re planning a weekend excursion, business trip or need a comfortable place to stay for family or friends, consider our Guesthouse.

You will have the entire second floor apartment.

We are a full service vacation rental agency, with a virtual front desk and concierge.

Trendy Roscoe Village offers boutique shopping and a variety of restaurants & bars.

Approx 2.5 blocks from public transportation which will take you downtown.

We do have a 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom unit in the same building that could sleep an additional 10 guests. The property can accommodate up to 16 total guests.

Guest will also be asked to sign a contract for reservation as per Chicago vacation rental laws.

access:
Guests have access to their own private room and to the common areas of the bungalow. 
A total of 3 rooms are available in the bungalow.
Guests have 24-hour access to the bungalow and the private bedrooms via keypad door locks
The basement is not accessible
description:
This bungalow has been furnished to a great standard. It’s the ideal retreat for a comfortable & cozy stay, located to the south of Chicago. We believe it’s the ultimate location to find some seclusion while needing to be close to downtown Chicago. Get ready to get inspired! Very close to a pristine stretch of lakefront. All in all, guaranteed enjoyment and relaxation. All day long.

This simply styled home makes for a perfectly convenient getaway. Ideal for couples who need to be in the area. But an especially great space for solo and business travelers. Great for people looking for a laid back place to stay. Perfect if you want to be close to the hustle and bustle of Chicago but not right in the middle of it. If you need it, it’s a 20minute drive to downtown. Comfortable, calm and convenient. We love to go that extra mile, so you feel like you are at home.

Without a doubt, this place makes for a true “revival” for those in need of one. We are sure you will enjoy this home as much as we do.

We’ll supply you with:
- Ultra comfortable bed Linen
- Towels
- Bathrobes
- Toiletries
- Fast & Free Wi-Fi
- Fully stocked fridge

We guarantee a private stay. The bathroom is shared with three other rooms. Upon your arrival, we will stock up the fridge with fresh milk, yogurts, cereals, drinks and some other healthy and extremely tasteful essentials. To make sure you have the basics without having to leave home to get them.

We have provided teas, coffee, and snacks, so all that’s left for you to do is relax and settle in after your journey. Or if you prefer, you can enjoy a refreshing shower; we have stocked the bathroom with gentle toiletries.

Guests have access to their own private room and to the common areas of the bungalow. 
A total of 3 rooms are available in the bungalow.
Guests have 24-hour access to the bungalow and the private bedrooms via keypad door locks
The basement is not accessible

We will be happy to tailor to all of your needs during your stay to make your trip to Chicago an unforgettable one. After you check in via SMART lock, we can answer any questions you have, provide local advice and directions as required. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to local recommendations. We will be happy to assist you with any needs you may have during your visit. Besides that, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

This property is amazing all year round for a visit to Chicago.
The home is located on a very quiet block less than nine miles from downtown Chicago and two to three miles from the University of Chicago campus and the Museum of Science and Industry. It is also located within blocks of the future site for the Obama Presidential Library.
Hyde park, many biking trails, lakefront, restaurants, supermarkets, Starbucks, Jackson Park Hospital and much more are just a stone throw away.
Loads to do for all tastes, from outdoors adventures for urban city explorers to total isolation for those who prefer the homely and the comfy!

The property is close walking distance from CTA public bus lines and Metra Train which heads straight to the downtown area and south suburban areas.

Room amenities
- Fully furnished & nicely designed
- fridge - SMART TV – Hulu, Netflix - Chromecast
Extra facilities
- Bluetooth speaker
- Extremely comfortable double bed
- Great bed linen
Bathroom
- Toiletries
- Towels
- Hair-Dryer
A wonderful kind of seclusion. This means you can enjoy a truly quiet and homely atmosphere. All in all, a quiet and convenient retreat.
Contact us today for a unique BnB experience! We would love to welcome you to your home away from home. For any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us.

Be mindful of the space and the property

After you check in via SMART lock, we can answer any questions you have, provide local advice and directions as required. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to local recommendations. We will be happy to assist you with any needs you may have during your visit. access: Your room is your own private space and the rest of the apartment is shared.
description:
This is a private room in a 3BR apartment (all 3 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and Wrigley Field are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 12-minute train ride away via the nearby Belmont Red/Brown/Purple Line station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Queen-size bed
✔ Fully-Equipped Kitchen
✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
✔ 44" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board
✔ Dishwasher

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club and co-working space located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower (for reservations <14 days).  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

Your room is your own private space and the rest of the apartment is shared.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander.

THINGS TO DO NEARBY

✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game.
✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail.
✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre.
✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Belmont Red/Brown Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're a short walk from the Belmont 'L' train station. Search for “Belmont Red Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

access: Guests have access to the entire house, including the kitchen to cook your favorite meal, as long as the kitchen is clean and all safety guidelines are followed.
description:
This is a 7 bedroom, 3.5 bathrooms house in a quiet neighborhood. House has 2 kitchens, spacious dinning and living rooms, a small family room, and enclosed patio. This room has 1 comfortable double bed. Homestay includes breakfast & some dinners.
This room is only available for guest staying over 4 months. 

This room can accommodate 2 guests - bookings for second guest have an additional $20 per day fee.

My home is within minutes of restaurants, entertainment, movie theater, small art galleries. 
There is a fresh food market within a block, and a Walmart within 8 blocks.
I'm 40 minutes away from downtown Chicago. 
My central location makes ideal for guests doing internships anywhere within the Chicagoland area because I'm minutes way from most expressways. 
The house is served by the Blue Line Train and the bus is one block away.

Guests have access to the entire house, including the kitchen to cook your favorite meal, as long as the kitchen is clean and all safety guidelines are followed.

My community is very safe and offers the convenience of a food market, shopping, restaurants and public transportation within few blocks.

I'm one block away from the bus that takes you 10 minutes away to the Blue Train Line that goes all around the city and the airport.  
I have street parking and have accessibility to the zoning guest passes for you.

I have high speed ATT - WIFI. Ask me for the code. I have my business license. Cleaning fees are charged per visit, or per month, depending on the length of your stay. 
Monthly cleaning fee for short-term guests is $75 and includes other toiletries such as toilet paper and and additional home goods, cleaning and kitchen supplies used by the long-term guests. 
Long-term cleaning and supplementary fee is $50 per month, in addition to the monthly rental fee. 
For your convenience this fee can be paid either all at once when doing the homestay booking, or it can be paid on a monthly basis to the host via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), or Chase Quickpay.

access: The loft is a private access with keypad entrance.  You will have access to the loft and the backyard for sitting out or having breakfast.
description:
This affordable loft is ideally located 20 minutes from Downtown Chicago in Historic Oak Park.  The loft is a clean, comfortable, private, second story apartment with a 5-Star rating.    It offers free WiFi, a large private bedroom with a comfortable queen bed and quality linens.  The master bathroom has a large custom shower with soft bath towels.  
The kitchenette provides the needed coffee, micro, and mini-fridge with some simple breakfast treats to get you going in the morning.

The living room has a sleeper couch (full bed),  49” Roku TV, and a coffee table that converts to a dining table with two chairs for meals ordered in.  

There is an office area with a roomy contemporary desk for laptop and ample plugs for all the electronics needed.    

I encourage you to read our guest’s reviews.  They are the best ambassadors we could ask for in providing you with details about our Airbnb loft.  We hope to see you soon in Oak Park.  

We offer a 10% discount to active duty, reserve, or retired military personnel.

The loft is a private access with keypad entrance.  You will have access to the loft and the backyard for sitting out or having breakfast.

As our guest, the loft provides you with private space to relax and unwind.   However, as life-long Chicagoans,  we are always available for Q & A, or to chat about Oak Park, commuting to the Loop, local restaurants or info regarding any of the hundreds of activities in Chicago and Oak Park.

The loft is located on a quiet, safe,  tree-lined street that is 2 blocks from the Blue Line train to Chicago or O'Hare Airport.  Walking distance to unique restaurants, coffee houses, shopping, spas & grocery.  Walk, bike or ride-share to Frank Lloyd Wright Museum, Historic Hemingway House, Art District, and Downtown Oak Park.  Two bikes are available with advance notice.

Blue Line elevated train (2 blocks), Pace bus stop (1 block), Green line elevated & Metra are just a short walk.

description:
This cozy apartment in the centrally located River West neighborhood is just steps from everything city! Adjacent to Blue line, buses, divvy and the highway. Enjoy a full kitchen, roomy bedroom and inviting living space. A quiet retreat in the city center! Highest complements are for my amenities and central location.

The apartment is spaced with rooms on either end so you will have plenty of privacy. The large bedroom and closet will give allow you ample storage for luggage and clothing. Amenities in room include iron, hairdryer, AC unit for your control, and TV in the room with amazon fire with many paid options. Daily parking permits provided. Apartment has been upgraded with keyless entry for a flawless and flexible arrival!

Blue line
Divvy bikes
66 Bus to Michigan Ave and Oak street beach
General store (CVS) 
Dunkin' Donuts

Generally very little host interaction as work takes me out of town! I will have a co host to help out when I’m not available.

Proximity to transportation! Train, bus, bike, and highway access. Also a very quiet part of town. Very little noise and very safe environment! Great spots for food and drinks close by as well! Quick bus to Michigan Avenue shopping and Northwestern medical campus! Quick train to downtown and Millennium park! Close to highway with street parking for those who wish to bring a car!

Blue line across the street
Divvy bikes
66 Bus to Michigan Ave and Oak street beach
56 Bus up and down Milwaukee Ave

Approximately 35-40 min Blue line train to/from O'hare Airport

Keyless entry allows for anytime arrival! Early check in and check out are happily granted on a case to case basis. Leaving luggage past checkout is generally also allowed in the hallway area. A new listing will be added this winter and a guest may occupy the 2nd bedroom.
house_rules:
•Noise at a respectable volume for neighbors while outside
•No parties and guests must be pre approved
•Shoes off helps keep a clean space and is kindly appreciated
•Always use caution on the patio and no more than 4 people on deck at one time
•Smoking outside only
interaction: Generally very little host interaction as work takes me out of town! I will have a co host to help out when I’m not available.
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to transportation! Train, bus, bike, and highway access. Also a very quiet part of town. Very little noise and very safe environment! Great spots for food and drinks close by as well! Quick bus to Michigan Avenue shopping and Northwestern medical campus! Quick train to downtown and Millennium park! Close to highway with street parking for those who wish to bring a car!
notes: Keyless entry allows for anytime arrival! Early check in and check out are happily granted on a case to case basis. Leaving luggage past checkout is generally also allowed in the hallway area. A new listing will be added this winter and a guest may occupy the 2nd bedroom.
space: The apartment is spaced with rooms on either end so you will have plenty of privacy. The large bedroom and closet will give allow you ample storage for luggage and clothing. Amenities in room include iron, hairdryer, AC unit for your control, and TV in the room with amazon fire with many paid options. Daily parking permits provided. Apartment has been upgraded with keyless entry for a flawless and flexible arrival!
summary: This cozy apartment in the centrally located River West neighborhood is just steps from everything city! Adjacent to Blue line, buses, divvy and the highway. Enjoy a full kitchen, roomy bedroom and inviting living space. A quiet retreat in the city center! Highest complements are for my amenities and central location.
transit:
Blue line across the street
Divvy bikes
66 Bus to Michigan Ave and Oak street beach
56 Bus up and down Milwaukee Ave

Approximately 35-40 min Blue line train to/from O'hare Airport

additional_house_rules:
House Rules:

All bookings require a security deposit of $500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.  

Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 125 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards.  

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.  

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.  

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M -11PM. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. 

We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

 Our locations do not allow pets.  No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit.  

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required.  

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. 
Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

Lost or unreturned keys will result in an additional $100 fee (per set).  

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.  We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays.  

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately.  

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance.  

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.  

Shoes off, please.

description:
Pour a cup of Nespresso and start the day in the marbled bathroom with Alba Botanical bath and body products. This Parisian-inspired apartment includes an inviting chesterfield sofa, from where fine city views can be seen through tall windows.

Neighbourhood overview
This apartment is conveniently located within walking distance of McCormick Place and Wintrust Arena, together with some of the city's best dining. A short drive will reach attractions such as the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Chicago Bean.

Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

access: The entire home is yours for the duration of your stay!
description:
Imagine yourself spending the weekend in a beautiful New Orleans style maison dropped into the heart of the Windy City. Huge gorgeous Victorian lovingly restored to its' original glory.  Vintage furniture throughout.  Approximately 4000 square feet, this house does not disappoint.  Pool table parlor, speakers throughout, roof deck... This three story home (plus basement) is great for larger groups, modest events, etc...  Going to a game or a concert at United Center?  Only a five minute walk!

The entire home is yours for the duration of your stay.  This massive gorgeous corner home just a couple blocks west of the United Center has been painstakingly restored with attention to detail and just a bit of southern flair.  Explore three full floors featuring six fireplaces, multiple parlors, dining room, light filled atrium, backyard with fire pit, pool table, music lover dream lounge (over 20 signed guitars!), 3 good sized bedrooms and a huge master suite on the third floor with private roof deck. You will love staying here.

The entire home is yours for the duration of your stay!

Our property manager is always available!

Just west of the United Center!  A block from Pete's Fresh Market! Just a couple blocks from the IL Medical District, Ukrainian Village, TriTaylor and just a mile and a half west of Randolph St/Fulton Market and all that the West Loop has to offer.

Blue line is just two blocks away!

Did you know that Chris comes from a family of artists?  Both Chris' father and grandfather went to the Art Institute of Chicago and you will find original paintings throughout the house.

additional_house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.

No Smoking
The home (and entire building) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Keys
If you happen to lose your key, you will be charged $75.

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire or police related emergencies please call 911.
