access: The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.
description:
Welcome to PRARIE SMOKE in the historic Uptown neighborhood, where jazz is king! With an eclectic feel and radiant vibe, Uptown is filled with music, nightlife and truly unique multi-cultural cuisine! Less than two blocks to the lake, this home is a stunner in every season! This comfy studio is perfect for business or pleasure. Whether you're looking for a night in with your sweetheart, or a night out with your friends, Uptown has endless romance, culture, and entertainment.

The Space
Sleeping Arrangements 
This studio apartment features one queen bed & a convertible sleeper sofa (queen). 

Kitchen  
The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.  
 
Cleaning Supplies  
You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels.

Washer/Dryer 
There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay!

TV
The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize during your stay. 

Non-Smoking 
The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.

We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing reservations@livly.io!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.

For live music and nightlife, sit back for some jazz at the Green Mill, a 100-year-old classic where the swanky atmosphere harkens back to prohibition's heyday. Or for a lively mix, go for either indie rock, salsa concerts, world-class boxing or colorful wrestling matches at the Riviera or Aragon.

More information
Historical landmarks districts in Uptown Square are just some of the architectural highlights. Immerse yourself in the present while experiencing history, just have a sample of the ethnic cuisines that have found a home in the neighborhood. On Argyle Street and the surrounding blocks, you can take a tour of Asia with destination restaurants serving up Beijing duck, sushi, traditional Chinese dim sum and Vietnamese specialties like banh mi and pho. Adding to the variety are ethnic grocers mixed among Ethiopian, Lebanese, Indian cuisine and SO much more.

Whether you got a set a wheels, using public transportation or you're just old fashioned walking, the neighborhood works for any transportation needs.

There is easily accessible "Pay to Park" street parking. Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few blocks from the red line for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses on every street corner.

The neighborhood is all completely walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.

Check In / Check Out
Check in starts at 4 PM CT
Check out time is 11 AM CT

We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  

Luggage Hold 
If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.

Pets
There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them.

Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids.

While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you will be required to provide up to date vaccination records and will be fully liable for any medical, veterinary, or property damages incurred.
house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.

No Smoking
The home (and entire building) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Keys
If you happen to lose your key, you will be charged $75.

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire or police related emergencies please call 911.

description:
Enjoy city living in this beautiful newly remodeled multi level home in the heart of Wicker Park/Bucktown, known as a hip, trendy and artistic neighborhood that continues and remains one of Chicago's most fashionable places to live and stay. This house comes with onsite private garage parking, tons of closet space, vaulted ceilings, jetted whirlpool bathtub, onsite laundry room. You will enjoy all the restaurants, shopping and public transportation right at your fingertips.

On site parking is available in private 2 car garage.

I will greet you at the house during check in or send you a code via message to let you in the house. I live in the area so if you have any questions, problems or simply need recommendations for dinner, please don't hesitate to call.

Hip Wicker Park has been a residential enclave since Chicago was incorporated as a city in 1837. North Milwaukee Avenue is known for its bustling nightlife, dining and entertainment venues, with Double Door, Subterranean and Davenport’s setting the bar for the city's trendy music clubs. North Damen Avenue draws hip crowds with its quirky shops, minimalist cafes, specialty grocery stores and cool fashion boutiques.

Bucktown is home to a variety of restaurants, from traditional neighborhood eateries to hotspots that prescribe to the latest dining trends. But you won't find many of the typical chain restaurants here; most of Bucktown's restaurants are as independent and eclectic as the neighborhood's residents. Some local favorites are En Hakkore, Shuga Records, and the Victory Gardens Theater. Keeping with the unique spirit of the neighborhood and its residents, Bucktown also features some of the most distinctive shops in the city and is home to more artists than any other area in the Midwest.

The house is a couple blocks away from the Clybourn metra train station that brings you right to the city or a long distance away. You are very close to the Courtland & Hermitage bus station that will bring you right to the Lincoln Park Zoo.

access: Everything on the top floor is accessible only to our Airbnb guests
description:
Our cozy three bedroom apartment is close to everything Logan Square has to offer! A few minutes away from CTA Blue line (takes you from O'hare to Downtown), a few blocks from the highway and within walking distance to the neighborhood's hottest bars and restaurants! 
*Free street parking

With three separate bedrooms, our newly rehabbed apartment is perfect for a family trip or a group of friends wanting to explore Chicago. The pull out couch offers an extra sleeping space with a comfortable memory foam mattress.

With added security in mind, you'll have you're own locked stairway up to the apartment including an extra private room in the back.

Everything on the top floor is accessible only to our Airbnb guests

We're local Logan Square residents so we can easily be reached for whatever comes up!

There is a good reason Logan Square was voted as one of the Nation's Hottest Neighborhoods. With award winning restaurants, multiple breweries & distilleries, and numerous music venues, this trendy neighborhood will have you wanting to extend your stay with us (and we wont mind) ! :)

Enjoy a walk to Logan Square’s all year round farmer's market every Sunday or check out the cities best brunch spots right here in our backyard. Whatever you’re looking for you can most likely find it close by!

We're located only half a mile from the CTA California Stop. So whether you're coming from the airport or going to the city, you'll have no issues getting around. If you want to explore the city a little differently there is a Divvy bike station (one of hundreds around Chicago) around the block that lets you rent out bikes for your adventure! 

Also located only a few blocks from highway entrance/exit so calling an Uber or Lyft will be much easier and less expensive. If you're driving then don't worry about the parking, there's always available spots along the street in front of the apartment

access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
description:
Hyde Park is home to the University of Chicago, the kind of place where they discover the universe is expanding. Expand your own cultural universe when you stay in this eclectic neighborhood, home to Frank Lloyd Wright’s Robie House, theaters, parks, and plenty of culinary destinations both seasoned (get it?) and new. Your unit includes two bedrooms, a full kitchen, and expansive entertainment options.

Access is available to the entire apartment.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Hyde Park, also home to the avant-garde Renaissance Society art gallery, Jackson Park, and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich neighborhood full of eclectic shops, restaurants, and small businesses. Enjoy a stroll through the neighborhood’s expansive green spaces—or explore Chicago by bike when you hop on the Lakefront Trail and cruise for miles.

Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is three blocks to the nearest Metra station that takes you directly to the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.

We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.

access: You'll have private access to your entire floor (1200 square feet) and the shower on the main floor. You're welcome to share use of the kitchen and store food in the main refrigerator.
description:
A whole floor to yourself! Full floor finished basement with light from glass sliding doors, private bedroom, half bath, gym equipment, tv with HD cable, 2 desks and a working printer. Spic and span - we steam clean after every guest! Brand new (1/28/2018) memory foam queen size bed with two more queen size self-inflating airbeds that never gets low if you need another bed. 7 minutes via car to downtown or 2 blocks to train/bus.

This is a 2500 square foot single family home with 12 foot ceilings and the higher end trappings of inhabitants who are coffee, food, and lifestyle snobs (but no snobbish personalities!). 

Your Space: 
  -Large private bedroom with a super comfy, brand new memory foam Queen bed 
  -Awesome airbeds to accommodate a desire for a second bed (full size very comfortable bed that never deflates on you). 

  -Private shower and shared toilet/sink access on main floor (strong water pressure and large hot water heater)
  -Personal coffee maker with fresh ground Collectivo coffee, cream & sugar
  -HD cable tv in your private space
  -Snacks for hungry travelers
  -Brita filtered water
  -Fresh, clean towels and bed linens
  -Adorably soft cat friends to keep you entertained 

Gym Equipment
  -Treadmill
  -Dumbell assortment
  -Resistance bands 
  -Yoga mat, yoga block, yoga strap
  -Aerobic stepper block
  -Spin bike
  -Foam roller

There is also a gym directly behind our house with everything you will need - guest passes at the Pilsen Gym change prices from time to time but are super cheap as a monthly membership is only $20! 

Kitchen Access
  -High quality knives, cutting board, pots & pans
  -Gas burners and oven
  -Refrigerator with space for groceries
  -Vitamix professional blender
  -Hot water pot with specialty temperature settings for various types of tea
  -Cuisineart food processor with assortment of blades
  -Juiceman Jr. for fresh juicing
  -Toaster
  -Microwave
  -Coffee/spice grinder
  -Crockpot

You'll have private access to your entire floor (1200 square feet) and the shower on the main floor. You're welcome to share use of the kitchen and store food in the main refrigerator.

Mi esposo habla español. One of us is usually home and we're available to provide any guidance you need. We also understand that this is your time and you may not want to spend it socializing, so feel free to just say hi and bye. My husband has lived in Pilsen for 40 years and I've been here 15 years, so we know all the spots - feel free to ask for a recommendation!

We're an activist family and care deeply about accommodating all backgrounds - race & ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, religious or nonreligious identity, age, urban/rural, immigration status - all are welcome and respected

Pilsen is our favorite neighborhood in Chicago and is in the midst of dramatic change - hopefully change that retains the vibrant Mexican culture that makes it what it is. This is an artistic and culinary mecca for Chicago, with galleries throughout the neighborhood, politically and socially conscious murals on every block, and a wide array of food, including some of Chicago's best Mexican cuisine. The Mexican Fine Arts Museum is one of the best in the country. Several breweries are located here, along with dive bars, comedy spots, upscale fusion restaurants and music and mole festivals throughout the warm months. This is a demographically diverse community that is still dominated by Mexican families, but has a strong hipster and young professional presence as well. Get ready for Portlandia style beards and coiffed dogs.

Public transit is very convenient - you can hop the 18th street bus a half block away, the #60 Blue Island bus to downtown just 2 blocks away, or the Pink Line El train to anywhere just 2 1/2 blocks away. Get to Chinatown by hopping the #22 bus on Cermak and Ashland - you’ll be there for wontons and Chinese dumplings in 10 min. 

There is permit parking on the street and we're happy to provide you a permit for your time with us for $2/day ($3/day starting Feb 1).

We have two sweet cats, one of whom is very shy and will probably disappear when you're around. The other likes to be petted. They will be kept out of your room unless you want them around.

Pre-check in baggage drop off welcomed. In case you need to drop your bags off before check in, please let us know and we will gladly accommodate you.

Get to Chinatown by hopping the #22 bus on Cermak and Ashland - you’ll be there for wontons and Chinese dumplings in 10 min. 

There is permit parking on the street and we're happy to provide you a permit for your time with us for $2/day ($3/day starting Feb 1).

access: Internet, washer, dryer, cable
description:
Quiet room with new queen bed, TV, shared bath, and full use of our kitchen, living room, dining room. Near shops, restaurants, bus, and trains. 8 Minutes to Northwestern per search engine.

The guest room has a brand-new queen-size bed with extra pillows, as well as an individual fridge. There is a shared bathroom just down the hall with fluffy towels. While staying with us you are welcome to use the well-equipped kitchen and hang out in the living areas.  We have two friendly cats, but they're not allowed in the guest room (unless you explicitly invite them in). There is free wi-fi throughout the house and free parking just outside the front door or in our driveway.

We're always reachable by cell phone in case you need anything - including sightseeing and restaurant tips. 

You'll love Evanston! Our street is 100% residential. Just a short 10 minute bus or 5 minute are ride  away there are cafes, gourmet food stores, bakeries, and other specialty shops. 

Evanston is easy to navigate if you're driving, with plenty of street parking nearly everywhere, but there's also good public transportation. The Metra commuter train to downtown Chicago (28 minutes) or downtown Evanston (4 minutes) . A little away is the Purple Line, part of the Chicago Transit Authority's system of elevated and subway trains. You can get to O'Hare by public transportation in 90 minutes, and a flat-rate suburban taxi will get you there in half an hour. (Add at least 20 minutes to get to Midway.)

Northwestern University (Evanston Campus) is just under 5 miles away. Driving time is 5 minutes.

Internet, washer, dryer, cable

As a good hostess I will do my best to say a hello and good bye.

Our location is close to the 205 cta stop near McCormick and golf or the 208 Pace stop near Mccormick and Church stop.

Just a friendly reminder we have an amazon yellow head parrot in our home as well as two cats.

access:
Kitchen, dining room and living room
Restful, private backyard with fire pit and charcoal bbq
Washer and dryer located in basement
description:
Welcome to my 3-story historic landmark Evanston home w/ 3 rooms to choose from 2.5 blocks from CTA and 4 blocks from Metra.  Ideal for Northwestern Univ-related business or family affairs w/ mult-room needs.  Bath in hall is shared by guests. Self-serve breakfast included.  Use dining room, living room, backyard, board games.  Wifi is strong anywhere in the house. Close to Downtown Evanston, 80+ restaurants, Union Pizzeria & Space for musical acts and good eats. 15-minute walk to Lake Michigan.

The house is one of unit of a landmarked Holabird and Roche, 5-unit row-house built in 1892. A 3-story home located in a quiet, tree-filled neighborhood full of beautiful historic churches and homes. 
Guest rooms are on the second floor and share a bath. Out of respect for our neighbors and other guests, we lock the door at 11:30p unless special arrangements have been made in advance.

Kitchen, dining room and living room
Restful, private backyard with fire pit and charcoal bbq
Washer and dryer located in basement

I am happy to provide as much or as little interaction as you desire. I work at home, so am available more often than not and am more than willing to provide restaurant or other suggestions to enhance your stay.

Location is on a quiet, residential street with a park just a block away. Many other historic homes and churches within walking distance.  Lake Michigan is just 3/4 mile away with beaches, parks, and biking and walking paths. There are Trader Joes, Whole Foods and Jewel/Osco stores approximately 1/4 mile from the house. Many fine restaurants are within walking distance . Approximately 1.25 miles from Northwestern University.

You can get to anywhere around Evanston and the city of Chicago from the Dempster Street purple line (2.5 blocks)and Davis Metra (5 blocks) stops which are within easy walking distance. Evanston has over 80 restaurants covering almost any ethnic food you could desire.

The bus route 250 which travels to and from O’Hare airport has a stop at Davis St. (5 blocks). Free street parking is available on the blocks surrounding the house.

There is no smoking allowed in our home. You are welcome to use the kitchen as long as you clean up following its use. Please, no wet or dirty footwear (slippers provided). Please treat our home with the same care and consideration you would your own.

You must also acknowledge
Pet(s) live on property - There are two dogs who live full-time at the house - Shadow, a silver Standard Poodle and Godfrey, a Norwegian Puffin dog. You may also see Kashyyyk,
No parking on the property - We do not have a garage, but there is very ample street parking on our tree-lined street.
Must climb stairs - There are steps up to the main entrance of the house. The guest rooms are on the second floor one flight up.
Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $100
Some spaces are shared - Guests are welcome to spend time anywhere on the first floor and in the backyard, weather permitting

access: Entire 2nd floor apartment with access to front and back entrances, backyard, porch, basement with washer/dryer
description:
Located in West Rogers Park, this home is set on a quiet, residential block. The apartment is spacious, bright and cozy. Approximately 45 minutes from O'Hare Airport, close to highway and LSD. Within walking distance to parks, Cta, restaurants and shopping. Try authentic Indian, Pakistani and Mediterranean cuisine on nearby Devon Ave, visit ethnic grocery stores and shops. Also within walking distance to Starbucks, Walgreens, dry cleaner and bank and easy public parking.

Lovely diverse neighborhood with friendly neighbors! Our family has lived here for 2 decades and we love our neighborhood. Enjoy a laid back atmosphere in the city with easy access to authentic restaurants, beautiful scenery in Chicago parks, with convenient public transportation on Western or Peterson Ave., 30 minutes from Lake Michigan beaches, 15 minutes from Lake Shore drive.

Entire 2nd floor apartment with access to front and back entrances, backyard, porch, basement with washer/dryer

We are Elma and Edo, originally from former Yugoslavia (Bosnia-Hercegovina), and we have made Chicago home for the last 20 years. We are empty nesters spending our time busy with work, but also enjoying visiting parks and Nature preserves, biking, picnics and summer bbqs. Our children are currently off seeing the world. We love meeting new people and we would help with any questions about getting around the city or any recommendations on places to see and visit. We both work full time and are usually around most evenings.

We love our neighborhood! It is a diverse, immigrant friendly neighborhood, very family oriented with tons of authentic ethnic food available. Easy access to Japanese, Korean, Indian, Iranian, Mexican and Mediterranean cuisine. Devon Ave is a wonderful experience of Chicago's "Little India" with family owned shops, restaurants and dessert cafes! A very authentic Chicago North side experience!

Near Western Avenue, a 5 minute walk to 49 B Western Bus, you can take south toward Western CTA Brown Line Station, located in Lincoln Square, a charming historic neighborhood, and the 84 W Peterson Bus, you can take east toward CTA Bryn Mawr Red Line Station or the beach in the Edgewater neighborhood. Take 155 W Devon Bus east toward Loyola University and the CTA Loyola Red Line stop, or continue onto to another bus that goes to Downtown via Lake Shore Drive. 
A 20 minute drive to I 94, or to Lake Shore Drive. Heading south on Western Ave is also a convenient way to visit other Chicago neighborhoods heading south, or pay a visit to Evanston IL, about a 25 minute drive north of Roger's Park.

There is a lovely family with 2 children who live on the 1st floor, they are respectful, quiet and very friendly!
house_rules:
- Check In between 12 p.m-9p.m
- Check out is at 1 p.m
- Smoking allowed on back porch only

access: Guests have access to the building's fitness center and seasonal pool.
description:
Enjoy scenic city views in this 3 bedroom/ 2.5 Bath, 2 floor townhouse in River West. This space comes with modern amenities such as a rooftop lounge area, pool, and fitness center. Here you’ll find all the comforts of home: full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City. Whether coming for work, pleasure or both, this Domio is sure to delight you and your guests.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 3 bedroom and 2.5 bath townhouse boasts a spacious living room, premium furniture, and high-end finishes. The master bedroom has two queen beds attached bathroom. Bedrooms 2 and 3 each have a queen bed as well. In the living room, there is a sofa bed and air mattress for added comfort.

Guests have access to the building's fitness center and seasonal pool.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

River West is one of Chicago's best neighborhoods of being close to the loop, yet far enough from all the hustle and bustle. Easily walk to bars or restaurants that call River West their home.

Chicago Registration Number: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

description:
If you’re looking for a family neighborhood that has it all? Then look no further, I think you’ve found it.

ENTIRE APARTMENT in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago, Little Italy.  

Free street parking and EARLY check is available (12 pm!).

8-minute drive to the Chicago Bulls Stadium, 1 Mile west of the “Loop” Chicago Downtown.  One block to Rush Hospital, minutes to interstate 290, and an 8-minute walk to the pink line train. 

Everything is nearby!

Bedrooms
Room 1 This is the front bedroom.  Its just perfect for a good night rest with a full size plush pillow-top bed & 600 thread-count bed sheets.

Room 2 This is the rear bedroom.  This bedroom has a zen like quality to it that will be sure to invoke a sense of peace and tranquility.  It has a full-size bed with 600 thread-count bed sheets 

Kitchen
This is a fully stocked kitchen, with everything you need to cook even the largest of meals!
Comes with:
– Pots/Pans for large meals.
– Serving utensils.
– Full set of knives.
– 1 oven,1 dishwasher.
– Coffee Maker/Toaster/Microwave.
– Alexa assistant

Living Room
Sit back and relax in a comfortably cute living room that has everything you need.  
– 1 plush sectional couch that lets out into a double bed
– 1 swivel accent chair 
– 1 smart television with local channels Netflix, HBO & Disney apps
– Front facing street view

Bathroom
Fully equipped bathroom prepped for you
– Bathtub
– Shower
– Fresh Towels
– Soap

Amenities
 - Coffee Maker
 - Iron
 - Iron Board
 - Wi-Fi
 - TV
 - Black Out Curtains
 - Heating
 - AC
 - Street Parking
 - Bathtub
 - Alex Speakers
 - Microwave

I am available during the day to assist with check-in and to provide local information and tourist tips

This neighborhood is perfectly placed between Rush University, Rush Hospital, UIC (University Of Illinois Chicago) and the Chicago Bulls Stadium.  Known for its Italian restaurants and community, there is plenty to do and see within blocks of your stay.  Transportation is convenient with commuter rail nearby, local bus routes and public bike rentals

In most cases I will meet you to let you in the unit and show you around.  In the event that i cannot meet you directions will be given for lock-box access.

Also note - Street parking is available, however you will need a parking permit that will be provided to you.  You will need to display the permit in your car window during your stay.

ENTIRE APARTMENT in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago, Little Italy.  

Free street parking and EARLY check is available (12 pm!).

description:
700 sqft 1BDRM Garden Apartment in Edgewater/Andersonville.

Large eat-in kitchen, full stove/oven, refrigerator and dishwasher. Clean bath room with deep tub. Cozy living room with little workspace, wifi is available and smart TV has been installed (Enjoy Netflix, Hulu ... etc).   
This space can accommodate 2-3 people. Bedroom has a Full size bed. For 1 additional guest, air mattress can be provided on request.    
Coin laundry on site. Parking space available (assigned).

Feel free to contact.

Walking distance to many restaurants, bars and cafes. Many antique and resale shops to browse.

Good transportation. Bus stop is on corner (Clark street Bus #22). Short bus ride to Wrigleyville. About 10 mins walk to Lake/ Lakeshore dr, 20mins to downtown by car. Red line train station is walking distance. Take Damen bus (#50) to Wicker park.


O'Hare international airport----- 13mi (30 min by car without traffic, 1h 15min by public transportation)

Midway international airport----- 21 mi (40 min by car without traffic, 1h 30min by public transportation)

Downtown ----- 9 mi (20min by car, 40-50min by public transportation) 

Wrigley field----- 4 mi (12min by car, 20min by public transportation)

Bryn Mawr Station (Red line)----- 0.6 mi (13 min by walk)

Clark bus stop (#22)----- 0.1 mi (2 min by walk)

Damen bus (#50)----- 0.1 mi (3min by walk)

Private access by lockbox.

access: Guests will have full access to the entire apartment and will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before their arrival through the booking platforms app or email.
description:
Welcome to this 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom Bucktown apartment located less than a mile from the train. Bucktown is one of the most exciting neighborhoods in Chicago and features some of the best restaurants, bars, shopping, and nightlife the city has to offer. This apartment is perfect for groups of four, but can comfortably accommodate groups of six. The apartment is a great option for groups of friends or families visiting Chicago and looking to stay in an exciting neighborhood close to the city.

The apartment has two floors and a great floor plan. Both of the bedrooms have a queen bed and are located upstairs. There is one bathroom upstairs with a shower and it is easily accessible from both bedrooms. The main floor of the apartment has a fully stocked kitchen with everything guests need to prepare a meal. There are four seats at a breakfast bar in the kitchen and a dining table with bench seating. The family room is located off of the kitchen and it has a mounted flat screen TV, comfortable furniture, and a double bed/daybed that can sleep two guests. There is one bathroom with a shower/tub on the lower level. 

The apartment has a great location within the Bucktown neighborhood. The Western train stop (Blue Line) is eight blocks away (15 minute walk) and the restaurants, bars, and shops that line North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues are within walking distance on a nice day or a quick Uber/Lyft ride away. The apartment does not include a parking space, but there is free street parking and we recommend using the SpotHero parking app to help you find street parking.

Guests will have full access to the entire apartment and will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before their arrival through the booking platforms app or email.

We are off site but available when needed. Please message us through the platform if you have any questions or concerns. It's the quickest way to reach us!

Wicker Park and Bucktown are one of Chicago's creative epicenters and they lie just outside of downtown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music, nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails, an affinity for coffee, enjoy sifting through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area than Bucktown and Wicker Park!

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, and boasts some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops and independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of national and global retail chains that make this one of the best places to shop in Chicago!

This apartment has a great location and you are a 10-15 minute walk from most of the attractions in the neighborhood. If you want to venture beyond Wicker Park and Bucktown the most convenient way is the train. The Western stop on the Blue Line train is 0.8 miles (about a 15 minute walk) from the apartment. The Blue Line runs from O'Hare International Airport to downtown. There are also plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis if needed!

This apartment does not have parking, but we recommend using parking apps like SpotHero to help you find street parking.

access: All common areas, excluding other bedrooms.
description:
A peaceful comfortable home away from home with a touch of luxury.  You are invited to make this home yours.  You may find it nestled deep within a long established safe, quiet residential community in one of the best and most desirable locations in Morton Grove.  Countless nearby shopping centers and food options to choose from.  Bedroom sits on the garden level and room dimensions are 14 x 14 feet.  There is plenty of parking available on the street.

A queen sized bed with a private office space can be found in your bedroom complete with desk lamp including power and USB ports, as well as high speed Wi-fi to facilitate your needs.  Bed has built in reading light and multiple drawer spaces.  Automatic locking doors throughout the house.  Privacy lock on your bedroom door which only you will have access to. 

Kitchen is spacious and includes long granite counter tops and ample self/soft closing drawers and cabinetry with plenty of storage space to serve your cooking and storage needs.  Dining available in both kitchen (breakfast area) as well as dining room.  Patio also has an area for a pleasant outdoor dining experience when weather permits.  This is a well kept and maintained clean home with regularly scheduled cleaning in all common areas.  TV can be found in the living room, and there are a couple of other recreational areas that can be found on the property with seating for your comfort. There are 2 clean and well kept common/shared bathrooms, one with full shower/tub and the other has a standing shower.  You are sharing this home, so you must be responsible for upholding and adhering to the rules of maintaining a pleasant, respectful, positive and comfortable environment.

All common areas, excluding other bedrooms.

Host will be available and prompt to address your needs.

Nearby you can find:
Numerous highly rated restaurants (TripAdvisor.com)
Lutheran General Hospital - One of the top 50 hospitals in the country less than 2 miles away, a 6 min drive.
Many Schools such as Oakton Community College
15 minutes from the Chicago O'Hare International Airport (ORD)
17 minutes from the Chicago Executive Airport (PWK)
Golf Mill Mall less than 1 mile away
Westfield Old Orchard Mall, less than 5 miles and 13 minutes away
Many parks, forest preserves, biking, walking trails and golf courses within short driving distance

Near the Morton Grove train station, 2.8 miles and an approximate 11 minute drive.  This can take you to downtown Chicago and numerous other locations.

You are welcome and encouraged to have indoor slippers or sandals, no shoes inside please.   Be careful not to park in front of the fire hydrant in front of the house.

access: The room is on your right as you get in the house.
description:
Is this your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay

www.airbnb.com/c/christiang5737

Are you ready to become a host.?! Use this link to get started

www.airbnb.com/r/christiang5737

Private room in a brand new mobile home 10 minutes from O'Hare airport, clean and safe community. Allstate Arena, River Casino,Outlet mall, Donald Stephens Convention Center
✓ Free WiFi
✓ Continental Breakfast
✓ Uber/Lyft to airport around $15-$20, 10- 15min

Come stay in my (900 sq ft) home (private room with shared full bath) right by O"hare airport. Right next to all the great tourist hot spots, Rosemont, Allstate Arena, outlet mall, restaurants, Rivers Casino etc.. easy access to the metra(2 miles), the place is ideal to stay near the airport. Within 20 miles drive to downtown and some of the most popular and photogenic spots in Chicago. Why pay $200+ a night at a hotel when you can stay in my house for much less? Allstate arena has concerts all the time, check their concerts program. River Casino offers great food, buffets and music. The house is sunny, spacious, and warm. You'll have your private space. The entire 3 bed/ 2 bath mobile home was build in 2015 Brand new kitchen counter tops, tiles, dark hardwood floors, custom cabinetry, new refrigerator, central heating, and with huge windows.  If there is anything you need to help make your stay easier just let me know. I can gladly pick up any food, prepaid phones, or prepaid transit tickets that you'll need beforehand. Any groceries you think you'll need also just let me know. If you forget we're always within a 5 minute drive to a gas stations and 5 min to a Target, Kmart, Our kitchen is pretty stocked with the basics and you are free to use any of the utensils/spaces as you please. Morning people are free enjoy any of the breakfast cereals that we have and any of our delicious keurig coffee as well.

5 miles from O'Hare International Airport
20 miles northwest from downtown Chicago
4 miles away from the Des Plaines Metra Train Station which takes you downtown Chicago
Walk to  # 223 Pace Bus Stop
Next to I-294 Interstate Highway
6 miles from Fashion Outlets Of Chicago
4 miles from Rivers Casino

The room is on your right as you get in the house.

Situated on the Des Plaines River, Des Plaines is an outdoor lover's paradise. The Des Plaines River Trail features hiking and bicycling paths, and in the winter months draws cross-country skiers and snowmobilers. Autumn is a particularly wonderful time on the river, as the leaves glow in fiery shades of red, orange and yellow.

5 miles from O'Hare International Airport
20 miles northwest from downtown Chicago
4 miles away from the Des Plaines Metra Train Station which takes you downtown Chicago
Walk to  # 223 Pace Bus Stop
Next to I-294 Interstate Highway
6 miles from Fashion Outlets Of Chicago
4 miles from Rivers Casino

No Parking. 
If you're being picked up by Uber or Lyft, please SHARE YOUR LOCATION with your driver to be found easily.

access: Guests will have full access to the entire first floor unit plus a garage spot.
description:
Beautifully furnished 3 bedroom, 1 bath condo perfect for a family vacation, getaway with friends, visit to Depaul campus or Wrigley Field! New on the market in Nov 2014 with brand new beds, linens, and remodeled bathroom.  One queen sized bed in each of the three bedrooms.  Includes garage spot.

Beautifully furnished 3 BD/1 BA condo perfect for a family vacation, getaway with friends, visit to Depaul campus or Wrigley Field.  Located in the heart of Northcenter, bordering Lincoln Square, Wrigleyville, Lincoln Park, Andersonville, and Lakeview.  New on the market in November 2014 with brand new beds, linens, and remodeled bathroom.  Comfortably sleeps 6 with a garage spot included.  All bedrooms are private rooms with lockable doors.  (3 queen beds)

Located 2 blocks from a grocery store and pharmacy, 3-4 blocks from the CTA Irving Park and Montrose Brown Line stops, and in the center of a neighborhood with adorable shops, restaurants, bars, park, music venues, and movie theater! 

UNIT:
Comfortably accommodates 6 people 
Garage spot included
Hulu streaming and wireless internet access
In-unit washer/dryer (detergent and dryer sheets provided)
Pack-n-play and booster seat available
Non-smoking unit
No pets
No parties

BEDROOMS:
Bedroom #1  - Queen size bed
Bedroom #2 - Queen size bed
Bedroom #3 - Queen size bed
All bedrooms include linens, blankets, stacking drawers, a reading lamp, and hangers.  Bedroom #1 has a hanging rod and Bedrooms #2 and #3 have closets.

KITCHEN:
Full kitchen with stove, microwave,  dishwasher, refrigerator, dishware, silverware, knives, cooking spoons, pots and pans, glasses, coffee cups, wine glasses, coffee pot, tea pot, toaster, dishcloths and towels, paper towels, napkins, casual dining for 4.

BATHROOM:
Towels, toilet paper, body soap, shampoo, and conditioner included.  

LIVING ROOM:
Comfortable living space with full sized couch, 2 armchairs, 50'' television, Hulu streaming. 

DINING ROOM:
Formal dining space for 6 people.

Guests will have full access to the entire first floor unit plus a garage spot.

Guests enter the unit using keyless locks.  Their personalized code will be assigned once the booking is finalized.  The building is host occupied in the event anything is needed.  The host strives to strike a balance between respecting guests' privacy and being available when needed.

Located in the desirable Northcenter neighborhood there is something for everyone.  Walking distance to public transportation, high end and casual dining, local brewery, bars, coffee shops, movie theater, public library, parks, bowling alley, grocery stores, drug stores, farmers market (seasonal), dry cleaners.

Close to the Montrose CTA Brown Line stop (.4 miles) and the Irving Park CTA Brown Line stop  (.5 miles).  

CTA bus lines within 4 blocks: 50 (Damen), 9 (Ashland), 80 (Irving Park), 49 (Western)

2 blocks to a Divvy bike station

Garage spot included 

Free street parking on Damen

Easy access to Loop and all Chicago tourist attractions via Brown Line

Both O’Hare and Midway airports are accessible by public transportation.
house_rules: No smoking, no pets, no candles, no parties

access: Entire first floor and yard. Garage parking available upon request. Plenty of FREE street parking.
description:
Fully renovated, fresh and clean. Queen bed sleeps two.

Brand new bath with walk-in shower. Bathroom only shared with two AirBNB rooms on the first floor. Host has upstairs bedroom/bath. 

Located between O'Hare and Chicago. Close to CTA/Metra.

Single family home. Host sleeps upstairs leaving two first-floor bedrooms for guests. Located in Jefferson Park which is halfway between O'Hare and downtown Chicago.

Entire first floor and yard. Garage parking available upon request. Plenty of FREE street parking.

My son and his partner live next door and are happy to provide recommendations for restaurants, sightseeing, etc. I'm usually up around 7:30am. I watch TV in the living room after dinner and typically go upstairs to bed around 10:30 or 11. The living room is a shared space. If the daybed room isn't being rented, guests in the queen room are free to use the daybed room as a private living room. There's cable TV in that room too.

Jefferson Park is a transportation hub. We are conveniently located halfway between O'Hare and Chicago. There are 2 blue line CTA stations within walking distance (Montrose and Jefferson Park) and multiple Metra stations. The neighborhood has lots of resident police officers and fireman, Polish immigrants/grocery stores, and feels more suburban than urban.

10 minute walk from 2 CTA (subway) stations and multiple Metra lines. Easy access to I90/94. Downtown accessible by Uber/cab in 20 minutes without traffic. O'Hare also 20 min away. Safe and quiet neighborhood.

- Please contact us for details

description:
Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom River North apartment. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this modernly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI132)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your cheery living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- 24/7 Security
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Rooftop Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck
- Garden

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

description:
Quiet, clean 1BR apartment in the heart of Lakeview. Great light, and walking distance to local shops, restaurants, and other great neighborhoods in Chicago (Both Lincoln Park & Wrigleyville just 15 mins. in either direction on foot). I will be available via e-mail or text throughout your stay.

If you request to book, just shoot me a short message about your trip details and who will be joining you (if any) during your stay.

Large living room and bedroom with clean sheets, blanket, towels, and bathmat. Large TV with Netflix / Amazon, etc. 

Quick List:
- WiFi
- TV
- Linen
- Large desk and breakfast nook for planning your day ahead :)
- Shower with *great* water pressure
- Kitchen / Dishwasher

If you are booking this space, it means I am out of town! But, I will be available to you via text message, e-mail, or WhatsApp.

Located in the center of Boystown, East Lakeview, and Wrigleyville. Just a hop and a skip from great shops on Belmont (record stores, coffee, bookstores), or restaurants & bars on Broadway & Clark. Short 15 min. walk to Lincoln Park.

- Broadway and Clark bus stop right outside.
- Lake Michigan & Trail 1 block away.
- Bus downtown just down the street (~20mins by bus).
- Red Line Train 10 min. walk west.
house_rules:
No shoes in the house.
No pets.
No smoking in apartment or in apartment courtyard.
After your stay, hang bathroom linen to dry.
Put keys back in the lock box after you check out.
Read stereo instructions before use.
Volume-wise, be conscientious of neighbors.
Lock doors when you leave or check out.
Shut all windows when you leave or check out (in the event of rain).
Use Coasters :)
Please clean your dishes and take the (kitchen and bathroom) trash out at the end of your stay. Do not leave takeout in the fridge.
No parties.
Please don't sleep on the couch overnight. If you must, please use a sheet.
Be courteous and enjoy your stay.

description:
This is a private room in a 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and Wrigley Field are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 15-minute train ride away via the adjacent Sheridan Red Line station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you.

PLEASE NOTE

The building is adjacent to the "L" train tracks. This means you will hear train noise regularly in the apartment and your room. 

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Queen-size bed
✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
✔ 65" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board
✔ Hair dryer
✔ White noise machine
✔ Keyless Entry

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, lounge area, and bathrooms.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander.

THINGS TO DO NEARBY

✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game.
✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail.
✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre.
✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Sheridan Red Line 'L' train station is a 1-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 35-50 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 65 minutes away via public transit and 40-55minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Sheridan 'L' train station. Search for “Sheridan Red Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

4. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

5. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The apartment has two shared bathrooms.
house_rules: We ask that you be mindful of anyone else who might be sharing the apartment with you and also of our downstairs neighbors. If you are watching TV in the evening, we ask that you keep the volume at a moderate level. Please no food or drink in the room (water is okay) and no entertaining guests in the apartment after 11:00 pm. Per Airbnb policy, only guests booked through Airbnb can stay overnight.

access: Bedroom (s), kitchen, finished basement, laundry room and outside patio.
description:
My Home is a beautiful Tuscan-style house, ideal oasis for a couple  visiting family, or just see the city.  ” A safe and quiet neighborhood close to Andersonville, Lincoln Square, North Park University and Northeastern University. Easy access to Evanston, Skokie, Lincolnwood and the North Shore. Free PARKING in front of the House. 
Free parking in Front of the House

Lovely bedroom with ensuite bathroom in a private residence.   This setting is comfortable for up to 2 guests.  For additional guests I have another room available for an extra fee.  Go to “Chic Private Room By Lincoln Square” and book it at the same time. 

My guests are welcome to: 
A continental breakfast - discuss your preference upon booking.
Sharing my kitchen and fridge.
Gourmet coffee and tea anytime.
Relaxing in the garden's patio seating. 
Free use of washer/dryer and iron and ironing board.

This home is a perfect place to stay while visiting friends and family. It also affords you the opportunity to work quietly from your own room. Best of both worlds!

Public transportation is only a few blocks away. Free street parking is plentiful if you have a car.

Longer occupancy considered on case by case basis.

PERFECT FOR BUSINESS PEOPLE!

Bedroom (s), kitchen, finished basement, laundry room and outside patio.

The host will be available to offer suggestions and advice for activities and dining recommendation.

Peterson Woods neighborhood by the river is a "hidden gem", blend of old and new beautiful houses, parks and tree lined streets. Not far from my home you can find a great variety of restaurants which offer fine food from different countries around the world. The center of the neighborhood is only 4 blocks away, it has a pharmacy, banks, and small stores. You are only a short ride to downtown Chicago or up to the North Shore. Public transportation is only a few blocks away. Plenty of FREE street parking.

Public Transportation is a few blocks away CTA Bus #82 at Kimball to Lawrence and take 
the CTA Brown Line train to the downtown Chicago or other locations.

To the O'Hare Airport (ORD): CTA Bus #82 at Kimball to Foster, transfer to CTA Bus #92 at Foster then transfer to the CTA Blue Line train to ORD.

CTA Bus #82 from Kimball takes you to Belmont where you can transfer to the CTA Blue Line train.

CTA Bus #92 from Foster takes you to the CTA Blue Line train as well.

You can take an Uber or Lyft for a few Dollars to the CTA Brown Line train at Lawrence and Kimball or Western Ave and Lawrence.

On Weekends ONLY, if available, the host offers 1 trip before noon to the CTA Brown Line train station.

FREE parking available on the street. This is the perfect place if you have a car.

Continental Breakfast - discuss your preference upon booking.

If you stay over the weekend, and you don't have a car, ask the host to give you a ride to the train station (CTA Brown Line), this service will be offered only if the host is AVAILABLE and before noon on weekends ONLY. 

Great place if you have a car Free parking available in front the house.

description:
Conveniently situated across the street from Loyola University’s Rogers Park Campus and close to cafés, restaurants and shops, this brand new modern and stylish 3 bedroom 3 bathroom residence presents a new standard in luxurious modern living.

Designed to showcase the very best in contemporary living, the unit’s boast light-filled open-plan layouts with soaring ceilings overhead. Hardwood floors featured in all the units along with in-unit washer and dryers, adding convenience and comfort.

The apartment offers high-speed internet which is accessible throughout the entire building plus keyless fob entry for both the main entrance and the residence, ensuring peace-of-mind and added security.

Guests have access to a 4,000 sqft outdoor space, ideal for entertaining friends. Prepare meals on the grilling stations before gathering around the café tables or large community table. Relax in front of the fire pit with lounge seating or have fun on the ping-pong table. 

There is also an indoor amenity space available with a communal kitchen and a large table while there’s also a lounge with televisions plus an arcade game and a private conference room with a television. A high-end fitness room complete with a full TRX system, Echelon bike, Nordic treadmill and a bench with free weights completes the list of impressive features. 

For those in need of parking, you can rent a garage space for $30 per night plus there is also free bike storage available.

access: Make yourself comfortable! Guests are welcome to use the fully-equipped kitchen as they would at home.  There is a full-size washer/dryer in the unit - feel free to use it. Wifi is free.
description:
If this is your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: www.airbnb.com/c/nilsag46

You will love the quiet, cozy, sunny, modern vibe that allows you to relax & feel at home while still being steps from the City's Best Restaurants, Cafe's, and Nightlife. Covered patio&grill to enjoy outdoors. It's very close to public transit bus, train, bike and easy to get to Downtown you could even walk. Short walk from the "L" Train for O'Hare & Midway Airports & Union Station.

This is a very spacious modern apartment with 10-foot ceilings and plenty of natural sunlight. Two private bedrooms furnished with queen-sized beds and full walk-in closets. Common space features a queen size sofa bed. Towels, sheets, soap, shampoo, conditioner and hair dryers/iron, are provided and the place is cleaned thoroughly before guest arrival.  The unit has a huge fully loaded kitchen, nice coffee and wine bar granite counter tops the bedrooms are on the second level downstairs so you can escape & relax. Link Virtual tour of the space:  1R.1010NWOOD.fyi

Make yourself comfortable! Guests are welcome to use the fully-equipped kitchen as they would at home.  There is a full-size washer/dryer in the unit - feel free to use it. Wifi is free.

You will have the entire apartment to yourselves, but I'm happy to share my love of Chicago should you have any questions!

Location, location, location.
According to a popular city neighborhood guide, "Chicago's triumvirate of coolness is comprised of Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Ukrainian Village."
Well, we are right here in the middle!
- East Ukrainian Village/ Wicker Park - a vibrant, safe and fun, extremely walkable neighborhood that entices Chicagoans and tourists alike to visit and explore our great dining, culture, and nightlife entertainment options.
With its abundance of cafes and coffee shops, modern boutiques and classic vintage resellers, record stores and live music venues, dive bars and fancy lounges, fine gourmet restaurants and street food vendors, our area has something for everyone to enjoy and explore.
Only three blocks away from busy Damen, Division and Chicago Avenue, Wood is a quiet and quaint side street, serene, and lined with century-old trees. Your sleep will not be disturbed.

Getting around
METRO "L"  BLUE LINE TRAIN:
10-minute walk to either Damen or Division stops of Blue Line that connects O'Hare to downtown/ Loop and many other great neighborhoods in the city.
BUS: Bus is a great way to get around in Chicago and you can use the same Ventra card you use for the metro train
5 blocks to the Chicago Avenue Bus --- gets you downtown in 15 minutes!4 blocks to the Damen Bus 1 block to the Augusta Bus3 blocks to the Division Bus
TAXI/ UBER:
You'll have a very easy time hailing a cab a few blocks from the apartment on Division, Damen or Chicago Ave. Cab ride downtown is 5-10 minutes and $9-15. Try Uber or Lyft much cheaper for door to door service.
DIVVY Bikes:
Chicago has an awesome bike sharing system --- it's $7/ day for an unlimited number of rides – there are stations all around a few blocks away from the apartment. 
Divvy is a great and fun way to explore the city like a local and to connect to Damen/ Division train from the apartment in just a 5-minute walk.

Lively & safe walkable neighborhood with tons of bars and restaurants (fit for foodies!). Walking distance to the 606 Bloomingdale Trail. Shopping includes upscale stores, small boutiques, thrift stores and everything in between. We are a super pet-friendly building, we do charge a $49 pet fee. Plenty of free street parking available, we do rent out our garage please inquire for details.
house_rules:
- Please respect our neighbors' privacy. No loud & late partying Quiet hours after 11pm.
- Do not remove or destroy any things in our home
- Well behaved Dogs are welcome $49 fee per pet, no other pets
-Extra Guests Fees for additional guests not on the booking $49 Fee per each guest/per day after 4 guests
-Surveillance or recording devices on property
interaction: You will have the entire apartment to yourselves, but I'm happy to share my love of Chicago should you have any questions!

access: Guests will have access to entire apartment
description:
Cozy apartment in the heart of Wicker walking distance to everything you need. Great bars Resturants and clubs all in walking  distance. Half a block from blue line. Private full bath and WiFi

This space is the perfect size for one or two people looking to be in the middle of all the action that wicker Park has to offer.

Guests will have access to entire apartment

I am happy to share my favorite places in the city and help however I can with any questions about the city, if needed.

Wicker Park is one of Chicago's creative epicenters and lies just outside downtown and next door to Bucktown. This neighborhood is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants, cool boutiques and countless art galleries.

Everything is in walking distance in this neighborhood! Blue line at the end of the block. Minutes away from downtown, a quick train or uber ride.
house_rules: Please be respectful of the space and our neighbors. Please remove shoes at the front door to avoid any dirt build up. Please be clean! I am not a smoker and do not want smoking in my apartment. Feel free to come and go as you please, just be mindful of the noise level after dark.

additional_house_rules: Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises.

access: wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!
description:
Beautiful first floor room located in a safe and upscale area . New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Homestay is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.

Spacious and clean homestay with 3 full bathrooms and one 1/2 bath! Located in the heart of Forest Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.

wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

I am available for anything you may need!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.
house_rules: Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises.

access: In addition to the basic amenities, You will have access to the main floor kitchen if necessary to cook breakfast.
description:
My wonderful daughter and I are excited to open our beautiful clean home to our honored guests.  Safely located just a few blocks from Purdue Calumet University, Cline Avenue and Kennedy Avenue 80/94 Exit our home is in the perfect area.   The South Shore line train station is just a mile and a half away to help you get to downtown Chicago with a breeze!  We will gladly help provide transportation for you!

The completely remodelled and well furnished lower level of our home is available to guests and provides a fully furnished private bedroom with queen sized bed, full bathroom, and a full sized bed in the common area.

Complete with the fastest Wi-Fi on the market, take time to relax with the Comcast Voice Control Cable, Roku or enjoy any of the in house movies and board games.

Travelling with more than two people?  Not a problem!  We will gladly open our entire home up for additional guests for the length of your stay.  (Additional charges apply)

In addition to the basic amenities, You will have access to the main floor kitchen if necessary to cook breakfast.

You will always be able to reach me via text message.

If you are feeling super social in your stay, take the time to meet our awesome neighbors -- they love to meet new people and may even throw some Ribeyes on the grill or light up their fire-pit for some evening nightcaps.

To help offset the expense of Train, Uber or Taxi, for a $10 flat fee we will gladly provide any local transportation including the local malls, restaurants, Airports, Downtown Chicago or Michigan City for you. You can also access the Chicago South Shore Line train station just a mile from our home to get to downtown Chicago.

additional_house_rules:
There is a surveillance camera in the outer vestibule area outside of the apartment facing the front door to ensure house rules are follows
- All guests are required to have a form of live 2-way communication that works in the US during their stay 
- There is an extra-guest fee of $25 per person after 6 guests 
- While parties are allowed, all party-plans must be shared with host in advance. There is a $50 party fee and waiver required in advance 
- All outside guest names must be shared with host prior to their arrival at apartment 
- No loud noise between the hours of midnight and 7am
- No smoking or drug use of any kind allowed inside the apartment or any interior area of the house. If guests are found to have smoked inside the unit, they will be subject to a $100 smoke-odor-removal fee
- Lock-out services are not guaranteed. If lock-out services are available, a charge of $50 will be applied for these services 
- Use of the apartment and surrounding premises is at guests’ own risk. There is the expectation that guests will exercise good judgment and avoid unsafe behavior. Host not liable for preventable injuries incurred by guests/friends of guests during your stay. This is a turn-of-the-century building. Please use common sense. :)
- Guests/friends found to be violating house rules are subject to immediate removal from the premises
- In winter, thermostat should not be set higher than 75 degrees and there will be a charge of $50 if thermostat is found to have been above 75 degrees upon guest departure

access: Guests have access to a private outdoor patio
description:
Charming 2 bedroom, 1 bath flat in the heart of one of Chicago's oldest and more picturesque neighborhoods - Lincoln Park.  Our home is  just 3 blocks from the Armitage Brown Line Stop & the famous Armitage Shopping District!  Also walk to DePaul University, Alinea, Steppenwolf Theatre and more trendy shops and boutiques than we can possibly list!

This is also a perfect spot for a soirée since parties are allowed! Apartment also features a private outdoor patio and ample street parking too!

As you enter this flat you'll notice the beautiful vaulted ceilings and vintage charm.  Its open floor plan is great for parties or gatherings and it even has a wet-bar!  We describe this space as a grown-up crash pad: it's decorated to accommodate small & large groups in town for relaxed fun!  In addition to the spacious interior, there is a private back patio guests can enjoy. 

We've maximized the space to allow amply sleeping arrangements for larger groups. 
Master bedroom features a queen-size bed.  Second bedroom has 1 bunk bed.  Dining Room had been converted to a study with a day bed which pulls out to a king-size bed.  Additionally we offer a queen-size premium inflatable mattress.  

We have everything you need to throw a fun adult gathering: party games, a Sonos blue tooth speaker, flat-screen 4K Smart TV, full poker game equipment, and even a wet bar!  Please be aware that while we welcome parties, the following house rules apply and are STRICTLY enforced: $50 party fee, 30-guest maximum, liability waiver, absolutely NO drug use or cigarette smoking allowed & quiet hours strictly enforced out of respect for our neighbors. This is a great location for a “grown-up gathering,” but NOT a “frat party!” :)

Also Please be aware that the apartment is near the El tracks. The noise is minimal, but we do provide ear plugs for light sleepers.

If you need even more space we offer a second 2 bed/1 bath apartment downstairs that sleeps 10 for a total capacity of 18 people!

Guests have access to a private outdoor patio

I live in town and am available as needed - 24/7!

This neighborhood is perfect for shopping, eating and entertainment and boasts a Walking Score of 94!  The Armitage and North/Clybourn Corridors are two of the best-known and most popular shopping districts in the City.  The number of trendy shops, restaurants, theaters within walking distance is too many to list, but some of the highlights include:
- Kiehl
- Benefit
- MAC
- L'Occitane
- Peruvian Connection
- Bonobos
- Marine Layer
- Paper Source
- McShane's Exchange
- Patagonia
- Sephora
- Lululemon
- Pottery Barn
- Crate & Barrell
- Forever 21
- Sephora
- Nordstrom Rack
- Apple Store
- Alinea
- Summer House
- Stella Barra
- Balena
- Jeni's Ice Cream
- Steppenwolf
- The Chicago History Museum (more of a short Uber ride than a walk!)
- Second City
- iO Improv Theater
- Victory Gardens Theater
- The Park West
- The Store (one of the best open-mic venues in Chicago)
- Kingston Mines
- B.L.U.E.S.
- Joe's on Weed Street

For families, the list of attractions is almost as long!  Attractions within walking distance include Lincoln Park Zoo, Peggy Notebeart Nature Museum, Adams Playground Park,  Lincoln Park Conservatory, Old Town School of Folk Music and Oz Park...not to mention the Lakefront which is also walking/cycling distance!

For those "walking score" crowd, one of the hidden gems of our neighborhood is "Mansion Row" which actual encompasses several blocks of the largest, most opulent mansions in all of Chicago including the most expensive home in Chicago (asking price of $50M.  Address: 1932 N Burling).  I live in the neighborhood (but not in one of the mansions. ha!) and one of my favorite year-round activities is strolling up and down streets like Burling, Orchard, Howe just enjoying the beautiful homes.  And from there you can keep walking East to Lincoln Park which, at 1208 acres, is more than a one-day walking activity!  I also encourage walkers to head just a few blocks South to Old Town which is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Chicago full of Victorian-era buildings, quaint brick-paved streets and little eateries. 

Oh, and did I mention that we are just 3 blocks from the campus of DePaul University?!  It's hard to overstate just how much there is to do within walking distance of our home!

One of the most attractive aspects of this apartment is it's proximity to public transportation!  The Armitage Brown Line stop 1.5 blocks away.  The Armitage bus line also runs just 1.5 blocks away.  The Clyborn bus line is 1.5 blocks away too and the North Avenue Red Line stop is 2.5 blocks away!

This is a 2nd floor apartment so climbing stairs is required

If you need even more space we offer a second 2 bed/1 bath apartment downstairs that sleeps 10 for a total capacity of 18 people!
summary:
Charming 2 bedroom, 1 bath flat in the heart of one of Chicago's oldest and more picturesque neighborhoods - Lincoln Park.  Our home is  just 3 blocks from the Armitage Brown Line Stop & the famous Armitage Shopping District!  Also walk to DePaul University, Alinea, Steppenwolf Theatre and more trendy shops and boutiques than we can possibly list!

This is also a perfect spot for a soirée since parties are allowed! Apartment also features a private outdoor patio and ample street parking too!
transit: One of the most attractive aspects of this apartment is it's proximity to public transportation!  The Armitage Brown Line stop 1.5 blocks away.  The Armitage bus line also runs just 1.5 blocks away.  The Clyborn bus line is 1.5 blocks away too and the North Avenue Red Line stop is 2.5 blocks away!

additional_house_rules:
Cloud9 House Rules

1. IDs:: All adult Guests (18 and older) must provide ID verification: license, state ID, or passport before Check-in. 

2. Security Deposit:: All bookings require a security/damage deposit of $2500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.
*For last-minute bookings or local stays, damage/security deposit may be held in advance by Cloud9*

3. Cancellations:: Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if Check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before Check-in. *No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of Check-in*

4. Check-in:: any time after 4 PM. 
Check-out:: any time before 11 AM. 
*If an earlier Check-in or later Check-out time is desired, please send a request. We can only confirm 24 hours in advance. No guarantee* 
*If an unauthorized late Check-out delays cleaning of the unit, Guests will be charged $100. Any Guest still in the unit after 1 PM will be charged another night (Note: this does not apply if late Check-out was pre-approved)*

5. Violations::
-No smoking or vaping of any kind: $500 fine 
-No pets (please notify us if you have a service animal)
-Lost/missing keys/fobs: $100 each to replace
-Renter is liable for any damage and/or lost/stolen items during occupancy
-If extraordinary cleaning is required: $100 every hour of extra cleaning
-No parties, gatherings, or events
-If the property is used by more than the number of individuals listed in your reservation, we may charge the full security deposit

6. Liability:: Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises and/or using its facilities. It is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises.
-Guests should report immediately to us anything that presents a danger/could result in damage to the location or individuals

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please :-)

description:
Indulge in this sprawling 1,845 square foot Modern Industrial 3 bedroom 2 bath Penthouse apartment in an elevator building set in River West at the gateway to River North & West Loop.
Neighborhood Overview
River West connects two top Chicago neighborhoods, River North and The West Loop making it the ideal place to stay in the city.

When nothing will do except the very best, Cirro by The Cloud9 Experience awaits.

A modern apartment with luxe amenities serves as your own tranquil retreat.
Marvel at Chicago’s skyline views from the expansive windows or a private 437 sq ft deck completed in Porcelain. Take in the crystalline scene from the chic living room with space for six or eight if need be. Enjoy high tech of todays highest standards such as 65 inch living room TV and surround multiple speaker sound provided by Sonos as well as seriously fast internet thanks to 1GB speeds. Gather in the integrated Chef’s kitchens from Archisesto featuring Liebherr/Miele Appliances outfitted with Le Caphalon Cookware, Zwilling J.A. Henckels silverware and Chef’s knives, Schott Zwiesel wine glasses, Frieling french press or Nespresso for your coffee and much more. Or head to the bedroom to luxuriate in the impossibly soft linens of your pillow top Memory Foam bed. 

Here, there’s no detail too fine—and no standard too high. 

Welcome home.

In addition to the entire apartment the rooftop has a 3000 sq ft deck for Cloud9 guests to enjoy.

River West connects two top Chicago neighborhoods, River North and The West Loop making it the ideal place to stay in the city.
