access: Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s an electronic lock, so there are no keys to keep up with!
description:
Beautiful home in Des Plaines IL 3 bedrooms 1 full bath. Can sleep 11! Beautiful apartment. Great location walking distance to restaurants and shops. Near the train and highway easy access to get to downtown chicago. Full kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker and all the amenities. Central heat and ac. Everything is here. Plenty of free street parking. Cable TV

Stay in a private apartment all to yourself, The house has a full kitchen with all the amenities, 3 bedrooms with 3 queen size beds, 1 couch, and 2 additional air mattresses for more guests, 1 full bath, living room,. Plenty of free parking.

Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s an electronic lock, so there are no keys to keep up with!

It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

great location near highway and train easy access to downtown chicago. Walking distance to restaurants and shops 

Top things to do in Chicago area. 
Wrigley Field watch the chicago cubs play, ton of bars, restaurants, and nightlife 
Sky Deck Willis tower downtown Chicago the Bean at Millenium Park towner downtown Chicago 
Shedd Aquarium. Down town Chicago Rivers Casino Rosemont IL 
HorseShoe Casino Hammond IN 
Museum of Science and Industry Downtown Chicago 
Magnificent Mile down town chicago. Maggie Daley Park. Downtown Chicago 
Lincoln Park zoo Chicago IL
 Lake Front trail for walking and biking. Beaches summer time. Down town Chicago 
Field Museum for history. Down town Chicago 
Chicago River Walk ton of shops and restaurants. Down town Chicago 
Chicago Cultural center. Down town Chicago 
Boat tours Down town Chicago 
Buckingham Fountain Down town 
Chicago Art Institute Down town Chicago 
360 Chicago Observatory Deck Down town Chicago 
Richard H. Driehaus Museum Down town Chicago
 Symphony Center - Chicago Symphony Orchestra Down town Chicago 
United Center watch the Bulls, Blackhawks play 
Comiskey Park watch the whitesox play

Taxis are available anytime and cost about to get to anywhere else in town. I prefer Uber, which is a private driver service. Also, the public bus stops a few blocks away.    Enjoy your stay!

access:
3rd floor entire space, not other floors of the building. We have other tenant live in other floors please.

*** If this listing is already booked by others, plz click on my host profile find other rooms I have offer. Thanks. ***
description:
Welcome to stay with Sonya!!
I been hosting for 3+ years. I love staying airbnb as well as hosting.
It's the house top entire place located at 3rd floor, nothing fancy BUT
it's experienced set up in the house everything you need as a traveler.
You're taken care of if you decided last min booking & come bare hand.
If you don't mind climb stairs to 3rd floor to cockloft, I'm pretty sure you will happy with the rest.
Individual bathroom and your own space for privacy. Self check in available.

It's 2 bedrooms and each has a queen bed in.
1st bed room with a desk & bed side table, closet to hang cloths.
2nd bed room with a bed side table, little stand up drawer, closet to hang cloths.
Kitchen there's Microwave, water kettle, coffee maker, little dinner table, NO stove and oven set up. But we have electricity cooker could make easy meal, salad etc.

summary:
Welcome to stay with Sonya!!
I been hosting for 3+ years. I love staying airbnb as well as hosting.
It's the house top entire place located at 3rd floor, nothing fancy BUT
it's experienced set up in the house everything you need as a traveler.
You're taken care of if you decided last min booking & come bare hand.
If you don't mind climb stairs to 3rd floor to cockloft, I'm pretty sure you will happy with the rest.
Individual bathroom and your own space for privacy. Self check in available.

access: Guest have use of the entire apartment.
description:
Modern and spacious  1st floor apartment features 2 bed/1bath.   Located in West Rogers Park, on far North Side of Chicago.   Guests will have entire apartment at their disposal during their stay.  Unit includes 65 inch TV with cable.  Close to public transportation and to nearby shopping/restaurants (Olive Garden, Target, Walmart, Mariano's).   Overlooks Indian Boundary park.  Apartment is perfect for couples, business travelers, families with children.

Elegant, spacious and fully furnished 1st floor apartment features 2 bed/1bath.   Located in West Rogers Park, on far North Side of Chicago.   Guests will have entire apartment at their disposal during their stay.  Tons of natural light. Gourmet kitchen with high end black stainless steel appliances.  Quartz countertop.  Built in combination oven, dishwasher. Spa like bathroom features full size shower with rain shower and body sprays.  Kohler soaking tub with air jets.  All Kohler fixtures.  Marble tile.  Across from the Indian Boundary Park with cultural center that offers variety of classes such as Yoga and activities. Tennis courts also right across the street.  Minutes from Robert Black golf course.  Close to public transport and nearby shopping.

Parking in a garage behind the property is available at $10/night.

Approx. 4 miles from Northwestern University and 2 miles from Loyola University

Guest have use of the entire apartment.

Available 24/7 via messenger

Quiet, tree lined streets.  In the heart of historic bungalow district with many unique and beautiful homes.

Within walking distance to Little India with variety of Indian restaurants and shops.

Public transport (bus) or Uber/Lift; shared bike rental stand is within 1 block

Parking in a garage behind the property is available at $10/night.

description:
We are located by the I-290 and a 10 minute walk to the CTA. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a queen sized bed. Closet with hangers and extra storage space in the dresser. 40” Tv with Roku in your room. 

Shared office desk available.

55” TV with Roku in the shared Living Room. 

Plenty of free street parking available in front of the home and in the back.

-Located on the first floor. 
-Queen Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. 
-Carpeting throughout the house. 
-Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, and body wash.
-Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time.
-Smoking allowed on front porch

The two front doors have an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.

I am not always on the property, but I am always a phone call or text away. When I am home I do like to socialize with the guests.

15 minutes from Logan square
18 minute drive to Sears Tower
10 min walk to the Garfield Park Conservatory 
Close to public transportation (82 bus, and green line)

24 minuets to Navy Pier
23 minutes to Oak Street Beach

19 minuets from Millennium Park/Grant park
24 minuets to Shed Aquarium, the field museum and the Adler planetarium.

The train station is a 10 minute walk. Uber or lyft is always a easy way to get around.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen

Building amenities
- Rooftop terrace

Greektown highlights
- Walkability score: 93
- 3 minute walk to Greek Islands (eatery specializing in traditional Greek cuisine)
- 6 minute walk to Lou Mitchell's (historic diner serving breakfast and lunch)

Getting around
- 1 block to Halsted & Jackson bus stop
- 10 minute drive to downtown
- 60 minute drive to ORD Airport

Greektown highlights
- Walkability score - 93
- 3 minute walk to Greek Islands (eatery specializing in traditional Greek cuisine)
- 6 minute walk to Lou Mitchell's (historic diner serving breakfast and lunch)

License: HL 2684667

This Sonder is centrally located and prone to city and construction noise.

There's no cable. We've provided an HDMI cord for streaming.

There is no elevator.
house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

access: Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast served in our gourmet kitchen.
description:
Bright and modern guest room located just a block away from great dining, vintage and boutique shopping, art galleries, cool cafes and vibrant nightlife.

The Wabansia Queen guest room is one of 9 rooms within the Wicker Park Inn, a newly renovated, boutique Bed and Breakfast offering high quality yet affordable accommodations in a hip & trendy neighborhood

Wabansia Queen has a queen-size bed and en suite bathroom. This room is located on the second floor and faces our quiet, tree-lined street. Each room has free WiFi, DirecTV, and breakfast is included in the rate. Wabansia Queen accommodates a maximum of two people.

Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast served in our gourmet kitchen.

We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.

Wicker Park is a diverse, thriving community full of vintage boutiques, coffee shops, highly-rated restaurants, and trendy bars.  Tree-lined residential streets are beautifully lined with a vibrant mix of historic and modern homes.

The Wicker Park Inn is nestled a convenient walking distance from two Blue Line el stops as well as several buses to both downtown and north side Chicago!

On-site garage and permit parking is available for $25/night, with free parking available within a few blocks of our location.

We’re just minutes away from downtown Chicago, where you can enjoy popular Chicago attractions such as the Magnificent Mile, Museum Campus, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Chicago Theaters. With all the amenities of a hotel and the warmth of home, the Wicker Park Inn Bed and Breakfast is a rewarding lodging experience that allows you to live like a local!

additional_house_rules: Feel free to "pop" on any of the many backdrops for a "selfie" as part of the fun of staying in this 3000 sq ft studio.  For our fellow professional photogs and artists, please note we will be creating a separate listing to rent the studio for commercial work.  However, for the time being, it is NOT available as a work space. :)   We are NOT currently available as an event space for parties.  This space is exclusively for our Airbnb traveling guests.  Additionally,  travelers who are approved guests of the studio, may NOT host parties, big or small, without written permission of The Studio.   This includes inviting anyone into the premise who was not part of the original reservation.

access: Besides the guestroom located on the third floor with a great view of United Center, please make yourself comfortable in our beautiful modern kitchen -- oven, stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, tableware.... all the amenities for any meal on the second floor with a private deck with seating for 4 should you want to eat, drink or hang out.   We also have an awesome office on the first floor,   where can easily spread out in this large workspace.
description:
Super Cool Loft Photo Studio located in the urban vibe of West Town! This room was just renovated to create a clean, mod space for the hip traveler.  Just blocks from everything:
Downtown,Wicker Park/Bucktown,Randolph St.,United Center + free parking

Super Cool Loft Photo Studio located in the urban vibe of West Town! This room was recently renovated to create a clean, mod space for the hip traveler.  Just blocks from everything:
Downtown,Wicker Park/Bucktown,Randolph St.,United Center + free parking
This space is amazing with 3 enormous open concept levels to call your own.  We wanted to create a place that is really clean with great comforts, cable, Internet, and an overall chill factor.  This room can accommodate an individual or two guests traveling together.   This is not a shared space.    When you book, you and your guest will be the only people occupying the space!  By day, we are a cutting edge photo studio and by night, a chic space you can call your own in the heart of Chicago's industrial corridor.

Besides the guestroom located on the third floor with a great view of United Center, please make yourself comfortable in our beautiful modern kitchen -- oven, stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, tableware.... all the amenities for any meal on the second floor with a private deck with seating for 4 should you want to eat, drink or hang out.   We also have an awesome office on the first floor,   where can easily spread out in this large workspace.

We will be available the entire length of the guest's stay.  We live next door if you need anything at all, we would be delighted to help. :)

West Town is a HOT neighborhood located in the industrial corridor minutes from Bucktown, Wicker Park, United Center, the Loop, Randolph Street, and Ukrainian Village.  There's tons of free street parking in front of the studio. 
Ukrainian Village voted #1 Hottest Neighborhood 2016 in the US by Redfin!!!

Super easy to access anywhere you want to go!  O'Hare? Midway?  Simple! The CTA 65 Grand Bus is a 2 minute walk out the door which can take you to the Blue Line (O'Hare Airport) or downtown or the CTA 50 is also a 5 minute walk out the door which can take you to the Orange Line (Midway Airport).  Cabs are always plentiful and we are located a quick cab ride away.

Hey There Smokers --- although there is NO SMOKING in the studio/loft, there is an awesome deck outside off the kitchen with an ashtray waiting for you!  Outside on the deck is the designated smoking area, this is the ONLY area we allow smoking.
No kids and no pets :)  While both are adorable and we just love them, we are neither a kid friendly or pet friendly space.  If you sneak them in you will be asked to leave immediately...really.

access:
• 24-hour access to house and private bedroom via keypad door lock (check-in till 11PM at arrival)
• Extra housekeeping service is offered for an extra fee (includes unit added cleaning, restocking of linens, fresh towels, basic supplies)
• Bi-weekly pest treatment and testing is provided and access to room may be requested  (Note: pests, if found, are not considered an extenuating circumstance therefore refunds or cancellations do not apply, in many cases they could be brought into the home by guests in which case it would be outside of our control; we provide regular preventive methods and appreciate your cooperation to keep pests out of the home and notify us when signs are found)
• This is a private, owner-occupied, single-family home. Male roommates share common spaces with the property owner such as bathroom, lounge, kitchen, etc. (Note: Both the Airbnb Policy and the US Housing Regulations allow owners and hosts not to accept tenants of a different gender as long as they share common spaces such as bathrooms, kitchens, living rooms, etc. as in this case)
description:
My vintage shared-home is steps to Stony Island Metra Station and Jackson Park Hospital, 15-min drive to downtown, or 7-min transit ride to University of Chicago, upscale Hyde Park or Museum of Science & Industry. Metra will take you to McCormick Place, Grant Park, Millennium Park, Loop, Soldier Field, Natural History Museum or Art Institute in about 25 minutes. A stone's throw away from lakefront harbor, restaurants, supermarkets, Starbucks and the downtown bus. Free street parking. [Male Only]

Suburban house filled with natural light, stylish decor and comfy furniture. Private bedroom with shared bathroom, common living room, lounge/dining area, fully equipped kitchen, communal breakfast and cooking supplies. Rooms with wardrobes, crisp, clean sheets, memory foam mattresses and pillows. Lounge area over wooden floating floors and a fully equipped kitchen, free spring water dispensers, your designated utensils and all the essentials. Unlimited free wifi and amenities like air conditioning, heating, fresh linens, towels, toiletries, laundry supplies, city guidebooks and more. Coin laundromat available right across the street.

• 24-hour access to house and private bedroom via keypad door lock (check-in till 11PM at arrival)
• Extra housekeeping service is offered for an extra fee (includes unit added cleaning, restocking of linens, fresh towels, basic supplies)
• Bi-weekly pest treatment and testing is provided and access to room may be requested  (Note: pests, if found, are not considered an extenuating circumstance therefore refunds or cancellations do not apply, in many cases they could be brought into the home by guests in which case it would be outside of our control; we provide regular preventive methods and appreciate your cooperation to keep pests out of the home and notify us when signs are found)
• This is a private, owner-occupied, single-family home. Male roommates share common spaces with the property owner such as bathroom, lounge, kitchen, etc. (Note: Both the Airbnb Policy and the US Housing Regulations allow owners and hosts not to accept tenants of a different gender as long as they share common spaces such as bathrooms, kitchens, living rooms, etc. as in this case)

I prefer to give my roommates their own privacy, although I can be available for any question upon request. My response rate is one hour in average via Airbnb app.

“Experiment the adrenaline of the city from a quiet corner at one of the most representative suburbs, not too visited, vanished by a history not too often told, with locals whose daily train ride offers them someone to share their stories with. That mixture of police news at 8PM with beautiful street murals, electronic music mixed with men dancing in bus stops, mothers who bring their children to preschool mixed with gang members or basketball players, in short, the daily story of millions in the South Side, a side that left an imprint to the African-American heritage in the US, a heritage that is not too often found in books or tour guides, but that is felt and breathed in the air of the Gospel chants, the Mosque’s recites, and the streets of a city inside of a city, lost in a cloud of blurry eyes for those who have been in the ‘blocks’ for decades, with the contrast of a culture of diversity that rises from University of Chicago, the Museum of Science & Industry, the nearby bookstores, the first African American President, the birthplace of House music, the Black History Month, the teens who shoot photographs and listen to their local hip-hop artists, the speakers with basslines that deafen the small streets of this, our neighborhood. By the supermarkets you can see magazine covers announcing the return of those who once gave a name to Chicago, places, sport teams, celebrities who have walked these same sidewalks, faces full of makeup that remember a city that felt like home: the Chicago Bulls, Bears and White Sox, Michael Jordan, Oprah Winfrey, Steve Harvey, Laurence Tureaud (Mr. T), Buddy Guy, Nat King Cole, Muddy Waters, Herbie Hancock, Chaka Khan, Jennifer Hudson, Kel Mitchell, Jennifer Beals, Bernie Mac, Kanye West, Frankie Knuckles, Chance the Rapper, Common or R. Kelly come to mind. Nearby Jackson Park is Tiger Woods' projected golf conglomerate offering public basketball courts, football fields and golf courses. Historic Stony Island Avenue gave title to a 1978 movie that tells the story of the only white kid in the block that forms an R&B band. Mc Cormick Place is only minutes away; the largest convention center in North America. South Shore and the neighboring Hyde Park received national attention thanks to Barack and Michelle Obama's residence, who got married at the South Shore Cultural Center and gave lectures at the University of Chicago in Hyde Park. You can see my Airbnb Guidebook for more details about nearby transportation, groceries, restaurants, entertainment, nightlife, recreation and other points of interest in the South side: Soldier Field Stadium, Chinatown, Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), Chicago State University (CSU), Adler Planetarium, Field Museum of Natural History, Wintrust Arena, Shedd Aquarium, Museum Campus, Northerly Island, Chicago Women's Park & Garden, Blues Heaven Foundation, or Buddy Guy's Legends, to name a few.”

Either the public transit, bike ride, car-share or drive to main attractions and the central business district is quite fast and convenient. 

Public Transit:
You'll find transit directions in most maps apps but here's a few of our favorite options to downtown and nearby attractions just steps away:
• Two Metra stations with two different lines; closest is Stony Island Metra Station which is just a 7-min walk from home and will have you in downtown in 23 minutes (Millennium Park), a ride that makes several stops at nearby attractions and features beautiful panoramic lake views arriving to Millennium Station.
• CTA Bus 28 (Northbound towards Hyde Park) is a 2-min walk from home and will have you at the Univ of Chicago, Hyde Park and nearby attractions on a 12-min ride; or during rush hours to downtown express in 20 to 30 minutes (Grant Park, Columbus Dr/11th, Loop). The bus also stops near the CTA “L” train at Roosevelt Station in Grant Park for the Red, Green and Orange lines.
Chicago's transit system ranks #4 of all major US cities, CTA trains/buses run every 15 minutes in average, while Metra train services run every 25 minutes during rush hours, or every hour at normal times. 

NOTE: Chicago Public Transit offers less frequencies during nighttime, weekends and holidays. There is almost NO public transit coming back home after 11PM. Bus fare is aprox $2.50 and Metra fare is aprox $4.25 per ride and can be paid cash on board, or at the stations for discounted vouchers on multiple rides. Metra offers student discounts at the station.

Driving / Car-Share Services:
Our home is about a 15-min drive from downtown Chicago or the Midway Airport, and about a 38-min drive from O'Hare International Airport (without traffic). You can save on the O’Hare ride by taking the blue line to the city, then using an Uber, Lyft, a taxi ride or the Metra train from Millennium Station. Uber Pool and Lyft Line are widely available in Chicago; for a convenient fare you'll split with other riders you can get to/from downtown at a $12 fare approximately during normal times (not surge). Car-sharing and car rental apps like Turo, Zipcar and Getaround are easy to find and will get you a rental for the hour or the day. Enterprise Rent-A-Car is minutes from home at Stony Island Avenue.
If you prefer to use your own car, our place is conveniently located minutes away from the Chicago Skyway, the 94 and 90 Interstate Highways, and the State Route 41 (Lakeshore Drive).

Parking: 
There's usually plenty of free street parking (no permit required).

Bikes: 
Divvy Bike rentals are available only a few blocks from home and anywhere in the city, and you can pick-up and return the blue bikes anywhere there’s a Divvy station. Biking trails from here to downtown are abundant through the lakefront or the parks.

A percentage of your payment is donated to Open Homes who help evacuees, relief workers and refugees find temporary housing, and work with some of the world’s leading nonprofits that connect people in need: International Rescue Committee, the Cancer Support Community, the All Hands and Hearts disaster relief for natural disasters, and Mercy Corps' global relief for natural disasters and crises.
The city taxes you pay in Chicago help homeless families find permanent housing.

description:
This garden unit features an open concept, 7ft ceilings, and is the bottom apartment of a 3 flat/unit building. You will be able to enjoy a fully equipped kitchen that flows right to the dining area, and into the living room with a large sectional couch to kick back. Theres 1 TV connected to the building Wi-Fi, and has a couple streaming programs for entertainment. When you're ready to rest; there is a full bathroom with stand up shower, 2 rooms with a bed in each, and an air mattress for use.

You'll enjoy this modern open concept apartment that is your home, away from home. The building was completely redesigned and renovated labout a year ago. This apartment is a garden unit/basement, 1 of 3 units in a 3 flat apartment building located centrally between the ohare airport and downtown so all your commutes are convenient.

These are need-to-know points about the apartment so that you are not surprised when you arrive.

There is not a designated parking spot for your reservation, but there is a parking lot right next to the property and street parking available. 

There is epoxy flooring throughout that can be slippery when wet and cooler than most other flooring.

There is an apartment above this unit and you can hear occasional footsteps and movement.

The A/C & HEAT system is the same for the apartment above and you wont have direct access to the thermostat, but if we can regulate temp remotely if needed.

There are security camera's located ONLY around the perimeter of the exterior of the property, and outside the entrances into the building.

Please feel free to contact me.

Tons of restaurants right down the block. Very close to shopping.

In non traffic hours :
30 min to Wrigley Field 
25 minutes to Sox stadium 
20 minutes to Soilder Field 
15 minutes to United Center 
20 minutes to Downtown 
15 minutes from Allstate arena 
15 minutes from O'Hare airport
30 minutes from Midway airport
20 minutes to UIC office of admissions and pavilion
40 min to UIC hyde park

Convenient public transportation to downtown. Easy access to the highway.
To get to the expressway that goes straight to downtown you simply go south on 25th Ave and it leads right to the I290
Bus stop is on the corner of the block to catch the 309/313 CTA Bus. Then straight shot to either Harlem or Austin to hop on the Green line train to adams/wabash

If you like, or are interested in Chicagoland historic buildings and landmarks then you'll enjoy this modernized "speakeasy."   During the 2017 rehab process of this building there was strong evidence that this building was used as an underground speakeasy for a members only crowd during the prohibition era. Melrose Park is widely known for allegedly having a strong mob presence dating back to the 1900's. Also this place is located 2 blocks away from the building formally known as Casa Madrid which is widley known for having  underground tunnels leading throughout the town.

additional_house_rules:
Just treat the place with respect. 

-  locals must contact the host prior to instant booking. This is to prevent parties at our building.

-If a party is thrown, and more than your reserved guests are present, law enforcement will be called and you will be asked to exit the premises with no refund in addition to the fees listed below.

-You will be held financially responsible for any damage to the property as well as the resulting loss of hosting revenue  because  of said damage.

- The building has a strict occupancy limit, any group attempting to violate the community policies on occupancy limit or quiet hours will be removed immediately.  Quiet hours are after 10pm. All guests staying with you must have been accounted for in your reservation. Additional guests without prior written permission is prohibited and subject to the fee of $100 per each unauthorized guests per night.


-There is a fee schedule for house rules violations, they are as follows: Checkout is 11AM. Unauthorized late check out is  $100 fee. If not vacating on time leads to other losses, you will be billed for that also. For example, if your late check-out causes me having to refund or relocate the incoming guests, you will be charged that amount in addition to the stated fees.  If unauthorized late check-out exceeds two hours, there is an additional $200 fee

This is a non-smoking building. Any type of smoke inside the apartment is prohibited. This violation will incure a $200 per day fee. 

Any lost garage opener will be $35 per  to replace. 

Our cleaning fee is based on a "Courteous guest" If you trash the apartment you will be billed an additional $75 fee. 

This is a self check-in property. You will be using a keypad doorknob with a given combination to enter the apartment. You understand this. You certify that you will read the check in instructions prior to arrival

access: Access to the apartment, the patio, and the garage roofdeck
description:
Beautiful apartment with a sleek modern design. This elegant space is furnished with white leather couches, white marbled tabletops, and tastefuly bold bourdouis artworks. Features big windows, high ceilings, sunroof, spiral chandelier,  and an exposed brick wall.

-No partying

You will love the attention to detail of the stylish decor. If Carrie Bradshaw moved to Chicago, she would live here.

In the building there are two apartments, your stay is on the second floor so stairs are present. The apartment below you is also an Airbnb.


*Keypad entry allows you to check in at your leisure

*2 bedrooms, both queen beds

*Full kitchen with cookware and utensils, coffee, tea.

*Fenced in backyard patio with string lights and restaurant quality outdoor furniture

*Garage roofdeck with grill and hammock chair

* Garage parking for one car, but there's also ample free  parking.

*TV's with with Hulu, Netflix, Hbo, and Prime video all included.

*Voice controlled Alexa speakers

*central ac/ heat that you control

*laundry in unit

*Bathroom fully stocked will all essentialls including hair dryer, makeup remover wipes, vanity kit etc.

*Convenient bus stop infront of the apartment that takes you into downtown. Bike rental docks one block away at $3 ride or $15 for the day.

Access to the apartment, the patio, and the garage roofdeck

I am easy to reach to address your needs as I live in the building

The apartment is in the Humboldt park neighborhood, right next to a gorgeous city park that is also called Humboldt. It's a great place to spend some time relaxing as the park contains a boathouse, lagoons, gardens, fieldhouse etc. You can rent paddle boats, go fishing and more. There's a very popular trail nearby called the 606 that is great for a leisure stroll

The neighborhood is rich in culture and the cuisine is excellent. It  neighbors the very popular Logan square and wicker Park neighborhood for dining and nightlife  You will be a short ride from all the action. Getting into downtown could not be easier as there is a bus right infront  of the apartment that takes you right into downtown, magnificent mile, and the ever popular Navy Pier

Public transportation:
To get to downtown (magnificent mile) take the 70 bus that is infront of the apartment going east. To get to Navy Pier take the 65 grand bus.

Ride-sharing: an Uber /Lyft to downtown is typically 12-15 dollars and takes 20-30 mins

There is also a rent a bike docking station right infront of the apartment, $3 for  a 30 minute ride, or $15 for the day

I am veteran of the hospitality and service industry, that experience is evident through my listings

description:
Revel in your Chicago stay at this comfortable 3 bedroom, 2400 square foot  duplex. This clean, spacious and cozy home sleeps up to 11 people. Enjoy two common living spaces and a fully equip kitchen, excellent for whipping up your favorite meals. This unit is a perfect space for multiple couples, a big friend trip or a family stay. You know they say it's all about location and this space gives you easy access to many of Chicago's most favorite attractions.

We want this to be your home away from home and enjoy the following amenities:
Key-less entry
Free parking (we provide street permit for first car, free parking available on streets surrounding for each car after one)
WiFi
Two smart 49' big screen TVs
Private washer and dryer
Cable
Hangers
Hampers in each bedroom
Two blow dryers
Ironing board
Heat & central air
Towels
Toilet paper
Napkins
Paper towel
Coffee with fixings
Pots & pans
All utensils for eating & cooking
Flatware
Glasses, mugs & wine glasses
Fully functional kitchen
Pack and play available upon requests
Games and cards for kids and adults to play

3 miles from Magnificent Mile
3 miles from McCormick Center
1.9 Miles from Grant Park
1.9 Miles from Museum Park 
2 miles from Soldier Feild
3 miles from Sox's Stadium
0.5 miles from UIC campus
2 blocks from Medical District
Surrounded by Pilsen, Greektown & the bustling West Loop

We are new Airbnb hosts and want to make your experience as comfortable as possible. Please feel free to contact us at any time during your stay with questions or needs. We live in the upstairs unit so we are here to help!

This home is located in the historic neighborhood of Little Italy, chuck full of amazing restaurants, bars, coffee shops and parks. The best part is that all of this is walking distance.

3 blocks from Blue Line
3 blocks from Pink Line
Surrounded by the 290 & 90/94
Easy access to bus stops
Quick Uber ride anywhere downtown

access: Guests have access to the entire space.
description:
This is a beautiful remodeled duplex house in the historic Chicago Bronzeville neighborhood near IIT, White Sox stadium, McCormick Place, Solider Field, the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum and the 31st Street Harbor.  

This listing is for a private full house rental for 3 bedrooms.  The home is perfect for couples, small group of friends, business travelers, and familes. It a 20-min walk to McCormick Place (or 5 min Uber/Lyft).

The house is in an excellent location for IIT, University of Chicago, White Sox and McCormick Place visitors. 

Duplex is a 10 minute Uber/Lyft to the Loop/Downtown; 20 minute walk to McCormick Place (5 min by Uber/Lyft). 

CTA buses 3, 4 and 35 stops are one block away.  The house is a 5 minute walk to the Green Line station and a 10-minute walk to Red Line and Metra 35th St. station. CTA Bus 3 will take you directly to McCormick Place in about 8-10 minutes as well as downtown/ Magnificent Mile in about 20-25 minutes. Bus 4 takes you directly to downtown or University of Chicago in about 15-20 minutes. 

There is also free street parking directly outside of the home. 

We tend to have same-day check in and checkouts. Therefore to allow adequate time between guests, we cannot guarantee an early check-in, late checkout. If you require an early check-in please ask BEFORE booking.

Guests have access to the entire space.

We are available via cell phone and AirBNB messenger during your stay!

There is FREE street parking available.

Easy Access to Public transportation:
5 minutes from CTA Greenline
10 minutes from CTA Redline station/Metra 35th St. Station 
#3/#4 /#35 CTA Bus stops are half block walk 
Downtown by bus: 20 - minute ride 
Downtown by train: 15- minute ride

Interstate Highways: 
I-55 less than 5-minutes away 
I-90/94 less than 5-minutes away 
I-290 less than 8-minutes away 
Lake Shore Drive 5-minutes away

Uber/Lyft generally picks up within 5 minutes or less. 

Airports: 
Midway Airport 15-20 minutes away depending on traffic 
O’Hare Airport 40-50 minutes away depending on traffic

We tend to have same-day check in and checkouts. Therefore to allow adequate time between guests, we cannot guarantee an early check-in or late checkout.

description:
Beautiful Apartment with WIFI 

Car Available for Rent (please inquire)

If you are looking for a 1 Bedroom or 2 Bedroom - or booking for groups of 1-5, our space is perfect for you. 

Full 1 bdrm, 1bth  apartment for you and your guests to enjoy on your own (not a shared apartment/space). 

Look no further, this is your private home rental with all you need to stay for a week, a month, or a year. 

When you're here, you're home. Just pack your bags and you're ready to go. 

We welcome you!

Three Flat Residential Yellow Brick Property, 1 Bedroom, 1 Full Bathroom, 1 Queen Bed, Airbed Available. 

Modern, artsy, décor and design scheme
Very spacious and comfortable
Eat-In Kitchen
Gorgeous decorative two-tone painted living room
Hardwood floors

1 Queen Mattress for uber comfy relaxation
AirBed Available
Suitable for Groups of 3 or Smaller
Very Comfortably Sleeps 2

Everything you need to make yourself at home.


***Please Be Advised***:We do not provide mail access for short term stays. Please arrange a PO Box Rental or make other arrangements if you need mail.

Available 24hr by phone or text

Little Village, often called “Chicago 2nd Magnificent Mile” has a 2-mile stretch on 26th Street that has its own nickname: the “second Magnificent Mile.” The highest grossing shopping and tax revenue hub in the city of Chicago after downtowns popular tourist “Magnificent Mile’ on Michigan Avenue, it’s lined with independent storefronts and colorful restaurants that awaken and envelop the senses.

CTA 'L' TRAIN -  Pink Link Pulaski Stop, 5 blocks away
CTA BUS - 53 Puaski Bus, 3 blocks away

CTA Cash Fare: 
$2.25 bus single ride
CTA Transit Card: 
$2.00 bus first ride 
$2.25 rail first ride 
$0.25 first transfer 
FREE second transfer

CTA Unlimited Ride Passes: 
$10.00 1-Day 
$20.00 3-Day
$28.00 7-Day

METRA TRAIN 2.2mi at 26th and Cicero, Cicero, Illinois 60804. Take Pink Line Train from Metra to Pulaski Stop which is 5blocks walk to our location.


Metra Fare: 
$2.75-9.25 one-way ticket by zone

access: Guests have a private entrance and are welcome to enjoy the entire apartment.
description:
We recently moved into this house and heard rumors about strange happenings in and around it, but ignored them. The garden apartment was sealed shut and no matter how hard we tried, we could not open it. One day the door was mysteriously ajar. We entered what looks like house elf quarters! We’re muggles, but the family before us must not have been. Elves are very small, so be warned, the ceilings are very low. Anyone 6’ or taller may want to book elsewhere, or be ready to slouch.

The space has 2 bedrooms. One with a queen bed and one with a full size bed. Both bedrooms have closets. The living room has a couch and a 50” Netflix enabled (amazon fire stick) television. The bathroom has a stand up shower, no tub. The dining rooms seats 4-5. The kitchen includes a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, refrigerator, and stove. The entire apartment is yours. It is below another apartment so there may be some noise/footsteps, but we do our best to keep it down at night and early in the morning. The ceilings are about 6’ tall and lower in some places, so please consider this before booking. Please let us know if you’re interested in purchasing parking passes PRIOR to your arrival, each pass is an additional $10 for 24 hours of street parking. We may have last minute passes available, so don’t hesitate to ask, but requesting parking while booking is the best way to ensure that we’re able to provide you with as many passes as you’ll need. The Belmont blue line stop is a 6 minute walk from your door.

Guests have a private entrance and are welcome to enjoy the entire apartment.

The space is entirely private so we rarely see guests face to face. Please let me know what time you plan on checking in and out prior to your arrival. Please also mark yourself checked in or send me a message when you arrive, as well as when you check out so that I can have the space available for the next guest as soon as possible. Thank you! We live in the same building but travel quite frequently . Ideally, I will be around to assist with anything you need. If we will be out of town, I will definitely let you know beforehand and make sure you have everything you need to make the stay comfortable.

Our neighborhood is quiet and safe with a residential feel to it. There is a bar at the end of the street and other nearby places to eat and drink up Belmont if you want to escape the quiet neighborhood. We’re very close to public transportation as well.

We are a 6 minute walk from the Belmont blue line stop which will take you just about anywhere in the city. We offer $10/day parking passes if you wish to drive yourself around and need a safe place to park your car at night, just inquire when booking. Uber and Lyft drivers are always in the area and offer safe affordable transportation options.

Quiet hours:
Sun-Thurs 9pm-6am
Fri-Sat 2am-8am

WARNING: Low ceilings, around 6’ high and lower in some areas. 
This is a garden apartment so it’s below another apartment. Some noise/footsteps should be expected.

I can not guarantee an early check-in time. I can usually make it happen, but it depends on when the previous guests check out and how much of a mess is left behind. For this reason, I can never guarantee an exact time when guests request early check-in. Please let me know if you would like to check in early and I  do my best to get the place ready for you ASAP! I will send you a message as soon as it is available for check-in. I do not offer luggage drop off prior to check-in time or late check-outs.

access: Full use of entire apartment and in-unit washer/dryer.
description:
Full first floor of a 3-flat in the heart of Wicker Park with quick public transportation to downtown and numerous restaurants and bars to amuse yourself within the neighborhood. 

Large vintage apartment with one bedroom and in-unit washer/dryer. Living area is large enough for queen air mattress, which I can provide for an extra guest.

Street parking available with daily permit passes (upon request). Restricted parking for those with passes so it's usually easy to find.

Apartment is walking distance to night life in Wicker Park neighborhood and close to downtown via public transportation. Good sized one bedroom, perfect for a long weekend or weeklong stay in a larger space than a hotel room. The apartment works well for a single traveler, 2-3 friends or a couple. Out of town guests only please. Local/suburban Chicago guests will be refused as I do not want my place to be party pad for a weekend in the city. 

Apartment has one queen-sized bedroom and living space with two dining/game tables with sufficient enough room for air mattress and/or extra person on the comfy couch. Apartment has central heat and window A/C plus in-unit washer/dryer.

Full use of entire apartment and in-unit washer/dryer.

I will be traveling and you will have privacy to enjoy the apartment on your own.

Hipster area with incredible restaurants and coffee shops. Great live music venues, record stores, quirky/trendy shops, and plenty of late night establishments.

Well situated neighborhood only a few stops from downtown. Direct train from O'Hare (blue line) for cheap and quick transport from the airport.

Blue line train, Milwaukee 56 bus, North Ave 72 bus, and Ashland 9 bus all within 1-3 blocks. For those driving, free parking allowed with guest passes (must ask me to leave them out).

additional_house_rules:
All bookings require a security deposit of $1000 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $75 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

 Lost or unreturned keys will result in an additional $100 fee (per set).

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $100. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

description:
Wake up to the sights and sounds of Lake Michigan at this bright, stylish, and eclectic loft with large windows, plush beds, and exposed concrete. Settle down on the velvet sofa with a travel guide and plan the next day's adventures.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Master Bedroom Cirro Suite (sleeps 4) caters to all your needs in a modern, spacious layout with artistic decor that gives this suite a sophisticated edge. Set against the beautiful Chicago skyline, the Parker Suite is a hub of culture in the clouds.

Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

This apartment is conveniently located within walking distance of McCormick Place and a short drive to all tourist attractions, including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and the famous Chicago bean (Cloud Gate) sculpture.

interaction: Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is conveniently located within walking distance of McCormick Place and a short drive to all tourist attractions, including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and the famous Chicago bean (Cloud Gate) sculpture.
space: Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Master Bedroom Cirro Suite (sleeps 4) caters to all your needs in a modern, spacious layout with artistic decor that gives this suite a sophisticated edge. Set against the beautiful Chicago skyline, the Parker Suite is a hub of culture in the clouds.
summary: Wake up to the sights and sounds of Lake Michigan at this bright, stylish, and eclectic loft with large windows, plush beds, and exposed concrete. Settle down on the velvet sofa with a travel guide and plan the next day's adventures.

description:
This is the a private  studio. It has a queen sized bed, it’s own bathroom, giant walk-in closet, TV with cable,  it had a separated kitchen, a bathroom, and a large a huge closet .

It has a very big space and it’s designed like a hotel room plus it comes with aPlenty of Pots/Pans/Platters for large meals.
– Serving utensils.
– Grilling tongs.
– Full set of Henkel chef knives.
– 1 ovens, 1 grill, 1 dishwasher.
– Almost any condiment you need! We keep the fridge and pantry stocked with olive oil, butter, salt, pepper, hot sauce, BBQ sauce, mustard, ketchup, mayo, spices etc.

It’s strategically located in uptown ,
close to  shopping stores  like target, wall green and cvs and  mc Donald. Restaurant and other need services

It’s 5 minutes walk to the redline trains, the trains arrives after every 5 minutes and it’s 7 minutes drive to the Chicago downtown

additional_house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Please be advised that this home is equipped with NoiseAware. NoiseAware works like a smoke detector, but for noise. The sensor tracks the decibel levels in this home, evaluates other risk factors and will send an alert if there are excess noise levels detected. Please do not unplug the device.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine. 

No Smoking
The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside the vicinity.

Key Fob
The key fob is your way of accessing everything from your short-stay apartment to the amenity spaces in the building. If you happen to lose your key fob, you will be charged $75. 

Security
Please be advised that the building exterior and common spaces are equipped with surveillance devices. Please respect the building and its community. 

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire and police related emergencies please call 911.

access: The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.
description:
Welcome to CULVERS ROOT in the historic Uptown neighborhood, where jazz is king! With an eclectic feel and radiant vibe, Uptown is filled with music, nightlife and truly unique multi-cultural cuisine! Less than two blocks to the lake, this home is a stunner in every season! This comfy studio is perfect for business or pleasure. Whether you're looking for a night in with your sweetheart, or a night out with your friends, Uptown has endless romance, culture, and entertainment.

Sleeping Arrangements
Master Bedroom - 1 queen bed
Living Room - pull out sleeper sofa (queen)

Kitchen  
The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.  
 
Cleaning Supplies  
You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels.

Washer/Dryer 
There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay!

TV
The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize during your stay. 

Non-Smoking 
The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.

We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing reservations@livly.io!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.

For live music and nightlife, sit back for some jazz at the Green Mill, a 100-year-old classic where the swanky atmosphere harkens back to prohibition's heyday. Or for a lively mix, go for either indie rock, salsa concerts, world-class boxing or colorful wrestling matches at the Riviera or Aragon.

More information
Historical landmarks districts in Uptown Square are just some of the architectural highlights. Immerse yourself in the present while experiencing history, just have a sample of the ethnic cuisines that have found a home in the neighborhood. On Argyle Street and the surrounding blocks, you can take a tour of Asia with destination restaurants serving up Beijing duck, sushi, traditional Chinese dim sum and Vietnamese specialties like banh mi and pho. Adding to the variety are ethnic grocers mixed among Ethiopian, Lebanese, Indian cuisine and SO much more.

There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby. 

 Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few blocks from the red line for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses on every street corner.

The neighborhood is all completely walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.

Check In / Check Out
Check in starts at 4 PM 
Check out time is 11 AM

We do not offer early check in or late check out.

Luggage Hold
If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.

Pets
There is a $25/pet per booking fee. 

We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them.

Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids.

While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you will be required to provide up to date vaccination records and will be fully liable for any medical, veterinary, or property damages incurred.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our 3 bedroom condo is ideal for traveling groups - 4 beds means it can comfortably sleep 8, and there's an air bed to sleep 10! You'll love playing our Silver Strike Bowling arcade game! On the top floor and close to Garfield Park Conservatory and the Green Line. It's a 15 minute train ride to the Loop, there's parking in the back, and we're centrally located - ideal for any Chicago adventure you have in mind.

You enter our condo into one of two living rooms, which has overhead a large skylight. To your right is the second living room, with a TV, and the front bedroom. To your left is a dining area and the second bedroom. Down the hallway is the bathroom, and the third bedroom, which has two queen sized beds in it. At the rear of the condo is a spacious kitchen.

With streets that are decorated in vibrant murals and air that smells of carne guisada, Humboldt Park is a Caribbean escape shrouded in urban charm.

We're less than a 5 minute walk to the Kedzie green line station, and offer parking onsite.

additional_house_rules:
Street parking is limited to 5 weekdays per month and unlimited weekend days (Saturday and Sunday). Please contact us prior to booking if you will need parking for longer. 

Kitchen Rules
1.	Completely clean up after yourself
2.	Don’t leave water running
3.	Wash with dish soap, dry w/ paper towel, and put away all dishes before leaving the kitchen—Don’t leave dishes in the sink
4.	Make sure to scrape plate/bowl in trash 
before washing it—there is no garbage disposal
5.	Empty/clean sink trap/drain catch and sponge or towel
6.	Don’t forget to wash the spoon rest from the stove after use
7.	Don’t forget to wipe down/out stove/oven, toaster oven, and/or microwave—things splatter and crumbs seem to jump
8.	Empty and rinse coffee filter and/or throw out K-cup after use
9.	Put everything back in its place—storage is limited so organization is a must
10.	Wipe down the counter with a paper towel and Lysol
(located in spray bottle under sink)
11.	Sweep (those darn pesky jumping crumbs)
12.	Try not to store/leave items on the counter—again, space is limited
13.	Use cork trivet (located next to microwave) under hot/warm food/plates when eating at the dining table—the heat stains the table
14.	Please don’t forget items in the fridge
15.	For items that smell or will smell, tie it up tightly in a 
grocery bag (located on the side of the fridge, by window); 
please double bag, before putting it in the trash
16.	Please use the appropriate can for trash and/or recycle


Bathroom Rules

1.	DO NOT FLUSH PAPER TOWELS, 
BABY WIPES, OR ANY SANITARY ITEMS
2.	Bathmat should not be soaking/dripping wet
—use hook near shower to keep bath towel close
to mostly dry off before getting out of the tub
3.	Try not to allow lots of hair to go down the drain
—wipe up with a paper towel and toss it in the trash
4.	Rinse shower and use shower spray when done
5.	Please be mindful of what you put in the trash
—Remember that this is a shared space.
6.	Shower liner should be inside tub while in use
—water should drip down into tub not on floor
7.	Close shower liner/curtain after use
—this allows for liner to dry and prevent mold and mildew
8.	Wipe up as needed (mirror, sink, etc.)
9.	Please put toilet seat back down
10.	Don’t use the towels in bathroom
—towels for your stay are in your room and more are available by request  



Living Room Rules
1. Clean up after yourself
—crumbs, paper, cups, personal items, etc.
2. Take all your items with you 
when you leave the room
3. Fluff and put pillows back
4. No sleeping on couch 
or any personal hygiene services 
in living room

access:
Guests are welcome to reasonable use of sunroom with massage chair and recliners, kitchen, living room, and backyard.

Street parking is limited to 5 weekdays per month and unlimited weekend days (Saturday and Sunday). Please contact us prior to booking if you will need parking for longer.
description:
Vintage home with an eclectic touch of modern in a quiet family neighborhood on a tree lined block; very close to forest preserves, shopping, public transportation, and easy access to many hospitals (for medical students), Chicago, Forest Park, Oak Park, and O'Hare. Home will be shared with a married m/f couple (owners) and permanent female renter. Entire 1st floor and outside is for use and most of the basement. There are 2 rooms available in this home through Air bnb though separate listings.

The private room is located on the 2nd floor of the home (about 13 stairs) and is more than efficient. 

32" TV with almost all of the cable channels (including premium), OnDemand, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and Chromecast (for mirroring your personal device). Decorated with students or business travelers in mind but nice and comfortable for anyone! Queen size mattress with memory foam topper; Blackout curtains; desk/vanity with office chair; full length mirror, and limited storage space. 

A single extra folding bed is available but there will be very little space in room except for sleeping. This bed is only set up by request so please give us advance notice if this bed will be needed for your stay. Note, the accent chair folds out to the single bed. 


Room is steps away from the bathroom which is only used by the owners. Access to most parts of the house except for "office" space in the basement, though basement may have very minor restrictions. Workout equipment is located in basement. It's not a full gym but has most things needed for a good workout.

It should be easy for you to make yourself at home!

Guests are welcome to reasonable use of sunroom with massage chair and recliners, kitchen, living room, and backyard.

Street parking is limited to 5 weekdays per month and unlimited weekend days (Saturday and Sunday). Please contact us prior to booking if you will need parking for longer.

Please use Airbnb to communicate as we have cohost that may be better to assist you. Only use the cell phone number listed in emergency. 

We are open to chatting with guest and giving recommendations or information on Chicagoland but I do work a lot so sometimes it may just be a simple good morning 😀 in passing. Permanent renter works in hospitality so she's full of information about Chicagoland.
The best way to reach us is through the Airbnb app so both host and co-host have access to assist.

Street parking is limited to 5 weekdays per month and unlimited weekend days (Saturday and Sunday). Please contact us prior to booking if you will need parking for longer. 

The best way to get around varies from car service (uber, Lyft, taxi/cab) and public transportation. Google is a good option for comparing which mode of transportation would be better to get to and/or from desired destination. Remember to adjust time and day to reflect as desired as this may alter the best route and/or mode of transportation. 
For those that are driving and may need parking at a destination away from the house, follow the link below for discount parking near your destination. 
https://refer.spothero.com/s/2qkp2

Please use Airbnb to communicate as we have cohost that may be better to assist you. Only use the cell phone number listed in emergency. 

Only verified Airbnb users on the reservation will be allowed to check-in.

Street parking is limited to 5 weekdays per month and unlimited weekend days (Saturday and Sunday). Please contact us prior to booking if you will need parking for longer.

access:
Access to the house is easy, and I’ll provide you your own key to
Come & go as you please. There is access to a large back yard and deck enjoyable in the summertime. As previously mentioned, there is driveway access and walkability to the train. 

For commuting access: Metra 1 block away to get to downtown Chicago, La Grange, Naperville, or Aurora (BNSF is an easy and west bound train). Downtown Downers Grove 1 mile away westbound. Downtown Westmont 1 mile away eastbound. I-88 is 1.5 miles away, I-294 is 3 miles away, and I-355 is 2 miles away. Pace buses allow for local commuting. If you need a short ride though, I’ll likely provide one for gratis ;-)
description:
Welcome to my clean and happy abode! “Mi casa es tu casa,” is the motto. I am a friendly host, who loves having AirBnb guests.

Sleep on your choice of a new, large leather sectional, or the pullout twin bed, which is converted from a custom Pottery Barn honey-colored chair. 

No need for a car; Metra is as close as possible and is walking distance! 

Imagine staying in a home with a happy, young professional host, and you’ve got your stay in Downers Grove.  Come live like a Chicago suburbanite!

The Chicago western suburbs are extremely safe and friendly. While many parts of Chicago have affluent neighborhoods, you’ll find in some places, the town nextdoor a mile away is a bit sketch. Not in Downers Grove: you’re insulated from crime by having many other nice, neighboring towns in Dupage County such as Westmont, Lombard, Naperville, Woodridge, Western Springs, Hinsdale, and Oak Brook. 

From the house, you have convenience to all sorts of shops and restaurants. Looking for groceries? Try Standard Market! The best specialty foods and high-quality grocer in the United States is only a mile away (dry-aged steaks, fantastic seafood, fancy cheeses, and the freshest produce, I cannot emphasize how amazing this place is!). Want to have a bite to eat? Neat Kitchen & Bar is one mile East in Westmont, featuring hip, New American food & atmosphere. There’s also the local Chicago hot dog and gyro joint, The Eagle Restaurant, just around the corner and about a two-minutes walk from the house. Want to experience local breweries? Emmet’s is one mile west off the same street as the house, and Alter Brewing Co. is another great microbrewer 2 miles from downtown Downers Grove off of Belmont Rd. 

There’s so many places in the suburbs, but downtown Chicago is easily accessible as well! Leave the car behind: getting downtown is easy. Take a 4 minute walk to the train station, and you can be downtown in less than half an hour via the Metra line BNSF. 

With all your urban exploring and adventuring, I’ll make sure your stay is comfortable and restful. At the house, I will provide you fresh linens with two white sheets, a blanket, and two standard cotton bed pillows to sleep on. I make sure to make the space as comfortable and clean as possible. I literally clean every day, guest or not. 

For your things, there is available a small living room closet, with a hanger bar for clothing. You’re also free to pile your bags in the corner if that’s your style. 

The house features hardwood throughout, kitchen access, and a big yard and deck. Private parking is available in the spacious driveway. If you need to do laundry, there is a washer and dryer, ironing board, and a Swash Machine. I will also provide you a fresh towel and wash cloth, hotel-style shampoo & soaps, and blow-dryer and styling tools if needed. The bathroom features a heated fan which is amazing for Chicago winters!

Last to mention is the beta fish, George, who is amazingly friendly and agile for a fish. He likes to be pet and have human interaction, and he will do jumps for his food! He sits in a 5 gallon tank on the table in the kitchen, keeping you company when you want to sit and eat a snack. George will help you bring home a unique story for your nice stay! 

While you stay in Downers Grove, anything you need, just ask. Mi casa es tu casa, and I believe you will truly enjoy this shared space.

Access to the house is easy, and I’ll provide you your own key to
Come & go as you please. There is access to a large back yard and deck enjoyable in the summertime. As previously mentioned, there is driveway access and walkability to the train. 

For commuting access: Metra 1 block away to get to downtown Chicago, La Grange, Naperville, or Aurora (BNSF is an easy and west bound train). Downtown Downers Grove 1 mile away westbound. Downtown Westmont 1 mile away eastbound. I-88 is 1.5 miles away, I-294 is 3 miles away, and I-355 is 2 miles away. Pace buses allow for local commuting. If you need a short ride though, I’ll likely provide one for gratis ;-)

Guests have considerable space in the house. Living room, bathroom, kitchen are all open- you def aren’t confined to a small space. Also the closet in the living room is open for use.

The Downers Grove and Westmont area is part of the beautiful and affluent western Chicago suburbs. Both have downtowns with many neat restaurants, shops, and bars if you would like to go out to eat or are looking for an evening hang out locally. Downtown Downers is 1 mile west, Westmont 1 mile east. 

The house is walking distance to the Metra, 7/11 & Speedway, the Eagle Restaurant, Burlington Barber Shop, Treehouse Arts Center, and multiple parks and forest preserves. On weekdays, the BNSF Metra line will get you to downtown Chicago in 25 minutes, and on weekends, Metra rides are 50 minutes. The line can also take you west to Naperville and Aurora. 

This area is great for recreation. Runners will have plenty of nice flat paths including one that will take you through the forest preserve. Waterfall Glen, which features over 9 miles of hilly crushed limestone paths, is only a few miles away. For a nature-renowned treat, visit the Morton Arboretum in Lisle, located just 4 miles from the house. If there’s snow on the ground, try cross-country skiing at the Morton for a very affordable price! 

For golfers, there are multiple courses within a 5 mile radius, some of which even offer rental clubs, perfect for those traveling. I suggest Downers Grove Golf Club, the oldest golf course in North America, which is only a few miles away in the same town.

For public transportation, the metra is one block away: BNSF Fairview Ave. Driving in this area is easy with nearby highways I-355, I-88, and I-294. Parking is available in the driveway.

Because I pride the home for cleanliness, please respect this as well as a priority. Take your shoes off before walking around the house. Clean your dishes and take-out boxes right away. Don’t leave a wet towel or blankets tossed around the living room. I’ve had a string of really respectful and fun guests, and I’d like to keep it that way.

access: You will have access to the entire apartment. You can use the back porch area as well. There will be several locked closets that you will not have access to.
description:
Welcome to Wicker Park! Perfect location to explore the city, 20 min from the loop, 8 minutes away from the blue line,  and all buses leave from the front door.

Our space is fully stocked so you feel like you're at home. Enjoy a Keurig coffee maker, free toiletries, comfortable beds, a Roku TV, and the fastest internet you can get in the city. Keypad entry makes check in a breeze. We look forward to hosting you!

This large vintage apartment is located in the heart of Wicker Park, one of Chicago's most popular and safe neighborhoods. Our building was constructed in the 1890s. We are close to tons of stores and restaurants. In fact, our apartment is above a great Mediterranean restaurant and across the street from a delicious diner. A new tavern just went in next door and you are within minutes of the vibrant Wicker Park restaurant and bar scene. 

We are a 15 minute Uber ride from downtown Chicago. There is a bus stop right outside our front door. Walk 8 minutes to the "El" (Chicago's elevated train system) and ride anywhere in the city for just a couple of dollars. Perfect home for a business traveler. It is also great for groups or families because we can accommodate up to 8 people with three queen sized beds, one queen sized air mattress, and one full sized sofa pullout. 

Check-in is a breeze with keypads on both the front and back doors to the apartment. Once inside, feel free to adjust the heat/central air to your liking. There are also three space heaters and a window heating/air conditioning unit that you can use as needed.

There is plentiful free street parking on the side streets surrounding the apartment. There is also paid street parking right in front of the apartment that is $4 for 2 hours until 10pm, and then it is free overnight until 8am. I never have to park more than a block away from the apartment and the neighborhood is very safe. 

We have very fast WiFi and a Roku TV that you can use to log into your Netflix, HBO Go, Amazon Prime, etc. We also have Alexa in the living room.

All three bedrooms house comfortable queen sized beds with fresh, clean linens. Our couch pulls out into a full sized bed. We also have a queen sized air mattress. You can comfortably sleep 8 people in this space. 

We have towels for all guests as well as extra toiletries such as face wash, toothpaste, toothbrushes, tampons, lotion, etc. We also provide body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. 

If you love to cook, you will love our kitchen. Feel free to use our cookware and spices as well as our gas stove and oven. You wont ever pine away for a spatula or a dish; we live in this house when we are in the country and it is well stocked. There is a Keurig coffee maker available for your use. There is also a lot of space for dining and serving: we have a dining table in both the kitchen and the dining room with room for up to ten. 

The  washer and dryer are in the apartment and are available for your use. Detergent and fabric softener are provided.

Our apartment is clean and spacious. It is a great home base for your stay in Chicago!

You will have access to the entire apartment. You can use the back porch area as well. There will be several locked closets that you will not have access to.

We are always available through the Airbnb app. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to message us!

"One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds."

Source: Choose Chicago

You can park on the side streets very easily. Uber, Lyft, and taxis are abundant. Wicker Park is also very walkable and has great public transportation. Jump on the blue line just 8 minutes away, or catch a bus on the corner.

Our downstairs neighbor is a delicious Mediterranean restaurant and our upstairs neighbors are local teachers. The front bedroom faces the street and there will be city sounds as this is a busy neighborhood. Please be respectful with your noise level, and no parties or loud music. Any noise complaints will be immediately reported to the police. Please treat our home as you would want your home treated! Thank you in advance :)
house_rules:
- Quiet hours from 10pm-8am
- No parties or loud noise/rowdiness. If there are noise complaints you will be first asked to quiet down. If it happens again, you will be asked to leave with no refund. 
-No smoking in the house. Please go out on the back porch. Please keep noise down on back porch after 10pm.
interaction: We are always available through the Airbnb app. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to message us!

description:
Entire top level inclusive of a master suite & living space in the eves of a beautiful, newly renovated, classic Chicago bungalow. Complete with an open-aired back deck, a bonfire pit perfect for outdoor enjoyment & a beautiful kitchen to enjoy a quick bite, this home is the epitome of tranquility during your busy Chicago trip. In a quiet neighborhood with convenience to everything the City has to offer, & a host who knows the best spots of Chicago, you’ll feel right at home.

Please let me know of any dietary restrictions or allergies you may have upon booking. Also, please let me know your preferences on tea and coffee, fruit, and to-go breakfast items.
