description:
Explore downtown from this cozy high rise apartment. Walking distance to Bulls stadium, Sears Tower and Soldier Field.
We are fit for solo travelers, couples, business travelers, families, and groups of up to 4 people.  (All guests have to provide valid ID to pick up the KEY FOB from security desk)

The building hosts various activities to bring people together. They've done cookouts on the outdoor sun decks, have live music and snacks on some Thursdays, have a Food Truck park outside once a week, 'no cook Wednesday' where they have a restaurant come in and sell take out, monthly restaurant raffles, discounted tickets to Sox/Bulls/Museums/restaurants, etc.

Self check in through Door man.

Our Unit is conveniently located near Greek-town and West Loop/Randolph Row. There are plenty of grocery stores Mariano's and Whole Foods are close. Conveniently positioned for public transit (L trains, union station, Ogilvie, water taxi). Also a quick mile jog to the lake shore path.

Near the train station and bus runs in front of building.

Check in time :  From  3PM      
Check out time : 11AM
Please leave key in unit when check-out. 
Parking in building $40 per 24 hours.
house_rules: There is absolutely no smoking in the entire building,  just an FYI there is a security deposit of $1,500 if rules are violated. I hope you are enjoying  in your time in Chicago.   I Can’t wait to have you as my guest. This home is fit for solo travelers, couples, business travelers, families, and groups of up to 4 people.  UP TO 4 PEOPLE are allowed.

description:
Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom South Loop apartment with high floor views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, bright living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI138)

Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. 


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- In-Building Laundry
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

access: Shared Back Deck with Grill Outdoor Lounge Furniture Laundry - Washer and Dryer Children's Outdoor, Wooden Playhouse Children's Toys Small Children's Pool
description:
This sunny, charming apartment is nestled in the Lakeview neighborhood off of the premier corner of Southport & Addison. The building sits on a quiet, tree-lined street with a lovely, small neighborhood playground just steps from the home. The apartment has 3 bedrooms, 2 queen and 1 double bed. If you are traveling with small children, enjoy the complimentary baby and toddler items, a travel crib and high chair (upon request). The large living room is a great place to wind-down and relax.

This sunny, charming apartment is nestled in the Lakeview neighborhood off of the premier corner of Southport & Addison. The owner occupied building sits on a quiet, tree-lined street with a lovely, small neighborhood playground just steps from the home. The apartment has 3 bedrooms: 2 queen and 1 double bed. 

If you are traveling with small children... please enjoy the complimentary baby and toddler items, a travel crib and high chair (upon request). The large living room is a great place to wind-down and relax. Curl up on the overstuffed sofas and watch a movie on the 55” flat screen T.V. with Premium HD cable including HBO, Showtime, and many others. High-speed internet throughout the building – from the front steps to the backyard. Walk to Wrigley Field to cheer on the Chicago Cubs and find great dining and shopping along Southport Avenue. Take advantage of the Divvy Bike rentals and head to the beach or take the Brownline L downtown or to visit other great Chicago neighborhoods. Enjoy free laundry during your stay. The laundry room is located in the basement and is equipped with a high efficiency washer and dryer. Interested in making dinner at home or would you prefer to grill outside? You’ll find all your grocery needs at Jewel, one block away. Nearby you can also find your favorites at Whole Foods and Trader Joe’s. The cozy kitchen is fully outfitted for cooking meals with pots & pans, small kitchen appliances (blender, coffee maker, toaster, etc), mixing bowls, cooking utensils, baking dishes, serving dishes, measuring cups and spoons, etc. Dishes, flatware, glasses, mugs, salt & pepper mills, creamer & sugar bowl, and place-mats are also furnished. Children's plates, cups, and cutlery provided.

Shared Back Deck with Grill Outdoor Lounge Furniture Laundry - Washer and Dryer Children's Outdoor, Wooden Playhouse Children's Toys Small Children's Pool

Available 24/7 - reach out by phone/text/email

Southport Corridor: Wrigleyville: Lakeview

Divvy Bike Rental - Southport and Waveland

Southport & Roscoe Brownline L 

Addison Red Line L

Addison Bus #152

Taxi service is very easy to find all day/night 

Uber a ride- they'll be there in minutes, even seconds! Use Uber Pool to meet the locals

Parking:

For guests who plan on driving, parking is very easy to find- and in most cases, right in front of the building! One zone parking pass will be provided for each rental day.  

If you have more than one car you can park the other vehicles on Ashland Ave one block west   No parking pass is necessary on that street 

Parking can also be provided on site for an additional 25 dollars per day   Please reserve in advance

Children's pack-n-play, crib, high chair, etc available upon request

Air Mattress available upon request

If you are interested in catching a Cubs game, please ask us about purchasing Cubs bleacher seats available for most weekend and weeknight games. 2 tickets per game.
house_rules:
Please refer to House Manual upon Arrival
Strict about number of maximum guests 
Owner Occupied Family Building. No big parties or loud late nights

description:
Only ONE BLOCK away to United Center. Best location and most affordable price! You can get to Untd Cntr in 5min walking. You have all the nice bars and restaurants of west loop 7min away by car.Hearth of downtown 10min away with not traffic. And 15min by public transp. Free parking on the street. We offer all the amenities you might need. My cohost runs over 40 rooms around the city. We have a whole team to help you anytime and to make sure everything is perfect! Place is clean every single day.

Only ONE BLOCK away from United Center(5min walking).

Super close to Downtown chicago( 7min away to west loop area where all the bars and restaurants).
10 min by car to the hearth of Downtown with no traffic.
15 by public transportation

You can get there by Uber or public transportation. Parking is free on the street. Right in front of the building it’s free but you’re not supposed to park there when there is events in United Center. But on the two other street of each corner of the street where the building is you can park for free as well

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 
The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3rd or 4th guest in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3 or 4. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. the room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 
As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound. There will be security cameras ON in shared spaces only( living room, kitchen, hallways, entrance of the apartment, exits of the apartment).

access: 24/7 Front Desk
description:
Standard Queen Rooms feature one Queen bed as well as a coffee maker and a decorative round table with two chairs in each room. Amenities include: Complimentary wireless Internet, Coffeemaker and coffee, Iron/ironing board, Mini refrigerator, Pillowtop beds , Hairdryer, Room service, Air conditioning, Flat-screen TV with cable and satellite channels, Safe

Located directly on Michigan Avenue, the Chicago Landmark has a marvelous view of Lake Michigan and amenities ranging from free Wi-Fi, a superb breakfast and valet parking. Valet parking is $49.00 per day and parking at the garage is $44.00 with free in/out service.

24/7 Front Desk

Located in Chicago's central "Loop" neighborhood, the hotel is walking distance to main attractions such as Millennium and Grant Parks, Lake Michigan, famed Mag Mile and Chicago Boat Tours.

access: Private room for you, the shared spaces are living room, bathroom and kitchen.
description:
FREE Wi-Fi, Roku TV with Netflix and Hulu. Toiletries provided, clean towels, snack basket. FREE coffee and tea. Room has a small dorm fridge. In kitchen there's a microwave for guest use. Free street parking. There is a Walgreens 50 yards away and a Starbucks. An LA Fitness gym one block away. 7 minutes away from the Orange Line train station and only 12 minutes away from Midway Airport by Uber, Lyft or Taxi. $50 cleaning fees if you leave a big mess

Secure apartment in quiet commercial/residential area. I have a security camera facing the front door in the living room and it will be recording when there is movement for security reasons of my guest and I. 

Original hardwood floors with lots of character. There's free street parking, either in front of building or the streets close to building. Public transportation near. Walgreens open 24 hours on same block.

Sleeping arrangements:  There's a comfortable full size bed with Essence Bamboo pillows comfortable for all sleep positions with luxurious infused knit covers that can accommodate 2 guests, I also have an air mattress you can inflate in room or in living room that fits one, and if there's a 4th guest there's a comfy sofa in the living room that can be used to sleep.

Private room for you, the shared spaces are living room, bathroom and kitchen.

Most of the time I will not be home or I'll be staying away from home but I'll be only a phone call away if you have questions or anything else you need. Respecting your privacy is essential to me.

This is a colorful diverse neighborhood located in the city's southwest side.

There's free street parking, either in front of building or the streets close to building. The orange line train is near by. I recommend Uber or Lyft because it will be more convenient and faster.

-Check in is at 2pm- Flexible before of after that time but you need to communicate time of arrival in advance so I can arrange a smooth check-in

- Do the dishes after use if you leave dirty dishes a $20 cleaning fee will be charged to you. No smoking allowed in the apartment. If you stain the sheets a $20 fee will be charged also if you leave a big mess in the rooms a cleaning charge of $50 will be applied.  If you bring an unlisted guest a $100 charge will be added per extra person not listed in the original booking.

-Check out is at 11am but if you stay later than 11am without being acknowledge by me first, a $20 extra charge will be applied since this will delay my cleaning process to have the place ready for the next guest.

- If you lose or take the keys with you after check-out I will have to buy a new set of door knobs for the front entrance and the bedroom to replace them, also I will have to make extra sets of keys for me and the guest. The total it's $60 so please make sure you don't loose the keys.

-No extra charge for late check-in (acceptable as late as 1am)
Please communicate time of arrival as soon as you book or before.

- If you disconnect the security camera or the modem and the wireless router you'll be charged $500 for tampering with the security system.

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
description:
Welcome to Chicago, home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our Studio condo is a perfect place to stay on any Chicago getaway, whether business or vacation. It is professionally designed with a full kitchen, living room, and modern decor. 

Street parking is limited  and it is difficult to park at night, we recommend parking your car once and taking the train for your entire stay. The Wellington L Station is just a 10 minutes walk away.

In the heart of trendy Boystown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston.

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows.

Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertop. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. There is a common laundry area for guests which they can use during their stay. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!!

Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

What’s better than staying in the heart of Downtown Chicago? How about an apartment that gives you the best of both worlds: minutes from the most exciting attractions of the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier, but far enough away that you can get a taste of authentic Chi-Town life like a local.

Our place is a 10-minute walk from the Wellington L Station which can take you straight into Downtown. Our neighborhood itself, though, is best explored foot, so you can meander through the quaint boutiques and tasty eateries while enjoying the lush trees that line the streets. Walk just 10 minutes east and you’ll stumble upon the spectacular Lakefront Trail, which offers panoramic views of Lake Michigan and is a fantastic place to run, walk, and people watch.

You’ll never go hungry in this ‘hood. Some of our favorite places to eat include Crisp, known for Korean-style fried chicken, Chilam Balam for Mexican small plates, and the delicious Mediterranean fare at Troy. When you’re craving something sweet, walk just 2 minutes to Bobtail Ice Cream for a milkshake, sundae, or a scoop of their chocolate chip merlot ice cream. Or chocolate ice cream infused with Jack Daniels, if that’s what you’re into.

In the mood for a night on the town but you don’t want to deal with the crowds Downtown? There are plenty of low-key, exciting, sophisticated, and eclectic bars here that will be perfect for the kind of evening you want to have. From the whisky-centric Duke Of Perth to the 80-year-old Jake's Pub (they even have a jukebox) to Bar Pastoral’s wine and cheese expertise, there’s something for everyone.

And if you just want to relax and watch a show, you have options within walking distance. Catch the latest blockbuster at Landmark's Century Centre Cinema or a live drama at TimeLine Theatre Company, both about 5 minutes from our place. Not much further away are the Laugh Factory comedy club and the Blue Man Group’s Briar Street Theater for more live entertainment.

Why break the bank with a pricey rental car when you can take advantage of Chicago’s top-notch public transportation system? Our place is just a 10-minute walk from Wellington Station, where you can catch the Brown Line and the Purple/Red Line. Any line will take you to Downtown Chicago in just about 15 minutes, or you can head north to Uptown or Evanston on the Red Line, which later turns into the Purple Line.

Flying into Chicago? We’re a 25-minute drive from O’Hare when there is no traffic, but if there is traffic you may be better off taking public transit (and saving some $$ on the taxi or Uber fare). Take the Blue Line from O’Hare to Clark/Lake, then transfer to the Brown Line to Wellington Station. Or, transfer from the Blue Line to the bus, depending on what time of day you’re traveling.

In addition to public transit, ridesharing (Uber or Lyft) is also a great way to get around the Chicago metro. When you’re heading out with a group or want that extra little bit of luxury, just request a ride - they’re readily available and can take you anywhere you want to go.

-There are many units inside this building.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

description:
Heart of Chicago, the bars and restaurants filled river north, just across the river from the popular Fulton Market next to the popular multi-story East Bank Club with pools, gym fitness. The building also provides a large free fitness center. 
-In unit washer dryer, balcony, fireplace. 


*Don't allow less than 5 month unfortunately. Building has 6-month minimum. First time posting via Airbnb.

*Please text me for discount queries.

Trains and buses to all parts of Chicago start in this area so connectivity is superb.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Free private parking

Wicker Park highlights
- Walkability score: 93
- 4 minute walk to Big Star (best Mexican street food)
- 6 minute walk to Bongo Room (inventive brunch fare)

Getting around
- 4 blocks to Damen subway station
- 20 minute drive to downtown
- 35 minute drive to ORD Airport

Boasting a youthful energy and trendy dining and shopping scenes, Wicker Park puts endless possibilities at your fingertips. Walkable streets are littered with boutique shops, cafes, and art galleries. Craft cocktail bars and performance venues make it one of the city's most popular nightlife destinations, while the Bloomingdale Trail and Park offer joggers and bikers a welcome respite from bustling streets.

This Sonder has cathedral-style ceilings and prone to noise.

There is no elevator.

There is basic cable. Additionally, we've provided a ROKU streaming device.

access:
Entire top floor unit. Front stoop & coin-laundry in basement, access upon request.

NOTE: we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late checkouts and do not allow bags to be dropped off early or left for pick up later.
description:
Come stay in an updated classic Chicago Greystone! Doesn't get much more Chicago than this! Large 3bed/1bath top floor unit. Steps to Chicago's Blue Line Train Station which takes you to O'Hare or Downtown in 20 mins (Logan stop, halfway between O'Hare and Downtown). 3 blocks to 90/94 expswy, 1.5 blocks to historic Logan Blvd, hip Milwaukee Ave shops & restaurants, Logan Theater, bars/nightlife and 4 miles to Wrigley! Family friendly area. (Profile photo required when requesting reservation).

Large unit features living room, separate dining room, kitchen, 3 full bedrooms & an updated bathroom. Central air, ceiling fans, new windows, original hardwood floors. Light decoration throughout. Kitchen features fridge, oven range, microwave, dishwasher, coffeemaker (w/coffee), electric kettle, toaster, dishes, silverware, few pots/pans. Clean towels, bath mat provided.

Entire top floor unit. Front stoop & coin-laundry in basement, access upon request.

NOTE: we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late checkouts and do not allow bags to be dropped off early or left for pick up later.

We live on first floor and will be available at anytime. We are both friendly people and open to conversation but understand that many guests want privacy. We're happy to provide directions or offer recommendations but if you don't reach out, we'll happily keep our distance. We are very respectful of space and will follow your lead. We will not enter your rented space unless by request or in the case of emergency.

Historic Logan Square

Blue Line is just a 5 minute walk that operates 24 hours. We are located halfway between O'Hare Airport and Downtown via both the Blue Line and 90/94 Expressway.

For those with a vehicle during their stay, street parking is mostly permit in our neighborhood & we provide one (1) 24-hour parking permit per day of your visit. Additional street parking on Schubert or Diversey does not require a permit however be mindful of any City of Chicago parking signage posted, as applicable.

There is a family that rents the unit in the front portion of our basement level. Our utility room with coin-laundry is located in the back portion of the basement.

additional_house_rules:
Thank you for being mindful and respectful of the space...

Please treat things nicely.  Smoking on the back porch but not inside.  Thank you

Some expected Kitchen & Bathroom Courtesies:

Please keep wooden kitchen counters free of wet glasses & dishes, pots & pans.  Please dry dishes in dishwasher racks and not on wooden counters and cutting boards.

Please use wooden cutting boards for fruits and vegetables and only use plastic cutting boards for any meat/fish/poultry.

Please clean kitchen counters and cutting boards after use.

Please rinse sink and remove food debris.

Please rinse dishes and silverware of foods and sauces before placing in dishwasher.

Please tread lightly in the bathroom and rinse down tub and bathroom sink and wipe mirrors after use. 

I appreciate your care to these details.

Please let me know if there is anything I can offer to improve your stay!

Thank you and hope you have a wonderful visit!

access: Access to living areas, kitchen, bathroom, laundry room and back deck.
description:
Private bedroom in beautiful wood trimmed 3BRapartment with luxury marble tiled bathroom, friendly kitchen with modern appliances including dishwasher and washer/dryer in unit. 

Historic Tri-Taylor neighborhood is minutes to downtown, UIC, hospitals & United Center. 

CTA blue line 4 blocks away.  

Welcome and enjoy your stay!

This space is perfect for students or professionals visiting Chicago or for short and long-term stays.

Private room in 3 bedroom apartment.

Access to living areas, kitchen, bathroom, laundry room and back deck.

I am available to answer any questions or help in any way. You are welcome to interact as much as you desire and can remain as private as you like

Beautiful and safe historic neighborhood is like living on a movie set!  Great neighbors and with convenient store two blocks away, and a few restaurants, and also a nearby liquor store and friendly bar across the street for sporting events on cable TV.

Easy walk to the cta blue line or two bus stops literally steps from the door.   Free and permit Street parking around the corner

I ask that you please be mindful of the pace and clean up after yourself.  Please do not excessively eat food in the room as crumbs tend to attract ants out of the woodwork.  There is an eat in kitchen or deck with table.

additional_house_rules:
•	Help keep things clean: Remove your street shoes upon entering the apartment.

•	This is a family neighborhood, with lots of fun things to do nearby in Little Italy & in the West Loop. Please no parties or large gatherings in the unit and be mindful of loud music. 		     Quiet hours are 11pm-9am.

•	You have access to the entire 1st floor apartment, including the front courtyard and ground level backyard patio. Cushions for the patio furniture are in the brown container along the garage, please feel free to use anytime, be sure to put away when not in use. 

•	No smoking on premises

•	No Candles

•	No Pets 

•	Feel free to use the washer/dryer to do your personal laundry. You may place dirty linens/towels in blue hamper in laundry room area. 

•	Please run any dirty dishes through dishwasher upon leaving (simple wash setting, no heat dry). Please hand wash pots/pans.

•	If you happen to damage anything during your stay, please let us know! We understand things happen, let’s have open communication to resolve any issues easily and nicely.

•	You’re welcome to any wine, snack bars, coffee and tea that’s in the unit, help yourself!

•	Please lock the apartment whenever you leave. Be sure to press the ‘Schlage’ button after closing the inner door, then make sure the black door is securely shut behind you. 

•	First Aid Kit and Fire Extinguisher located in cabinet to the right of the kitchen sink. 

•	Trash: Please take trash bags out to the green/black trash bin on back patio after your stay (or whenever necessary). Please be sure the lid of the outdoor trash bin is closed at all times. 

•	Recycling: Please place in recycling bin in unit, we will place in our large recycling bin in alley after your stay. 

•	Please do not share your door code with anyone other than your registered guests.

access:
- You have access to the entire 1st floor apartment, including the front courtyard and ground level backyard patio. 
- Please don't access any stairways to the 2nd level without prior permission.
description:
Newly renovated, 2 bedroom, furnished apartment, located just off Taylor Street in the heart Little Italy!

Safe and lively neighborhood, packed with diverse restaurants, cafes, bakeries, parks, etc. 
Classic Italian dining at Francesca's, blues music at the Taylor St. Tap, happy hour at DaVanti, all within a 2 minute walk from the apartment! Nearby West Loop also packed with trendy shops and amazing dining spots.

Flat screen TV in every room, In unit laundry, patio space, coffee/tea provided

-  Classic Chicago-style home in a quiet neighborhood, yet very close to downtown (3 miles from the Loop)
- Gated yard, ground level entrance to apartment.
- Fully furnished, providing all the comforts of home!
- 2BR w/  One Queen bed and Wall mounted TV
- Front bedroom is equipped with large desk, great for business travel!
- Rear bedroom is equipped with cable TV
- Beautiful bathroom w/ double vanity, large shower/bath, plenty of towels for your stay.
- In-unit washer/dryer, feel free to use for personal items, no need to wash linens/towels.
- Large Smart TV with Comcast Cable TV in Living Room, Wall mount can swivel 90 degrees to make viewing while cooking in the kitchen easier
- Galley kitchen with all the essentials for cooking a meal if you like.
- Keurig Coffee Pods & Tea bags provided complimentary.
- Dining Room seating for two, Bar seating for four.
- Lots of closet/storage space - great for long term stays!
- Large back patio area with furniture to relax on.

- You have access to the entire 1st floor apartment, including the front courtyard and ground level backyard patio. 
- Please don't access any stairways to the 2nd level without prior permission.

- We live on premise, upstairs in the 2nd floor apartment. 
- You'll be able to enter with a keyless entry system, so you can check in anytime that's convenient for you Noon-10pm unless otherwise discussed.
- We'll give you plenty of space, and we're always available for you throughout your stay!

Great Breakfast Spots/Bakeries: 
  - Stax Cafe - hands down our favorite brunch spot, varied menu and always delicious. Open 7a-3p everyday.
  - L'ours Bakery - cool, trendy decor and great lighting, great for pastries and fun drinks of all sorts!
  - Scafuri Bakery - classic Italian bakery, great pastries, coffees, etc. 
  - Sweet Maple Cafe - great country-style comfort food, generally a line to get there early! Open 7a-2p everyday.

Great Dining:
  - Davanti - great wine list, oven-fired pizzas and shared plates
  - Francesca's - white tablecloth Italian dining, classic staple of the neighborhood.
  - Bacci's pizza - quick & easy, oh-so-delicious
  - Yummi Thai - the orange chicken is amaaazing !
  - Chilango - great empanadas & tacos
  - Rosebud - famously historic, large portions!
  - Pompeii - cafeteria style Italian dining

Beer/Wine Purchase:
  - Gentile's Bottle Shop - amazing wine and craft beer selections!
  - Taylor Wine & Spirits - wide variety available, slightly closer than Gentile's

Closest Neighborhoods
  - Pilsen - rich with Mexican history, you'll find offbeat vintage shops, independent coffee houses and quaint cafes alongside bodegas, panaderias and restaurants serving authentic Mexican cuisine. Check out Dusek's for dinner, Punch House or Tack Room for cocktails.
  - West Loop - aptly named "Restaurant Row," you can go from sushi bar to sports bar, bakery to brewery, wine tasting to taquería, butcher shop to champagne salon, late-night diner to futuristic cocktail lounge — all within this stretch. Check out The Hoxton hotel for casual cocktails with friends, Bandit for amazing service and great outdoor dining options, Little Goat Diner for a quick meal from the Goat Group or Lone Wolf for a more divey bar experience.

- Uber/Lyft is the best option for getting around.
- #157 bus runs Mon-Fri until 7pm to downtown and back; Stop located half block North at Taylor & Loomis next to Stax Cafe.
- Easy access to I-290 to go West, 90/94 to North/South
- Blue Line Train Stop 10 min walk North on Loomis - Racine stop

- Basic common sense: always be aware of your surroundings.
- 24-hr Permit parking stickers will be available for you to park your vehicle, please let us know how many vehicles you will have before arrival and we'll make sure you have enough for your stay. 
- Always lock your vehicle and don't leave any valuables in sight. 
- Don't leave any belongings outside unsupervised. 
- Chicago does not allow open carry of alcohol. 
- Keyless Entry: Please do not share your entrance code with anyone, and be discreet with announcing it out loud as you enter the unit. This code is your KEY to the apartment, so don't announce it to the world :)

access:
All guests are welcome to enjoy our home.  
We provide organic coffee/tea, toast, butter, jam in the morning,  bottled water, bath towels, bed linens and WiFi.  
Two flat screen TVs (with cable) are available to watch in kitchen area and Living Room.  
Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Full kitchen use not allowed.
A lovely, large outdoor deck is available in summer, fall to enjoy.
description:
Bedroom with comfortable Full/double bed, ideal for 1 person.  The Modern bathroom is squeaky clean.  I provide high quality linens and bath towels.  You will be happy you chose my house and feel like this is your home away from home.

This bedroom has a comfortable double/full size bed, spacious closet, and natural sunlight.  I provide high quality, fresh linens and plenty of bath towels.   This room can accommodate 1 guest.   
I have two other listings that you can look at to see what the best choice is for you.  
Listing #2 is https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/496809    Cozy, Spacious Room, Rogers Park  (King Bed) for 1 or 2 guests
Listing #3 is https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3634631  Perfect for One in Charming home  (Twin Bed)

All rental rooms share the modern shower on second floor.  Perfect for people visiting Loyola or Northwestern (Evanston) for a quick trip or for month long stays.   Easy going hostess provides a safe environment to re-charge for the next day's adventures.  
I have two kittens that behave reasonable well - they are adorable!  

Evanston is 3 miles north and the neighborhood Andersonville is less than 2 miles south.  Both areas have great dining and shopping.  
Downtown Chicago (The Loop) is approximately 8 miles south and public transportation can get you there with ease.  So many Things To Do in Chicago!

House is on a cute, quiet residential block.  You will be happy you chose my house because you will feel comfortable and safe.  This is your home away from home.

All guests are welcome to enjoy our home.  
We provide organic coffee/tea, toast, butter, jam in the morning,  bottled water, bath towels, bed linens and WiFi.  
Two flat screen TVs (with cable) are available to watch in kitchen area and Living Room.  
Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Full kitchen use not allowed.
A lovely, large outdoor deck is available in summer, fall to enjoy.

I live in the home with my partner.  We are quiet and will respect your privacy.  We both work daytime hours and are home in the evenings.   I will be there to greet you and assist with questions.  I will respect your privacy or love to visit - which ever you prefer.

We are conveniently located south of Evanston and north of the trendy neighborhood, Andersonville.  Both are easy to get to by public transportation, about two miles in either direction.  Both areas offer great restaurants and shops. Large movie theater in Evanston.

The Metra line is 3 blocks away.  Clark street bus #22 is a block away.    CTA Red Line is about a 15 minute walk, (Morse or Loyola closest stops).  Taxis are readily available.   Chicago also has Uber and Lyft car services.

In summer, there  are ceiling fans and AC unit in bedrooms, no central air.  

No additional pets allowed.  

I have three rooms available to rent, they all share the modern shower. 
Listing #1 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1900901  Bedroom in vintage home, Rogers Park (Double Bed) for one person.  

https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/496809    Cozy, Spacious Room, Rogers Park  (King Bed) for 1 or 2 guests

https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3634631  Perfect for One in Charming home  (Twin Bed)

additional_house_rules:
1. You're living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c'mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn't super awesome? 

2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We're super sorry if this is a bummer, but it's our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren't super surprised that we still mean it. 

3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren't allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal then give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.  

4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren't, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What's a little information between friends?  

5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you're responsible for their actions.  

6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilarious, there are occupancy rules Stay Alfred must follow for each of our buildings. Help us follow the rules and check your rental contract for occupancy requirements. If you exceed it, don't worry! Give us a call and we'll get you one of our bigger travel apartments. (It's like needing an Uber XL when you have a ton of people with you!) 

7. We're here to help! The onsite building staff doesn't work for Stay Alfred…strange, right? So, if you need something, send us a chat, or just give us a call. Our awesome Guest Services department will assist you 24/7.

8. Take only memories, leave only the keys, fobs, parking passes, etc. behind. They won't help you out when you get home and it's a total pain to have to replace them. 

9. We love gifts, but the greatest gift is making sure you don't leave anything behind. We suggest taking one last look around before you head home as fees are associated with sending you your belongings. Trust us, the extra five minutes is worth it! 

10. Ugh, here's the hard one. Should you break anything, really mess something up, or decide to stay longer than your agreed upon length of stay, we have the right to charge you additional fees, but we'd really rather not (and, we're sure you'd rather not too!)

11. Guests must be 21 years of age or older to make a Reservation, and the Guest who made the Reservation must be present for the duration of the stay. If the Guest who made the Reservation isn't present during the stay, occupants may be removed from the Rental Unit, and the Reservation may be canceled without refund.

description:
Classy vacation rental with top-notch amenities in Chicago's buzzy Gold Coast neighborhood.

Among the shops, restaurants, and attractions of Chicago's exciting Gold Coast district, these elegant travel apartments offer style and sophistication everywhere you look. From the tall ceilings to the gorgeous dark-wood cabinets in each unit to the expansive rooftop terrace and barbecue stations, there's no better place to relax and recharge on a whirlwind trip to Chi-Town. The building's common areas are anything but common - including a cozy game room and a state-of-the-art gym - and the fireplaces in the lobby offer an ideal place to cozy up in the middle of a chilly Chicago winter.

We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we're here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don't need us, we'll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.

Ready to experience the best of Chi-Town? The vibrant Gold Coast neighborhood is the perfect home base for any Windy City adventure: Whether you want to take your Chicago vacation to new heights at the 94th-floor 360 Chicago observation deck or down closer to sea level on the scenic coast of Lake Michigan, you're in the middle of it all. The neighborhood is home to Armani, Barney's,Chanel, Jimmy Choo and Tom Ford, and steps away from more great shopping, including the high-end 900 North Michigan Shops and the huge Water Tower Place. Cultural landmarks like the Museum of Contemporary Art and Loyola University's Museum of Art are also close at hand.

We furnish all of our properties to a uniform standard, but individual units may differ slightly from the pictures shown.

description:
Walking distance to tons of restaurants, nightlife, and shopping. 2 BEDROOMS , 2 Queen Beds, 2 Full Bathrooms. Newly renovated apartment home. Come home to premium catering style kitchens featuring state of the art stainless steel appliances. A three minute walk from Lake Michigan and two blocks from Michigan Avenue. Enjoy premium shopping, dining, and nightlife at your doorstep. You can enjoy all that the greater Chicago area has to offer.

24Hr Fitness Center with Yoga/Pilates Studio
Additional Storage Available
Business Center with WiFi Hotspots
Cable/Satellite TV
Convenient Zip Car Access
Easy Access to Brown/Purple Line
Employer Discount Through Exclusive LINC Program
Exclusive Monthly Resident Events
Free On-Site Bicycle Storage
Full Service Concierge
Granite Countertops
LEED Certified
Personalized EnV Concierge Phone App
Pets With Limitations
Private Assigned Garage Parking - $300 extra per month 
Private Wine Storage Lockers
Rooftop Swimming Pool
Valet Dry Cleaning and Package Acceptance
Wi-Fi Access in Lobby, Rooftop and Billiards Room
Apartment Amenities

Enjoy luxurious interior unit features including:

Above Range Microwave
All-Glass Balconies*
Bamboo Wood Floors
Built-in desks*
Built-in Wine Racks
Ceiling Fans
Central Air and Heat
Dishwasher
Expansive 9ft. Ceilings
Floor-to-Ceiling Windows Throughout
* In Select Apartments
Loft Like Exposed Ductwork*
Pendant and Track Lighting
Stainless Steel Whirlpool Applicances
Washer & Dryer in Each Apartment Home
Wheelchair Access
Whirlpool Refrigerator with Water & Ice Dispense

Managed by Corporate Housing Company Prestige Suites.

EnVision. Every element of your busy life catered to. EnVision the view out your stunning, seamless glass windows to the sparkling city skyline, overlooking the hottest restaurants, galleries, showrooms, and nightlife the city has to offer, all at your doorstep.

description:
A beautiful, clean, and safe space in Hyde Park! We are located walking distance from University of Chicago and nested within Hyde Park neighborhood and that means that this home is perfect for folks who like to be 15 mins south of Downtown but 1 mile from the lake. This private room has an additional sitting room   that allows in lots of daylight and perfect for Yoga/ Meditation.  The room offers a cozy queen sized bed.

Guest access
You will have access to the private room , back deck are and shared common spaces ( living room , dining room , bathroom)

The building does have quiet hours from 10 pm - 8 am

You will have access to the following:

> Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating.

> Private room includes: queen-sized bed, 1 night stands, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, steamer & ironing board, hair dryer.

> Kitchen includes: refrigerator, table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pots.

> Living room includes: Sofas, chairs, coffee tables.

> Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper

I will greet you when you arrive and show you around the apartment. If I am not available, you will receive self-check-in instructions prior to your arrival. Feel free to message me via Airbnb if you have any questions before or during your stay. You will receive a prompt response.

Frank Lloyd Wright's Robie House sparked a revolution in residential architecture whose influence still reverberates today. Designated by the American Institute of Architects as one of the 10 most significant structures of the 20th century, this American treasure is celebrated as one of Chicago's most important works of art. The home is regarded as a Prairie style masterpiece and a modern architectural icon. The Frank Lloyd Wright Trust offers tours Thursday - Monday, 10:30 am to 3 pm. “Robie House: A Modern Home” guided interior tour tickets: $20/adult, $17/students/seniors (65+)/military. “Robie House Past and Present” self-guided exterior walking tour tickets: $18 adult, $15 students/seniors(65+)/military. “Robie House In-depth” tour offered Saturdays and Sundays ($60 adult). Advance tickets are highly recommended. Information and tickets at www.flwright.org. Group tours available.

Hyde Park Art Center
Founded in 1939, the Hyde Park Art Center is at once a contemporary art exhibition space, learning lab, community resource, and social hub for artists and art-curious alike. 
( AMAZING ART WORK )

UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO QUADRANGLES
Less than a mile walk and perfect for photos

I live within 1 mile of  amazing restaurants (Cedars Mediterranean,Leona's Italian, Chicago's Famous Harold's Chicken) a great produce market, fully stocked liquor store, CVS drug store, coffee shops, and health food store. Also within a mile of a movie theater, LA fitness gym, Core Power Yoga, Giordano's Pizza (the famous stuffed Chicago kind). 

My favorite spots for dinner and ambiance are :
The Promontory 
The Sophy Hotel 
Jolly Pumpkin
Chant

Please note: There is an additional charge for more than 2 guest. $20 additional per guest, per night. This is to help maintain the unit, cover extra cleaning cost and to cover additional wear and tear.

access: You will have the entire apartment.
description:
My one-bedroom apartment in Edgewater is a short walk to the beach and Andersonville, and just a few blocks from the el and a handful of buses. A pull-out couch in the living room means that 4 people can stay comfortably.

My charming 1BR apartment is on the third floor of a courtyard building in Edgewater, a quiet, residential neighborhood just north of Andersonville.

[Please note there is no elevator in the building.]

The bedroom has a double bed. The living room has a pull-out sofa that sleeps 2 (comfortable, I promise) if you'd like to fit more people in.

The kitchen is well-equipped (I like to cook) and has a breakfast nook with seating for 4.

I have an Apple tv (hulu, netflix, hbogo) and broadcast tv.

In the summer I have a window a/c unit that cools the living room and bedroom.

Andersonville is about a 10-minute walk away, and is a great neighborhood for coffee, brunch, craft beer bars, dining, and shopping, especially if you like antique or repurposed furniture.

You will have the entire apartment.

I usually let the apartment when I'm out of town. You'll access the keys from a lockbox outside the building, and I'm available by phone or text during your stay.

I'm a 5-10 minute walk to the red line of the el train, which will get you downtown in about 30 minutes. I'm also within a few blocks of several buses. If you're coming into town for a specific reason, I can give you an idea of how you would get there from my place and how long it would take you.

There is free street parking in the neighborhood - availability depends on when you're looking for a spot. During the day it's pretty easy to find a spot on my block or less than a block away. The later it gets into the evening the longer you might have to look, but generally you'll be able to find a spot in less than 10 minutes.

description:
Beautiful luxury apartment  all to your self available. There is 2000 square feet of finished space. 4  bedrooms and 2 baths.  Great area Logan Square is  20 minutes to downtown Chicago and Ohare airport. Lots of restaurants and shopping a few minutes away. 4 full size beds,  1 futon couch, 4 air mattresses.  Free parking in the Garage and street parking. This home can comfortably sleep 16  people. TV fire-stick watch any live channel you want. Registration license R19000039136

Stay in a private beautiful apartment, The apartment has a full kitchen with all the amenities, 4 bedrooms with 4 full size beds 1 futon couch, 4 air mattresses for more guests, 2 full baths, living room, dining area and  a lovely backyard area. Parking in the garage. Basement finished living area. Washer and dryer is free. Free parking. You can park 1 in the garage and free on the street. You will just need a parking sticker that will be provided.

Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s an electronic lock, so there are no keys to keep up with!

It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

description:
2.5 bedrooms, 1 bathroom. 
Amazing kitchen for the avid chef.
Located in a wonderful family neighborhood.
This apartment is the second story in a 2-flat building with its own back porch.

2 Bedrooms each equipped with a queen size bed and closet/storage space.
3rd bedroom doubles as an office space. A plush futon converts the office to a bedroom with a queen sized bed. 

*printer in office is available for guest use*
1 Bathroom with shower/tub combination.
You have private use of the entire apartment.

Laundry room is in the basement and is shared with my parents unit who live on the first floor. You will have access to do laundry 1 day per week during your stay.

Window A/C units are available in each bedroom as well as the main corridor. Additionally, there are ceiling fans in each bedroom and the living room. 

This apartment truly is a home, you will notice that from the moment you enter.  The kitchen is fully equipment as we love to cook. The bedrooms are cozy and welcoming and the living room is full of live trees and plants, a deep comfortable couch and reading chair. This is our home that we live in when we are in Chicago, not just a rental apartment so we hope those that stay with us will treat it as such. My parents live below us, they are wonderful people so if you'd like to get to know them during your stay please do. 

Our dog will sometimes be staying with my parents while we are away. If you have a problem with the occasional dog barking then this apartment is not for you. Our good friends and next door neighbors have a dog sitting business as well so occasionally you will hear them also.

Plenty of street parking if you have a car.
Bus stop that will take you to either the blue/brown/red line is less than 1 block walk.
Red/Brown lines will take you to downtown and the Blue line can take you to the airport.

Roscoe village is a wonderful family oriented neighborhood. Roscoe street is full of cute shops, restaurants and cafes.

To get to downtown you can take the Belmont bus to the red/brown line, which can be picked up one block from the apartment. The other option is  a 15 min walk to the Paulina Brown line stop.

***Government ID verification required upon check-in***

description:
Enjoy the unique opportunity to stay in Chicago downtown, in a safe neighborhood, discovering the adventures of nightlife, entertainment, arts & shows that the city can offer you in a wonderful studio, totally furnished thinking in your comfort in first place. Here you will be close to the most visited attractions like Millennium Park,Skydeck,Loop, Mag Mile and Cloud Gate (10-20 minutes walk). The building is also close to the major subway lines and to the Chicago Station.

Enter through the door and you will find a bright and spacious studio with a living room that comes with a LCD TV that you will be able to watch Netflix while relaxing on the sofa, comfortable using the Wi-Fi with high-speed.

A complete kitchen (toaster, microwave, electric kettle, coffee maker, refrigerator, dishware set,set of pots and pans, glasses, stove and oven).

King size bed and extra bed, if requested, with bed linens, extra pillows and blankets – all the essentials for a pleasant night's sleep. A closet to accommodate your clothes and lamp shade next to the bed.

The space also comes with one full bathroom which includes a hairdryer and large towels. And of course, there are air conditioning and heating!

The space is all yours during your stay and we are very glad to receive you.
Free access to the gym, available at the building.

This is entirely up to a guest’s preference. We will send you a welcome message to walk you through check-in and the rest is up to you! We will be available when you need me through text, email or phone. We are more than happy to chat or assist with anything.

This is an extremely easy area to find restaurants, stores, bars, shoppings, FUN in general, everything a walking distance to the building. You will love this place.

access: Access all common areas in the unit. The unit has a smart TV to access your online streaming memberships such as Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc.
description:
Highly lit and spacious unit. Hardwood floors throughout, SS appliances, and granite CTs. Plenty of closet space. 2.5 bath. Washer/Dryer in unit. Enough to currently sleep 8 adults comfortably.  Location is 0.7 miles to the United Center and is also less than 3 miles from downtown. Public Trans and ride sharing services are easily accessible. Grocery and food establishments are near.

Space has a great open floor plan in the living areas. Bedrooms are spacious and are located away from each other with its own private bathrooms to allow privacy. Newly painted walls and minimal wall deco allow simple styling. Plenty of closet and drawers for your belongings.

Access all common areas in the unit. The unit has a smart TV to access your online streaming memberships such as Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc.

I'm excited to meet you personally, when possible, when u arrive but am always available via text or phone call.

Location is part of the revamp of the United Center neighborhood. There is active regentrification in the area as numerous restaurants and resources are located nearby. Young students and professionals reside in the area due to close proximity to the Illinois Medical District. Conveniently located near tourist spots while maintaining the feel of staying with the locals.

All forms of transportation is available.  FREE street parking.

My place is perfect if you’re attending concerts, NBA and  NHL games, or just touring the city.

Absolutely NO PARTIES or gatherings allowed in the unit. We will not tolerate heavy traffic of unauthorized visitors (unknown to host) in and out of the unit. Any unauthorized party will be stopped and local authorities will be called and will result of guests vacating the unit immediately. We have external security cameras for your safety and the building’s residents, and is monitored regularly. 

No smoking of any kind allowed in the unit.

Please also note that extra guest fees of $25/guest/night will apply beyond the reserved guests on the original reservation. For example, you reserved as 1 guest and 2 additional guests stayed with you, the fees will apply.

Currently, there is new construction next to the building so please be aware that there may be potential extra noise.

access:
Guests have access to the building's world class amenities including:
Seasonal outdoor pool
Spa with sauna, steam and whirlpool
Outdoor grilling stations
Rooftop fitness center
Rooftop sky lounge
Yoga room
description:
Upgrade your Chicago experience and stay in this modern Domio apartment. Walking distance from some of Chicago's best attractions, this stylish space was professionally designed to delight our guest at every corner. There are also restaurants and bars just about 10 min walk. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of history, architecture, and bites that Chicago has to offer.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts a premium living room, premium furniture, and bright finishes. In addition to a fully stocked kitchen with professional-grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked decor and artwork throughout the home. This Domio has the following bedroom layout:

Bedroom 1:
Queen Bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen Bed

Living Room:
Sofa Bed 
Air Mattress

Additionally, there is a washer/dryer in-unit.

Guests have access to the building's world class amenities including:
Seasonal outdoor pool
Spa with sauna, steam and whirlpool
Outdoor grilling stations
Rooftop fitness center
Rooftop sky lounge
Yoga room

access: Enjoy a large private rooftop and get plenty of selfies with the entire Chicago skyline!
description:
This Lincoln Park condo is in the heart of Lincoln Park, near downtown, the lake/beach, tons of shopping and restaurants, Steppenwolf theater, DePaul University, and much more. Gorgeous view of the skyline from private rooftop.

The condo is the well decorated second home of the owners and they love to share it when they are out of town. Make this your home away from home also.

Enjoy a large private rooftop and get plenty of selfies with the entire Chicago skyline!

The unit is a self check in and check out. Luis and JP (John) are readily available via text or call and have support system in place in case of any issues. We encourage you to read the house manual on the app.

The neighborhood has so much shopping.  
There are tons of home decor stores including Crate&Barrel (across the street), West Elm, Pottery Barn, William Sonoma, Ethan Allen, Design within Reach, and many more. 
The Apple store is on the corner and if you’re looking for some bargain shopping, Off 5th and Nordstrom Rack are a block away!

The North/Clybourn (Red Line) stop is 1/2 a block away and takes you anywhere you want to go.. Cubs games, Sox games,  Bears games, Downtown, the Loop, etc! 
You can also easily order a Lyft/ Uber. Interstate 90/94 is 3 mins away if you have a car with you. 
There is a  Dvvy (rental) bike station 1/2 block away too! Take it easily to the lake and enjoy a great bike ride along the gorgeous lakefront!
house_rules:
There is an Elevator Card (Fob) that will be provided for you to access the unit directly from the elevator. 
Please do not lose this fob... there is a $500 replacement cost.

access: Entire duplex Side A except garage. Enter through front door.
description:
Watch amateur fireworks over the snow covered lake on Xmas and New Year's. Listen to the geese as they land and roost. Enjoy warm fires on chilled evenings by the lake on rustic tree stumps. Great fishing, Top dining and  shopping, Use of bikes, paddle boat, kayaks, canoe, walking trail. Pets and small parties allowed for fee.
Located on a stocked 20 acre lake and next to private community beach.

This is a home split into two sides this listing is for Side A is 3/2 with 2 Large decks with two sliders and Front door entrance. (Side B is 1/1 with a separate outdoor side entrance and separate fenced deck which affords privacy. Outdoor areas are shared.) Separate listing.) There is the option to rent both sides. Please inquire. Garage not included. Side A is not accessible to side B and vice versa without both keys for safety and comfort of guests. We allow up to 4 cars right now. If you have more please let us know so we can make arrangements. Parking on street after 12am will get you ticketed.

Entire duplex Side A except garage. Enter through front door.

I’m available as well as a property manager who lives next door in Side B sometimes.  We respect privacy but Anything you have ?'s about just ask while staying.

Downtown Chicago 30 to 60 min Oakbrook 5 min Hinsdale 5 min Westmont 5 min Downers Grove 12 min Lombard 15 min Naperville 20 min Aurora 30 min O’Hare 20 min Midway 30 min. Quiet serene area in a high end neighborhood on the lake. Great for morning walks and evening chats by the lake.

Park in driveway on left. Can park on street but not overnight. Uber/Lyft  is available here. Metra Train or Forest Park Blue line to city 15 min drive.

Easy train ride to city from Westmont or Hinsdale station. Able to Uber to train station or park there for reasonable amount.  We offer events for up to 50 guests for a fee. Please inquire. Please note we are adding a futon to Master.  This will bring the bed count to 8 with sofa bed, couch, and 2 rollaways included.

access:
Private bedroom
Private bathroom
Patio w/ grill
Fully stocked kitchen
Living room with couch and TV
description:
Come enjoy a spacious, yet cozy retreat in Lakeview for 1-2 guests. Through a private entrance you’ll find a 1,400 sq ft lower level with a private bedroom/bathroom, shared living space & patio.

Steps away from Wrigley Field, the lake and the Wrigleyville and Boystown neighborhoods. Two blocks from public transit for easy access to much of what Chicago has to offer. Note: we have a non-shedding Goldendoodle (see more below).

This is a private room in our home for 1-2 guests. We live upstairs with our Goldendoodle. 

This space is perfect for solo travelers, friends or a couple coming to the Lakeview neighborhood. Whether you are catching a game or concert at Wrigley, exploring Lakeview, Wrigleyville, Lincoln Park, Boystown, or just in town for some good ole' fashioned fun, we look forward to hosting you.  

Our home is a duplex down. We live upstairs and your private entrance, bedroom, bathroom and the shared living space are on the lower level. Like many other duplex downs, ours has something called a light well to allow more natural light into the lower level. Because of this, we’ll definitely be able to hear each other in the shared spaces. We are very conscious of being quiet in the morning and at night as to not disturb you. We ask that you are respectful when it comes to noise and do not bring other people into the unit without first letting us know.

Note: As mentioned above, we have a teddy-bear looking Goldendoodle named Ruxbin. He's friendly, well-trained and respectful of your things. He goes to daycare some days of the week and others he is at home. We are happy to keep him upstairs with us. If you have any questions about him, please let us know. 

A few more things you can expect during your stay --

* On the bar you will find your own Keurig coffee machine, tea and some breakfast snacks.

* In the family room there is a smart TV with Xfinity cable and in the bedroom there is a TV with a Roku (already logged into Netflix and Amazon Prime). 

* You are welcome to keep food in the fridge downstairs and/or freezer upstairs, and use our kitchen to whip up something to eat.

* From Midway or O'Hare public transportation will have you at our condo in about an hour. Happy to help you navigate CTA.

Private bedroom
Private bathroom
Patio w/ grill
Fully stocked kitchen
Living room with couch and TV

We live upstairs in the apartment. One of us is usually working from home and is able to help if you need anything during your stay. And of course we are always available by phone or email if you need anything during your stay. If we are not home to let you in when you arrive, we will provide you with keys in a lockbox.

This condo sits on a quiet, tree-lined street in Lakeview close to all Lakeview, Wrigleyville, Boystown and the lakefront have to offer. Walk to dozens of restaurants, bars, shops and music venues (Metro and The Vic). It's close to multiple forms of public transportation and grocery stores. We'll provide you with a list of our favorite spots.

Two blocks to the CTA Red Line which provides easy access to Lakeview, Lincoln Park, Old Town, Gold Coast, River North and Downtown. The lakefront is about a 10 minute walk. If you have a car, we have daily parking permits for neighborhood street parking that you can use. 

If you are arriving at Midway or O'hare you can take public transportation and be to our house in about an hour.

If you are arriving at Midway or O'hare you can take public transportation and be to our house in about an hour.

access: Access to work room and laundry is through a shared area, but I will try not to use when the suite is occupied.  Feel free to hang out in the backyard.  There are some lounges, table, and grill. I just ask that there is no smoking anywhere on the property (including outside).
description:
Located on a quiet tree lined street, the bungalow's garden level design was influenced by the rumpus rooms of the 1950's.  

A private side entry, a few steps down from the rear courtyard, leads into your tropical get away.  Heywood Wakefield furniture and thatch palm leaf wall covering enhance the Tiki vibe of the sitting room. An exercise area, private bedroom and bath are all accessed from this main space.  While the suite is at garden level, it is always bright and airy.

The main sitting room doubles as the Owner's media room when the suite is not occupied.  DVD's or TV can be projected on a pull down screen (please keep the volume down).  An exercise room has a tread mill, bow flex, weight bench with some light dumbbells.  (Flat screen TV).   The bedroom has a queen platform bed from CB2 and a desk area (if you find the need to do any work).  While there is no cable in the house, the roof top attena still picks up about 40 channels.  Netflix and Amazon built into DVD player.  Please note there is no kitchen.  There is a small refrigerator, microwave and Tassimo coffee maker (coffee provided).

Access to work room and laundry is through a shared area, but I will try not to use when the suite is occupied.  Feel free to hang out in the backyard.  There are some lounges, table, and grill. I just ask that there is no smoking anywhere on the property (including outside).

Entry is keyless with punch code. Hopefully everything else is self explanatory.  While I live upstairs, I hope that privacy is a two way street.  Feel free to say hi if you see me in the yard.  I am accessible by phone/text if anything comes up.

Portage Park/Six Corners is a pedestrian orientated neighborhood.  You will be in walking distant to bars/restaurants (Community, Fishman's, Hops & Barley, Old Irving Brewery, Eric Cider/Brewery), entertainment (Filament Theater, Portage Theater, Copernicus Center) shopping (Jewel Grocery, Binny's Liquors, Marshall's) and chains (Dunkin Donuts, , McDonald's, Burger King).  Good central location for visits east to Wrigley Field, north to Northwestern Football weekends, West to Oak Park/ Frank Lloyd Wright tours, South to Loop/Downtown.

.9 mile to Blue Line (service to/from O'hare, downtown)
.7 mile to Metra Mayfair Stop, Grayland Line (service to downtown and suburbs)
Irving Park Bus  (5.5 miles to Wrigley Field, 6 miles to Lake Michigan
Plenty of street parking
Easy access to Kennedy and Edens.

You are a guest in my home and I would hope you would treat it the same way you would if someone was staying at your home.  This is not a hotel, so please don't treat it like it is.

access: You have access to everything the property entails
description:
Hello there! My name is Max. I’m 27 years old. I live with my pup Sunny. (He a 3 pound puppy currently) I have an extra room for travelers or somone looking to stay for longer. Either is fine with me. Great place. Walking distance to tons of bars and restaurants. Walking distance to the blue line which will get you to the heart of downtown in 10 min. Very safe area. Cozy apartment.  I have a 2 car garage if you need to park your car inside. If not there’s tons of street parking.

You have access to a full kitchen as-well as washer and dryer. I would recommend you bring your own towels. If not I can supply.

You have access to everything the property entails

I’ll be there. I’m not exactly a homebody so I’ll be in and out.

There’s pretty much everything you’d want near by. Personally I’m addicted to wicker park so I rarely venture out of it. You’ll find basically everything

I do have bikes if you would like to roam around

additional_house_rules:
*CHECK IN TIME 3 pm 
*CHECK OUT TIME 11 am 

I provide a bed, clean linens, and one fresh towel per guest. I do have water available for guests, but do not provide food or meals. The fridge is free to stock with food and beverages of your choice!

Shoes must be removed and left by at front door before walking through the apartment.

Please leave bathroom doors open when not in use.

When using the shower do not remove hair catcher. When you are done with the shower please remove your hair from the hair catcher and flush it down the toilet. Please put the hair catcher back on the drain when finished.

Please turn off all lights throughout the apartment before going to sleep for the night.

No eating or drinking anything but water in the bedroom. spills and/or broken glasses will incur a fee if needed.

I keep the guest bedroom door closed at all times so as to eliminate cat hair gathering in the bedroom. However this is a household with a pet, and even though I clean my home and bedrooms furiously, there are always going to a few hairs floating about. 

No heavy drinking within the apartment walls. No drugs and/or smoking allowed.

Fridge is free to stock with what you please. 

I expect guests to respect the air bnb space and clean up after themselves as if it were there own home.

description:
Enjoy a quiet and peaceful home located in the epicenter of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods - Logan Square. 

Logan Square is a "locals" neighborhood, and about a 15-20 minute ride from the heart of downtown Chicago, where many of the tourist-y sites are located. 

This air bnb is walking distance to a plethora of local neighborhood restaurants, bars and concert venues in addition to major public transportation stops.

The apartment is a large and sunny 2 bedroom apartment with 1 full bath and one half bath.

Tall exposed brick walls and wooden floors give this apartment the quintessential Chicago -feel. 

The bedroom includes one comfortable queen bed, fresh linens and towels, and charging ports for iPhone and android devices.

A few things to note;

I do not have a TV anywhere in the air bnb. If you're looking to watch TV I would suggest booking an air bnb with one.

Also I do not have any Mr. Coffee-type coffee makers : ) I do have a french press and italian stove top coffee maker though that can guests can use free-ly.

1 private bedroom
1 full bath with shower, sink and toilet.
1 half bath/powder room with sink and toilet.
Please feel free to use fridge to store any food 
Living Room
Roof top patio with BBQ

I will be living in the space as I normally do so any interaction will just flow naturally. 

I work weekends, so if you are coming in in the evenings please be mindful of the fact that I need my rest to prepare for work by making minimal noise as you enter the apartment. 

While you are here I am very happy to answer any questions about the area, where to go and/or getting around.

"Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and streetscapes dotted with beautifully-restored mansions, handsome greystone homes and majestic churches."

Within a block of multiple bus stops and a 5 minute walk to the CTA blue line Western and California/Milwaukee stop. 

5 minute walk to Chicago DIVY bike rental station.

10-20 minutes on CTA to downtown Chicago.

Free street parking is plentiful on the street the air bnb is located and all around : D

Please remember;

Check in time is at 3 pm 
Check out time is at 11 am

The closest CTA stop to my house on the Western stop on the Blue Line and after that the California/Milwaukee stop on the Blue line as well.

Bags can be left inside the apartment but rooms must be cleared out before 11 am so I can get it ready for he next guest before I go to work for the next day.

Please plan your arrival and departure times accordingly as I need time to get the space clean and ready in between guests.

My space is definitely a reflection of my funky mind that I think guests will enjoy very much.
