*CHECK IN TIME 3 pm 
*CHECK OUT TIME 11 am 

I provide a bed, clean linens, and one fresh towel per guest. I do have water available for guests, but do not provide food or meals. The fridge is free to stock with food and beverages of your choice!

Shoes must be removed and left by at front door before walking through the apartment.

Please leave bathroom doors open when not in use.

When using the shower do not remove hair catcher. When you are done with the shower please remove your hair from the hair catcher and flush it down the toilet. Please put the hair catcher back on the drain when finished.

Please turn off all lights throughout the apartment before going to sleep for the night.

No eating or drinking anything but water in the bedroom. spills and/or broken glasses will incur a fee if needed.

I keep the guest bedroom door closed at all times so as to eliminate cat hair gathering in the bedroom. However this is a household with a pet, and even though I clean my home and bedrooms furiously, there are always going to a few hairs floating about. 

No heavy drinking within the apartment walls. No drugs and/or smoking allowed.

Fridge is free to stock with what you please. 

I expect guests to respect the air bnb space and clean up after themselves as if it were there own home.
interaction:
I will be living in the space as I normally do so any interaction will just flow naturally. 

I work weekends, so if you are coming in in the evenings please be mindful of the fact that I need my rest to prepare for work by making minimal noise as you enter the apartment. 

While you are here I am very happy to answer any questions about the area, where to go and/or getting around.
neighborhood_overview:
"Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and streetscapes dotted with beautifully-restored mansions, handsome greystone homes and majestic churches."
notes:
Please remember;

Check in time is at 3 pm 
Check out time is at 11 am

The closest CTA stop to my house on the Western stop on the Blue Line and after that the California/Milwaukee stop on the Blue line as well.

Bags can be left inside the apartment but rooms must be cleared out before 11 am so I can get it ready for he next guest before I go to work for the next day.

Please plan your arrival and departure times accordingly as I need time to get the space clean and ready in between guests.

My space is definitely a reflection of my funky mind that I think guests will enjoy very much.
space:
The apartment is a large and sunny 2 bedroom apartment with 1 full bath and one half bath.

Tall exposed brick walls and wooden floors give this apartment the quintessential Chicago -feel. 

The bedroom includes one comfortable queen bed, fresh linens and towels, and charging ports for iPhone and android devices.

A few things to note;

I do not have a TV anywhere in the air bnb. If you're looking to watch TV I would suggest booking an air bnb with one.

Also I do not have any Mr. Coffee-type coffee makers : ) I do have a french press and italian stove top coffee maker though that can guests can use free-ly.
summary:
Enjoy a quiet and peaceful home located in the epicenter of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods - Logan Square. 

Logan Square is a "locals" neighborhood, and about a 15-20 minute ride from the heart of downtown Chicago, where many of the tourist-y sites are located. 

This air bnb is walking distance to a plethora of local neighborhood restaurants, bars and concert venues in addition to major public transportation stops.
transit:
Within a block of multiple bus stops and a 5 minute walk to the CTA blue line Western and California/Milwaukee stop. 

5 minute walk to Chicago DIVY bike rental station.

10-20 minutes on CTA to downtown Chicago.

Free street parking is plentiful on the street the air bnb is located and all around : D

access: Keyless entry for guests to enter and exit home.   It will be given 24 hours prior to check in.
description:
This renovated Redstone home is titled The Carter II which means twice the beauty for eminent experiences catered to families, friends or for business travel.    It is minutes away from the McCormick Place, 31st St Harbor/Lakefront, Wintrust Arena, Guaranteed Rate Field and Soldier Field.  Short ride to Hyde Park for diverse dining and entertainment.

It boasts 3 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, designer's eat-in kitchen, family room,  2 fireplaces, custom lighting, large deck area, and outdoor space. The house is on two levels with 10’ ceilings. The main level features two fireplaces, dining area, designer’s eat-in kitchen that overlooks private deck and outdoor space. 
 
The second level features 3 bedrooms, a small sitting/reading area, laundry, and two full bathrooms.  Master suite has a king size bed, custom closets, and a soaking tub.   The second bedroom features a full-size bottom bunk bed and the third bedroom has a queen-size bed and an office nook.

Keyless entry for guests to enter and exit home.   It will be given 24 hours prior to check in.

I am available via phone or text as needed.

Carter II is situated in the beautiful Kenwood area, one of Chicago's most affluent neighborhoods in Bronzeville.

From Muddy Waters to Muhammad Ali and longtime White Sox owner Bill Veeck, some of Chicago's best have called Kenwood home. This remarkable neighborhood on the city's South Side was once a refuge for Chicago's elite who, to escape the clamor of downtown Chicago, built enormous homes on the Lake Michigan shoreline. Today, Kenwood gracefully echoes its lavish beginnings with historic streets, official Landmarks and an ever-growing commercial district.

For the architecture buff, Kenwood vaunts an impressive collection of Art Deco high-rises from the early twentieth century. Walking through the neighborhood's Indian Village district, visitors are greeted by the Powhatan Apartments and the Chicago Beach Hotel (now Regents Park), which are both recognized by the National Register of Historic Places.

Artistically inclined visitors will be amazed by the Hyde Park Art Center, a community center that offers major exhibitions and a lively calendar of must-see events.  If taking in the celebrated works of local artists gives you an appetite, the nearby Norman's Bistro gives you a  jazzy vibe and delicious food.  (don't go hungry because the service is slow)

A walkable community that is near public (bus and rail) transportation, local eateries, galleries, and shops.  Plenty of free street parking.

House is on a tree-lined street with several greystones and a major high school.    There is free street parking.   However, during the week you can only park on one side of the street until school is out.

description:
Quiet, centrally located private room for 3 people with FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 3 pm and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)
The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.

> 1 Queen-sized bed with GREEN TEA & ALOE VERA memory foam mattress + 1 air mattress for 3rd person

> GREAT location!

> LATER check-out! 1 pm!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room :)

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

Please read your check-in instructions carefully
Please no overstaying past your checkout time
neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
space:
Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)
The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.

> 1 Queen-sized bed with GREEN TEA & ALOE VERA memory foam mattress + 1 air mattress for 3rd person

> GREAT location!

> LATER check-out! 1 pm!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room :)
summary:
Quiet, centrally located private room for 3 people with FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 3 pm and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
transit:
"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

access: The entire apartment (roughly 1600 sq ft) will be available for exclusive use during your stay.
description:
Coming to Chicago for a conference, holiday, or to visit the prestigious University of Chicago?  Make your stay hassle-free in a beautiful, airy apartment featuring two large bedrooms, two spacious bathrooms, a generous living room, a fully-fitted laundry and generously equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Perfect for couples, especially convenient for families with children. Perfect for academic visits, conferences, and for those wishing to experience the renowned UofChicago vibe.

Beautifully remodeled apartment featuring exposed brick, a luxurious jacuzzi master bath and brand new kitchen appliances.  Short walk to a wide array of restaurants and shops or to the University of Chicago.

The entire apartment (roughly 1600 sq ft) will be available for exclusive use during your stay.

I will be available via text or phone call at all times.

Let your taste buds indulge in a wide-array of restaurants serving world cuisine, savour some of the best ice-cream in Chicago, grab a few groceries at Whole Foods or a local produce store, walk to the University of Chicago, go bowling and unwind with a choice book or a great movie, all without leaving Hyde Park or needing a car!

Turn the corner for bus lines taking you to the University of Chicago, Navy Pier, Chicago's famous museums and many other great locations. Or walk a few minutes to the Metra Electric train line and be at McCormick Place or the Magnificent Mile within twenty minutes. Or simply stroll down to Lakeshore Drive to watch an exquisite sunset over Lake Michigan.

access: You’ll have the whole apartment to yourself
description:
Welcome to chicago! We hope you’ll enjoy your stay here with us in your own private oasis in the city. We are walking distance to McCormick place and if you’re lucky, you can try some of Maci’s baked goods!

Our 2nd floor unit is your perfect escape but still in the lovely city of chicago. Very comfortable queen size bed, full size bed & the third room has two twin size beds. Can sleep 6 comfortably.

You’ll have the whole apartment to yourself

I'm quite busy owning a travel agency and managing real estate, will not be able to show guests around but I can offer advice on where to go and what to see!

Located in the heart of Chinatown & walking distance to the red line, couple of buses and McCormick center. Simple place to stay but Maci’s baked goods will make you feel right at home.

5-8 minute walk to Chinatown red line stop,  our place is less than 2 miles from McCormick center (about a 20 min walk, 12 min by bus, or a 4 min cab ride). If you have any other questions, please let me know.

No pets and no smoking allowed indoors.

access:
-Free house WI-FI
-Full kitchen
-In houseWasher dryer
-Blender, microwave,
-Huge patio/roof backporch
-Huge common space area/gallery

Two restrooms, one shower, and a kitchen. The Damen Blue Line is less than a block away, as are bus stops and numerous last minute lifesavers (24hr Kinkos and Walgreens, Stan's donuts, plenty of restaurants, clothing stores, Banks, bars, grocery stores...).
description:
This is a large private room  located within a working arts collective in the heart of Wicker Park.
The Damen Blue Line is less than a block away, as are bus stops and numerous last minute lifesavers like 24hr  Walgreens and Kinkos, Stan's donuts, plenty of restaurants, clothing stores, Banks, bars, grocery stores...).
In your room, amongst other things you'll have:
+Queen size bed
+Large sofa and center table
+Work station/ desk and chair

Greetings friends, fellow artists and travelers!

You will also have access to our 1,325 sq.ft. (123 sq.m) gallery/exhibition space and have a huge roof patio.

-Great central location in the city of chicago
-15 minutes train ride to the loop/downtown
-24 hour public transportation at less than half a block (Blue line Damen train stop)
-12ft tall ceilings, huge loft, red floors, art on walls
-Respectful atmosphere

Please write back and tell us a little bit about yourself.

Thank you for your interest!

-Free house WI-FI
-Full kitchen
-In houseWasher dryer
-Blender, microwave,
-Huge patio/roof backporch
-Huge common space area/gallery

Two restrooms, one shower, and a kitchen. The Damen Blue Line is less than a block away, as are bus stops and numerous last minute lifesavers (24hr Kinkos and Walgreens, Stan's donuts, plenty of restaurants, clothing stores, Banks, bars, grocery stores...).

We're a friendly bunch of dedicated artists looking for openminded individuals to share our space with. We thrive off our work & inspiration from one another.

Wicker Park is a major hub for art and entertainment. The streets are bustling with a diverse community, day and night. The weekends are bumping. You shouldn't be bored.

We're right next to a 24 hour subway train, the CTA blue line Damen stop takes you home. Plus, we live at a 3 street intersection, that's North, Damen & Milwaukee. They've all got buses moving in both directions :)

In your room, amongst other things you'll have:
+Queen size bed
+Large sofa and center table
+Work station/ desk and chair
transit: We're right next to a 24 hour subway train, the CTA blue line Damen stop takes you home. Plus, we live at a 3 street intersection, that's North, Damen & Milwaukee. They've all got buses moving in both directions :)

access: Relax on the patio and enjoy potted plants, a garden and a koi/goldfish pond.  A charcoal grill is available upon request.
description:
Hello Travelers!  Enjoy a stay at Carol’s Guesthouse located in a nice middle class Chatham neighborhood on Chicago’s Southside.  Two spacious air conditioned apartments can be rented individually or together.  Each floor has a living room, dining room, bathroom, two bedrooms and a kitchen.

Nearby restaurants are within walking distance:  Just Jerk Cafe, Pepe’s Mexican Restaurant, Sharks Chicken & Fish to name a few.  Italian Fiesta Pizza can be picked up or delivered.

Public transportation is minutes away.  Head north to Cellular Field (home of the White Sox), Chinatown, McCormick Place, or our fabulous downtown area!  Stay close and visit DuSable Museum of African History.

Feeling lucky?  Visit the Horseshoe Casino located in nearby Hammond, Indiana just 20 minutes away by car.

Relax on the patio and enjoy potted plants, a garden and a koi/goldfish pond.  A charcoal grill is available upon request.

If you have questions feel free to call me on my cell phone.  Looking forward to hosting you!

Quiet Middle Class Neighborhood

Free street parking available!

Reservations are extended to vacation and business travelers who desire a quiet, clean, and comfortable place to stay.  Overnight visitors and excessive in and out traffic of guests’ visitors is prohibited.  Guests must be respectful of other guests in the building and neighbors in the area by keeping the noise level down.  Reservations for parties and events cannot be made.

access: I welcome you to enjoy a very peaceful, relaxing, and unique living experience in the heart of Chicago's gem neighborhood of Bucktown and Wicker Park -- the neighborhood that Wall Street Journal calls as one of the most exciting in the country!  Your biggest conundrum will be deciding which of the many activities and venues to explore during your stay.  Whatever you decide, the private back porches and  backyard newly landscaped patio will make for a perfect start of the day with breakfast and coffee, or roam in the butterfly garden in the backyard, or relish the end of the day with cocktails while enjoying the sunset over the Chicago skyline, or continue well into the night with the portable firepit and nothing but the stars in the sky!
description:
NEWLY REMODELED (Nov '19), beautiful cozy 2-bedroom flat, set in the heart of Bucktown/Wicker Park - one of hottest & hippest neighborhoods - and STEPS from acclaimed 606 Trail, the trendiest bars, lounges, cafes, restaurants, ("6 Corners"). This flat has quartz countertops, grey hardwood floors w/ huge back porch, upgraded bathroom & LED lighting, new laundry appliances. Relish the space, tranquility, furnishings in a charming neighborhood! Pets okay w/small fee. Host boasts 675 5-star reviews!

Guests will enjoy total privacy in the entire 2 bedroom / 1 bathroom with oversized deck and front porch entrance - including beautiful landscaped garden that is surrounded by a brand new 6 foot privacy fence.  In November 2019, apartment went through a complete remodeling of fresh new paint, upgraded bathroom with wood-look tile, upgraded vanity and lighting, expanded guest bedroom, LED lighting throughout apartment, and new quartz countertops and kitchen sink & faucet.

Pets OK with fee per Building Management. 

Enjoy a tranquil neighborhood (Bucktown) that is proximate to downtown (2 miles), Lincoln Park (2 miles), and just off the Blue line from the airport for easy to/from transportation.  Park your car or rental car on street with permits for a small fee (1 permit required per 24 hours).  Or rent a parking space in the garage.

Other Parking options: Non-permit parking is also available  along Bloomingdale Ave, Hermitage, Wood, Honore, Wolcott, Marshfield or Paulina (north side past 1840 N Paulina St.). ***We provide COMPLIMENTARY street parking permits from December - April***. Garage parking available for small fee in the back of the building.

I welcome you to enjoy a very peaceful, relaxing, and unique living experience in the heart of Chicago's gem neighborhood of Bucktown and Wicker Park -- the neighborhood that Wall Street Journal calls as one of the most exciting in the country!  Your biggest conundrum will be deciding which of the many activities and venues to explore during your stay.  Whatever you decide, the private back porches and  backyard newly landscaped patio will make for a perfect start of the day with breakfast and coffee, or roam in the butterfly garden in the backyard, or relish the end of the day with cocktails while enjoying the sunset over the Chicago skyline, or continue well into the night with the portable firepit and nothing but the stars in the sky!

As guests you will enjoy total privacy and the entire apartment is for your use only.  Host is available 24x7 by text / phone for any questions, recommendations, special needs, etc.

We welcome you to enjoy a very peaceful, relaxing, and unique living experience in the heart of Chicago's gem neighborhood of Bucktown and Wicker Park -- the neighborhood that Wall Street Journal calls as one of the most exciting in the country!  Bucktown/Wicker Park just got ranked as Chicago's trendiest and highest rental demand neighborhood... and is known for its unique collection of stores and restaurants, as well as its exciting nightlife!

The apartment is only STEPS away from the famed 606 Bloomingdale trail that opened recently.
The 606 brings together arts, history, design, trails for bikers, runners, and walkers, event spaces, alternative transportation avenues, and green, open space for neighbors, Chicagoans, and the world.

Trees, single family homes, all families, and close to a hundred bars, restaurants, shops, boutiques, and cafes.

Multiple options to get to downtown and other neighborhoods:
a - The Blue Line (CTA) train takes you downtown and the Loop in minutes!  
b - The express Metra train leaves from only a block away (Clyborn station) and arrives downtown in less than 5 minutes!
c - Bus 73 runs right by the apartment taking you to Lincoln Park, Old Town, the Lakeshore/Beach, and Gold Coast in a matter of 15 minutes.
d - Rent a commuter bike for 24 hours with unlimited check in/out privileges at a Divvy bike station on Cortland less than a block away from the apartment
e - Use Uber / Lyft / Via to get to downtown for $4-6 during off-peak hours

Please check out our 670+ 5-star reviews on Airbnb across other listings in Chicago for a better idea of the quality, essence, and hospitality of our Airbnb listings.... rest assured you will be in good hands!   

Long-term stays of 2 months or longer include monthly cleaning service.  As such, for long-term stays (greater than 21 days), there is an additional cleaning fee prorated to the length of the stay to cover regular interval cleaning.  

Pets allowed (below 90 pounds) with small non-refundable fee.

***Complimentary queen deluxe airbed provided upon request for stays with more than 3 guests.***

Negotiated rates available for stays longer than 60 days.  

Please note all weekend stays (that include Fridays or Saturdays) during the peak months of May - October, less than 3 nights will incur a small surcharge of 20%.  Surcharges are assessed separately from Airbnb charges.

additional_house_rules:
No one under age 18 yo
- private message for special consideration prior to booking 

Clean after oneself 
- wash pots/pans/plates immediately after use (teamwork makes the dream work) 
- clean spills/wipe counters after use
- trash can located to left of oven in kitchen
- cleaning supplies under kitchen sink

Pets
- prior approval before booking
- max two
- book each pet as “guest” at guest rate

No parties
- pregame and go 
- come home to pass out 

No additional guest beyond booking #
- will accommodate late additions 
- $20/extra person/availability dependent 

Smoking/420
- allowed on outside patio
- no smoking cigarette inside the apartment

Quiet hours
- 12am to 6am 

Lastly
- Be an adult and remember, the person who booked the reservation is responsible for his/her party and any damages resulting from your stay. 

Ask questions if in doubt, now come on and let’s go see Chicago!

access:
Guest may access any common area in apartment, restricted from locked rooms

Plenty of free street parking  7 days/week, with good lighting on side street and front street (S. Western Ave) that will accommodate up to a full size dually truck

***Please note***
Signs posted for parking restriction on the main street (S. Western Ave) for cleaning  on TUESDAYS ONLY from 8am-5pm
description:
Modest, traditional Chicago style apartment built in 1902. Located at the western end of the Tri-Taylor neighborhood. It is walking distance to UIC, Rush, County, and Mount Sinai Medical centers- and situated between Taylor and Roosevelt. This makes it Easy to drive into the city (2 miles to Willis tower) or hop onto CTA bus (stops in front of the building). Also there are a number of bars and restaurants along both streets that are easily walkable to, w/the first bar across the street from here

The struggle is real.... 

This booking is for bed #2 and is exactly as seen in the photos. It is located in a shared living area and is  a functional 8” full size/Futon in the Bottom bunk. 

It fits up to 2 individual adults or one person who needs a larger space than the twin bed located on top. 

* Please message prior to booking For parties >2 people.   You may book up to an additional 3 persons (up to 5 total- availability dependent), split between the top bunk (bed #3 listing- It is an 8” memory foam twin that comfortable enough for someone 6 feet tall); with an additional 14” tall, full size air mattress that fits two people comfortably in the living room or dining room. 

***Provided*************

For bed #2 (8” full size- Bottom bunk) or bed #3 (8” memory foam twin- Top bunk) bookings. 

(Per bed/booking)
- Linens
- pillows

(Per person)
- 1 towel
- 2 wash clothes 
- face towel

Note: PLACE ALL LUGGAGE UNDER THE BUNK BED WHEN NOT IN USE. This is a shared area and too congested with luggage left out. 

******

Bathroom:
- Please use towels provided to you at check in
- Extra towels can be found in the bathroom if needed, limited, use sparingly
- Please place used towels in hamper provided in bathroom, after your last use.

******

Kitchen: Please wash all dishes used by your party
- Basic seasoning
- Olive oil 
- filtered water (please refill after every use)
- coffee 
- tea
- sugar 
-> place refrigerated items separate from other guest, by placing together on a self or in a drawer. 
 
I do not provide groceries, but YOU CAN use what ever bread, condiments, paper towels foil, or parchment paper I have as well. 

Please look up tourist stuff online, but feel free to ask questions about the apartment

Guest may access any common area in apartment, restricted from locked rooms

Plenty of free street parking  7 days/week, with good lighting on side street and front street (S. Western Ave) that will accommodate up to a full size dually truck

***Please note***
Signs posted for parking restriction on the main street (S. Western Ave) for cleaning  on TUESDAYS ONLY from 8am-5pm

I’m a medical professional and will be in and out. Any questions are replied to quickly via email or text

Nearby attractions 

North East: 
United center 1.2 mile 
The French market 3 miles
Magnificent Mile 5.3 miles 
Lincoln Park Zoo 5.9 miles (free)
Wrigley Field 6.8 miles

East:
Little Italy 1.9 miles 
Willis tower 2.7 miles
Buckingham Fountain 3.8 miles 
Museum Campus (soldier field/museum district/McCormick place) 4 miles
Millennium Park 4.2 miles

South:
Chinatown 3.8 miles
Guarantee Rate Field (white Sox stadium) 3.8 miles

West:
Garfield Conservatory 2.7 miles (free)

Nearby hospitals;
Northeast 
VA  0.6 miles
Stroger (county) 0.8 miles
Rush 1.0 miles 

East
UIC 0.8 miles

Southwest 
St Anthony  1.1 miles
Mount Sinai  0.7 miles 


Please use the internet for questions, this is not an all inclusive list. I just live here.

Ample/quick Uber, lyft, or taxi services

Divvi City bikes rentals 0.1 miles from apartment 

***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***
Public transportation 
***Download Ventra app; Use app for bus/train stop locator (uses your location) to find closest stop to you, pay fare, see time tables, and use real time bus/train tracking. 

CTA blue line nearest bus locations
- Roosevelt & Western, 0.1 mile South
  North/South  #49, #X49, #157
  East/West:  #12, #49, #X49, #157
 
- Western & Taylor, 0.1 mile North 
  North/East:  #49, #157
  South: #49
  
Rail Station 
- Blue line train station
  S Western Ave & 290, 0.5 mile North
- Pink line train station
  S Western Ave & Western, 0.9 mile South


***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***   ***
Parking in the city: multiple options
***Download APPs to AVOID getting towed
 - Park Chicago- mobile app parking meter
    varies $2/hr-$4/hr, time limits
    [meters are free from 10pm- 8am]
 - Spot hero- cheap spots downtown
    best value for parking >1hr and/or difficult
    to park venues/vehicles 
 - Spot Angels- when you question if that
    “Free” parking you found is “actually free”

Multiple eateries next door to complex including subway, KFC, Harold's Chicken (Chicago classic!) and more

This area is heavily patrolled by Chicago police department and by UIC campus police making it safer than most areas of Chicago. 

*Remember* Chicago has a reputation for a reason. Use common sense when traveling/walking/interacting with people no matter what part of Chicago you are in.
house_rules:
No one under age 18 yo
- private message for special consideration prior to booking 

Clean after oneself 
- wash pots/pans/plates immediately after use (teamwork makes the dream work) 
- clean spills/wipe counters after use
- trash can located to left of oven in kitchen
- cleaning supplies under kitchen sink

Pets
- prior approval before booking
- max two
- book each pet as “guest” at guest rate

No parties
- pregame and go 
- come home to pass out 

No additional guest beyond booking #
- will accommodate late additions 
- $20/extra person/availability dependent 

Smoking/420
- allowed on outside patio
- no smoking cigarette inside the apartment

Quiet hours
- 12am to 6am 

Lastly
- Be an adult and remember, the person who booked the reservation is responsible for his/her party and any damages resulting from your stay. 

Ask questions if in doubt, now come on and let’s go see Chicago!

- Photos are from a similar property. Our interior decorating team is currently working on the furnishing. The furniture and equipment will look almost identical, but some differences in layout must be expected.
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled

- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this charming Streeterville furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and bright living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI81)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Garden

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished rental is located in Streeterville, only a 5 minute walk from The Loop. One of the fastest-developing neighborhoods in Chicago, Streeterville extends out into Lake Michigan and attracts a blend of young professionals, students, and tourists. A plethora of amenities and activities exist for every lifestyle. From Navy Pier activities to luxury shopping on Michigan Avenue, it is a walkable community with easy access to entertainment.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

access: You will have access to the entire house, including the laundry room that is located in the lower level. The house has an enclosed back porch and an outdoor patio with a grill that can be used for outdoor cooking.
description:
Lots of natural light. Arranged to give ea. person some semi-privacy.  Two dressers, lamps & sml. computer tables; shared closet. Includes  breakfast. Same sex buddy room only. Fee is per person-per night.

This is a 7 bedroom, 3.5 bathrooms house in a quiet neighborhood. The space is well distributed with 2 kitchens, spacious dinning and living rooms, a small family room, and an enclosed patio.

You will have access to the entire house, including the laundry room that is located in the lower level. The house has an enclosed back porch and an outdoor patio with a grill that can be used for outdoor cooking.

We keep a family environment. We share some times at dinner time when everyone makes it around the same time in the evening.  The kitchen and dining room are the main gathering place.  We share conversations about our cultures and journeys around the world. On weekends, sometimes people gather in the living room to watch a movie. On special occasions, we go out together.

The neighborhood is safe, clean and quiet.  We have couple of museums closeby. We also have other amenities and entertainment places such as movie Close to all city entertainment via the Blue Line train and CTA bus system. 
My website also provides you with the link to the bus system tracker so you can be always informed about the bus schedule. The same is for the train system.

Directions to the house:
From the airport, take the Blue Line train. Get off at the Irving Park station. Take bus #53 going South and get off on George Street.  Walk one block West to the house.theaters, a Blues, Jazz, Comedy and Life Music venues.

Directions to the house:
From the airport, take the Blue Line train. Get off at the Irving Park station. Take bus #53 going South and get off on George Street.  Walk one block West to the house.

From home to downtown: 35-40 minutes
Option 1:
Walk 2 blocks to Diversey
Take bus #76 - 12 min to train
Get off in Logan Square station - Take Blue Line - 20-25 min to downtown

Option 2:
Walk 1 block to Pulaski
Take bus #53 to Irving Park 
Take Blue Line to downtown

I have high speed Xfinity- WIFI. Ask me for the code. I have my business license. Cleaning fees are charged per visit, or per month, depending on the length of your stay. Monthly cleaning fee for short-term guests is $75 and includes other toiletries such as toilet paper and and additional home goods, cleaning and kitchen supplies used by the long-term guests. Long-term cleaning and supplementary fee is $50 per month, in addition to the monthly rental fee. For your convenience this fee can be paid either all at once when doing the homestay booking, or it can be paid on a monthly basis to the host via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), or Chase Quickpay.
house_rules:
We keep a respectful and private environment for all guests. 
Given that all guests have different school, work and traveling schedules, I ask that everyone keep the noise down after 10:30pm during the week and by 12:pm during the weekend, unless we are having a gathering at the house.
Everyone should clean after themselves and keep their areas organized.

access: Guess have access to the main living floor and outside terrace along with kitchen and front sitting room and of course the downstairs bedroom.
description: Relax on cushioned outdoor seating on the shared patio of this luxurious Lake View house. This comfortable and centrally located home is filled with natural light and luxurious furnishings. Enjoy access to the shared kitchen and a private en suite.
interaction: We enjoy interacting with our guests as schedules permit. Often times we will sit together outside on the terrace and enjoy a glass of wine as the day comes to a close. We will be available by text for any needs you might have.
neighborhood_overview: Perfect for Cubs fans, the home is close to Wrigley Field, as well as Sidetrack, Starbucks, Roscoe's, Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams, and Ann Sather.
space: Our guests enjoy access to one of the downstairs bedrooms and shared access on the main floor and outside terrace. You’ll find yourself with lots of room to relax and unwind while enjoying the Chicago living seen.
summary: Relax on cushioned outdoor seating on the shared patio of this luxurious Lake View house. This comfortable and centrally located home is filled with natural light and luxurious furnishings. Enjoy access to the shared kitchen and a private en suite.
transit: It is super easy to get around in the city given we are only one city block from the Southport brown line train stop. Using this you can get downtown in a matter of minutes. We’re also only six blocks from Wrigley Field and lots of other attractions in our neighborhood.

description:
Private accommodations can be found tucked in a quiet prairie outside of Chicago. The Indian Lakes Hotel puts you lake front in a beautiful hospitality setting. Our historical architecture is complimentary by modern interior design in each room. The oversized guest rooms are great for all travelers.

Oversized guest rooms are furnished with modern décor and style. The rooms create a warm, inviting atmosphere with smooth tones. The standard king or queen rooms feature the respective-size beds. You’ll have lots of peaceful nights away from the big city.

Indian Lakes Hotel is located in Bloomingdale, IL, just outside of Chicago. There are several tasty restaurant options nearby. You can also visit Wriglet Field, Lynfred Winery, and the Brookfield Zoo. We are a short drive to O’Hare International Airport.

Each room includes:
Complimentary WiFi
Flat screen HDTV with DIRECTV
Coffee maker
Air conditioning
Safe deposit box

description:
This is a legally licensed Chicago vacation rental.  

Located on a peaceful street in a lively neighborhood with world-class culture at your fingertips. Our professionally designed interiors will accommodate couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups.

You can stay close to Chicago’s artsy Damen Avenue yet feel tucked away in this quiet, beautifully renovated 1890’s coach house. Walk through the lush urban garden and on the second floor of this vintage building you’ll find Bucktown House Suite No. 2. This 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment sleeps up to 5, but if your party is larger you may rent the downstairs unit as well to accommodate 5 more guests. Both floors are listed together here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/14631349

Suite No. 2 has a warm and eclectic vibe, with peachy yellow walls and thoughtfully chosen décor. The living room has space for everyone to gather for a movie or game night on the vintage-feel furniture. At the same time, the comforts of the kitchen and bathroom are thoroughly modern. A beautiful marble tiled bathroom and the custom designed eat-in kitchen make this apartment a comfortable space for you to call home. Here are more highlights from Suite No. 2:
More than 700 square feet of comfortable, plush living space with airy treetop views.

Gourmet kitchen with gas range, granite countertops, cherry wood cabinets, frost-free refrigerator, microwave, filtered water system, and gorgeous glass tiled backsplash.

Queen-sized bed with reading lamps in the master bedroom.

Two twin-sized beds with reading lamps in the guest bedroom.

Living room features a Carlyle Convertible Sofa Bed.

Luxe marble bathroom with (MALIN+GOETZ) toiletries.

Beautiful urban garden with outdoor seating and grill.

Flat screen TV with DIRECTV premium channels, DVD Player, iPod docking station and AT&T U-verse Internet Service.

Laundry facilities on-site with complimentary detergent.

Central air conditioning and heat with individual climate control.

Free street parking - no permit required.

Secured building with keyless self-locking doors that require a punch code to enter.

Bucktown is not just a peaceful residential enclave, it’s also full of incredible arts, world-class culture, Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, and activities that are sure to satisfy any on-trend traveler. The Bucktown House is also within walking distance of Holstein Park and The 606 Bloomingdale Trail, a walking/biking trail surrounded by installation art and creative urban landscaping.

Stroll down Damen Avenue for a shopping experience second only to Michigan Avenue, or for a diverse selection of international cuisine. In the evening you can take in a show at the Gallery Cabaret, the Trap Door Theater, or Gorilla Tango Theater - all within easy walking distance of home.

The surrounding neighborhood has no shortage of dining options, from single-barrel bourbon and pork belly tacos on the outside patio at Big Star to nine-course menus at Schwa, an upscale BYOB. Or if it's nightlife you're after, try Bangers & Lace for a hunting lodge vibe or work your way through the Chop Shop's cocktail program.

And if you tire of the local scene, just take the blue line and in 20 minutes you’ll be near Navy Pier. Bucktown is a locus of Chicago’s beauty, entertainment, and culture - book now to stay in the heart of it all.

space:
You can stay close to Chicago’s artsy Damen Avenue yet feel tucked away in this quiet, beautifully renovated 1890’s coach house. Walk through the lush urban garden and on the second floor of this vintage building you’ll find Bucktown House Suite No. 2. This 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment sleeps up to 5, but if your party is larger you may rent the downstairs unit as well to accommodate 5 more guests. Both floors are listed together here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/14631349

access: You will have private access to this spacious room, walk-in closet, and bathroom.
description:
Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite! We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space. We live in the main, separate part of the home and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city! 

We are located just two blocks from beautiful Humboldt Park and minutes from Division and Damen's hot bars and restaurants. Minutes from trains, interstate and downtown.

Privacy is key - My family and I live on the other side of the apartment but you'll have your own suite! This is an ideal space for a single or a couple looking to get away together. Kick back and relax or get some work done next to the large windows of this spacious suite.

The room comes with a double sink bathroom, full bath (with a jacuzzi feature), and a large walk-in closet! This master suite is at your own end of the apartment with its own entrance so you will have it all to yourself. However we live next door and walls might be thin so keep that in mind.

We are available for any questions about the space or the neighborhood and would love to meet you if you are around, so feel free to reach out.

We offer self check-in and check-out, but are available for questions if needed. Your privacy and comfort is our #1 priority.

You will have private access to this spacious room, walk-in closet, and bathroom.

Located on the Northeast side of beautiful Humboldt Park. Great local food and drink nearby and just minutes from Division and Damen's hot bars and restaurants. Minutes from trains, interstate, and downtown. Approx $10 Uber/Lyft ride to downtown (or just ride a Lyft scooter!)

East Humboldt park was voted by Chicago magazine one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. Lots of charming buildings, parks and restaurants.

2 minutes to Division #70 bus, 5 minutes to North #72 bus, 18 minute walk to Blue line, or you can easily take the California bus #52 to the Blue line stop to get to the loop or O'Hare! It's also a short affordable Lyft/Uber ride to downtown. 

If you need a parking space, please request one before checking in. The park space (for one vehicle) in the back of the unit. There is also free street parking all along Rockwell and side streets and its very easy to find a spot.

Humboldt Park also features lots of electric scooters, which you can ride cheaply with the right app!

description:
Make yourself at home in this cozy, inviting apartment! Freshly painted and furnished throughout. Smart TV included for all your viewing needs. Comfortably sleeps 6 guests. Short walk to blue line train, Walgreens, 711, dining, and grocery. Complimentary coffee provided to get your day started!

Conveniently located to a variety of walkable amenities! Walk to blue line train, Walgreens, 711, grocery and dining. Short drive to 90/94 expressway. Make it to downtown within 20 minutes!

Readily available and easy to get a hold of. Don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or requests to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Avondale is one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Chicago! Conveniently located near a variety of walkable amenities! Walk to blue line train, Walgreens, 711, grocery and dining. Short drive to 90/94 expressway. Make it to downtown within 20 minutes. Other trendy neighborhoods including Logan Square and Wicker Park a short drive away!

Free street parking available.  About 7 minute walk to Blue line train station.  Short drive to 90/94 expressway, nightlife in Logan Square and Wicker Park. Make it to downtown in 20 minutes.

additional_house_rules:
We do ask that you please do not wear any shoes inside the Studio and absolutely no smoking inside our home. Quiet hours are 11 PM – 6 AM. Please refrain from loud noises or music during that time. 

Guests with vehicles requiring stays longer than 5 nights must purchase village parking passes $5 for 20.

All guests must dispose of trash in bins outside the garage in alley before check-out. Trash is collected on Thursdays, and must be separated for recycling.

Please remove all used linens and place at foot of bed. Used towels should be placed in hamper in bathroom.

access: Private entrance, foyer, bedroom/living area and bathroom. Outdoor patio, deck and yard.
description:
Family friendly modern garden studio. Plenty of room to relax and enjoy work or play. Private access with microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Great for extended stays near the Oak Park Arts District. 10 minute walks to the CTA Blue or Green line with service to downtown Chicago, O'Hare and other attractions.

Charming 1900's greystone updated with 50's modern furniture and appliances. Come share in hand-feeding our hens and you may walk away with fresh laid eggs.

Private entrance, foyer, bedroom/living area and bathroom. Outdoor patio, deck and yard.

Tickets and ride to the following attractions available; Chicago Children's Museum (Navy Pier) $10 per person, Museum of Science and Industry +2 attractions $30 pp. Brookfield Zoo $12 pp.

Can also recommend Chicago sporting event tickets, Cubs, White Sox, Bulls, Fire, Sky, Bears and Blackhawks. Along with local bars, clubs and restaurants.

Airport pick up and drop off available for additional fee.

CTA Blue line is a 10 minute walk South. CTA Green line is a 10 minute walk North. Divvy (Bike sharing) station 1 block away.

Street parking available. Please download Passport Parking App, Zone 206. Guests requiring extend parking must purchase overnight village parking passes $5 for 20.
house_rules:
We do ask that you please do not wear any shoes inside the Studio and absolutely no smoking inside our home. Quiet hours are 11 PM – 6 AM. Please refrain from loud noises or music during that time. 

Guests with vehicles requiring stays longer than 5 nights must purchase village parking passes $5 for 20.

All guests must dispose of trash in bins outside the garage in alley before check-out. Trash is collected on Thursdays, and must be separated for recycling.

Please remove all used linens and place at foot of bed. Used towels should be placed in hamper in bathroom.

description:
・"The best place isn't the most luxury ones, is the place where the host share everything." 
Bright and cheerful Room Furnished with all necessities for a short trip Private Bath-tub, Smart 50 Inch TV, Wifi,Parking, Near Bus Stop/Train Station Walking to Restaurants, Supermarket, 5 minutes to: " Rosemont Theater, Donal E Stephen Center, Fashion Outlet Shopping Mall, (ORD) O'Hare Airport, Casino & Allstate Arena",

Conveniently Located, walking distance to Restaurants, Supermarket, and public transportation, Safe residential area and Family & friendly atmosphere.
Please Inform in Advance if you will need a Parking space.
My host account was created to welcome travelers for relatively short stays. We are offering you a shared space in a great location- you'd be staying in a private bedroom with a private Bath and Private Balcony and the rest of the space (kitchen, living area, etc) is openly shared. The Bedroom has its own door and can be private if you'd like it to be. 50Inch Smart TV, to Access you Netflix, Roku, Hulu, etc.

Personal Laundry, Shared Kitchen and Living and Dining room, Patio.
City Center (Downtown) reachable between 25/35 Minutes by Train or Approximately 15 Miles Drive. Fast & Easy Uber/ Lift Transportation

Normally we will give our guess their privacy but at the same time we will do everything possible to make them comfortable, show the city around and touring the areas of interest when possible.

Its a very safe and family oriented neighborhood, Walking distance from Restaurants, Supermarkets and just steps from public Transportation, 5 min max from Entertaining districts, Donal E Stephens, Movie theater,  Bars, Bowling, Casino and New Chicago Outlet mall.  25 minutes to city center by Metra.

Access to Trains and Public Transportation Uber and Lift are prompt and very conveninetaround.  Acceso a los trenes y transportaciones publicas como Uber y Lift son muy convenientes y rapidas en esta area.

This a Private Room is in a residential area while you will have you own privacy and convenience of having you own room, entrance to the Room its shared with other guest in the House, and Kitchen and Patio are shared with other Guest
We do however have some noise from the outside at times, that is something we can't control, Cars, Ambulances and whistling of the train at times its is a little bit loud, Keep in mind also that we are near the Airport and without predictable notice Planes flights over and could be some noise, for the most part you wont hear it (we go Months some times without and others a couple of days you hear it at times) but keep in mind that we are part of the city so Noise its normal.

access: We have a shared lounge, bathroom and table space available to guests. The upstairs is my personal apartment.
description:
A private basement available in Lincoln Park 2 flat, a nice neighborhood near downtown. The basement will accommodate two people very comfortably with 2 seperate beds, wireless internet, private bathroom with a BASIC/MINIMALIST set up.

The layout allows for a lot of privacy as your rooms and bathroom are located in the basement area of my home. I work from home and occupy the upstairs. I operate an Organic Catering Company called "Goose & Fox", as well as a recording studio. The building itself is over 100 years old and located in awesome part of town.

We have a shared lounge, bathroom and table space available to guests. The upstairs is my personal apartment.

I try to give my guests as much space as I think they want or need.

If I am around, I am accessible but not in your space, meaning I am working in my office with the door slightly cracked or doing something upstairs while you are downstairs in your bedroom or bathroom. I also operate a recording studio so sometimes I am upstairs recording stuff. I also have two friendly dogs who generally hang with me in the office. They sometimes bark when people arrive but are super friendly after a couple minutes. They do not have access to the basement.

On the other hand, if you need answers or just want to talk, I always enjoy this part of the host experience.

I try to let the guest set the pace when it comes to how much interaction we have.

The place is located in the heart of Historic Lincoln Park with easy access to the Armitage Brown Line stop and the "el".  We are in the best possible location if you need access to downtown we are literally a 5-10 minute train ride away.

Lincoln Park is home to DePaul University and boasts tree-lined lakefront paths for biking/jogging, a vibrant shopping district, beach, dozens of ethnically diverse restaurants, live music venues, movie theaters and more. north avenue beach, and the lakefront, are less than 10 minutes from our home.

Breakfast is offered at an additional charge with your stay but you must verify the time  you want prior to your arrival or the day before when you arrive. Breakfast can be served at any time and is cooked to order so you can sleep in if you need to, but you must arrange it with the host so we can make sure we have everything we need to give you a great breakfast. 


-full cooked to order breakfast (omelettes, frittattas, potatoes, french toast, pancakes, locally sourced bacon, biscuits & gravy, eggs benedict. special dietary needs are no problem! Your Host is a world class Chef so we can pretty much make anything and it will always be awesome!

I DO NOT PROVIDE PARKING. STOP ASKING ME ABOUT PARKING. WE ARE LOCATED IN A LARGE CITY. PARKING IS DIFFICULT. Public transit is a much better option.

Buses and trains are literally ride outside my front door and about a minute walk from the apartment (train ride downtown is then only a 10 minute ride)

Cabs: No more than a moments wait to flag a cab directly out front of my place day and night. This is a safe area where you can walk around at night as well.

Parking: We are about 5 minutes from downtown so Parking is limited, random and mostly based on luck like any populated urban area. research the neighborhood and plan ahead. I do not provide parking and due to the popularity of the area my recommendations will only go so far. Our location is great for public transit, which we recommend you use.

Here are some tips:

 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Or reserve your spot with Spot Hero:

Hostels provide budget-oriented, sociable accommodation where guests can rent a bed, usually a bunk bed, in a dormitory and share a bathroom, lounge and sometimes a kitchen.

There are several differences between hostels and hotels, including:
Hostels tend to be budget-oriented; rates are considerably lower.
For those who prefer an informal environment, hostels do not usually have the same level of formality as hotels.
For those who prefer to socialize with their fellow guests, hostels usually have more common areas and opportunities to socialize. The dormitory aspect of hostels also increases the social factor.
Hostels are generally self-catering.

PLEASE DO NOT
- Do anything illegal
- Smoke inside (Thank You)
- Invite guests over without prior written approval
-ask me about parking (do the research, (Hidden by Airbnb) directions)

Valid IDs will be required upon checking in.
I can be very flexible with move in and move out times as long as I can get the apartment cleaned for the next airbnb client

DISCLAIMER!
Now that I have hosted for over a year, I generally prefer more laid back guests who have experience with airbnb. Specifically, Millenials, Artistic types and younger folks going to concerts, work trips etc. This space is not exactly the four seasons but I do my best to make it comfy and affordable. If you are an older more discerning traveler who is going to not follow the rules, read my ad or at least send me some basic info on the why, when and where when you attempt to book it probably be best for you to stay at a hotel. I also tend to only book people who have experience with home sharing, as new guests tend to not follow the simple requests and like to write 5 paragraph essays on the stain they found on the bathtub.
interaction:
I try to give my guests as much space as I think they want or need.

If I am around, I am accessible but not in your space, meaning I am working in my office with the door slightly cracked or doing something upstairs while you are downstairs in your bedroom or bathroom. I also operate a recording studio so sometimes I am upstairs recording stuff. I also have two friendly dogs who generally hang with me in the office. They sometimes bark when people arrive but are super friendly after a couple minutes. They do not have access to the basement.

On the other hand, if you need answers or just want to talk, I always enjoy this part of the host experience.

I try to let the guest set the pace when it comes to how much interaction we have.
neighborhood_overview:
The place is located in the heart of Historic Lincoln Park with easy access to the Armitage Brown Line stop and the "el".  We are in the best possible location if you need access to downtown we are literally a 5-10 minute train ride away.

Lincoln Park is home to DePaul University and boasts tree-lined lakefront paths for biking/jogging, a vibrant shopping district, beach, dozens of ethnically diverse restaurants, live music venues, movie theaters and more. north avenue beach, and the lakefront, are less than 10 minutes from our home.

Breakfast is offered at an additional charge with your stay but you must verify the time  you want prior to your arrival or the day before when you arrive. Breakfast can be served at any time and is cooked to order so you can sleep in if you need to, but you must arrange it with the host so we can make sure we have everything we need to give you a great breakfast. 


-full cooked to order breakfast (omelettes, frittattas, potatoes, french toast, pancakes, locally sourced bacon, biscuits & gravy, eggs benedict. special dietary needs are no problem! Your Host is a world class Chef so we can pretty much make anything and it will always be awesome!
notes:
Hostels provide budget-oriented, sociable accommodation where guests can rent a bed, usually a bunk bed, in a dormitory and share a bathroom, lounge and sometimes a kitchen.

There are several differences between hostels and hotels, including:
Hostels tend to be budget-oriented; rates are considerably lower.
For those who prefer an informal environment, hostels do not usually have the same level of formality as hotels.
For those who prefer to socialize with their fellow guests, hostels usually have more common areas and opportunities to socialize. The dormitory aspect of hostels also increases the social factor.
Hostels are generally self-catering.

PLEASE DO NOT
- Do anything illegal
- Smoke inside (Thank You)
- Invite guests over without prior written approval
-ask me about parking (do the research, (Hidden by Airbnb) directions)

Valid IDs will be required upon checking in.
I can be very flexible with move in and move out times as long as I can get the apartment cleaned for the next airbnb client

DISCLAIMER!
Now that I have hosted for over a year, I generally prefer more laid back guests who have experience with airbnb. I also tend to only book people who have experience with home sharing, as new guests tend to not follow the simple requests and like to write 5 paragraph essays on the stain they found on the bathtub.
space: The layout allows for a lot of privacy as your rooms and bathroom are located in the basement area of my home. I work from home and occupy the upstairs. I operate an Organic Catering Company called "Goose & Fox", as well as a recording studio. The building itself is over 100 years old and located in awesome part of town.
summary: A private basement available in Lincoln Park 2 flat, a nice neighborhood near downtown. The basement will accommodate two people very comfortably with 2 seperate beds, wireless internet, private bathroom with a BASIC/MINIMALIST set up.
transit:
I DO NOT PROVIDE PARKING. STOP ASKING ME ABOUT PARKING. WE ARE LOCATED IN A LARGE CITY. PARKING IS DIFFICULT. Public transit is a much better option.

Buses and trains are literally ride outside my front door and about a minute walk from the apartment (train ride downtown is then only a 10 minute ride)

Cabs: No more than a moments wait to flag a cab directly out front of my place day and night. This is a safe area where you can walk around at night as well.

Parking: We are about 5 minutes from downtown so Parking is limited, random and mostly based on luck like any populated urban area. research the neighborhood and plan ahead. I do not provide parking and due to the popularity of the area my recommendations will only go so far. Our location is great for public transit, which we recommend you use.

Here are some tips:

 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

additional_house_rules:
TERMS OF SERVICE 

BY BOOKING, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE TO THE FOLLOWING:

- This a quiet residential neighborhood.  Any parties will be reported by neighbors and will result in immediate cancellation of the reservation with no refunds.  Please respect the house rules.
- Quiet hours after 9pm
-Security cameras are outside of the house and are monitored.  Monitoring includes for parties and extra guests not indicated in the reservation and paid for.
- Early check-ins/late check-outs are subject to additional charges
- Check out is 10AM sharp
- Baggage drop off permitted if prearranged
-Please accurately indicate the number of your guests on your booking.  Extra guests not indicated on the booking will result in the surplus guest charges
-Only guests who are permitted are the ones on the reservation.  NO VISITORS.
-The presence of unauthorized guests constitutes a violation of the rules and the booking may result in cancellation with no refunds.
-The presence of visitors constitutes a violation of the rules and will result in cancellation of booking with no refunds.
-Do not congregate on front stoop.  (It looks bad).  Use back yard for outdoor gatherings.
-Packages delivered are the guest’s responsibility.  If your package does not arrive by the time you check-out, please do not ask us to mail it to you or return to sender.  We will hold the package for 30 days for you to pick up at our offices.
-We cannot accept responsibility for receiving package deliveries on behalf of guests.
-Items left behind cannot be mailed back to you.  We will hold lost and found items for 30 days at our offices for you to pick up.
-We cannot accept package deliveries on behalf of guests.
-We provide 2 sets of towels for each registered guest.  There is a washing machine to freshen up towels for longer visits.
-You will be charged for damages, missing items or excessive clean up beyond 8 hours of cleaning/laundry you paid for with the cleaning fees.  If there are preexisting conditions, please bring to hosts attention as soon as you notice them.
-Please acknowledge we do not charge hotel prices and therefore cannot provide hotel level services.
-Please ensure you have read through the entire listing description, including neighborhood description.
-Upon booking, guest has agreed to terms of service, including house rules, and has acknowledged they have read the entire listing.

access: You will be able to access the entire home with the exception of any locked closets or bedrooms.
description:
This stately home built in 1893, renovated in 2003, is located on a beautiful, tree-lined street in the South Shore neighborhood of Chicago, 9.5 miles south of downtown. House boasts gorgeous wood floors, custom blinds, 2.5 car garage, 4 bedrooms, 1.5 baths, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer.  The backyard’s fresh landscaping is ready to be enjoyed.  BEDS-3 Kings, 1 Full, 1 folding single cot in LR.5 Roku TVs, 1 Gig Wifi.  Please read neighborhood description b4 booking.  It is important.

This is truly a comfortable and enjoyable home.  It is about a 20 minute drive from downtown Chicago and about 5 blocks west of the Lake.  

We think we have thought of just about everything to make your stay comfortable.  We have plenty of dishes in the kitchen for a group of 9.  3 of the 4 bedrooms are located on the second floor.  One of the bedrooms is located in the basement.  We have a full bathroom on the second floor and a 1/2 bath/powder room on the first floor.  Each bed has ✔bed bug protectors. We have super ✔fast Wifi (1 gig) with Orbi extenders so there should be no dead spots.

★This is a new listing so no reviews have been posted yet.  Please do check out my reviews on other properties under the host profile.★

♥HOSPITALITY PHILOSOPHY♥
We treat each guest as a potentially lifetime customer.  Once you stay with us, we want you to feel that you do not wish to stay at any other property (except one of our properties) on your next visits to Chicago.  In furtherance of that objective we are developing loyalty programs which give special incentives and attention to returning guests and their friends and family members.  While there can always be small mistakes and oversights at any property (no one is perfect 100% of the time), with us you know we will do everything in our power to make your stay fantastic. 

This lovely home is truly a vacation rental in the city.

Pack and play available upon request.

☹PLEASE BE AWARE THAT WE DO HAVE A STRICTLY ENFORCED NON-PARTY/NO UNAUTHORIZED VISITORS POLICY IN PLACE AND WE DO MONITOR OUR SECURITY CAMERAS VIGILANTLY SO WE KNOW IF A BOOKING IS IN VIOLATION OF THAT POLICY.  IF YOU BOOK TO HOLD A PARTY, WE WILL CANCEL, ISSUE NO REFUNDS AND CHARGE FOR EACH PERSON WHO ENTERED THE PROPERTY PLUS ANY ADDITIONAL CLEANING FEES TO GET RID OF ANY SMOKE SMELLS—SIMPLY NOT WORTH TRYING.  WHILE RARELY EXERCISED, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO ENTER THE PROPERTY.☹

☻Responsible conduct by hosts and guests alike will help ensure Chicago and suburbs do not follow the lead of Santa Monica, San Francisco, New York City and Oahu in banning airbnbs altogether in their districts.☻

For reservations longer than 7 days, we will need to do a weekly inspection of the property.

You will be able to access the entire home with the exception of any locked closets or bedrooms.

☎Please message me on the airbnb app for fastest responses.☎ I do respond by telephone if you need me.

The house is on a quiet residential block in the historic neighborhood of South Shore.  South Shore is an African American cultural mecca which has gone through some ups and downs over the past half-century.  The neighborhood attracts artists, professionals, academicians and its residents are proud of its history. This is the neighborhood where Michelle Obama grew up, a mile west of the house on 74th Street & Euclid, and where the young Obama couple resided while launching the former President's political career after they both graduated from Harvard Law School.

South Shore’s proximity to downtown Chicago (about 20 minutes drive up Lake Shore Drive),  to the Lake (about a 10 min walk) to the future Obama Presidential Library (7 min drive) and the proposed Tiger Woods championship golf course (uniting the existing Jackson Park and South Shore golf courses) are major forces contributing to the neighborhood’s renaissance.  

The location is economically diverse (low, middle and upper middle income households) with a smattering of abandoned and boarded up buildings littered throughout the area.  (There are two boarded up homes right across the street, so if this is an issue please do not book).  However, you will also see many well maintained homes, aggressive rehab activity in the area and some grand, stunning historic homes along the lakefront and west of Jeffrey Blvd.  A new blues/jazz club, “The Quarry” has opened on Exchange and is within walking distance as is the cafe “South Shore Brew”, Majani’s Vegan Restaurant, and Chef Sarah’s Cafe.  

Most of the smaller rehabbed homes in South Shore are selling briskly between 300-500K which tells me a lot about how the market (ie prospective buyers) views the prospects for this still affordable lakefront community.  The larger, non-rehabbed homes appear to be selling above 600K price point.  There are 4 decent eateries all within walking distance -- L&G Diner, Sarah's Cafe, Majani's and South Shore Brew.  The nearest grocery store, Whole Foods, is a 15 minute drive, but Stop & Save, a supermarket chain, is slated to open its doors in Fall 2019 at 71st & Jeffrey, a 5 minute drive.  A proposed entertainment complex consisting of a 7-screen cinema theatre and fine dining options is due to go up also on 71st & Jeffrey.

I feel safe in this neighborhood because I know what precautions I ought to take.  For example, I would not recommend female guests walk around the neighborhood alone and I would not recommend ANY guests to walk around the neighborhood super late at night.  (That would also be my advice for any Chicago neighborhood, by the way).  Guests have walked late at night in the neighborhood and been just fine, but I like to advise caution.  Daytime and evening strolls are perfectly safe.  In fact you will see many bicyclists using the Lake Shore Drive bike path.  The block is hospitable and neighborly.  Our neighbors have a vested interest in ensuring that you feel at home as your presence contributes to the ongoing revitalization of the area and all that means for local job creation, property values etc.  Despite all the bad publicity the City of Chicago receives, let’s just say that few, if even any, who live here (or know South Shore, as do I) feel unsafe.  I have stayed at this house for long stretches of time as I prepared it for its opening.  I have hosted family, including my mother, at this home.  

In essence, guests are giving up staying in arguably “better” Chicago neighborhoods but are gaining the following: 1) value; 2) space; 3) comfort; 4) easy access to the city via public transport.  

We kindly ask that you weigh those pros (pricing, comfort, space, superb location) against the cons (neighborhood which has seen better days —and will again see better days) before booking.  We do not want you to ding us on the review because the neighborhood was not to your expectations.

ABOUT SOUTH SHORE
There must be something in the water that fosters brilliance in this southern lakefront community. First Lady Michelle Obama, business magnate Larry Ellison, Nobel Prize winner James D. Watson and rapper Kanye West are all former residents of South Shore. In addition to its homegrown celebrities, the neighborhood boasts architectural spectacles, one of the city's largest beaches and the South Shore Cultural Center, a crown jewel in Chicago's arts and culture community.  

As the neighborhood's main attraction, the South Shore Cultural Center features an impressive array of galleries, dance studios and public beaches. A longstanding symbol of community pride, it was the sight of President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle's wedding reception and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. The building also boasts a nine-hole golf course and the Paul Roberson Theatre, a 600-seat space that hosts the South Shore Opera Company.

The neighborhood's most striking area is the Jackson Park Highlands. This residential pocket features a hodgepodge of architectural styles and imposing mansions, which when combined with a pit stop at nearby Rainbow Beach, make for one of the most charming neighborhood strolls in Chicago.

The house is a 4 minute drive to US-41 (Lake Shore Drive.)  Car is recommended but Lyft and Uber is a convenient and cost effective alternative to public transport or rental cars. 

The # 26 bus takes you to downtown Chicago in 40 minutes.  The bus stop is a 3 minute walk (on South Shore Drive and 74th Street).  You can also take the #71 bus from 74th Street & Exchange (about a 5 minute walk) to 71st & Jeffrey and then transfer to the J14 bus to downtown Chicago.  This will also take you downtown in about 40 minutes.  Please consult the Chicago Transit Authority - Ticket information line at for more detailed information.  We can give you the phone # upon booking.

McCormick Place is a 12 minute drive down Lake Shore Drive (US-41) or 21 minutes via the University Park Electric Line Metra commuter train which stops at the Windsor Park train station which is less than a 7 minute walk.

The Loop is an 20 minute drive 

Museum of Science and Industry is a 10 minute drive

University of Chicago is a 15 minute drive 

Whole Foods in Hyde Park is a 15 minute drive as is the retail and restaurant corridors of 53rd, 51st, 55th and 57th Streets

Jackson Park is a 7 minute drive

We do charge by the # of guests so if you do not provide an accurate count we will be unable to properly price your stay to reflect additional laundry and consumables costs to us. Please make sure xtra guests are accurately reflected in your booking so you receive the correct pricing at time of reservation Thank you!

While we cannot guarantee early check-ins or late check-outs, you can make a request and we will note the request and inform you the day before if we can accommodate. There is a $25 fee per early check-in or late check-out up to 3 hours before/after check-in time, if we can accommodate. Any early check-ins or late check-outs longer than 3 hours are charged at a rate of $10 per hour. Thank you for understanding. Baggage storage fee is $5 per bag. Pack and play rental is $10 per night.

L&G Diner on the corner of 75th Street & Exchange is a nice, friendly place to grab breakfast -- about a 5 min walk. South Shore Brew, on 71st & Yates, about a 7 minute walk, is another great place to grab a breakfast sandwich and your morning coffee or an afternoon cappuccino.  The Metra train line station is also a 5 min walk. The nearest grocery store, Stop & Save, is a 5 min drive on 71st & Jeffrey.  Whole Foods in Hyde Park is a 12-15 min drive.  10 minute walk to Rainbow Park and beach.  10 minute drive to Museum of Science and Industry.  15 minute drive to campus of University of Chicago.  20 minute drive to downtown Chicago.  15 minute drive to Soldier Field.  15 minutes to McCormick Place.   7 minute walk to South Shore Drive where you catch #6 or the #26 bus to downtown Chicago (30 minute ride).  Abundant public transport options.
