I have stayed at this house for long stretches of time as I prepared it for its opening.  I have hosted family, including my mother, at this home.  

In essence, guests are giving up staying in arguably “better” Chicago neighborhoods but are gaining the following: 1) value; 2) space; 3) comfort; 4) easy access to the city via public transport.  

We kindly ask that you weigh those pros (pricing, comfort, space, superb location) against the cons (neighborhood which has seen better days —and will again see better days) before booking.  We do not want you to ding us on the review because the neighborhood was not to your expectations.

ABOUT SOUTH SHORE
There must be something in the water that fosters brilliance in this southern lakefront community. First Lady Michelle Obama, business magnate Larry Ellison, Nobel Prize winner James D. Watson and rapper Kanye West are all former residents of South Shore. In addition to its homegrown celebrities, the neighborhood boasts architectural spectacles, one of the city's largest beaches and the South Shore Cultural Center, a crown jewel in Chicago's arts and culture community.  

As the neighborhood's main attraction, the South Shore Cultural Center features an impressive array of galleries, dance studios and public beaches. A longstanding symbol of community pride, it was the sight of President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle's wedding reception and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. The building also boasts a nine-hole golf course and the Paul Roberson Theatre, a 600-seat space that hosts the South Shore Opera Company.

The neighborhood's most striking area is the Jackson Park Highlands. This residential pocket features a hodgepodge of architectural styles and imposing mansions, which when combined with a pit stop at nearby Rainbow Beach, make for one of the most charming neighborhood strolls in Chicago.
notes:
We do charge by the # of guests so if you do not provide an accurate count we will be unable to properly price your stay to reflect additional laundry and consumables costs to us. Please make sure xtra guests are accurately reflected in your booking so you receive the correct pricing at time of reservation Thank you!

While we cannot guarantee early check-ins or late check-outs, you can make a request and we will note the request and inform you the day before if we can accommodate. There is a $25 fee per early check-in or late check-out up to 3 hours before/after check-in time, if we can accommodate. Any early check-ins or late check-outs longer than 3 hours are charged at a rate of $10 per hour. Thank you for understanding. Baggage storage fee is $5 per bag. Pack and play rental is $10 per night.

L&G Diner on the corner of 75th Street & Exchange is a nice, friendly place to grab breakfast -- about a 5 min walk. South Shore Brew, on 71st & Yates, about a 7 minute walk, is another great place to grab a breakfast sandwich and your morning coffee or an afternoon cappuccino.  The Metra train line station is also a 5 min walk. The nearest grocery store, Stop & Save, is a 5 min drive on 71st & Jeffrey.  Whole Foods in Hyde Park is a 12-15 min drive.  10 minute walk to Rainbow Park and beach.  10 minute drive to Museum of Science and Industry.  15 minute drive to campus of University of Chicago.  20 minute drive to downtown Chicago.  15 minute drive to Soldier Field.  15 minutes to McCormick Place.   7 minute walk to South Shore Drive where you catch #6 or the #26 bus to downtown Chicago (30 minute ride).  Abundant public transport options.
space:
This is truly a comfortable and enjoyable home.  It is about a 20 minute drive from downtown Chicago and about 5 blocks west of the Lake.  

We think we have thought of just about everything to make your stay comfortable.  We have plenty of dishes in the kitchen for a group of 9.  3 of the 4 bedrooms are located on the second floor.  One of the bedrooms is located in the basement.  We have a full bathroom on the second floor and a 1/2 bath/powder room on the first floor.  Each bed has ✔bed bug protectors. We have super ✔fast Wifi (1 gig) with Orbi extenders so there should be no dead spots.

★This is a new listing so no reviews have been posted yet.  Please do check out my reviews on other properties under the host profile.★

♥HOSPITALITY PHILOSOPHY♥
We treat each guest as a potentially lifetime customer.  Once you stay with us, we want you to feel that you do not wish to stay at any other property (except one of our properties) on your next visits to Chicago.  In furtherance of that objective we are developing loyalty programs which give special incentives and attention to returning guests and their friends and family members.  While there can always be small mistakes and oversights at any property (no one is perfect 100% of the time), with us you know we will do everything in our power to make your stay fantastic. 

This lovely home is truly a vacation rental in the city.

Pack and play available upon request.

☹PLEASE BE AWARE THAT WE DO HAVE A STRICTLY ENFORCED NON-PARTY/NO UNAUTHORIZED VISITORS POLICY IN PLACE AND WE DO MONITOR OUR SECURITY CAMERAS VIGILANTLY SO WE KNOW IF A BOOKING IS IN VIOLATION OF THAT POLICY.  IF YOU BOOK TO HOLD A PARTY, WE WILL CANCEL, ISSUE NO REFUNDS AND CHARGE FOR EACH PERSON WHO ENTERED THE PROPERTY PLUS ANY ADDITIONAL CLEANING FEES TO GET RID OF ANY SMOKE SMELLS—SIMPLY NOT WORTH TRYING.  WHILE RARELY EXERCISED, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO ENTER THE PROPERTY.☹

☻Responsible conduct by hosts and guests alike will help ensure Chicago and suburbs do not follow the lead of Santa Monica, San Francisco, New York City and Oahu in banning airbnbs altogether in their districts.☻

For reservations longer than 7 days, we will need to do a weekly inspection of the property.
summary: This stately home built in 1893, renovated in 2003, is located on a beautiful, tree-lined street in the South Shore neighborhood of Chicago, 9.5 miles south of downtown. House boasts gorgeous wood floors, custom blinds, 2.5 car garage, 4 bedrooms, 1.5 baths, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer.  The backyard’s fresh landscaping is ready to be enjoyed.  BEDS-3 Kings, 1 Full, 1 folding single cot in LR.5 Roku TVs, 1 Gig Wifi.  Please read neighborhood description b4 booking.  It is important.
transit:
The house is a 4 minute drive to US-41 (Lake Shore Drive.)  Car is recommended but Lyft and Uber is a convenient and cost effective alternative to public transport or rental cars. 

The # 26 bus takes you to downtown Chicago in 40 minutes.  The bus stop is a 3 minute walk (on South Shore Drive and 74th Street).  You can also take the #71 bus from 74th Street & Exchange (about a 5 minute walk) to 71st & Jeffrey and then transfer to the J14 bus to downtown Chicago.  This will also take you downtown in about 40 minutes.  Please consult the Chicago Transit Authority - Ticket information line at for more detailed information.  We can give you the phone # upon booking.

McCormick Place is a 12 minute drive down Lake Shore Drive (US-41) or 21 minutes via the University Park Electric Line Metra commuter train which stops at the Windsor Park train station which is less than a 7 minute walk.

The Loop is an 20 minute drive 

Museum of Science and Industry is a 10 minute drive

University of Chicago is a 15 minute drive 

Whole Foods in Hyde Park is a 15 minute drive as is the retail and restaurant corridors of 53rd, 51st, 55th and 57th Streets

Jackson Park is a 7 minute drive

additional_house_rules:
House Rules:

All bookings require a security deposit of $500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

 Lost or unreturned keys will result in an additional $100 fee (per set).

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

description:
Treat yourself to a modern getaway in a Alto Suite on exciting South State Street! Enjoy the comforts of a plush hotel in the privacy of a light, airy apartment just minutes from The McCormick Place and The Wintrust Arena.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 3 Bedroom Alto Suite (sleeps 8) caters to all your needs in a modern, spacious layout with artistic decor that gives this suite a sophisticated edge. Set against the beautiful Chicago skyline, the El Paradiso suite is a hub of culture in the clouds.

Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

This apartment is conveniently located within walking distance of the McCormick Place and a short drive to all tourist attractions including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and famous Chicago Bean. Get ready to experience the best of Chicago during your stay!

access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
description:
Crisp and clean, this Ravenswood one-bedroom has a luxurious queen bed, full kitchen, tons of natural light, and a pretty serious leather chair. In fact, it’s pretty serious about all of its accent pieces. But that’s no reason to stay inside. This apartment is right around the corner from the Davis Theater and the Old Town School of Folk music, so if expanding your cultural horizons is what you’re into, this is probably the spot for you.

Access is available to the entire apartment.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Ravenswood runs the gamut from trendy, hip breweries in old warehouses to trendy, hip breweries in old warehouses. Seriously, if you like beer, then the eponymous Ravenswood Avenue is your spot. Of course there’s a lot more than that to see and do, from incredible restaurants to bustling shopping districts to art classes to cooking classes, music classes and more. (But, like, seriously. Try the beer.)

Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is also just a short walk to the Damen Brown Line station.

We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.

description:
Private bedroom , share bathroom with one other guest . Queen size bed. Located at Historical Douglas Area, Chicago landmark . Close to subway station, bus stop , IIT, loop, museums campus, McCormick Place(20 min walk or 5 min drive), 31st beach and everything. Area is quiet and safe, plenty of restaurant and super markets. Plenty of free street parking.
3 story house, 3000 sf . The bed room is on 2nd FL, roof top patio with downtown view. There are long term tenants live in the house too.

Private bed room, share bathroom with one other guest .
Large living room and dinning room, kitchen on 1st fl. 
65 in Roku TV in living room .

Living room, kitchen , dinning room , roof top terrace

You can reach me 24 hours

Historical Douglas Area, Chicago landmark . Tour bus drive through this area, some buildings are designed by famous architect such as Louis Sullivan .The house is built in 1890,  iconic Chicago row house. Close to IIT (5min walk) , downtown, loop, museums campus, McCormick Place(20 min walk), lake shore , 31st beach (15 min walk), restaurants, supermarket, and everything.

Free street parking
Green line and Red line subway stations are within 10 min walking distance, bus stop within 3 min walking distance. All that can take u straight  to downtown and loop.
20 min walk to McCormack place, 5 min walk to IIT, 15 min walk to white Sox stadium .

There are long term tenants live in the house too. Please stay quiet and always clean up after yourself. Thank you!
The house is big, it takes a while for hot water to reach shower, might takes a minute.
No smoking, no drugs, no pets, no unauthorized guests that are not on your reservation.

access: Guest has full access to the condo plus building amenities.
description:
Beautiful, modern and newly furnished 4br/4 bath condo at a desirable location for business conventions and vacation travel. FREE private parking and plenty of street parking. Condo has 6  beds and can accommodate 10 or more guests. Minutes to Downtown, McCormick Place, and popular attractions. Walking distance to stores and many great restaurants.

We have other properties as well that could accommodate groups of 27+ guests or more. Please contact us for details.

- 4 Full beds
- 2 Sofa beds
- 4 Full bathrooms
- Memory foam mattresses
- Additional portable sleeping mattresses (on request)
- Toiletries & towels
- Iron,  ironing board, & Hairdryer
- Stocked kitchen
- Keurig coffee maker & pods
- Laptop friendly workspace
- Wifi
- Central air & heat
- On-premise washer/dryer
- Smart Roku TVs
- FREE private parking

Guest has full access to the condo plus building amenities.

We're conveniently located near the 27th Street and Princetion. Convenient to get to as major highways  (I-90/94, I-290, I-55) all converge in this area. For the foodies, this is the place to be with many great restaurants within walking distance and close by the downtown and South Loop area. Conventioneers will be glad to know that McCormick Place is a 25 minute walk/5 minutes drive away. See below for more details.


Driving distance to nearby Points of Interest:
Greektown (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Guaranteed Rate Field (1.2 miles / 5 min)
Illinois Institute of Technology (1.6 miles / 7 min)
Lincoln Park Zoo (7.8 miles / 20 min)
Little Italy (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Magnificent Mile (3.5 miles / 11 min)
McCormick Place (0.9 miles / 6 min)
Millennium Park (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Museum Campus (Aquarium, Field Museum, Adler Planetarium) - (1.8 miles / 10 min)
Navy Pier (5 miles / 15 min)
Soldier Field 2.3 miles / 7 min)
United Center (4 miles / 15 min)
University of Illinois at Chicago (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Wrigley Field (10.4 miles / 27 min)

Walking
Many of the city’s top attractions are a short walk or ride away from each other. Weather-permitting, walking is the best way to see the city and the hidden treasures of architecture and public art in the downtown area.
When planning your route, keep in mind that every 8 blocks equals 1 mile.

Chicago Public Transportation (CTA)
The buses and trains of the CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) are a fast and cost-effective way to get into and around the city. Known as the “L” (though they may be elevated or underground) the trains are a fun way to see The Loop from a new vantage point.
CTA visitor passes offer the best value, with unlimited rides on all CTA trains and buses. A 1-day pass is $10, a 3-day pass is $20, and a 7-day pass is $28.
Passes are easy to use. They activate the first time you use them and are valid for the number of consecutive days purchased. Just dip your pass into the bus fare machine or the train station turnstile.
Check the CTA website for the latest fares, travel alerts, and trip planners.

Taxis
Taxis are abundant throughout most of Chicago so finding a cab is typically easy. Taxi rates depend on gas prices and number of passengers and can get a bit pricey but provide a fast and convenient way to get around the city, particularly beyond downtown.

Biking
If time and weather permit, consider renting a bike. Chicago’s lakefront boasts 26 uninterrupted miles of easy bike and walking trails.
Half-day rentals are available from Bike and Roll at Navy Pier and Millennium Park.


From the Airports

O’Hare International Airport: 
Chicago’s O’Hare is one of the world’s busiest airports. It’s about 15 miles northwest of the Loop in downtown Chicago. O’Hare has 5 terminals, all of which have information booths and multilingual employees to assist you.

Midway International Airport:
Although it’s smaller than O’Hare, Midway is closer to the Loop and services more discount airlines (but fewer airlines overall). If you’re looking for a good deal on plane tickets, check out flights to Midway.

• Check-in 3 PM or later. Check-out before 12 PM
• No Smoking (including e-cigarettes) in the house and common areas
• No pets
• No parties or events
• Observe quiet hours from 9:00PM to 7:00AM 
• Early check-in or late check-out may be accommodated for a nominal charge based on occupancy

description:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space" *

Lovely single family house with large fenced yard. One large bedrm with a good-size closet. Common areas include living, dining, kitchen & laundry rooms. Great for business travelers with office amenities (printer, copier), iron & washer&dryer. 

Quiet & upscale suburbs.  Known for its Frank L Wright hses. Cls to public trans & I-290. 15 min to dwntwn Chicago via train & 20 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr & Hines VA & Rush Hsptl

NOTES: 
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in". 
(3) Let the host know if you plan to drive so the parking matter can be addressed if needed.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house has an exceptional great location.  It is about 10 minutes to a Green Line Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car.
(c) Free parking is provided.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. If you rent a room in or near downtown Chicago, you implicitly or explicitly spend a lot of money just on parking.
(d) The "Occupancy Tax" is about 11% here which is much less than 23% or higher (doubled) in Chicago. The occupancy tax is paid by the guests based on the sum of room rate and cleaning fee.  With this tax and parking cost in mind, it is much more economical (and without losing convenient access to downtown Chicago) to stay in a convenient suburbs rather than in Chicago or downtown Chicago. Since the "Occupancy Tax" is waived if you stay 31 days or longer, you can avoid this tax and save quite a bit of money if you plan your trip ahead and check with the host for room availability.

====== Other Information  ========
Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. A full service restaurant (Blue Max Cafe) is only a block north of the house (serves breakfast and lunch only). Various fast food and slow food restaurants are also very close.  A great oriental message service is just couple blocks south of the house (not too expensive, please get coupon from the host for one-time discount).

The house is the middle of Oak Park and Forest Park downtown (almost equal distance).  You have access to 24 hours super markets, and all sorts of other stores and entertainment in both downtown, plus big Chicago downtown of course. Come to stay in the house, and enjoy both the big Chicago, and friendly cute downtown in both Oak Park and Forest Park.
space:
NOTES: 
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in". 
(3) Let the host know if you plan to drive so the parking matter can be addressed if needed.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house has an exceptional great location.  It is about 10 minutes to a Green Line Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car.
(c) Free parking is provided.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. summary:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space" *

Lovely single family house with large fenced yard. One large bedrm with a good-size closet. Common areas include living, dining, kitchen & laundry rooms. Great for business travelers with office amenities (printer, copier), iron & washer&dryer. 

Quiet & upscale suburbs.  Known for its Frank L Wright hses. Cls to public trans & I-290. 15 min to dwntwn Chicago via train & 20 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr & Hines VA & Rush Hsptl

additional_house_rules:
-SHOES OFF AT THE DOOR!!!!! Check-in anytime after 3pm.

-As an environmentally friendly home, please limit plastic bottle and bag use. We have a reverse osmosis water filter system, bring your reusable bottle!

-Please use the drink coaster on your nightstand (Shared Beds).

-Lock the doors at all times! Hold door shut and press the “Schlage” button to lock door from outside. Hold door until the motor sound is finished.

-No smoking inside. Smoking is allowed outside in the backyard. Do not throw butts on the ground, discard properly in the garbage outside. 

-Quiet hours indoors from 11pm-9am, be respectful of other guests in the house. When watching TV, listening to music, etc. please wear headphones during quiet hours.

-Quiet hours outdoors 9pm, be respectful of neighbors and the neighborhood!

-Do not be rowdy (includes running, stomping, jumping, etc.). 

-Absolutely no unauthorized guests are allowed. 

-Do not steal; do not touch foods, drinks, and belongings that are not yours. 

-Clean up after yourself including the dishes if you use them.  

-Do not feed Lucky, certain foods can make him sick!

-Eating is prohibited in sleeping areas, please eat in dining area.

-Do not leave wet towels on beds, furniture, table, etc. Hang them on the bathroom door hanger.

-Due to multiple guests in the house and only one bathroom available, please limit hot shower use to 10 minutes.

-Please shut and zip all your bags; Lucky enjoys sock hunting and this also helps prevent the spread of unwanted pests.

-Check out is 11am.

description:
SLEEPING ARRANGEMENT
You get a twin size memory foam bed located in the living room of a dorm style home.

Kitchen includes all new appliances, granite counter tops, and reverse osmosis filtration system for the purest drinking water possible! Security features include smart lock (no more keys!), surveillance, fenced gate, and an 8lb maltese named Lucky. Backyard is great for grilling and enjoying fresh air!

Great for mingling with other travelers, perfect for a solo adventurer, couple, or with a friend! There may be other guests staying in the house during your stay since there are multiple listings in this house: Private bedroom and living room twin beds.

Free Street Parking, Wi-Fi, body wash, shampoo/conditioner, toothpaste, and bath towels are all provided!

Free street parking. Blue Line CTA approx. 1 mile at Damen or Western, bus routes on Western Ave. Bike rentals are blocks away on Division & Western via DIVY! Walking distance to Wicker Park, Ukrainian Village, simple bike ride to Logan Square, Bucktown, and West Town area. Approx. 15-20 minutes to Wrigleyville, Lakeview, Lincoln Park, the Loop, River North, Gold Coast, Navy Pier, John Hancock, Sears Tower, Willis Tower, and more. Enjoy a nice walk or party all weekend during Lollapalooza at Grant Park or party instead at Pitchfork & North Coast Music Fest at Union Park. Love sports? Catch World Series champs Cubs host games at Wrigley Field, catch the Bulls, pay your respects to Michael Jordan, Blackhawks, or a see a live concert at United Center, watch Da Bears and hope for a Mike Ditka sighting at the historic Soldier Field on the Museum Campus, or catch a game in the south side where the White Sox host at Guaranteed Rate Field, and more!

description:
Clean, private, professionally designed room in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING & an early check-in (1 pm!) You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is quiet and extremely safe even at night :)

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock your door. 

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> The back deck has a beautiful view of the Willis Tower

> Early check-in! 1 p.m.!

> Newly renovated apartment

> GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattress

> Restaurants and bars are 2 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 5 MIN walk to University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC)

> 15 MIN walk to Rush University 

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I am also providing a booklet full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

access: In addition to your flat, you may feel free to use the enclosed back porch, stone patio, garden/grass.  If you are here for an extended stay (over 3 days), you may also use the laundry room.
description:
A classic turn-of-the-century Greystone in historic Logan Square!  Your own flat in our two-flat home on a double lot with patio and garden.  Vintage style w/modern kitchen appliances/cooking supplies. Roku Streaming. Easy Access to City: 15-min walk to O'Hare Blue Line train, 1 block to #47 Fullerton bus to LincolnPark/Red/Brown Trains to Downtown, 1 mile to the 606 trail.  Nearby restaurants/bars, 1 block to grocery/liquor.  Free Street Parking & NO CLEANING FEE which can boost final costs up!

11-foot ceilings, original woodwork, hardwood floors and vintage charm like a claw-foot tub/shower, pantry and antique details.  With modern appliances and kitchen supplies.  Pedestal table with extra leaf for added seating.  Ceiling fans and portable AC units in each bedroom.  Double lot with large perennial garden and patio with dining table and lounge chairs.

In addition to your flat, you may feel free to use the enclosed back porch, stone patio, garden/grass.  If you are here for an extended stay (over 3 days), you may also use the laundry room.

I plan to be available most of the time, as we live in the other unit, and can assist with suggestions, directions, etc.  I love meeting my guests, but it is up to you how much interaction you would like to have.

I've been in Logan Square since 1987 and have seen it transform into a wonderful, vibrant community.  The Summer Sunday Farmer's  Market, Logan Theatre, the 606 trail, and ever-growing list of fabulous restaurants and coffee shops make it an ideal place to set up your base camp for exploring Chicago.  And our transit system is there to take you to anywhere you want to explore.

We are conveniently located a block from the public CTA bus that can take you to the Red/Brown Train lines (goes to downtown, Wrigley Field, etc).  And a short walk to the Blue Train line which goes to the O'Hare International airport or downtown.  From these, you can get to almost ANYWHERE you want to go in Chicago!

No parties!

access: The whole house is yours! That's 4 bedrooms, 3.5 bathrooms, a living/rec room, sunroom, family room, sitting room, deck, and yard.
description:
Come stay in our single-family home where Logan Square and Avondale meet, with four bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms. It's the perfect location, on a quiet street, in a convenient area just north of The Square. If you need space for a lot of people, we also have couches and open spaces (plus we can provide AirB's). We have a ton of space and have it stocked for your stay!

We have 4 bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms for your guests, with plenty of common areas to stretch out and enjoy your time in Chicago. We live here, but travel often, so we're opening our home for others to love it as much as we do.  Our home is located within walking distance of dozens of bars and restaurants and it's just off 90/94, an 86 Walk Score, 71 Transit Score, and has ample street parking--and we can also provide a garage if you have a car and prefer off-street parking. We can provide an electronic key the day you're due to check in, so logistics are easy. Just make yourselves and home and let us know if you need anything at all during your stay.

The whole house is yours! That's 4 bedrooms, 3.5 bathrooms, a living/rec room, sunroom, family room, sitting room, deck, and yard.

We can be reached via text or email at any time and have many people in the area to assist if needed.

My husband is from Bucktown and we stumbled upon Logan Square in the hunt for a condo we could afford and we've never looked back. It's great for families, couples, and young professionals, alike! The food and drink in Logan is second to none and - from the friendly corner bars, to the year-round Farmers Market and people lounging on the boulevards and monument - there is a strong sense of warmth and community. Check out the LoganSquarist website to find out the latest news and happenings!

Ample street parking, but you don't need a car here. We're a 7-minute walk from either the Logan Square or Belmont Blue Line stations.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen

Building amenities
- Rooftop
- Gym
- Outdoor grilling area

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 98
- 5 minute walk to Berghoff Restaurant (traditional beer stein and German cuisine)
- 10 minute walk to Vol. 39 (upscale cocktail and wine bar)

Getting around
- 3 minute walk to Jackson Red Line stop
- 2 minute walk to Harold Washington Library Brown Line stop 
- 9 minute drive to Navy Pier 
- 45 minute drive to ORD Airport
- 28 minute drive to MDW Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

This is a central location and prone to noise.
house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

access: Will have access to the washer and dryer, bathroom, wet bar, grill, kayaks, yard and large open space.  Upgraded 75 Mbps Internet Wi-Fi, with dedicated router password and ID.  The surround sound stereo has aux jack for iPod or Smartphone, can play CD's and DVD's. There is a 47" HD TV with DirecTV, including HBO.  Ring security system, smartphone controlled lights your path to the entry door.
description:
Spacious lower level of my home, situated on an acre of land.  This is a large living area & a full bathroom with two person Jacuzzi, an electric fireplace and wet bar.   There is a washer and dryer for your use and plenty of space in this one large studio. We are within 15-20 minutes drive of 4 major hospitals, Midwestern University, COD, Fermi-Lab and Argonne.  Ten minute walk to grocery store, restaurants, health clubs, shops and carry out. Metra and Pace bus are also just ten minutes walk.

Newly renovated home, with granite wet bar and tile floor.  Two person Jacuzzi tub with four position shower.  The electric fireplace has flames, heat and remote control.  There are two 4-drawer chests of drawers, two night stands, all matching. The comfy Lazy-boy chair reclines; reading lamps included. There is a desk if needed. Smart Ecobee/Nest controlled heat and air conditioning.

Will have access to the washer and dryer, bathroom, wet bar, grill, kayaks, yard and large open space.  Upgraded 75 Mbps Internet Wi-Fi, with dedicated router password and ID.  The surround sound stereo has aux jack for iPod or Smartphone, can play CD's and DVD's. There is a 47" HD TV with DirecTV, including HBO.  Ring security system, smartphone controlled lights your path to the entry door.

I live nearby and am available to you to answer questions and bring you what you may have forgotten.  You may text or call on the cell.

It has a rustic feel and there are lots of woods.  The neighbors are friendly and the 'no outlet block is quiet.  When entering from Belmont Road, be sure to go east and insure you come to the 'side' door of 1954. In the early summer  the lightning bug show in the backyard cannot be missed!  Don't forget to ask me for the free Alter Brewery Micro Brewery (five minute walk) drink coupon, if I didn't leave it out for you.

You can walk to the Belmont Road train station stop in 5-10 minutes, depending on how fast you walk. You may leave your (up to) 3 cars in my driveway, or can park for free most of the time near the train station (after 11AM and all weekends).  Also, UBER and Door Dash knows where my house is.

Looking for someone to move in between Feb 1-8.  You can take the METRA - BNSF train, 5-7 minutes walk away, directly to Union Station in Chicago east or to Naperville or Riveredge Park in Aurora to the west. Thalia (music) Hall is at the Halsted stop going east, as is Harlem Ave Lounge.  The site of the oldest golf course in America is a short walk away.  You can play nine holes at the Downers Grove Golf Club for just $20. Umbrellas are available in the hallway. There are games, extra kitchenware, towels, sheets, washcloths, storage all in the closets. Extra tables are available if needed.

space:
A basement bedroom with a private bathroom. In the basement unit, there are 3 private bedrooms in total. And a shared laundry is there as well.

If you need, you could use a shared kitchen upstairs.
summary:
My place is a basement bedroom with a private bathroom in the heart of Chinatown resident area. 

A small fridge is in the room. A paid laundry room is available in the apartment.

It is closed to Cermak-Chinatown Redline Station. Several bus stations are within in 5mins walk.

15 mins to Loop and McCormick Place.

You can enjoy every type of Chinese food in Chinatown.

Please remind: there is no window in the room.

additional_house_rules:
We encourage our guests to treat our home as their own.  Please feel comfortable to use the dishes and kitchen.  We just ask that you clean up after yourself.  We also don't allow smoking in the house, and we never wear shoes in the house.  We have two young pups who both like other dogs. They are generally well-behaved, but they are still in training.

We are flexible on the checkout time except Sunday mornings, when we need to be firm with the 10:00 checkout.

access: You'll have access to the full house (except our bedroom, of course).
description:
Welcome to the Chicago area! Our home offers easy access to  transit: CTA/Metra, 2 major airports, hospitals, & Chicago's cultural wonderland. Full kitchen, free street parking, &  complimentary high speed Wi-Fi available.  Short walk to grocery store & great food/drink.

A warmth of hospitality offered in a safe, local community. Hairdryer, bathrobes and slippers, fully stocked luxury bathroom amenities.

Our home was built in 1905, so as with many old houses, we have beautiful woodwork, the bedrooms are a bit on the cozy side! The house has just one shared bathroom, which we haven't ever found to be an issue.  Our yard has a myriad of lush native plants, enclosed garden fortress growing fresh produce. It's lovely to sit outside for tea on the terrace. 

We have two medium size doggies, who we are training as therapy dogs.  They both love people (may bark to say hello), then are quiet and generally well-behaved.

Please note that our home is not an event venue, so we respectfully request no parties.

You'll have access to the full house (except our bedroom, of course).

We both work partially from home and partially outside the home, so we're generally around to help with any assistance you may need.  We enjoy talking to and meeting new people, and we're also glad to give our guests any space they need.

Berwyn is a quiet family neighborhood and sanctuary city. Our home is on a double lot so we have a large yard and garden (for a city property). We walk both with and without the dogs at all hours, feeling comfortable. People are friendly and look out for each other. There is a major grocery store at the end of the block along with 3 local fast food options. Kinslagher, the brewery/tasting room is a few blocks away along with Autre Monde restaurant which has a nod from Michelin. Many music venues/bars run along the busier street which is in walking distance, not ear's shot. We love being a quick train to downtown Chicago and a cab/rideshare to downtown Oak Park all in a peaceful, historic space.

We are located 6 blocks from the Oak Park CTA Blue Line stop.  It's a nice 12 minute walk on a sunny day.  There is a Pace bus which runs down Oak Park avenue every 30 minutes and will get you within an eighth of a mile of our house.  Ample street parking is also available.  Lyft or Uber to/from O'hare is $30 and downtown Chicago $18 (approx.)

We respectfully request no shoes or smoking inside the house.
house_rules:
We encourage our guests to treat our home as their own.  Please feel comfortable to use the dishes and kitchen.  We just ask that you clean up after yourself.  We also don't allow smoking in the house, and we never wear shoes in the house.  We have two young pups who both like other dogs. They are generally well-behaved, but they are still in training.

We are flexible on the checkout time except Sunday mornings, when we need to be firm with the 10:00 checkout.
interaction: We both work partially from home and partially outside the home, so we're generally around to help with any assistance you may need.  We enjoy talking to and meeting new people, and we're also glad to give our guests any space they need.

additional_house_rules:
Please review rental rules before confirming. Confirmation of reservation conveys acceptance of rental rules. Thanks! :-)

This license agreement (“Reservation”) is between you, the Licensee of rental property (“Guest”), and Chloe & Cow LLC (“CC”), the Licensor authorized by the owner (“Owner”) of said rental property (“Property”), as of the date last set forth on the signature page of this Agreement. For good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the parties hereby agree as follows:

1. License:
a. In consideration of the monies paid and promises contained herein, the Owner does hereby grant to the Guest, the license to use those premises during the period as indicated in the Reservation.
b. Guest acknowledges that he/she is occupying the premises only as a licensee of the Owner, and that this agreement does not create a landlord-tenant relationship, or any other interest in the Owner’s property.
c. Owner and/or CC reserve the right to revoke the license agreement “at will”.
d. Owner and/or CC retain absolute control over the premises.
e. Owner and/or CC agree to supply the licensee of all the essential services required for the licensee’s permitted use of the premises.
f. The license described herein is non-transferrable.

Liability and Indemnification: The Property is privately owned. The Owner and/or Chloe & Cow, LLC is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illnesses that occur while Guest, Rental Party and/or invitees (registered or not) are on the premises. Nor is the Owner responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables. It is understood that Guest, Rental Party and/or invitees (registered or not) are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the Property. Owner will not assume liability for 1) any personal property or equipment of Guest, Rental Party and/or invitees (registered or not), or 2) any injury to Guest, Rental Party and/or invitees (registered or not) brought to the Property. Guest, Rental Party or invitees (registered or not) hereby indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Owner and/or  Chloe & Cow, LLC, agents, or successors-in-interest from any claims, actions, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses arising out of the rental of the Property. Guest, Rental Party and/or invitees (registered or not) assume all risk and waive all claims they may have against the Owner and/or  Chloe & Cow, LLC, agents, or successors-in-interest for damage to or loss of property (including theft) or injury to persons within or about the Property arising out of 3) use of the Property, or 4) breach of obligations under this Agreement, except for such damage, loss, or injury caused by the gross negligence of Owner and/or  Chloe & Cow, LLC, agents or successors-in-interest. SUCH ASSUMPTION AND WAIVER SHALL INCLUDE AN OBLIGATION ON GUEST, RENTAL PARTY AND/OR INVITEES’ PART TO INDEMNIFY, DEFEND AND HOME HARMLESS THE HOMEOWNERS,  CHLOE & COW, LLC, AGENTS, AND SUCCESSORS-IN-INTEREST FROM AND AGAINST ALL COSTS AND EXPENSES, CLAIMS AND LIABILITIES ARISING FROM SUCH DAMAGE, LOSS OR INJURY, INCLUDING ATTORNEY’S FEES AND COST, WHICH OBLIGATION SHALL SURVIVE THE EXPIRATION OR EARLIER TERMINATION OF THIS AGREEMENT.

Rental Rules
1. Smoking and Vaping are NOT allowed inside.
2. People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight in the property. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest.
3. All of the units are privately owned; the owners and/or  Chloe & Cow, LLC are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Homeowners and/or  Chloe & Cow, LLC are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.
4. Keep the property and all furnishings in good order
5. Please respect the homeowner and neighbors by refraining from making excessive noise, playing loud music, or having an excessive number of people at the house at any time.
a. Events and parties are not allowed. This home is located in residential neighborhood. Loud noise, especially outside, is always discouraged, and strictly prohibited after 10pm. If neighbors can hear you or music from inside, that is also a violation of the noise policy. The security deposit will be forfeited if noise violations occur, and management reserves the right to terminate the rental early if deemed appropriate. Our units have decibel level monitoring devices to prevent loud noises and parties and/or unruly behaviour. Tampering with the device will incur fees. 
b. Illegal substances and/or activities are strictly prohibited.
c. Owner or Owner’s Representative reserves the right to ask guest to depart the premises if these rules is ignored.
6. Only use appliances for their intended uses
7. PETS are not allowed at this property.
8. PARKING – We can provide parking through Spot Hero (Subject to availability) behind or near the building. Please let us know in advance so we can set that up for you.
9. Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the units.
a. All dishes used should be run through the dishwasher or hand washed prior to departure.
b. Please take shoes off inside, it's just hygienic.
10. Check out Policies. Guest should be checked out of home by 11am of last day, unless another time is specifically agreed upon. After making sure the house is securely closed up.
a. Penalty for unapproved late check out is $50 per hour

access: Guests will have access to everything aside from a storage closet and a secondary exit which isn't really used by anyone in either building.
description:
2 Flats Adjacent to each other in the same building, in The South Loop, a lively neighbourhood steps from ✔McCormick Place Convention Center✔Wintrust Stadium✔Minutes from Downtown and the Parks.

Is this is your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay with us: www.airbnb.com/c/mchan118

*Important* This is a combination listing of 2 flats adjacent to each other, uniquely situated steps away from McCormick Place, Wintrust Arena, Chinatown, and near Downtown

There are 5 bedrooms: three with Queen Beds and two with 2 twin beds. This combination is perfect for large families/groups (8-14) who cannot find adjoining bedrooms in Chicago hotels and / or who prefer to live in an apartment with kitchen and laundry and in close proximity. Also amazing for friends and couples or business associates and conventions. There is also 2 full bathrooms in each flat.

*Note* These are 2 flats next to each other, not one large unit.

We currently have 1 designated parking.

We love our spaces and we hope you do too!.

Guests will have access to everything aside from a storage closet and a secondary exit which isn't really used by anyone in either building.

We're foodies and are in the food industry so we'll be happy to give you our recommendations in the city and we're available any time to help with anything we can!

We are in the South Loop, the gateway into downtown, and where most major outdoor events take place whether in Grant Park or Millennium Park (Lollapalooza, The Blues Festival, and The Taste of Chicago!), Soldier Field, and McComick Place. This is host to numerous World Class Museums, like the Field Museum and the Art Institute.

At the moment we have 1 designated parking spot but there is a Spot Hero Parking lot right behind the building too for additional parking. Let us know and we can try to set you up with that if it's available for your stay! Our building has very quick, easy access to Major Highways, and Public Transportation taking you to major destinations within minutes. Also very close by is an entrance to Lake Shore Drive which can take you up the famous and scenic city coastline or down to Hyde Park where U of C is located and The Museum of Science and Industry. Just a block away we have the Red and Green Line Trains that can take you to every Major destinations downtown within minutes so there's no need to rent a car!

►Noise Potential◀ We are located next to the Train and McCormick Place so even though the windows are insulated you can still hear the Hustle and Bustle of the city. We do provide Earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Also our building doesn't have thick sound proof walls so at times, if loud enough, noise can carry through from other units and from the gym downstairs.

We want to make sure that your stay exceeds your expectations... When making a request, please tell us a little about yourselves, your interest in our home and indicate that you have read the full listing and house rules... Thank you!

a. Events and parties are not allowed. This home is located in residential neighborhood. Loud noise, especially outside, is always discouraged, and strictly prohibited after 10pm. If neighbors can hear you or music from inside, that is also a violation of the noise policy. The security deposit will be forfeited if noise violations occur, and management reserves the right to terminate the rental early if deemed appropriate. Our units have decibel level monitoring devices to prevent loud noises and parties and/or unruly behaviour. Tampering with the device will incur fees. 
b. Illegal substances and/or activities are strictly prohibited.
c. Owner or Owner’s Representative reserves the right to ask guest to depart the premises if these rules is ignored.
6. Only use appliances for their intended uses
7. PETS are not allowed at this property.
8. PARKING – We can provide parking through Spot Hero (Subject to availability) behind or near the building. Please let us know in advance so we can set that up for you.
9. Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the units.
a. All dishes used should be run through the dishwasher or hand washed prior to departure.
b. Please take shoes off inside, it's just hygienic.
10. Check out Policies. Guest should be checked out of home by 11am of last day, unless another time is specifically agreed upon. After making sure the house is securely closed up.
a. Penalty for unapproved late check out is $50 per hour
interaction: We're foodies and are in the food industry so we'll be happy to give you our recommendations in the city and we're available any time to help with anything we can!
neighborhood_overview: We are in the South Loop, the gateway into downtown, and where most major outdoor events take place whether in Grant Park or Millennium Park (Lollapalooza, The Blues Festival, and The Taste of Chicago!), Soldier Field, and McComick Place. This is host to numerous World Class Museums, like the Field Museum and the Art Institute.
notes:
►Noise Potential◀ We are located next to the Train and McCormick Place so even though the windows are insulated you can still hear the Hustle and Bustle of the city. We do provide Earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Also our building doesn't have thick sound proof walls so at times, if loud enough, noise can carry through from other units and from the gym downstairs.

We want to make sure that your stay exceeds your expectations... When making a request, please tell us a little about yourselves, your interest in our home and indicate that you have read the full listing and house rules... Thank you!
space:
*Important* This is a combination listing of 2 flats adjacent to each other, uniquely situated steps away from McCormick Place, Wintrust Arena, Chinatown, and near Downtown

There are 5 bedrooms: three with Queen Beds and two with 2 twin beds. This combination is perfect for large families/groups (8-14) who cannot find adjoining bedrooms in Chicago hotels and / or who prefer to live in an apartment with kitchen and laundry and in close proximity. Also amazing for friends and couples or business associates and conventions. There is also 2 full bathrooms in each flat.

*Note* These are 2 flats next to each other, not one large unit.

We currently have 1 designated parking.

We love our spaces and we hope you do too!.
summary:
2 Flats Adjacent to each other in the same building, in The South Loop, a lively neighbourhood steps from ✔McCormick Place Convention Center✔Wintrust Stadium✔Minutes from Downtown and the Parks.

Is this is your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay with us: www.airbnb.com/c/mchan118
transit: At the moment we have 1 designated parking spot but there is a Spot Hero Parking lot right behind the building too for additional parking. Let us know and we can try to set you up with that if it's available for your stay! Our building has very quick, easy access to Major Highways, and Public Transportation taking you to major destinations within minutes. Also very close by is an entrance to Lake Shore Drive which can take you up the famous and scenic city coastline or down to Hyde Park where U of C is located and The Museum of Science and Industry. Just a block away we have the Red and Green Line Trains that can take you to every Major destinations downtown within minutes so there's no need to rent a car!

access: The entire place is yours to enjoy!
description:
Hi there! Welcome to your open, comforting 3-bed apartment in Avondale. 

Find out why the iconic Lonely Planet’s travel guide named Avondale one of the countries most up and coming neighborhoods! Our guests stay with us because:

-You are near the Blue Line train stop and 1 block from the Metra Station
-The quiet tree-lined street
-NEW upgraded finishes
-Delicious & authentic restaurants in the neighborhood 
-Bustling nightlife just a few minutes away
-Our giving, helpful service! :)

(Pssst... Quick favor if you're thinking about booking: Please read the entire listing as it likely answers any questions you may have. Thanks!)

Newly rehabbed, this unit is spacious and perfect for a social experience with a group (yet private with the locations of the bedrooms), or a nice family weekend to enjoy the neighborhood and beautiful Chicago in the summertime!

Step inside and make yourself at home! Enjoy 3 beautiful, comfy bedrooms with queen beds in each and another huge, queen-sized pull out sofa in the living room accommodating a large group with ease. Alongside the living room is our favorite part of the apartment: the dining room! Settle into the 6-person dining table set and enjoy a delicious meal with your group :)

We also thought about the little things that matter for you: Coffee machines stocked for your pleasure, in-home washer & dryer prepared with detergent and dryer sheets are freely accessible, stainless steel kitchen appliances prepared for your use, and plenty of dining and work space. 

The bathrooms are stocked with amenities, including shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and plenty of fresh towels. Kitchen is stocked with all the necessary utensils and is ready for your cooking.

Q: Is the neighborhood safe?
A: Very much so. 24 hours a day.

Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens?
A: Nope! we provide all these things. Same with hotel-size toiletries (unless I happen to be out, which is rare).

Q: When can I check in or check out? 
A: Check in is 4pm and check out is 10am. Early check ins can be difficult if there are guests who checked out same day. We ask for an early check-in, or a late-check out fee, if you request either.

Q: Is there parking?
A: There is ample street parking.

Q: Will I have a key? Can I come and go as I please?
A: Yes and yes. And we wouldn't trust any listing with which this isn't the case.

Q: Is the place professionally cleaned between guests?
A: Yes, and we take pride in providing a clean home for guests.

Q: What's my total booking price? 
A: We honestly have no idea. With fees included, it only shows the guest how much they pay. This figure should be present after you enter your dates. Note that, pricing varies on a daily basis, and it actually uses some crazy algorithm to adjust it automatically, so I don't actually control this.

Q: Are the beds comfortable?
A: Very. Some guests say they're the best they've ever slept on!

The entire place is yours to enjoy!

All of the relevant information is available in your check-in doc, which you will receive within a week of your stay. That said, we are always here to help!

Described by the iconic Lonely Planet’s travel guide as the nation’s hottest, need-to-visit ‘hoods”, welcome to Avondale! You’re located on a quiet, tree-lined street but near famous Milwaukee Ave., full of nightlife, delectable restaurants and eclectic shops. Hip neighborhoods like Logan Square and Wicker Park are a short distance away and easily accessible.

Here are a few gems around the area:

-BYOB and enjoy some delicious tacos on L’Patron’s patio and a delicious twist on their fresh guacamole

-Get out and play some bocce ball or lounge under an umbrella at Logan Square’s newest patio bar - Park & Field

-Being a hub for the Chicago Polish community, you’re bound to smell some delicious Kielbasa from the many Polish restaurants on Milwaukee Ave., yum!

Getting around is easy when you’re conveniently located near everything! The Metra train stop is just a block away giving you access to O’Hare airport or straight downtown. If you’re driving, the expressway is a few minutes away.

Parking on the street in front of our house is free, but it can be kind of tough to find a spot later in the evening. Most of the surrounding areas are permit parking only from 6pm-6am, so please be mindful of signs if you want to avoid getting costly tickets!

We’ve made getting in and out a breeze. There are keyless locks to enter the building and the unit. The code will be provided to you before check-in.

Complimentary Smoking Fee, $500
Early check in or late check out, $50 / hour. $25 / hr if you let us know in advance.
house_rules:
• PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE.
- Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am
- Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages
- Pet Penalty: $500 + damages
- Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour

description:
A huge 2 Story Unit all for you.  Great natural light, two TV Area's with brand new 70" TV and 55" TV's. This is in a great neighborhood (LakeView/Lincoln Park) near great restaurants and Night life. During summer this is a 7 Block walk straight down the street to Wrigley Field. 1 Block walk to Brown Line 'L' Train that can get you anywhere in the City.

Washer/Dryer, 3 Bathrooms w/ blowdryers, Record Player!, Smart Tv’s, Coffee Maker, Espresso Maker

Garage Parking Spot Included!

Huge Unit that is perfect for the full range of travelers from large groups to family vacations. The unit is very cool, wide open with great natural light and all the toys (TV's, Record Player (Yes - 1960's Record Player), Speakers, Board Games) that any group would ever want.

We are at your beckon call to help point out as much or as little about the City and the area as you want to know!

Wrigley Field is 7 Blocks Away! If you walk down the street, you will literally run into Wrigley Field. Super close to the Brown Line (L Train) that can take you anywhere in the City. This area literally is surrounded by great local restaurants and bars. There is a very cool Video Game bar less than 1/2 block away. Totally get the feel of Chicago neighborhoods. Best of all, this is tucked away on a Quiet street.

Divvy, CTA 'L' Train and major Bus Stops all within 2 blocks of the unit.

access: You will have full access to two apartments and the back garden. Guests can enter via the front or rear doors.
description:
Two floors of the house - a large two bedroom apartment and downstairs studio apartment.
A full kitchen and two bathrooms.

This is the first floor and garden apartments of the building. Includes three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living room, a large dining room, large kitchen, nice breakfast nook, walk-in closets. 
There are hardwood floors in living areas, stone and tile in kitchen and bathrooms.

FEATURES: Central air conditioning, hardwood floors, and a NEW 40-inch flatscreen plasma TV plus 32inch in garden apartment

ADDITIONAL HIGHLIGHTS: Ceramic and stone tiles in bathroom and kitchen, updated appliances, tall ceilings on first floor, and oak kitchen cabinets.

OTHER INFORMATION:
Here are some suggestions and requests that should make your stay as comfortable as possible: You will notice that the location is the best between being close to the city and being in a quiet residential neighborhood. The CTA Brownline Paulina Station is just minutes away, the No. 11 Bus even closer. Whole Foods Market is the preferred upscale source for nourishments and the best fruits and vegetables for the discriminating taste. Jewel Foods is about 4 blocks south between Paulina and Ashland. There are several bars and restaurants in walking distance, feel free to inquire about recommendations.
You will find our beds comfortable, with hotel grade mattresses and 100% cotton linens, there are additional blankets and covers available for the asking. Please try to take care of the furniture and rugs and artwork, this is not a low-grade motel, the surroundings are appointed like a private home., as indeed, it is my home. There are no oak floors and oriental rugs at Motel 6.

NON-SMOKING, no dogs or cats please.

Also, our company manufactures 3in1Dead Sea skin care products, you will find some free samples for your use or take them with you. If you are interested in purchasing some, let us know.

You will have full access to two apartments and the back garden. Guests can enter via the front or rear doors.

A quiet and safe neighborhood street served by a Whole Foods, a number of Diners, Bakeries and local restaurants. 
With great connections to the rest of the city, its tourist spots, shopping and nightlife.
A short walk away from theater, comedy and Wrigley Field.

The apartment is very close to the brown line. This will take you downtown and to the museum and theater districts, Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier.
Wrigley Field is only a twenty-four minute walk away.
It is an easy drive to both the Kennedy and Lake Shore Drive which will get you into, out of and around the Chicagoland area.
neighborhood_overview:
A quiet and safe neighborhood street served by a Whole Foods, a number of Diners, Bakeries and local restaurants. 
With great connections to the rest of the city, its tourist spots, shopping and nightlife.
A short walk away from theater, comedy and Wrigley Field.
space:
This is the first floor and garden apartments of the building. Includes three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living room, a large dining room, large kitchen, nice breakfast nook, walk-in closets. 
There are hardwood floors in living areas, stone and tile in kitchen and bathrooms.

FEATURES: Central air conditioning, hardwood floors, and a NEW 40-inch flatscreen plasma TV plus 32inch in garden apartment

ADDITIONAL HIGHLIGHTS: Ceramic and stone tiles in bathroom and kitchen, updated appliances, tall ceilings on first floor, and oak kitchen cabinets.

OTHER INFORMATION:
Here are some suggestions and requests that should make your stay as comfortable as possible: You will notice that the location is the best between being close to the city and being in a quiet residential neighborhood. The CTA Brownline Paulina Station is just minutes away, the No. 11 Bus even closer. Whole Foods Market is the preferred upscale source for nourishments and the best fruits and vegetables for the discriminating taste. Jewel Foods is about 4 blocks south between Paulina and Ashland. There are several bars and restaurants in walking distance, feel free to inquire about recommendations.
You will find our beds comfortable, with hotel grade mattresses and 100% cotton linens, there are additional blankets and covers available for the asking. Please try to take care of the furniture and rugs and artwork, this is not a low-grade motel, the surroundings are appointed like a private home., as indeed, it is my home. There are no oak floors and oriental rugs at Motel 6.

NON-SMOKING, no dogs or cats please.

Also, our company manufactures 3in1Dead Sea skin care products, you will find some free samples for your use or take them with you. If you are interested in purchasing some, let us know.
summary:
Two floors of the house - a large two bedroom apartment and downstairs studio apartment.
A full kitchen and two bathrooms.
transit:
The apartment is very close to the brown line. This will take you downtown and to the museum and theater districts, Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier.
Wrigley Field is only a twenty-four minute walk away.
It is an easy drive to both the Kennedy and Lake Shore Drive which will get you into, out of and around the Chicagoland area.

Cozy, peaceful and clean living area 1 bedrooms  in the lower level with 1 full bathroom which may be shared with other guess My guess are allowed to use the full kitchen and back yard. Enjoy a movie in the private living room area. My room accommadated for 2 guest per room(couples) (friends)(relatives) if guess do not want to share the room you have to book and additional room.

Huge peaceful, clean single family home, 3 levels 3 bedroom  2 bathrooms, cozy  back yard with a deck and gazebos  where you can relax. Rental bedrooms( 1 room with a king size bed and 2 rooms with queen size beds) granite counter tops in the kitchen. 6 seating dining table. Hardwood floor.

Full access to the kitchen, dining room, back yard deck, gazebo, laundry room.

We like socializing with our guest, they can text or email me. We live in the house so we can interaction with our guess is most likely to happen  after our working hours, I am also a chef so you might be able to enjoy a meal .(EMAIL HIDDEN) (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

I have very good neighbors, it's fairly quiet, Brickyard  mall is in walking distance, Applebees, Taco bell, Popeyes, Burger King, McDonalds and many more restaurant's , Riis Park is in walking distance if your in to jogging public transportation near by. Uber is always a call away.

Very easy commuting. Bus routes a block North or East , Highway. Easy to order an Uber.

My pets roam freely around the house on the main floor, my stair ways are blocked off with gates for privacy and to keep my pets away from certain areas of the house.  I maintain my place very clean. If you have Allergies this might not be the place to stay. When using the back yard I only ask you keep the gates locked at all times. Booking is for two guess per room additional fees apply for unexpected guests $25.00. No smoking inside the house. No parties. Laundry room may be used for an additional fee of $25.00. We will provider laundry detergent and softener. I provide body wash, wash towels, shampoo,conditioner, lotion. Bottled Water is provided. For no reason food is allowed in the lower level or rooms. Snacks are ok. Parking is in the street.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. NO Smoking in-doors or outside on the property

2. Please close and lock all gates and doors when coming and going from the property. You only need to lock the top lock on the gates (not the deadbolt).

3. Garbage bags are under the sink.  If you are a longer -term guest and need to take the trash out, the trash is outside, use the gate on the right side of the garage and the trash bins are to the right. Put recycling in the blue bins and trash in the black bins. Recycling should be loose and not bagged. 

4. Toilet use:
Please DO NOT flush anything down the toilet except for toilet paper.  Do not flush paper towels, floss, face wipes, make-up wipes, Kleenex, tampons applicators or anything else besides toilet paper.  Putting these items in the toilet can cause the toilet to back up.

5. Please do not play loud music or play the TV too loud, be respectful of the other neighbors.

6. No large parties or gatherings are allowed inside or outside. 

7. Please do not put cutting knives, pots and pans, or baking sheets in the dishwasher.  They should all be hand washed.

8. You are welcome to use any basic cooking ingredients (olive oil, spices, etc) but please do not eat or drink any personal food items (granola bars, wine, snacks, etc) .

9. Please only use personal toiletries (shampoos etc) laid out in the showers on the counter.  Do not use personal products in drawers or cabinets. 

10. You are welcome to use the backyard space, just know that it is shared with the other residents of the building. (Everyone is very friendly though!). One resident does have a small dog as well. 

11. Please do not put fruits, vegetables, egg shells, chicken bones, etc down the garbage disposal. When in doubt, skip the garbage disposal and throw it away.

access: Guests are welcome to use the shared backyard!
description:
Have a place to come home and relax everyday! Recently rehabbed, modern, top floor unit located in Bucktown. HBO, Netflix, wifi, in unit laundry, dishwasher, zoned central heat and AC.  Stand-up showers, soaking tub, quartz counters, hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances. Easy access to the highway and walkable to all that Bucktown has to offer.

Too floor duplex up apartment. Master suite on top floor, 2nd bedroom on main floor off the kitchen. There's a shared backyard you can use as well!

Guests are welcome to use the shared backyard!

Airbnb messaging is the easy way to get ahold of me!

Bucktown is a great classic Chicago neighborhood. There are lots of fun local restaurants and stores that have more of a local/neighborhood feel than downtown Chicago, while still be close and easily accessible to downtow

We are a 10-15 minute walk to the CTA Blue line train which goes directly to the airport. If you are driving we are only a couple minutes away from the highway and street parking does not require a permit and is usually pretty easy. You can also get an Uber within minutes usually.

access: Bedrooms, bathrooms, living space, kitchen and back yard/deck.
description:
Fresh newly refinished house in beautiful Hickory Hills. Spacious and open living, with new deck and a nice back yard. Close to highways, train and activities. Whole house to yourself.

Everything redone within the last year. Child friendly, with crib, changing table and high chair available.

Bedrooms, bathrooms, living space, kitchen and back yard/deck.

The house is our home, but we will not be around when you stay here. Our house manager will  be available to you for questions or other things you might need.

The neighborhood is nice and quiet and groceries stores, restaurants and shopping are within a few minutes reach. There are several forest preserves in the area for your enjoyment and plenty of playgrounds for families. Kacey Meadow Park, which is just a few blocks down, has a splash pad for those hot days. 
Across 95th Street is a 29  hole golf course, banquet hall and a indoor/outdoor family fun and game center, with mini golf, food and play area for kids. 
Famous downtown La Grange, with it's many small boutiques and great restaurants is easily reached in under 20 minutes.

The train station in Oak Lawn is a 10 minute drive away. 
Close to 294 and 55, and also to the Historic Route 66.
Downtown Chicago will take you about 30-40 minutes.
house_rules:
No shoes in the house
Only the number of people booked  may stay at the house after midnight.
