access: Long term rentals will have access to whole space including kitchen and front room and dining room. Fully furnished with your own closet, dresser and access to washer/dryer.
description:
Lincoln & Armitage in an exclusive building in an upscale safe, quiet neighborhood is a perfect location for those who want to walk or take public transportation to experience Chicago's stunning lakefront, zoo, world-class shopping and dining, or take in a Cubs game.

It has a queen size bed in a spacious high ceilinged bedroom with shared kitchen and bathroom and a lovely porch off the bedroom.  

Available only for longer term rentals. Require a 15 day notice of interest, please inquire.

Few vintage condo's are left in Lincoln Park.  Vintage means that the building is 120+ years old with some of the things that come with being so old including: charm, uniqueness, stunning woodwork as well as sometime slow plumbing and many years of use.

Long term rentals will have access to whole space including kitchen and front room and dining room. Fully furnished with your own closet, dresser and access to washer/dryer.

I am often in and out, but accessible by email/text messages or phone (if you have an iPhone). Please call me if you have any difficulties (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). You will have self check-in for your convenience. Please lock the Condo door when you go in and out this will ensure you don't forget your key.

Charming quiet tree-lined street that is also close to restaurants, parks, bars, shopping, divy bikes, comedy club, zoo and transportation.  You will immediately feel at home.  Safe neighborhood for walking.

Public transportation Brown Line El (connects with Orange from Midway Airport or Blue from O'Hare) or busses close by. If coming from Union Station the 151 Sheridan (comes all times and all days) and the 156 LaSalle (Weekdays) stop at Armitage. Divy bikes on the corner of Armitage and Clark as well as many other locations. Walking to many attractions.

There is street parking but a sticker is needed after 6PM till 6AM on most streets except Armitage. If you have a car and need stickers there is a nominal fee to buy stickers. You need to put one sticker on per night you are there. Please leave the money on the table. There are children in the 1st floor condo and the condo behind me so consideration is always important. Please do not smoke off the back deck or leave cigarette butts in the front.  The back door does open WITHOUT force -- do not just pull on doorknob. Turn bolt lock and make sure that is open.

Garbage (under Kitchen sink) and recycling (in kitchen black garbage) out the back steps in the alley.

access: You'll have access to the private upstairs apartment and your private rear balcony. The back yard and front porch are shared with my family but you're encouraged to use both!
description: Cook in a gourmet kitchen, complete with stainless-steel appliances, in a home that's rich in designer tiles and finishes. The mid-century modern living area also has a fun touch of the schoolhouse, thanks to the desk, wall chart, and map.
interaction: We live in the building and we love the neighborhood. We're here to help with guiding you on your Chicago experience and we can help make your stay as comfortable as possible.
neighborhood_overview: Recommended restaurants and bars within a 5-minute stroll include Scofflaw, Parson's Chicken & Fish, and Bang Bang Pie & Biscuits. Palmer Square is a beautiful public park, and the property is under a block from a walkable mansion-filled boulevard.
space: Top floor (up one flight of stairs) apartment is quiet and private. We have a fully stocked kitchen and bathrooms. Your stay should be equivalent to a high end hotel, quiet, comfortable and relaxing. We absolutely love the space and we ask that you treat it with respect.
summary: Cook in a gourmet kitchen, complete with stainless-steel appliances, in a home that's rich in designer tiles and finishes. The mid-century modern living area also has a fun touch of the schoolhouse, thanks to the desk, wall chart, and map.
transit:
CTA Blue Line is about a 10 minute walk away. The Blue Line takes you directly downtown or to O'hare Airport. 
Divvy shared bicycles have 2 locations within 2 blocks of the property. 
If you drive street parking is relatively easy  on our block and you don't need a permit.

description:
Homie and cozy space

Great location, near downtown Chicago, easily access to transportation. Park near by, shopping and restaurants.

Guests will have privacy I live upstairs. If you need to contact me I’m available by phone or text.

This eclectic neighborhood is home to a unique culture that includes residents who have resided in Chicago for generations. Bordering the Stevenson Expressway, McKinley Park is located on the southwestern side of the city. Close to Pilsen neighborhood. Friendly residents and a beautiful park make this neighborhood a frequented spot for festivals and cultural events.

Conveniently located near public transportation CTA train and bus stop. Free street parking. Uber and Lyft available.

access: The CTA stop is just out the back door and to the east.  Download the CTA app, which has the bus and train schedule.  The easiest way to head downtown is to grab the Western Ave. Bus (49, 49A or 49B) and take it to the Western Station.  From their head inbound on the CTA train.
description:
Warm and safe apartment located in Lincoln Square that includes the entire entire unit with two (2) queen beds.  Immediate access to CTA and walking distant to tons of restaurants and bars.  The unit is located in a safe and fun neighborhood.

The safety of our guests is paramount so the unit entrances are monitored by security cameras.  

Unit includes two (2) queen sized beds, a couch and an air mattress.  There is one (1) full bathroom with a bathtub.

There are great restaurants and pubs all around but a higher density just south at and around Lincoln and Lawrence. 

Breakfast:  Café Selmarie at 4729 N. Lincoln Ave.  I recommend their Corned Beef Hash with two (2) poached eggs.  It gets busy early on weekends.

Lunch: If you want a great Italian Beef Sandwich or "OUTSTANDING" Cheeseburger and Fries head to Charcoal Delights at 3139 W. Foster Avenue; this is fast food the way it used to be.  

Pizza:  Walk down to the corner of Lincoln and Foster, there is a Pizza Place called Jimmy's Pizza Café.  Really good New York style pizza.  If you want deep dish order from Lou Malnatti's.

Bars:  There is a fun Korean Karaoke just South of Foster on Lincoln called Dancen.  Cardinal Spirit's is a bar and liquor store for the adventurous type.  Lastly, no trip to Lincoln Square is complete without a few drinks from the Hüettenbar.

Dinner:  I just discovered Las Alla del Sol.  (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Los Nopales sister restaurant.  It's located near Broadway and Hollywood but their Carne Asada is more than worth an uber trip.

The CTA stop is just out the back door and to the east.  Download the CTA app, which has the bus and train schedule.  The easiest way to head downtown is to grab the Western Ave. Bus (49, 49A or 49B) and take it to the Western Station.  From their head inbound on the CTA train.

Only if required.  We want to give our guests as much privacy as possible.

Lincoln Square has a smattering of great little restaurants and bars.  Extra points are awarded to the adventurous types!  Shopping can be found where Lincoln Ave. turns into a one-way just south of Lawrence Ave.

The best beach in Chicago is the Foster Ave. Beach.  Just hope the bus and head east and you run right into it.  Great sandbar and beautiful water.

Uber, bus, cab or train are all great options, but walking is the best!

Off-street parking is available for $20/night immediately adjacent to the unit.  Guest need to provide make, model, year, color and license plate number.

Chicago parking tickets are have been recently increased to $100 per violation.

3. No Disorderly Conduct or Illegal Activity
4. Quite Hours from 8PM to 8AM

access: You'll be able to enter the entire downstairs unit and a private porch. You'll also have access to the shared backyard. You will be given a door code for access.
description:
Come stay in Logan Square and soak in the local restaurant, music and shopping scene. Drink your morning coffee on your private porch, rest comfortably in our queen size beds, take a nice stroll to Koz park and, if you feel like cooking, prepare your favorite meal in the brand new kitchen. Netflix and Free permits for parking available. We're located off the Blue Line, so come straight here from O'Hare.

Welcome to our new home! Our newly remodeled home is a two flat located on the edge of Logan Square and the ever growing Avondale. The apartment you'll be enjoying features a private porch with comfy lounge chairs and a kitchen with brand new stainless steel appliances and all the basic cooking tools needed to create a meal. The two queen beds have new memory foam mattresses with fresh sheets. Each bedroom has a closet with hangers. You'll also be able to control your A/C and heat for the entire unit. Clean towels, soap, and shampoo provided.

You'll be able to enter the entire downstairs unit and a private porch. You'll also have access to the shared backyard. You will be given a door code for access.

We're happy to give you suggestions on how to get around Chicago or where to eat.

We are a short walk to Milwaukee where many of the restaurants and bars are located. We are a 12 min walk to the Blue line and if you don't feel like walking, the Diversey bus stop is steps from our door and takes you right there. Koz Park is 3 mins from our house. Parking is on Ridgeway and permits will be located in the unit. Permits last 24 hours, so be sure to change it each day.

Please note that we are approximately a 12 minute walk from the entrance to the Logan Square CTA Blue Line station and that we are likewise a 12 minute walk from Milwaukee Avenue and the many bars and restaurants that line it - close enough to be convenient but far enough to allow for a restful stay at the house. The Logan Square neighborhood itself is approximately four square miles and has great food and drink in every corner of it! Also please note that we have a security camera observing the rear gate to the alleyway for security and that the doorbell for our own upstairs residence is a Ring doorbell with camera, but there are no interior monitoring devices whatsoever.
house_rules:
- Please don't leave trash on the porch outside
- Please close all exterior gates behind you
- Please wipe up kitchen/house messes 
- Always make sure the back patio door and front door are locked when you are absent
- Fireworks not allowed on property

access:
Guest access
Private bedroom, shared bath, kitchen- dining- living space, on site parking, outdoor deck and barbecue.
description:
Welcome! This wonderful clean, spacious airbnb is located in Chicago's vibrant artist and historic neighborhood named “Pilsen.” It is situated on the famous 18th Street near to Harrison Park and The National Museum of Mexican Art. The Pink elevated train line is a block away will bring you to the Chicago Loop in 15 minutes. There are many fun and hip restaurants, cafes, musical venues, parks, and cultural events available nearby. 

We have two rooms available to rent (see "Airbnb Pilsen Treasure, 15min to Downtown Chicago") For more information please go to that ad and/or inquire.

Guest access
Private bedroom, shared bath, kitchen- dining- living space, on site parking, outdoor deck and barbecue.

Guest interaction
My name is Colby, I am Donald's daughter. I will be available to you to assist with whatever you may need. I can recommend all sorts of exciting and meaningful options for your stay in Chicago. There are many wonderful and unique restaurants, cafes, galleries, and cultural events in the neighborhood of Pilsen as well as throughout the city! I can help you choose places which will match your interests.

Neighborhood overview
The neighborhood of Pilsen is very special! It was skipped over by the great Chicago fire and is an Historic District. Most of the buildings are over 150 years old and European in scale. The architecture is primarily Czech with lots of detail. Today Pilsen is diverse and home to thriving and colorful artistic and Mexican communities. There are great vintage, record, book, and import stores as well as many bohemian cafes where artist come from their studios to talk about art and life, etc. There is an excellent choice of very authentic Mexican restaurants and bakeries, as well as other global cuisines such as a Creperie, Italian and Chinese restaurants, and wonderful Brunch options, etc. Nearby in Harrison Park there is the internationally renown National Museum of Mexican Art which is very unique, sophisticated and fun! They host many exciting events throughout the year. There is also an organic juice bar!

Getting around
It is very easy to get around Chicago from Pilsen. The elevated "Pink Line" train "18th Street" station is one block away and provides a scenic view of the city which is just 15 min. to the center of Chicago's downtown "Loop", The Chicago Art Institute, Millennium Park, and Lake Michigan. There are also busses available nearby which one can hop on to. In addition, many places are a short Uber ride away.

This lovely bedroom is for one guest but can sleep two. An extra guest is an additional charge of $25.
house_rules: If you are sick or have a cold do not book with us, please make a reservation with another Airbnb. We do not want any of our guests to be exposed to sore throats or other germs. Thank you for your consideration!

description:
Centrally located in Lakeview, you are walking distance to the lake, halsted street, belmont station, Wrigley field, The Vic, and much more nightlife and retail shops.  This unit has central heat and air, and in unit laundry. State of the art kitchen with stainless appliances and quartz counters.  2 contemporary full baths with glass tile, and modern fixtures.  Hardwood floors throughout with outdoor deck.Free Netflix.

Your own private apartment

Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions 48 hours before arrival in your itinerary.
https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/100/where-can-i-find-check-in-information-for-my-trip?topic=371

I am available as needed

The Lakeview neighborhood has something for all ages. From the Belmont Theater District to Belmont harbor on Lake Michigan. You will love Lakeview!

Many options, Belmont el station is 2 blocks. Bus available on the corner. Divvy bikes available for rental next to Belmont Station. Uber and Lyft available as well as taxi.

In unit laundry, rental parking available in back via Spothero web for 717 Belmonthttps://spothero.com/search?latitude=41.9399875&longitude=-87.6476672&search_string=717%20West%20Belmont%20Avenue%2C%20Chicago%2C%20IL%2C%20United%20States

access: The entire unit is available for your use. Large sectional to relax after a long day of discovering Chicago or enjoy a good book in the reading chair with an ottoman for those feet. If you are staying longer and need to do some laundry, there is a coin laundry located conveniently right outside the back door.
description:
This 1 bedroom / 1 bathroom garden apartments is located in one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Chicago, Bucktown. 
Far enough from downtown traffic but close enough that anywhere you want to go is just a few minutes away by cab or train. Bucktown is known for its stylish boutiques, electric cafes, fun pubs & great summer festivals. A great neighborhood for food and fun all year long!

Large bedroom with a queen size bed and a walk-in closet to hang your clothes.  Fully stocked kitchen with a Keurig to make a quick cup of coffee. Otherwise, you can walk down to the block the local Starbucks or discover all the boutique coffee shops throughout the neighborhood. This is a garden unit that does has some height restricts, so if you are 6'3" + there may be some sections you may need to duck.

The entire unit is available for your use. Large sectional to relax after a long day of discovering Chicago or enjoy a good book in the reading chair with an ottoman for those feet. If you are staying longer and need to do some laundry, there is a coin laundry located conveniently right outside the back door.

If you have a car, there is plenty of free parking around the house & the highway is about 3 mins away. 
Another great way to travel is by cab, Uber or Lyft.
But if you want to travel as most Chicagoans, then you have to use ‘the El’. Chicago Transit System/Authority (CTA aka ‘the El’) is only a quick 5-7 min walk to the platform.

additional_house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. No one can’t sleep in common areas.
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate house manager plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping) 

BREAKING ANY RULE OR DOING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY WILL END UP IN A IMMEDIATE CANCELLATION PF YOUR RESERVATION AND YOU WILL HAVE TO LEAVE THE PLACE IMMEDIATELY. Our top one priority is our guests’ security and provide a quiet stay!

access: You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
description:
Welcome to this Vintage, safe Multicultural Neighborhood where you can find some of the Irish culture but also Polish and Eastern Europe. This is the perfect spot  conveniently located to those who go to or from O’hare Airport because the train close by is the one that takes you inside the Airport in about 25min. Also, straight Downtown Chicago in about 25min.We offer Wifi,coffee maker,microwave,iron, hair dryer,pretty much everything you might need. We have cameras in common areas and keypads!

You will have a full size bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own padlock and there are cameras in common areas. 

This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm.

There are free parking on the street easy to find before 5pm, plenty paid parking around the house. 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.

If you text Alejandra she will be there for you most of the time she is going to give you quick responses! If you are a tourist she will love to share some places you can’t miss!

This place is conveniently located becase it’s between O’hare Airport and Downtown Chicago and we use the blue line train which is close to the house (7 min by walk or 2 min by bus) that will take you straightforwardly both places ! We have a Home Dpt Store just 1 block away and a Family D in case you need to buy any emergency cloth or amenities or food!

There are few free street parking by kimball usually easy to find before 5pm. 152 bus is just 1/2 block away. Addison Blue Line is 8min walk or 5min by bus. 82 bus is 1 block away. . McCormick Place is 20min far by car/Uber . United Center is 17 min far by car. Illinois Medical District is 17min by car. Grant Park is 21min by car/35min by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 23min far by car. Private Uber / Lyft or Via are around 20$ to those places!

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private small apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being conveniently located, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 

This room is downstairs in the basement. The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3 or 4 guests in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. The room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 
As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place, or have an earphone or something to block the sound.

We have cameras in common areas as outside the building, living room, kitchen, hallway. Of course we don’t have cameras in bathroom or rooms. 

Is forbidden in this place: parties, small gatherings, to bring people who are not in the reservation, family reunions, birthdays celebration, video shooting,  being noisy, smoke and bring pets. 

We work based in all airbnb policies, terms and conditions including cancelation policy, so makes sure before you book to read carefully houses rules or cancelation policy.
house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. No one can’t sleep in common areas.
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate house manager plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping) 

BREAKING ANY RULE OR DOING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY WILL END UP IN A IMMEDIATE CANCELLATION PF YOUR RESERVATION AND YOU WILL HAVE TO LEAVE THE PLACE IMMEDIATELY. Our top one priority is our guests’ security and provide a quiet stay!

description:
We are located in the Lincoln Park neighborhood. Walking distance to DePaul University, restaurants, and public transportation.  This is a brand new unit in a gut rehabbed building which opened March 2019.  There is a Samsung Smart tv connected to Free High-speed Internet in the unit and complementary Netflix on it. 24/7 exceptional exercise room. Onsite laundry facility and bike room. There’s no limit to great restaurants and shops around this neighborhood.

Furnished studio with custom kitchen, stainless appliances with white Carrera quartz. high-speed internet and complimentary Netflix.

Ones your booking is confirmed you can find check-in instructions 48 h before arrival in your itinerary. Late check-in no problem/lockbox with keys.

You have the entire place to yourself.

https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/100/where-can-i-find-check-in-information-for-my-trip?topic=371

We are always available to answer questions and give recommendations.

Walking distance to the Southport corridor and all that Lakeview and Lincoln Park have to offer

The Diversey Brown Line is just 0.5miles away so it's a short walk to it or you can hop on Bus 76 which stops right by the building for one stop. Uber, Lyft, taxi, and bike.

Great location near everything. Quiet hours 10pm-6am

Please keep the noise to a minimum inside and outside the unit after 10pm.

access: Unit has a private entrance and there's a lock box outside that can be used to hold the keys while you're out to minimize the risk of loss. We also have a cozy patio and grill area in the backyard that can be available for use upon request.
description:
Lie back after a busy day and rest easy in this carefully decorated home. The space features a mid-century modern aesthetic, hardwood floors, original design touches, a full kitchen, and a bright sunroom. Eco-conscious touches include composting, recycling, organic linens, and solar panels which provide for 100% of the building’s energy consumption.

Full eat-in kitchen with gas stove, microwave, full size fridge, Nespresso coffee machine, and a community pantry.

One queen bed in the first bedroom and a double/full bed in the second - both are brand new. Closet/valet stand and dressers available in both bedrooms. 

Bathroom includes shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotions. Laundry available upon request.

High Speed Wifi, books/magazines and Apple TV in the unit.

Security system for the property with outdoor cameras, smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, and first aid supplies.

Exercise bike, yoga mats, weights, bands and other fitness equipment is available for use. Just let us know what you need and if we have it you're welcome to use it.

Unit has a private entrance and there's a lock box outside that can be used to hold the keys while you're out to minimize the risk of loss. We also have a cozy patio and grill area in the backyard that can be available for use upon request.

Our family (including young child and a 14 year old Pomeranian/Shih Tzu mix) live in the upstairs unit. The two units share a common backdoor/stairwell of the building, but for more privacy you can shut the backdoor to the unit. Or leave it open and enjoy the sun on the back porch! We are available as needed to answer questions or provide tips on the area.

The property is about a 10 minute walk from both the Western and Damen Blue line stops. Great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife are all within walking distance. It is a short bike ride to Logan Square, Lincoln Park, and the lakefront.

8-10 minute walk to the Blue Line. 3 minutes to the Western (49) and North Avenue (72) CTA buses. Divvy bike sharing rack about 5 minutes away - bicycle is our preferred way to get around the city! The famous 606 bike/running trail is 5 minute walk. Parking is free and typically plentiful on a quiet, one-way street in front of the building.

Given that we have a toddler, we have toys, strollers, etc. for toddlers and infants. Please feel free to ask if we have anything that you might like to use while staying with us. We know what it is like to travel with a little one so we'll try and help lighten the load!

Additionally, given that we have a young daughter, no parties are allowed. 

Finally, our 2 flat is over 100 years old but has been updated and maintained wonderfully while still showcasing some of the vintage charm. Huge windows, tall ceilings...and creaky wood floors! We have hosted friends and family several times and no one has complained, but we do want to note that there are some noisy spots in the unit. Additionally, you may hear our daughter running around during the day, but she is in bed early and a great sleeper, so unit should be quiet after 8pm or so.
house_rules:
- Please leave shoes at the front door.
- We expect our guests to acknowledge that our family lives in the unit above the first floor rental unit. Additionally, our two flat is on a family friendly street containing many families with small children. We ask that even though typically staying with us for a couple days, our guests act as though they live in the area long term. Please keep the noise to a minimum inside and outside the unit after 10pm.
interaction: Our family (including young child and a 14 year old Pomeranian/Shih Tzu mix) live in the upstairs unit. The two units share a common backdoor/stairwell of the building, but for more privacy you can shut the backdoor to the unit. Or leave it open and enjoy the sun on the back porch! We are available as needed to answer questions or provide tips on the area.
neighborhood_overview: The property is about a 10 minute walk from both the Western and Damen Blue line stops. Great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife are all within walking distance. It is a short bike ride to Logan Square, Lincoln Park, and the lakefront.
notes:
Given that we have a toddler, we have toys, strollers, etc. for toddlers and infants. Please feel free to ask if we have anything that you might like to use while staying with us. We know what it is like to travel with a little one so we'll try and help lighten the load!

Additionally, given that we have a young daughter, no parties are allowed. 

Finally, our 2 flat is over 100 years old but has been updated and maintained wonderfully while still showcasing some of the vintage charm. Huge windows, tall ceilings...and creaky wood floors! We have hosted friends and family several times and no one has complained, but we do want to note that there are some noisy spots in the unit. Additionally, you may hear our daughter running around during the day, but she is in bed early and a great sleeper, so unit should be quiet after 8pm or so.
space:
Full eat-in kitchen with gas stove, microwave, full size fridge, Nespresso coffee machine, and a community pantry.

One queen bed in the first bedroom and a double/full bed in the second - both are brand new. Closet/valet stand and dressers available in both bedrooms. 

Bathroom includes shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotions. Laundry available upon request.

High Speed Wifi, books/magazines and Apple TV in the unit.

Security system for the property with outdoor cameras, smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, and first aid supplies.

Exercise bike, yoga mats, weights, bands and other fitness equipment is available for use. Just let us know what you need and if we have it you're welcome to use it.
summary: Lie back after a busy day and rest easy in this carefully decorated home. The space features a mid-century modern aesthetic, hardwood floors, original design touches, a full kitchen, and a bright sunroom. Eco-conscious touches include composting, recycling, organic linens, and solar panels which provide for 100% of the building’s energy consumption.
transit: 8-10 minute walk to the Blue Line. 3 minutes to the Western (49) and North Avenue (72) CTA buses. Divvy bike sharing rack about 5 minutes away - bicycle is our preferred way to get around the city! The famous 606 bike/running trail is 5 minute walk. Parking is free and typically plentiful on a quiet, one-way street in front of the building.

access: Guests have access to the building's fitness center and seasonal pool.
description:
Enjoy scenic city views in this 3 bedroom/ 2.5 Bath townhouse in River West. This space comes with modern amenities such as a rooftop lounge area, pool, and fitness center. Here you’ll find all the comforts of home: full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City. Whether coming for work, pleasure or both, this Domio is sure to delight you and your guests.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 3 bedroom and 2.5 bath townhouse boasts a spacious living room, premium furniture, and high-end finishes. The master bedroom has two queen beds attached bathroom. Bedrooms 2 and 3 each have a queen bed as well. In the living room, there is a sofa bed and air mattress for added comfort.

Guests have access to the building's fitness center and seasonal pool.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

River West is one of Chicago's best neighborhoods of being close to the loop, yet far enough from all the hustle and bustle. Easily walk to bars or restaurants that call River West their home.

Chicago Registration Number: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

access: This private room is a master bedroom with soaring cathedral ceilings. Private bath is equipped with jacuzzi tub, marble sink, and walk-in separate shower.  This space has wifi access Parking is easy and free on the street or connect to a bus that is 10 minutes from downtown.
description:
A lovely brownstone built in the 1800's.  This neighborhood was the site of Chicago's version of yesterday's original splendor with today's modern amenities.  This house is minutes from the lake, downtown and the museums.

This space is unique because you will see the beauty of art from the moment you step inside the gate.  You will enjoy a nice comfortable space with your own private bathroom.  This is your home away from home once you settle in from all the sightseeing Chicago has to offer.

This private room is a master bedroom with soaring cathedral ceilings. Private bath is equipped with jacuzzi tub, marble sink, and walk-in separate shower.  This space has wifi access Parking is easy and free on the street or connect to a bus that is 10 minutes from downtown.

We live in Historical Bronzeville neighborhood.  This area offers you entertainment and dining experiences.  
In addition, historical landmarks you can visit.

15- minutes to universities in downtown Chicago: Columbia College, Depaul, UIC, Roosevelt, and Northwestern

Interstate Highways:
I-55 less than 5-miinutes away
I-90/94 less than 5-minutes away
I-290 less than 8 minutes away
Lake Shore Drive 5-minutes away

Airports:
Midway Airport 15-20 minutes way depending on traffic
O'Hare Airport 40-50 minutes away depending on traffic

description:
Come stay in our Chicago decor private bedroom and bathroom in our lovely Row Home located in Logan Square. We are steps from the California Blue Line stop, Palmer Square Park and the hippest restaurants and bars in town.

Our home is a Row House which is a unique building that has a semi-condo and semi-house feel. There are 2.5 bathrooms so you can feel at ease to get ready to go out. On the first floor we share the common area for cooking, eating and hanging out. The bedrooms are on the second floor. Brad is a musician so we usually have music playing while we are home. We have a 4 year old puppy, Macchiato and a 1 year old child. They are very friendly, but CAN be a bit crazy from time to time.

Our street is super quiet, yet located extremely close to all the happening and fun stuff.

We occupy one of the bedrooms in our home and for the most part, we work from home.  Ask us anything about where do and what to do in our neighborhood and around the city.  We also put out a tray of snacks in our kitchen(croissants and fig bars, usually).

Logan Square is a very laid back neighborhood. Super bike friendly and dog friendly. We are steps from tons of restaurants, coffee shops, bars, clubs, the 606 trail and more.

Public Transportation:
CTA Blueline is a 2 minute walk away. We are close to multiple bus stops as well.

By Foot:
We are walking distance to many coffee shops, restaurants and bars.

Biking:
We are a 2 minute walk from a bike rental station. Chicago is super bike friendly and many streets have bike lanes.

Vehicles:
We can provide a permit for parking on our street. There is easy street parking in our neighborhood.

We have a 3 year old Airedale Terrier Puppy, Macchiato. He is super friendly and mostly quiet, but can be a little crazy at times and may ask you to play with him!
house_rules: When checking out, please lock the front door and leave your keys in our mailbox. Thanks!

On the first floor we share the common area for cooking, eating and hanging out. The bedrooms are on the second floor. Brad is a musician so we usually have music playing while we are home. We have a 4 year old puppy, Macchiato and a 1 year old child. They are very friendly, but CAN be a bit crazy from time to time.

Our street is super quiet, yet located extremely close to all the happening and fun stuff.
summary: Come stay in our Chicago decor private bedroom and bathroom in our lovely Row Home located in Logan Square. We are steps from the California Blue Line stop, Palmer Square Park and the hippest restaurants and bars in town.
transit:
Public Transportation:
CTA Blueline is a 2 minute walk away. We are close to multiple bus stops as well.

By Foot:
We are walking distance to many coffee shops, restaurants and bars.

Biking:
We are a 2 minute walk from a bike rental station. Chicago is super bike friendly and many streets have bike lanes.

Vehicles:
We can provide a permit for parking on our street. There is easy street parking in our neighborhood.

additional_house_rules: All bookings require a security deposit of $250 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.  Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 90 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards.  For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.   Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.   Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.   Our locations do not allow pets.   No parties of any kind are allowed in the unit.  If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $25 for every extra hour of cleaning required.   Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.   Lost or unreturned keys at the time of checkout will be charged a $100 per set.  If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.   We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays.  If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately.   If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance.   When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.  Shoes off, please.

description:
Treat yourself to a modern getaway in a Stratus Suite at the heart of trendy Pilsen! Enjoy the comforts and privacy of a light, airy apartment near the chicest galleries and gourmet cuisine.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 1 Bedroom Stratus Suite (sleeps 4) caters to all your needs in a spacious layout with a fun mixture of bold and muted styles that reflect the vibrancy of Chicago, all while providing a peaceful space for your stay. 

Stratus suites offer guests the comfort and style of a hotel without all the fuss. Complete with fresh furnishings and smart decor, each room is suited to the trendy traveler who craves comfort in new places. At the primary status level, the Stratus suite is ready to make you feel at home. 

At a Glance

* Custom furnishings 
* Full and spacious kitchen
* Large flatscreen Smart TV
* Fast Internet 
*On the Art Walk
*Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

This apartment is situated perfectly for the traveler looking to experience Chicago’s largest attractions while staying in one of its intimate communities. Pilsen is a cultural hub of flavorful and visual attractions, from The Art Walk and Thalia Hall to its authentic Mexican and Vietnamese restaurants, all of which are still only a short drive away from the Museum District, the Magnificent Mile, and Navy Pier.
Please note there is currently neighboring construction, potential for noise between 8am to 6pm.

Reserved parking is available for an additional fee.

additional_house_rules:
Quiet hours 10 pm

21+ to book

No smoking or parties in the unit.  This will result in a $500 fine, forfeiture of security deposit, plus $100 per person over the number that was originally booked for.

Must place keys back in lockbox upon check out, failure to do so will result in $100 fine (we have multiple cleaners who clean the units, most do not have a copy of the key).

If guest does not check out on time (without approval from host to stay later) one may be charged $25/10 min over check out time (rounded up).

By booking with us, if there is any violation of our house rules, you agree to forfeit your right to leave any review.

description:
1st floor unit, with a renovated basement near the United Center!

This is a two floor unit (duplex down) with 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, shared laundry room, and backyard access.

***Follow us on Instagram @goat_stays for future discounts on any of our properties.***

1500 sq ft 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.

"The Illinois Medical District (IMD) is a special-use ZONING district two miles west of THE LOOP in CHICAGO, ILLINOIS. The IMD consists of 560 acres of medical research facilities, labs, a biotechnology business incubator, a raw development area, four major hospitals, two medical universities, and more than 40 health care related facilities. The IMD has more than 29,000 employees, 50,000 daily visitors and generates $3.4 BILLION in economic opportunity."

Full unit with shared Laundry with the other building tenant. 2 bedrooms upstairs with one bed/bath downstairs for more privacy.

I will not be available in person, but can always be reached through the message control center.

We are in the heart of the Medical District, super close to the United Center and The Loop!

No car needed!
Blue Line Train Station (Western) - 0.4 miles 
Pink Line Train Station (Polk) - 0.9 miles 
United Center 1.3 miles
Wrigley Field - 7.0 miles
Soldier Field - 6.5 miles
Millennium Park - 4.0 miles
Guaranteed Rate Field - 5.6 miles
Restaurant Row - 2.0 miles
Ohare - 16.9 miles (can take Blue Line direct)
Midway - 7.7 miles

Very centrally located. When entering the building our apt. is the door on the right with a GOATHOTE sticker!

access: The place is yours!
description:
Fun and modern two level one bedroom in East Lakeview.  Walk to the lake, Wrigley Field, the red/brown/purple line and a ton of great restaurants, shops and bars.

2 level 1 bedroom loft in East Lakeview. Close to the lake, grocery stories, the cubs, and a billion restaurants and bars. The loop is a quick uber, bus or el ride away.

The place is yours!

I will be out of town during your stay but have my phone glued to me at all times - feel free to text, call or email - no matter the time or situation! I also have a few close friends that will be on call that live very close and stop by if needed.

My street and the ones surrounding it are perfect for grabbing a drink on a patio and dog watching! Wilde Bar has a little of everything. Dry Hop is great if you for beer, cocktails and good food. Yellowtail sushi is amazing and only a few blocks away. I also love to grab some wine, cheese or something from the deli at Marianos - grocery store basically connected to building - and then venture down to the park to eat on a park bench or blanket or by the lake.

I am a fan of lyft and uber but the El and bus makes getting around very easy as well. There is an El stop less than 10 minutes away (walking) that services the red, brown and purple lines. 

You can also sign up for a divvy membership - this allows you to check out the blue bikes you are bound to see on every other corner of the city. You just check one out and then return it to a divvy check-in center once you have made it to your destination. 

If you are planning a longer adventure and need a car for an hour or even a day or two - I would recommend checking out the app “Getaround”.

Tucker the cat will be with you in the apartment! 

Just be careful - the top and bottom locks take different keys. If you lock the bottom lock you can open door from inside but will be locked out from the outside.
house_rules:
Before checking out, please:
- place any used towels in the bathtub 
- takeout trash 
- place any used dishes in dishwasher
